Title: Mandarin Language Speaker & Software Engineer Speech Recognition and NLU

Job_Description: <strong>Machine Learning Researcher - Borealis AI</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What is the opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> Borealis AI is a team of researchers and developers dedicated to solving today’s leading problems in machine learning and artificial intelligence. Our researchers are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of theoretical and applied science, while our development team transforms state-of-the-art technologies and algorithms into impactful products with the potential to reach millions of people. <br/><br/> As a <strong>Machine Learning Researcher</strong>, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. We’re a lab that supports open academic collaborations with leading universities in Canada and the US on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects. Working in our lab will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to build game-changing statistical models. <br/> Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR and more. <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Performing literature reviews in areas of focus and presenting state-of-the-art findings to the team.</li><li>Conducting original research in Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Time-Series Analysis, Natural Language Processing, Optimization, Visualization and more.</li><li>Formulating and testing hypotheses quickly and efficiently.</li><li>Drafting, editing and publishing academic papers in leading scientific conferences.</li><li>Collaborating with RBC’s data scientists over the use of novel ML algorithms for data analytics</li><li>Working with the development team to transfer research results into production.</li><li>Teaching team members about latest developments in Machine Learning.</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <ul> <li>A passion for data, algorithms, and statistics.</li><li>A PhD or MSc. in computer science, engineering or another mathematically related field (e.g. Physics, Math, Statistics, etc.).</li><li>Experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in Python 3.x.</li><li>Familiarity with the Unix command line and bash scripting.</li><li>Proficiency with Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow, Theano, Keras and PyTorch.</li><li>Exposure to distributed computing frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases.</li><li>The ability to frame problems, research solutions, and successfully apply generalizable models.</li><li>A deep understanding of machine learning algorithms and/or statistical modeling.</li><li>Have experience in two or more of the following areas: Traditional Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Time-Series Analysis, Computer Vision and/or Reinforcement Learning.</li><li>Publications in fields relevant to data science or machine learning.</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply:</strong> <br/> Please email your CV and GitHub (or equivalent) portfolio to mi.research@rbc.com and include where you heard about this opportunity. <br/><br/> <strong>What’s in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. <ul> <li>A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable</li><li>Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities</li><li>Ability to make a difference and lasting impact</li><li>Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team</li><li>A world-class training program in financial services</li> </ul> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Get Career Alerts</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up for Career Alerts and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 100 College St. <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salary + Variable Bonus <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  No <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2017-12-31 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 146090 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em>

Job_Description: Senior Back-End Developers <br/><br/> Montreal, QC<br/><br/>The Challenge<br/><br/>As our Senior Back-End Developer, you will lead the design and development of back-end services associated with our E2 Platform which manages, among other things, real-time data flows to support machine learning features and also offers REST APIs to support our framework’s data-driven approach.<br/><br/>The Team<br/><br/>Our team is made up of versatile, passionate and lively developers with varying levels of expertise. They take pride in their ability to write top-quality code and create powerful products and, believing that the whole team is responsible for the code they write, shy away from working in silos.<br/><br/>The Role<br/><br/>LVL's Senior Back-End Developers are a fierce advocate of software development best practices. You should have the experience required to coach junior and intermediate developers, and can guide them to overcome a variety of technological challenges. What’s more, not only can you expertly define software architecture and clearly express your views to your team; you are also able to translate complex technological concepts and highlight the benefits of LVL’s solutions to all of the company’s internal and external stakeholders.<br/><br/>The Profile<br/><br/>You think outside of the box, can solve problems on the fly and have the interpersonal skills required to coach and manage a team. What’s more, you have at least 8 years of software development experience and are familiar with the following practices:  <ul> <li>Node.JS and TypeScript programming experience</li> <li>AWS experience</li> </ul>  The Nice-To-Haves   <ul> <li>Experience working with content management systems</li> <li>Experience working with Grafana</li> <li>Experience working with GraphQL</li> </ul>  Sound Like You? Apply Now!<br/><br/>If you are creative, motivated and have a genuine interest in contributing to the advancement of media and entertainment technology, you could be the perfect fit! <br/><br/> If you’re interested in this position but do not meet all of the requirements, we’d still love to hear from you. In addition to your résumé, make sure to send us a letter detailing why you think you’d excel in this position to careers@lvlstudio.com. <br/><br/> Also, be sure to check out our open-source library and follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook to stay up to date on any new LVL job opportunities.<br/><br/>Why Join LVL Studio?<br/><br/>Located in Montreal’s vibrant AI hub, LVL prides itself on fostering a friendly and dynamic working environment where innovation is at the heart of everything we do. <br/><br/> Join LVL and find your place within our team of expert strategists, designers and software engineers who provide major media and entertainment companies with the tools required to better reach, engage and retain audiences. From powerful entertainment platforms to leading products and services, our solutions make their way into the hands of millions of people, allowing our clients to refine the content discovery and consumption experiences they offer based on consumer trends and needs. <br/><br/> Did we mention that LVL offers a competitive benefits package, a base vacation bank starting at three weeks per year as well as flexible working hours? <br/><br/> Check out our portfolio<br/><br/>Apply to careers@lvlstudio.com
Title: Senior Back-End Developers

Job_Description: Granify is high-tech, high-energy e-commerce startup, backed by strong investors. We are building an industry-leading AI-based personalization platform for online retailers wanting to create a better online shopping experience for their customers. Do you know why some shoppers don’t buy? We do, and we can change their minds. <br/><br/> Do you want your work to have tremendous impact? Do you thrive in exploring vast amounts of data and extracting actionable knowledge out of it? Join us and you will enjoy a bustling startup vibe where everyone has fun, cooperates and sees the impact of their work. We will support you in your growth and provide learning opportunities and mentorship. You will work with an experienced, intelligent, and driven team that is highly cooperative <br/><br/> This position is full-time in Edmonton, AB, Canada. We welcome local applicants, as well as any Canadian citizens, permanent residents, or eligible international applicants willing to relocate.<br/><br/>What You'll Work On<br/><br/>As a key member of our Data Science team, you will work with vast amounts of behavior and transaction data, and design and implement algorithms which predict e-commerce shopper actions and needs. We have access to and act on millions of shopper sessions per day. This is an amazing opportunity to design algorithms which will be responsible for helping and influencing real shoppers across the world in real-time! <br/><br/> <strong>Tech Stack</strong>: We are using AWS cloud and the ML stack includes TensorFlow, Python, Spark, Tableau, and Hadoop. We have dedicated Data Engineers and Software Developers who provide support and tools needed for research and help with implementation of research outcomes. <br/><br/> As a Machine Learning Specialist with Granify you’ll:  <ul> <li>Develop new and improve existing ML models that guide our interactions with shoppers</li>  <li>Design and create AI based tools to interact with shoppers</li>  <li>Analyze, interpret and use machine learning and data mining algorithms on the enormous amount of behavioral and transactional data</li>  <li>Recommend new experiments supported by your findings and research</li>  <li>Dissect online stores’ shoppers data to identify opportunities to increase conversion, order value, lifetime value, and customer delight</li>  <li>Write code to implement your experiments</li>  <li>Work closely with our designers, developers, creative prototypers and account managers to bring your new experiments to life</li>  <li>Solve a wide variety of complex problems as they arise that will often require significant analysis of our data, research and deep thinking</li>  <li>Lead brainstorming sessions with your teammates to determine opportunities for improvement and experiments</li> </ul>  You Are...   <ul> <li>Thriving to learn new things and researches and apply them to real life problems</li>  <li>Self-motivated, hard-working and passionate about building things</li>  <li>Excited by finding elegant solutions to complex problems</li>  <li>Adept at brainstorming and creative thinking</li>  <li>Eager to ship often & iterate quickly</li>  <li>Comfortable jumping into an existing code base</li>  <li>Energetic, personable, with strong communication skills</li> </ul>  Fundamentals:   <ul> <li>MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, or related</li>  <li>Proficient in at least one programming language</li>  <li>Demonstrated ability to apply statistical or data mining techniques to solve real problems</li>  <li>Ability to organize, interpret, and analyze large amounts of data</li>  <li>Advanced skills and experience in machine learning and data mining</li>  <li>Knowledge of various ML and statistical tools and libraries (e.g. TensorFlow, sciPy, R, and similar)</li> </ul>  Bonus Points:   <ul> <li>Experienced with Deep Learning</li>  <li>Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks such as Spark</li>  <li>Experience in online advertising/marketing analytics, behavioral targeting or web analytics</li>  <li>Hands-on experience with Tableau</li> </ul>  Working at Granify<br/><br/>With offices in downtown Austin and downtown Edmonton, we’re working to create a collaborative environment where you can do and be your best. Together we’ll be tackling incredible challenges, driving customer value and innovating online retail solutions in 2018 and beyond. <br/><br/> Granify is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. You’ll find limitless opportunities for growth, development, and career progression - the only thing holding you back is you.
Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Specialist

Job_Description: Were looking for a Machine Learning Specialist Computer Vision or Deep Learning Engineer to fill a junior or mid-level full time position. If youre looking for a new adventure, join our team of talented Data scientist and Researchers to help us build innovative Computer Vision solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul>  <li>Brainstorm with the team to understand requirements and discuss solutions.</li> <li>Read state-of-the-art scientific papers related projects and develop knowledge.</li> <li>Develop solutions for achieving specific goals of extracting information from 2-D, 3-D (LiDAR) images and other types of data.</li> <li>Develop experimental pipelines for processing data, training models, predictions and tests.</li> <li>Optimize and compromise for speed, size or accuracy of productions pipelines.</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Must Skills / Knowledge</strong> <ul>  <li>Masters degree in Machine Learning or Computer Vision or Computer Science or a related field.</li> <li>Minimum 1 years or relevant work experience (academic projects are validated as experience).</li> <li>Experience in deep learning frameworks such Keras, TensorFlow, Theano, Torch or Caffe.</li> <li>Experience in Machine Learning APIs, frameworks, and AI tools.</li> <li>Experience in coding with Python (or Java or Scala or C++).</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Skills / Knowledge</strong> <ul>  <li>Experience in writing software in company, startup, or other industrial framework.</li> <li>Experience with large data sets.</li> <li>Experience in using relational databases and Big Data tools (such as Hadoop and Spark).</li> <li>Experience in image processing with OpenCV.</li> <li>Familiarity with state-of-the-art in computer vision is nice to have.</li> <li>Ability to build and evaluate predictive models.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>A natural curiosity and desire to learn</li> </ul>
Title: AI - Computer Vision and Machine Learning Scientist

Job_Description: Career Center <br/><br/> body { <br/>  background: #363636; <br/>  color: #ccc; <br/> <strong> }</strong><br/>  <div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> <div> <div> New Search</div><br/>  <div> Login Page</div> </div>  </div><br/>  <div> <div> <div> <div> Position Description</div> </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> <strong> <br/> AI / Machine Learning Scientist – Toronto AI Lab</strong><br/>  <div> <div> Location <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Toronto, Ontario</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Department (Org 2) <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Advanced AI - E60009</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Job Requisition <br/><br/> <strong>21111</strong> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>Apply Now</div><br/>  <div> <div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> <div><strong>Company:</strong></div><div><strong>Zenith R&D</strong></div></div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Job Function:</strong></div><div><strong>Engineering</strong></div></div> </div> <br/>At LG we make products and services that make lives better, easier and happier through increased functionality and fun. Put simply, we offer the latest innovations to make “Life Good” – from home appliances, consumer electronics, vehicle components and mobile communications to business innovations in digital signage, air conditioning, solar and LED lighting. As a global leader, we strive for greatness in product leadership, market leadership and people leadership to realize our growth strategies. <br/><br/> Talk about a mantra. Life’s Good with LG! <br/><br/> <strong>AI/Machine Learning Scientist – Toronto AI Lab</strong> <br/><br/> LG is looking to push boundaries of AI to build innovative disruptive product and services solutions to realize LG’s global vision for a connected world. As a part of this initiative, LG has set up an Advanced AI organization in North America centered in Silicon Valley. We are looking to tap into the world-class talent in Canada by establishing a first R&D lab in Toronto. <br/><br/> As part of LG’s North America AI initiative, we are looking for passionate and talented AI / Machine Learning scientists and engineers for our Toronto AI Lab to work closely with the global AI labs on novel and disruptive solutions that will shape out LG’s global vision for Connected Home, Connected Cars, IoT and Robotics. <br/><br/> The candidate will work with multi-disciplinary team in Silicon Valley, including data scientists, product managers and software developers, to design and launch AI products and solutions that help predict, personalize and transform lifestyles of LG’s global footprint of devices and users. Seniority will be commensurate with experience and accomplishments. <br/><br/> AI research scientists will work on advanced research topic and challenging business problem in the machine learning, natural language understanding, machine perception and cyber-physical systems, using emerging disruptive technologies. Research scientists and engineers will also design novel experiments, invent machine learning algorithms, and create prototype implementations. Research scientists and engineers are also encouraged to publish high quality papers and patents and collaborate with leading academic universities in this field. <br/><br/> <strong>Principal Duties and Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop AI/machine learning solutions targeted towards disruptive opportunities for LG business, based on perception, computer vision, speech, audio, cyber physical systems, etc.</li>  <li>Build novel machine learning/AI algorithms to develop differentiating IP for LG</li>  <li>Build quick Proof of Concepts (POC) and project ownership around projects that can demonstrate utilization, value and lead to scalable solutions</li>  <li>Actively participate in the research and academic community by disseminating novel results in top conferences and journals</li>  <li>Stay up-to-date on developments in the field and propose long term capability buildup</li>  <li>Collaborate with other R&D groups as well as business units within LG (around AI) while maintaining clear differentiation and value in our specific offerings, and leading the path of innovative value driven AI solutions.</li>  <li>Leverage experience with systems, and application development to realize products/offerings in multi-disciplinary settings.</li> </ul> <strong>Job Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, statistics or related quantitative discipline with a focus on Machine Learning/AI/Reinforcement learning or related areas with at least 3 years of experience. <strong>(Candidates without a PhD will not be considered)</strong></li>  <li>Strong background in two or more of the following areas: machine learning/AI algorithms, computations/statistical learning theory, scalable systems (e.g. Spark, Hadoop), large scale data analysis, optimization, functional analysis and deep learning.</li>  <li>Strong publication record in top conferences and journals</li>  <li>A demonstrable track record of developing novel algorithms, solutions and delivered/deployed projects in the area preferred.</li>  <li>Experience in deep learning frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, MxNet), and Large-scale optimization preferred.</li>  <li>Hands on coding experience in two or more of C/C++, Python, Scala, Lua, Java, R, Matlab</li>  <li>A sense of ambition and passion to change the world using AI and machine Learning</li>  <li>Experience in autonomous driving, smart city/home, IoT and application of AI/Machine learning in the context of these domains preferred</li> </ul> LG Electronics, USA Inc.; LG Mobilecomm USA, Inc., LG Mobile Research USA LLC, and Zenith Electronics LLC provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Further, the Company takes affirmative action to ensure that applicants are employed and employees are treated during employment without regard to any of these characteristics. <br/><br/> *IND123 <br/><br/> ​ <strong>*LI-SB1</strong><br/> <div> Back <br/> Email <br/> Apply Now</div> </div> </div></div> </div>  <br/>
Title: AI / Machine Learning Scientist – Toronto AI Lab

Job_Description: Job Description<div>We are looking for highly skilled individuals who are passionate about developing products that matter. And always curious, strive to overcome challenges, and come up with innovative and creative solutions for problems. And mostly, always thinking of the WHYs. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities will include but not limited to:</strong> <br/> Working closely within the AI team and rest of engineering organization to build out our core AI platform. <br/><br/> Integrate with our partners and vendors. <br/><br/> Data warehouse and mining. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualification:</strong> <br/> 2+ year(s) AI product development required. <br/><br/> Masters or PhD degree in computer science, operations research, statistics, engineering, or mathematics. <br/><br/> Proficiency in and experience with Java, Python, and C/C++. <br/><br/> Strong in object-oriented design and efficient data structures. <br/><br/> Knowledge in machine learning, algorithm design, complexity analysis, problem solving, and diagnosis. <br/><br/> <strong>Plus:</strong> <br/> Familiar with AWS. <br/><br/> Experience with networking and distributed systems, high performance computing, and multithreading programming. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Full-time <br/><br/> <strong>Compensation:</strong> competitive and depending on experience. <br/><br/> <strong>Please apply for this position by sending your resume to kris@trilliumhr.com</strong></div>
Title: AI Developer

Job_Description: Job Description<br/><br/><strong>Change the world at IBM.</strong> There arent many companies who can say they have been an integral part of the global business landscape for more than a century. While the world has changed considerably over the past 100 years, IBM, our people and our offerings have continuously led the way with business and technology innovation. <br/><br/> Today, we are more than a hardware, software and services provider, yet we remain true to our heritage as a team of collaborative forward-thinkers, focused on making business and society work better. We are part of the fabric of everyday life and stand for world-changing progress. <br/><br/> Join a company where you can make an impact and literally change the world. With so many different opportunities available the sky is the limit!   <ul> <li>This position resides in <strong>Toronto, Ontario</strong> and is a <strong>4 or 8 (co-op)</strong> month work term commencing <strong>September 2018</strong>. It is <strong>mandatory</strong> that all applicants are enrolled in <strong>full-time</strong> studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term.</li> </ul>  <strong>What IBM Offers You?</strong> <ul> <li>Work directly on product and services that affect our clients, while having access to cutting edge software technology</li><li>Work on projects which are challenging, innovative and rewarding</li><li>A business casual dress code and flexible work hours, to ensure work-life balance</li><li>Access to the Future Blue Community - IBMs large student community that provides networking opportunities, sporting and social events.</li> </ul> <strong>It is a mandatory requirement for students to apply online at www.ibm.com/jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Closing Date: Open Until Filled</strong>  <br/><br/> By 2020, there will be 30 Billion connected devices and IoT will generate 40% of all data. Beyond connectivity, IoT value will be driven by a revolution in Artificial intelligencedelivered through advanced analytics and cognitive <br/> capabilities. <br/><br/> IBM Watson IoT team is a global leader in helping clients re-invent their businesses with IoT by enhancing efficiencies in manufacturing, operation, asset optimization, financial services, and supply chain management. Visit our website to get an overview of the IBM Watson IoT Platform and solutions, https://www.ibm.com/internet-of-things/ <br/><br/> IBM Watson IoT platform is an industry leading cloud solution that allows you to: <ul> <li>Connect and manage IoT devices, networks and gateways</li><li>Integrating IoT data with structured and unstructured data from other sources</li><li>Gaining insights from information using real-time, predictive and cognitive</li><li>analytics</li><li>Secure IoT data with Blockchain</li><li>Develop custom machine learning algorithms using both IBM Watson and open source Deep Learning, CNN, and Computer Vision software</li><li>Deploy embedded computing and edge analytics to IoT systems</li> </ul> We are looking for developers that can work in one or multiple roles as below: <br/><br/> <strong>IoT Platform / Full Stack Developer</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with cloud platform development environments including AwS, Bluemix and Azure</li><li>Understanding of API specs and knowledge of how to create and integrate with REST services using NodeJS, ExpressJS, Sails.js, Java, etc.</li> <li>Experience with SQL and noSQL databases. Big data (Hadoop, Spark) platform is a plus</li><li>Comp Eng, Comp Sci students with proven API and web development skills</li> </ul> <strong>AI / Machine Learning Developer</strong> <ul> <li>Hands-on experience with fast prototyping using public libraries and APIs for Machine Learning or Deep Learning</li><li>Experience with Python, C#, C++, Scala, LUA, JavaScript, Matlab, or Java</li><li>Frameworks such as caffe, chainer, tensorflow, synaptic, eblearn, torch, shark, etc</li><li>Comp Eng, Comp Sci students with proven Math and programming skills</li> </ul> <strong>Embedded Systems Developer</strong> <ul> <li>Understanding of IoT hardware, sensors, gateway, network, etc</li><li>Capable of interfacing with sensors, gateways, and transceivers using embedded stack protocols and edge computing</li><li>Programming skills with C, c++, python, JS, Java, etc</li><li>Comp eng, Electrical eng, Mechanical eng, Systems Eng, Nanotech eng, Mechatronic eng</li> </ul> Are you eager to harness the IoT potential by collecting and securing data to gain real time actionable insight and implement AI solutions? <br/><br/> Are you that person who sees opportunity everywhere for digital technology to improve experiences? Can you collaborate and push the envelope to design, develop and implement leading applications for our clients? We want your skills and experience. Bring us your work portfolio and lets talk!<br/><br/>Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>Minimum of two co-op work terms in a development role</li><li>Co-op or internship program enrollment is mandatory</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience <br/><br/> None <br/><br/> EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: IoT & AI Developer - Coop

Job_Description: Experienced Python & Java/Scala Engineer <br/> Overview<br/><br/>Marketmuse Inc.s M4 Lab is seeking an experienced Python & Java/Scala engineer to help create the next generations of content analytics and content generation technologies. This role blends production software development, big data and machine learning. The engineer will work on natural language processing systems that try to understand the semantics, intent, and topical structure of vast amounts of web content at scale. This role requires extensive knowledge and experience in architecting and developing data intensive applications.<br/><br/>About Us<br/><br/>Marketmuse Inc. is a rapidly growing institutionally-backed content planning technology firm with offices in Montreal, Boston, and New York City. We are the premier provider of enterprise content planning technologies and are recognized as a leading technology for content marketing functions. MarketMuses new M4 Lab (the MarketMuse Montreal Machine Monograph Lab) will be a hub for our advanced machine learning and data sciences teams working on cutting-edge R&D to improve our systems quality of content understanding, knowledge representation, and machine learning powered content generation assistance tools. Our software also helps our clients optimize or create content ranging from short blog posts to long whitepapers.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Design and implement reliable distributed data pipelines</li> <li>Implement scalable architectures of machine learning prototype solutions geared towards solving natural language processing, knowledge representation, and natural language generation problems</li> <li>Create parallelized and/or distributed versions of existing algorithms</li> <li>Maintain and develop existing machine learning models</li> <li>Collaborate with research scientists, architects and product management to design and program innovative strategic and tactical solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles</li> <li>Gather and determine requirements for new features from internal colleagues</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Skills</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience with architecting data intensive applications</li> <li>Experience writing software in Python, Scala and/or Java. Experience working with data structures, algorithms and software design</li> <li>Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, including data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, tools and environments (such as Apache Beam, Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive, MapReduce, Flume)</li> <li>Experience with test driven development</li> <li>Experience working effectively with software engineering teams</li> <li>Mentor others in achieving their career growth potential</li> </ul>  Required Education and Experience Level   <ul> <li>At least 5 years of engineering experience with Java/Scala/Python</li> <li>At least 2 years of distributed or highly threaded software development experience</li> </ul>  Preferred But Optional Skills   <ul> <li>MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related fields</li> <li>Experience with workflow tools like Airflow, Luigi, etc.</li> <li>Experience with data mining or machine learning applications</li> <li>Hands-on experience implementing new research ideas with a neural network training framework such as Tensorflow, Keras, or PyTorch</li> </ul>
Title: Experienced Python & Java/Scala Engineer - for AI/machine learning startup

Job_Description: <strong>About the Role:</strong> <br/><br/> In this role, you will be implementing functionality similar to what you see in these videos: <br/><br/> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yUbK1yeYzAI <br/><br/> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M1ONXea0mXg <br/><br/> You will be learning and using the most advanced technologies in the fields of Natural Language Understanding, Speech, Search, and AI, all built in-house here at SoundHound over the past 10 years. <br/><br/> Weve worked hard to build a platform that enables individual developers to implement deep natural language user experiences very rapidly, often within days. These user experiences will be showcased within our Hound app, and made available to other developers via the Houndify platform, enabling them to power billions of devices and applications. <br/><br/> Your work will directly contribute to a revolution in the way people interact with the devices around them: by speaking naturally. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Leverage your C++ skills, and your ability to rapidly become proficient in a new programming paradigm</li><li>Implement, scale, and maintain non-trivial functionality end-to-end, solving algorithm and design challenges</li><li>You will be working on key portions of the unique technology powering the Hound app and Houndify platform</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent coding skills in C++ and at least one scripting language</li><li>Ability to design efficient and robust algorithms</li><li>Ability to work on hard open-ended challenges, and improve existing solutions</li><li>Comfortable working in a Linux environment</li><li>BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to haves:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with data conditioning and relevance algorithms</li><li>Experience with speech recognition and related fields</li><li>Experience manipulating and managing large amounts of data</li><li>Experience working with third-party API's</li><li>Fluent in additional languages such as: Spanish, French, German, Russian, Mandarin, Japanese, Korean, etc.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>How to Apply:</strong> <ul> <li>Please send us your resume and cover letter. Tell us why you would like a job at SoundHound in particular.</li> </ul> <strong>SoundHound Inc. turns sound into understanding and actionable meaning.</strong> <br/><br/> We believe in enabling humans to interact with the things around them in the same way we interact with each other: by speaking naturally to mobile phones, cars, TVs, music speakers, coffee machines, and every other part of the emerging 'connected' world. Our latest product, Hound, leverages our Speech-to-Meaning technology to showcase a ground-breaking smartphone experience. Our SoundHound product applies our technology to music, enabling people to discover, explore, and share the music around them, and even find the name of that song stuck in their heads by singing or humming. And through the Houndify platform, we empower developers to be part of the speech-to-meaning revolution.<strong> <br/><br/> Mission: Houndify everything.</strong></div>
Title: Software Engineer - C++/Hound

Job_Description: Job DescriptionWe are looking for an experienced machine learning scientist to contribute at the forefront of cutting edge machine learning.If you are passionate about new technology trends in machine learning, cloud services and reducing the time and effort to develop and deploy machine learned solutions we would like to talk to you. Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:   <ul>   <li>Learn and use advanced technologies</li> <li>Collaborate with internal engineering teams, leading technology companies around the world and open source community</li> <li>Evangelize deep learning technologies and services</li> <li>Create innovative products, and see them launched in high volume production</li> </ul>  As member of the software application development team in AWS AI, you will be working with cross-functional teams, customers and open source community to build deep learning applications, develop tutorials, presentation and blogs to evangelize and teach the use of deep learning, contribute to the deep learning framework development and develop new AI application and services. This position within the Deep Learning team presents a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor within a fast growing business and help shape the technology, product and the business. A successful candidate will bring deep technical expertise in machine learning or high performance computing, desire to have an industry wide impact and ability to work within a fast moving, startup environment in a large company to rapidly deliver services that have a broad business impact. <br/> Basic Qualifications   <ul>   <li>MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning or related field or equivalent work experience.</li> <li>5+ years professional experience in conducting experiments, building and deploying machine learned solutions.</li> <li>Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, high-performance computing and GPGPU programming.</li> <li>Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, complexity analysis, problem solving and diagnosis.</li> <li>Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as Java, Python, C/C++, C#, Perl.</li> </ul>  Preferred Qualifications   <ul>   <li>PhD in Computer Science, Math or Engineering</li> <li>5+ years of software development experience</li> <li>Knowledge in at least 3 languages or frameworks typically used for machine learning</li> <li>5+ years experience in big data processing or machine learning</li></ul>
Title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist - AWS AI Deep Learning

Job_Description: Description <br/>  <div> <em>Position at Coveo Solutions</em></div>  <br/>Blown away by the latest news about Netflix recommendations algorithms? Can’t get enough of learning about the logic behind Amazon’s purchase suggestions? We believe you have found your chance to put your experience and vast knowledge of Machine Learning, Data science and AI to work! <br/>  <br/> <strong>Become an AI guru</strong> <br/>  <br/> We are on the lookout for an AI connoisseur to make a brand new addition to our brilliant Machine Learning team. You are well-versed in a few programming languages (ex: Scala and Python) and large-scale data analysis platforms like Spark. You have worked professionally on several ML, NLP or AI projects in the past and have proven yourself to be a talented, well-rounded and well-informed expert on the subject. <br/><br/> Here is what we have in store for you on a typical day:  <ul> <li>Your day begins at the time of your choosing (no fixed schedule!), you pour yourself a fresh (free) cup of coffee</li> <li>You take part in the daily scrum meeting to be well aware of where your team is at and bounce a few ideas around</li><li>Back to your desk (or other work station) to continue working on the development of a few new algorithms you’re currently evaluating and testing</li><li>You show your colleagues the results of the tests you ran yesterday on a new algorithm that will revolutionise the intelligent search industry</li><li>You challenge your teammates on their hard work - We believe in rigorous code reviews to maintain an equilibrium between code performance, robustness, and elegance.</li> </ul>  You can expect to use the following tools on a daily basis: Our Coveo Cloud Platform, IntelliJ IDEA/Eclipse, Spark, Amazon Web Services (AWS), JIRA, Bitbucket (Mercurial), Google Docs/Sheets (to document tests and experiments), Slack. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Tell me more...</strong> <br/>  <br/> As a Machine Learning Developer, you will be encouraged to innovate and bring ideas to the table. You will have the opportunity to :  <ul> <li>Design, develop and improve our machine learning algorithms for our search tool</li><li>Improve our personalised search recommendations, automatic user grouping and auto-configuration of algorithms for each client/organisation</li><li>Personalise search results scheduling for each client/organisation</li><li>Experiment and compare the impact of recent changes on our algorithms’ performance metrics</li><li>Identify relevant usage patterns within the tens of thousands of data collected everyday</li><li>Analyse certain client cases to suggest improvements</li><li>Support our production team by analysing reported bugs and correcting accordingly</li> </ul>  <strong>And if you’re STILL not convinced:</strong> <br/>  <br/> <strong>What is Coveo all about?</strong> The Best information. Everywhere. Every Time. Recognized as THE Leader in intelligent search and insights, Coveo enables users to benefit from the latest, most relevant information for their needs, via a traditional search box or contextualized content recommendations. Major companies such as Adobe, Logitech and GoPro use Coveo to better answer their customer inquiries, facilitate self-service, accelerate innovation and sell more (and better). <br/><br/> <strong>What is it like to work at Coveo?</strong> You’ll come to join a team of passionate people with an innovative mindset that constantly push the envelope. Then you’ll enjoy learning with the best, the empowerment and trust from the leadership and the major projects you’ll be given leadership on. And you’ll stay for the « Work Hard Play hard » mentality; we sweat it off at work and know how to have fun and facilitate a balance with your personal life. For all these reasons,Coveo has been awarded the Grand and Gold Stevie Awards for great employers in 2016. <br/>
Title: Machine Learning Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Machine Learning Developer - Borealis AI</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What is the opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> Borealis AI is a team of researchers and developers dedicated to solving todays leading problems in machine learning and artificial intelligence. Our researchers are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of theoretical and applied science, while our development team transforms state-of-the-art technologies and algorithms into impactful products with the potential to reach millions of people. <br/><br/> Were looking for an enthusiastic software developer whos excited by the opportunity of being at the forefront of machine learning technology, and working on extremely challenging problems. As a Machine Learning Developer, youll be responsible for owning and delivering a project end to end everything from literature review and data pre-processing to implementing machine learning algorithms and front-end development. <br/><br/> At Borealis AI, youll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. You can find out more about our research areas at www.rbcresearchinstitute.com. <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Reviewing scientific literature to identify state-of-the-art algorithms in project-specific areas.</li><li>Prototyping solutions to evaluate the impact of selected algorithms on the target problem.</li><li>Collaborating with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions.</li><li>Optimizing algorithms and prototypical solutions for efficient implementation.</li><li>Extending prototypes into fully functional, polished solutions ready for internal and/or external use.</li><li>Supporting projects with thorough documentation of usage, design decisions and capabilities.</li><li>Extracting, transforming and loading massive datasets using distributed computing framework technologies (Hadoop, Spark etc.).</li><li>Demoing products and projects to various internal and external stakeholders.</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <ul> <li>Are a recent (0-3 years) post-secondary graduate in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent.</li><li>Have 2+ years of software development experience (including co-op and internships) in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment.</li><li>Have demonstrated interest or experience in two or more of the following areas: Traditional Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Time-Series Analysis, Computer Vision, Reinforcement Learning.</li><li>Experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in Python 3.x.</li><li>Experience with data visualization using D3.js, Chart.js, plotly or other open-source library.</li><li>Familiarity with the Unix command line and bash scripting.</li><li>Proficiency with Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow, Theano, Keras and PyTorch.</li><li>Exposure to distributed computing frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases.</li><li>Have an active public profile where you share passion projects.</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply:</strong> <br/> Please email your CV and GitHub (or equivalent) portfolio to mi.research@rbc.com and include where you heard about this opportunity. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. <ul> <li>A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable</li><li>Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities</li><li>Ability to make a difference and lasting impact</li><li>Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team</li><li>A world-class training program in financial services</li> </ul> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Get Career Alerts</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up for Career Alerts and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 100 College St. <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salary + Variable Bonus <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  No <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2017-12-31 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 146089 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em><br/><br/>Apply Now!
Title: Machine Learning Developer

Job_Description: <p><strong><br></strong></p>  <p><strong>Opening: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)</strong></p>  <p><strong>Who we are</strong></p>  <p>DeepLearni.ng is a technology company transforming the way enterprises work with AI around the world. Based in Toronto, we work with enterprise leaders to collaboratively build and deploy customized AI systems that solve real business problems. DeepLearni.ngs creation of enterprise AI systems is powered by our end-to-end platform Frontiers, designed to optimize team collaboration on enterprise AI systems. </p>  <p>We are also an active player in the AI community, and have partnerships with industry leaders including NVIDIA, the Vector Institute and Amazon Web Services. In 2017, we were named AI Company of the Year by the DFI Institute and received Series A funding.</p>  <p>A few examples of our work: </p>  <ul><li>Reinforcement learning for the credit risk areas of retail banking</li><li>Image classification for insurance adjudication and claims processing</li><li>Self-optimizing environmental controls for vertical farming</li><li>Machine vision for robot warehouse navigation</li></ul>  <p><strong>What is the opportunity?</strong><br></p>  <p>We are looking for a<strong> Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)</strong> to join our high performing team. The SRE will be a foundational member creating the practice of stringently testing machine learning tools for enterprise, including an end-to-end machine learning platform. You will work with diverse enterprise teams across industry verticals, helping drive quality assurance, user acceptance testing, performance optimization, load testing and go-to-market for tools and metrics. </p>  <p>As SRE, your main focus will be to maintain a high bar and rigorous standards in overall quality and user experience of new machine learning tools custom-built for enterprise. You will also create new efficiencies for our Engineering team, driving programs designed to measure their efficacy and velocity, with KPIs reported to the CTO on a weekly basis.</p>  <p>Working with a diverse range of technologies and clients across industry verticals, you will have the opportunity to become a leading expert in delivering transformative machine learning solutions to industry designed for real-world results. As part of a vibrant and growing team, you will be at the frontier of the AI revolution.</p>  <p><strong>What will you do?</strong></p>  <ul><li><em><u>Quality Assurance</u></em>: maintain, update and create strong QA methodology and testing of all our product lines to deliver bug-free code to our clients</li><li><em><u>Performance Testing</u>: </em>ensure that our world class tools enable machine learning experts (and aficionados alike) to run experiments at break-neck speed (as fast or faster than any CLI)</li><li><em><u>Load Testing</u>: </em>help us optimize and find the limitations of the system as a whole</li><li><em><u>Reliability and Usability Testing</u>: </em>give the best of user experience in the paradigm of always up, 100% SLA world</li><li><em><u>User Experience Refinement</u></em>: empathy for the end user and ability to positively impact usability for a multitude of enterprise users</li><li><em><u>Foundational Leader</u></em>: set the process for the quality assurance practice and facilitate across team for our lines of products</li><li><em><u>Release Management</u>: </em>produce deployment plans, run books and implementation plans; conduct release readiness reviews, milestone reviews, and go/no-go reviews</li><li><em><u>Project Management</u></em>: quality assurance, user acceptance testing to go-to-market strategies to optimize product launch success </li><li><em><u>Training & Collateral</u></em>: work with product marketing, product management and account management / professional services organizations to build collateral for training the wider organization, and to scale solutions globally</li><li><em><u>Enterprising</u>: </em>collaborate on identification of new opportunities for DeepLearni.ng to innovate on behalf of our customers in conjunction with Product Management, Business Development and Client input</li><li><em><u>Outreach</u>: </em>active involvement in evangelism activities such as giving tech talks, running webinars, leading internal hack-a-thons and coordinating lunch & learns / DoJos</li></ul>  <p><strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong></p>  <p><em>Must have:</em></p>  <ul><li>3+ years of software development experience with hands-on experience in reliability testing, including experience testing low-level system concepts </li><li>An Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, or similar degree</li><li>Demonstrable experience with Agile or similar methodologies designed for continuous product development</li><li>Ability to root cause sources of instability in a large-scale distributed system</li><li>Experience with configuration and troubleshooting of Linux, Java, Scala, Spark, PySpark, Hadoop, Kubernetes and other middleware technologies</li><li>Strong understanding of large-scale complex systems from a reliability perspective</li><li>Scripting abilities in scripting languages such as Python, Perl, Ruby, Bash, NodeJS or JVM-based languages</li><li>Passion for resolving reliability issues and identify strategies to mitigate going forward</li><li>Ability to dive extremely deep into code, network transports, REST APIs, websockets in a Linux environment</li></ul>  <p><em>Nice to have:</em></p>  <ul><li>Excellent speaking, listening, and writing skills, attention to details, proactive self-starter</li><li>Strong Linux system-level analysis capabilities</li><li>Experience delivering solutions at scale based on a variety of cloud and on-premises services (in the datacenter, AWS, Google, Azure, Digital Ocean, etc.)</li><li>Ensure community reach, having lead meetups, webinars, hacks, etc., including contributions to open-source or personal projects</li><li>Experience working on a B2B application for enterprise clients</li><li>Experience with or knowledge of machine learning and deep network analysis</li></ul>  <p><strong>Whats in it for you?</strong></p>  <ul><li>Work with purpose: contribute to deploying machine learning models that drive real business impact across industry verticals </li><li>Opportunity to work with leading machine learning experts on cutting-edge problems </li><li>Opportunities to develop relationships with a variety of industry decision-makers, subject-matter experts, software developers, and machine learning specialists </li><li>Split time between your work duties and pursuing personal machine learning passion projects with mentoring from our machine learning experts</li><li>Participate in feats of strength and lively company events that build your career toolkit while also enjoying a work-life balance </li><li>Enjoy a comfortable company work environment located in downtown Toronto that encourages self-expression, creativity, honesty, and learning</li><li>Amazing quality of life benefits: healthy snacks, gym memberships, travel accommodations, great health benefits, and more! </li><li>Stock options possible after you have proven your impact on the job </li><li>As needed: sponsorship for work visas</li></ul>  <p><strong>How to apply</strong></p>  <p>We look forward to receiving your application! Please apply directly online by sending your resume and cover letter addressed to the Hiring Manager. Please note that we will be in touch with applicants that make it to the next phase of the interview process directly.</p>  <p><em>By submitting your CV and application to this role, you authorize DeepLearni.ng to store your information in our internal recruitment database and to reach out to you as necessary for the purpose of further evaluating your qualifications for this or other career opportunities at the company.<br></em></p>  <p><em>We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.</em></p>  <p><br></p>
Title: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)

Job_Description: At integrate.ai, our mission is to build a future in which AI enriches peoples lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. To do this we are building an AI powered platform for B2C enterprises that integrates with business processes to make client interactions more natural and valuable. We are proudly based in downtown Toronto, Canada at the center of an exciting AI ecosystem. <br/><br/> We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our client team. This role will be working to develop statistical and machine learning models to power our AI platform. This is a unique opportunity for someone who wants to grow in the world of machine learning and work with a team of passionate individuals committed to the mission of bringing ML to enterprise. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will be doing:</strong>  <ul> <li>Researching, developing, and validating models to generate recommendations, alerts, and other client insights and client-facing business processes.</li> <li>Performing feature engineering and selection to support machine learning.</li> <li>Working with business stakeholders and our product team to translate product requirements into machine learning research and development activities.</li> <li>Working with architects, data and quality assurance engineers to develop processes, monitoring and testing automation frameworks to ensure data, insights, and model quality while delivering analytical insights into the product.</li> <li>Conduct statistical inference and unsupervised machine learning to discover trends and correlations.</li> <li>Document, communicate, and educate clients on product capabilities powered by statistical analysis and machine learning.</li> </ul> <strong>You have:</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years of hands-on machine learning experience, ideally in a high growth software development environment.</li> <li>A Degree in Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Operational Research, Computer Science, or a related quantitative discipline.</li> <li>Deep understanding of statistical modelling and machine learning.</li> <li>Passion about deriving insights from large datasets and communicating those insights to clients, product managers and engineers.</li> <li>Experience in the use of statistical analysis and machine learning tools, packages and languages such as Python scikit, R, Spark MLlib, TensorFlow, Theano, and PyTorch.</li> </ul> The diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ais team members help us make better decisions and drive great results. We foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. We are committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. We hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and growth. <br/><br/> We are naturally curious and have strong attention to detail. We love working in a team environment where trust is key and we all strive to make an impact every day. If this sounds like the right fit, please apply and come work with us.
Title: Machine Learning Scientist

Job_Description: <strong>Opening: Technical Product Owner</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> DeepLearni.ng is a technology company transforming the way enterprises work with AI around the world. Based in Toronto, we work with enterprise leaders to collaboratively build and deploy customized AI systems that solve real business problems. DeepLearni.ngs creation of enterprise AI systems is powered by our end-to-end platform Frontiers, designed to optimize team collaboration on enterprise AI systems. <br/><br/> We are also an active player in the AI community, and have partnerships with industry leaders including NVIDIA, the Vector Institute and Amazon Web Services. In 2017, we were named AI Company of the Year by the DFI Institute and received Series A funding. <br/><br/> A few examples of our work: <ul> <li>Reinforcement learning for the credit risk areas of retail banking</li><li>Image classification for insurance adjudication and claims processing</li><li>Self-optimizing environmental controls for vertical farming</li><li>Machine vision for robot warehouse navigation</li> </ul> <strong>What is the opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a <strong>Technical Product Owner</strong> who is passionate about driving product management activities in all facets of the product life-cycle while working closely with the development team in a fast-paced Agile environment. Prior hands-on experience in software product development as a hands-on Software Engineer or Developer is required to be successful in this role. <br/><br/> Working with a diverse range of technologies and clients across industry verticals, you will have the opportunity to become a leading expert in delivering transformative machine learning solutions to industry designed for real-world results. As part of a vibrant and growing team, you will be at the frontier of the AI revolution. <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Translate pieces of functionality that are prioritized in the product roadmap into fully fleshed out features</li><li>Identify comprehensive lists of use cases and define acceptance criteria to support iterative releases</li><li>Translate user needs into story details and acceptance criteria</li><li>Facilitate two-way communication between the engineering and product teams</li><li>Work with the engineering team to understand technical complexities, standups, retrospectives, and demos to give feedback on sprint achievement to the larger team, as well as to the scrum team</li><li>Participate in customer-facing demos and gather customer feedback</li> <li>Conduct primary and secondary research to identify user needs and pain-points</li><li>Conduct market research to use as input into the product strategy</li> </ul> <strong>What do you Manager/Scrum master, OR</li><li>5+ years of hands-on experience as a Software Engineer or Developer in pursuit of a transition into a Product Management role</li><li>An Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, or other quantitative degree</li><li>Full-stack web development and REST API experience, combined with a strong appreciation for UI/UX design and empathy for different users needs and concerns</li><li>Understanding of data science, data engineering, distributed computing, or big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Flink, Kafka, etc.</li><li>Experience with any of the following languages and technologies: Python, R, Scala, Ruby, Javascript, SQL, AWS/Azure/Google cloud infrastructure, Kubernetes, NumPy, NoSQL databases (Cassandra, MongoDB), Docker, Puppet, Chef, Ansible</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>Strong technical knowledge in systems design, architecture, and information security</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience producing high quality technical documentation</li><li>Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to dissect problems and projects into manageable tasks and assess trade-offs</li><li>Experience working with Agile and Scrum development processes throughout the SDLC</li><li>Proficient with JIRA, VersionOne, or similar agile management tools</li><li>Understanding of Version Control, Continuous Integration, and Continuous Deployment concepts and tools</li> <li>Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of people, and in a rapidly changing multi-disciplinary work environment</li> </ul> <em>Nice to have:</em> <ul> <li>Familiarity with AI, machine learning, deep learning, and related tools such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, MXNet, Scikit-learn, etc.</li><li>Experience with data-related products and/or projects and knowledge in statistics, data modeling, big data, data science, and/or data analytics tools</li> <li>Experience working in one or more of the following sectors: banking, insurance, telecommunications</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <ul> <li>Work with purpose: contribute to deploying machine learning models that drive real business impact across industry verticals</li> <li>Opportunity to work with leading machine learning experts on cutting-edge problems</li> <li>Opportunities to develop relationships with a variety of industry decision-makers, subject-matter experts, software developers, and machine learning specialists</li> <li>Split time between your work duties and pursuing personal machine learning passion projects with mentoring from our machine learning experts</li><li>Participate in feats of strength and lively company events that build your career toolkit while also enjoying a work-life balance</li> <li>Enjoy a comfortable company work environment located in downtown Toronto that encourages self-expression, creativity, honesty, and learning</li><li>Amazing quality of life benefits: healthy snacks, gym memberships, travel accommodations, great health benefits, and more!</li> <li>Stock options possible after you have proven your impact on the job</li> <li>As needed: sponsorship for work visas</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply</strong> <br/><br/> We look forward to receiving your application! Please apply directly online by sending your resume and cover letter addressed to the Hiring Manager.
