Title: Technical Product Owner

Job_Description: Play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction, contribute to a product portfolio that is rethinking how people use voice and messaging to work @ work, and work with other people who want to build great products using the latest technology in conversational user interfaces. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Implementing features for the conversational user experience, across modalities (messaging, voice) and platforms (SMS, Google Assistant, Siri, Alexa, and more)</li> <li>Work on primarily frontend feature development as part of a small team, and able to participate in backend and platform activities where it make sense</li> <li>Prototyping ways to iteratively learn, optimize for growth, and improve the user experience</li> <li>Collaborating within a cross-functional team, helping to create elegant systems that maximize reuse across technologies</li> <li>Dogged focus on software quality, performance analysis, and system tuning where possible</li>   <li>Applying lessons learned to other exciting client projects, and vice versa</li> </ul> <strong> Desired Skills & Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years experience developing commercial shipping products</li> <li>BS or MS in Computer Science, equivalent degree and/or equivalent experience</li> <li>Exceptional application development experience with Javascript (React, Angular.js, Node.js), Objective-C, Cocoa, Swift, Java and C++</li> <li>Knowledge of mobile development APIs (UIKit, Cocoa Touch, CoreFoundation, etc.)</li> <li>Development pipeline experience (Versioning, Automation, Testing, Continuous Integration, etc.) is an asset</li> <li>A well-trained eye for design, and the ability to collaborate with designers, are definite assets</li> <li>Familiarity with Unix, Speech Interfaces, AI/Machine Learning, and conversational UIs are assets</li> <li>Referenceable track record of positively impacting a team, and caring about your fellow human</li> </ul> <strong> Benefits & Perks</strong>  <ul> <li>Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship</li> <li>Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical development shop: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities</li> <li>Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated Awesome time (self-directed professional development) annually and quarterly training budgets</li> <li>Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage</li> <li>Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere</li> <li>Additional perks based on employee feedback and interest, including in-house mindfulness training, yoga, group get-togethers and more!</li> </ul> <strong>About Myplanet</strong> <br/><br/> Were a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the worlds most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, Ukraine, and Chicago, we're a team of 90 designers, product managers & engineers hell-bent on making the workplace better. <br/><br/> <strong>A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace</strong> <br/><br/> We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
Title: Conversational Product Developer

Job_Description: Why work at Sheridan? Click to view our video! <br/><br/> <strong>Faculty/Department:</strong> Applied Science and Technology <br/><br/> <strong>Employee Group:</strong> Academic <br/><br/> <strong>Campus:</strong> Trafalgar (May be assigned activities at any Sheridan campus) <br/><br/> <strong>Reference Number:</strong> 18/F/25 <br/><br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong> Open until filled <br/> <strong>Start Date:</strong> August 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Salary Range:</strong> $62,717 - $108,723 (based on relevant educational qualifications and experience) <br/><br/> Sheridan is looking for outstanding individuals to join our faculty team. The successful candidate will have a strong background that focuses on developing and using machine-learning algorithms and AI platforms, including big data technologies, used in the development of mobile and traditional software systems. Expertise in developing machine-learning based solutions using a variety of programming languages, technologies and frameworks is critical. The candidate must be able to teach courses in artificial intelligence and machine Learning, cognitive computing, modeling, simulation and visualization, data analytics and data mining. Additionally, the candidate must be able to supervise undergraduate student research and participate actively in curriculum development. <br/><br/> The candidate will teach using the latest machine-learning algorithms, platforms and big-data technologies for building smart mobile and traditional software systems. Currently, machine-learning methods include SVM, Neural Networks, Bayesian Networks, as well as various cloud and mobile AI services such as CoreML, Tensor Flow, Watson Assistant and Watson Analytics, Azure Cognitive Services, Bot Framework, and others. Practical experience with building and training machine learning models is a critical asset. <br/><br/> The successful candidate will focus on teaching courses in the <strong>Honours Bachelor of Computer Science (Mobile Computing)</strong> program and other programs as needed in the <strong>Faculty of Applied Science and Technology</strong> and will also contribute to program and curriculum development. With the increased focus on undergraduate research delivered within curriculum, candidates will also have the opportunity to participate in applied research roles, in the <strong>Center for Mobile Innovation (CMI)</strong> as well as other Applied Research Centres at Sheridan College. Evidence of a strong commitment to and qualification for both teaching and supervising student research is essential. <br/><br/> <strong>Specific Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> • Ensuring that program and course curricula are current, relevant and reflective of best practices within the appropriate professional/program disciplines   <ul> <li>Defining, evaluating and validating learning outcomes and topical outlines for courses and programs</li> <li>Creating an effective experiential and purposeful learning environment that accommodates students’ diverse cultural and educational backgrounds, experiences and learning styles, fosters creativity and resilience and builds on rigour of depth and breadth appropriate to each course</li> <li>Designing appropriate strategies and tools for facilitating and assessing student learning that are reflective of best practices in teaching and learning</li> <li>Developing appropriate strategies and tools to assess student performance in authentic ways that are consistent with the learning outcomes of the course and address multiple learning styles</li> <li>Developing multi-media materials, diverse delivery strategies, and incorporating appropriate educational technologies into the applied learning process</li> <li>Supervising students in their graduation Capstone Project or Thesis to provide guidance, mentorship and technical expertise as needed, and to support collaboration with industry experts to develop purposeful projects that aim to solve real-world problems in industry and community <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong>: <br/><br/> • Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or in a related field of study (PhD preferred);</li> <li>A minimum of three years relevant professional experience in industry or academia;</li> <li>Expertise in machine learning algorithms and methods, supervised and unsupervised learning and a diverse set of machine learning applications;</li> <li>Experience using machine learning frameworks such as CoreML, Tensor Flow, Watson ML, Azure Cognitive Services;</li> <li>Experience in designing and building conversational applications using bot frameworks such as Watson Assistant, Amazon Alexa Skills, Microsoft Bot Framework or similar;</li> <li>Experience with a variety of languages used in development and use of ML models, including one or more of the following: Python, R, Matlab, C/C+/C#/Java;</li> <li>Experience in using cognitive computing and machine learning tools in mobile app development is a strong asset;</li> <li>Experience in using machine learning algorithms for data mining and data analytics is a strong asset;</li> <li>Experience teaching and curriculum development at the post-secondary level or equivalent industry experience preferred;</li> <li>Experience in supervising undergraduate Capstone and Thesis in Computer Science and undergraduate applied research projects preferred;</li> <li>Formal studies in adult or higher education an asset;</li> <li>Strong network of contacts with other academics, professionals, organizations and employers;</li> <li>Excellent communications and interpersonal skills;</li> <li>Ability to convey the conceptual and applied aspects of knowledge to a broad range of students;</li> <li>Committed to excellence in teaching and learning and to working within a team environment. <br/><br/> Sheridan welcomes diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from all qualified individuals, including visible minorities, Indigenous People, and persons with disabilities. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), Sheridan is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. At any stage of the hiring process, Human Resources will work with applicants requesting accommodation. <br/><br/> Note: Copies of educational credentials are requested at the time of an interview. As a condition of employment, Sheridan requires confirmation of educational credentials in the form of an official Canadian transcript or an official evaluation of international credentials which determines Canadian equivalency. <br/><br/> <strong>Please apply online:</strong> <strong>https://careers-sheridancollege.icims.com</strong> <br/><br/> </li>  </ul>
Title: Professor, Cognitive Computing and Machine Learning

Job_Description: <div> <div>Deep Genomics is a Toronto-based startup company that is changing the future of medicine using artificial intelligence. Founded in 2015, Deep Genomics brings together a multidisciplinary team of world-leading experts in machine learning, genomics, chemistry and biology. Together we are on a mission to develop an AI-powered platform for rapid discovery and development of the best genetic medicines, focusing on oligonucleotide drugs for the treatment of patients with rare genetic diseases.</div><br/>  <div>Ideal Candidate</div> <br/> <div>We are seeking a creative and experienced machine learning scientist to decipher how mutations and genetic medicines influence the molecular world of the cell. The successful candidate will develop machine learning approaches for modeling complex RNA- and protein-level outcomes based on massively parallel assays. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of publishing at top machine learning conferences (NIPS, ICML, ICLR) or has applied deep learning to genomics in a top life sciences journal.</div></div><br/>  <div> <div> Requirements/Qualifications  <ul>    <ul> <li>MSc (Junior Scientist) or PhD (Senior Scientist) trained in machine learning.</li> <li>Extensive practical experience at systematically designing, training, debugging, and evaluating neural networks using modern frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, or Theano.</li> <li>Excellent scientific writing and presentation skills.</li> <li>Senior Scientists must demonstrate leadership and ability to introduce new machine learning techniques.</li></ul>   </ul>  </div> </div>  <br/><strong><div> <div> What we offer:</strong>  <ul>    <ul> <li>A chance to develop machine learning techniques that will save human lives.</li> <li>Inspiring, creative, and fast-moving startup work environment in downtown Toronto</li> <li>Competitive compensation package including stock options</li></ul>   </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div>Deep Genomics thanks all applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.</div><br/>  <div>Deep Genomics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</div></div> <br/>
Title: Scientist – Machine Learning

Job_Description: Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.<br/><br/>SEED Chercheur en apprentissage <br/> profond / Deep Learning Researcher - <br/> (Montréal) <br/> Français<br/><br/>SEED est une organisation de R et D chez Electronic Arts dont la mission est de rechercher et de développer l’avenir du divertissement et des jeux interactifs. Nos domaines de recherche comprennent la réalité virtuelle et augmentée, la conception des mondes de jeu de demain, la génération de contenu procédural et l’apprentissage profond, c’est-à-dire réseaux neuronaux et autres techniques d’apprentissage machine appliquées à l’IA de jeu et à la conception de jeux. <br/> Nous collaborons avec les franchises de jeu comme Battlefield, Mass Effect, Need for Speed et Dragon Age, et des jeux comme Star Wars: Battlefront, Mirror’s Edge: Catalyst et EA Sports FIFA. <br/> SEED a besoin d’un <strong>chercheur spécialisé en apprentissage profond</strong>. Nous misons actuellement sur l’apprentissage par renforcement et les modèles génératifs.<br/><br/>Quelles sont les compétences recherchées par SEED?<br/><br/>À titre de chercheur travaillant avec l’équipe d’apprentissage profond, vous devrez avoir une <em>passion</em> pour le domaine. <br/> Signes de passion : <ul> <li>Arxiv.org est votre site Web préféré.</li><li>Vous êtes impatient d'implémenter le tout dernier GAN dans Pytorch ou TensorFlow.</li><li>Les mystères entourant les hyperparamètres vous empêchent de dormir.</li> </ul> Si c’est le cas, poursuivez votre lecture. <br/> Le candidat idéal sera ouvert et curieux, impatient d’apprendre et d’enseigner. Il doit prendre plaisir à utiliser des techniques d’apprentissage machine avant-gardistes, à les étudier et à les adapter à des cas concrets de jeu et de divertissement interactif. Nous travaillons en petites équipes et vous demanderons d’avoir non seulement de l’initiative, mais également de travailler concrètement à nos projets.<br/><br/>Compétences recherchées :  <ul> <li>Connaissance experte en apprentissage machine ou en apprentissage par renforcement, PhD ou expérience équivalente misant sur les réseaux neuronaux profonds, les réseaux convolutionnels, les réseaux récurrents et les modèles génératifs</li><li>Compétences mathématiques; calculs, algèbre linéaire, optimisation et théorie des probabilités</li><li>Compétences en vision artificielle et traitement de signaux</li><li>Compétences en ingénierie logicielle; Python et C++ ou C#</li><li>Capacité de lire, de comprendre et d’expliquer aux autres des textes scientifiques sur l’apprentissage machine de pointe et l’informatique, et capacité d’établir un prototype, d’évaluer et d’améliorer les idées décrites</li> </ul>  <strong>Avec SEED:</strong>  <ul> <li>Tout est possible. Allez au bout de vos rêves.</li><li>Nous n'engageons que des personnes sympathiques, de milieux variés, qui s'intéressent au bien-être de leurs collègues.</li><li>Travaillez de l'endroit optimal pour atteindre vos objectifs.</li><li>Gérez votre temps. Passion, impact et résultats sont plus important que le nombre d'heures.</li><li>Partagez votre travail: vous êtes encouragé à publier, contribuer à des projets ouverts ou présenter lors de conférences.</li><li>Chaque projet est unique. Utilisez votre imagination pour repousser les limites.</li><li>Chaque personne est unique. Nous offrons un encadrement personnalisé pour vous permettre d'atteindre votre plein potentiel.</li><li>Vous façonnerez le futur du divertissement interactif.</li> </ul>  Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir? Bonne question!<br/><br/>Nous adorons vanter les avantages que nous offrons comme des régimes d'assurance-maladie et d'avantages sociaux complets, le remboursement des frais de cours, un régime d'épargne-retraite avec cotisation équivalente et, bien sûr, plusieurs autres à-côtés. Nous savons que pour créer des jeux de renommée mondiale, il nous faut des talents de classe mondiale. C'est pourquoi nous offrons une rémunération concurrentielle ainsi qu'une culture basée sur la créativité et l'individualité. Chez EA, nous incarnons le modèle « travail-loisir » chaque jour. <br/><br/> Plus sur notre emplacement : http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal <br/><br/> Communiquez avec notre responsable du recrutement : shandaw@ea.com<br/><br/>English<br/><br/>SEED is an R&D organization within Electronic Arts whose purpose is to research and develop the future of interactive entertainment and games. Our areas of research include virtual and augmented reality, how to build the game worlds of the future, procedural content generation, and deep learning, i.e. neural networks and other machine learning techniques applied to game AI and game design. <br/> We collaborate with game franchises like Battlefield, Mass Effect, Need for Speed and Dragon Age, as well as games such as Star Wars: Battlefront, Mirror’s Edge: Catalyst and EA Sports FIFA. <br/> SEED is looking for a Researcher with a specialization in deep learning. We are currently focusing on deep reinforcement learning and generative model<em>s</em>.<br/><br/>What skills is SEED looking for?<br/><br/>As a <strong>Researcher working in the deep learning</strong> team we expect you to have a <em>passion</em> for the subject. <br/> Signs of passion can be: <ul> <li>Arxiv.org is your favorite web site</li><li>You can't wait to implement the latest GAN code in Pytorch or TensorFlow.</li><li>Hyperparameter mysteries keep you awake at night</li> </ul> If that’s the case, continue reading. <br/><br/> We think that you are an open and curious person who is eager to learn and teach. You get a kick out of taking bleeding-edge machine learning techniques, investigating and adapting them to real use cases for gaming and interactive entertainment. We work in small teams, and we expect you to not only to take initiative, but also work hands-on in our projects.<br/><br/>We also think you have:  <ul> <li>Expert knowledge in machine learning and/or reinforcement learning, PhD or similar level of experience, focusing on deep neural networks, convolutional networks, recurrent networks and generative models</li><li>Math skills; you know your calculus, linear algebra, optimization and probability theory</li><li>Some 3D Computer Vision and Signal Processing experience</li><li>Software engineering skills, you know Python and C++ or C#</li><li>The ability to read, understand, and explain to others, scientific papers on state-of-the-art machine learning and computer science, as well as the ability to prototype, evaluate and improve the ideas described</li> </ul>  <strong>At SEED:</strong>  <ul> <li>The sky is the limit of your ideas. Pursue dreams and start working on making them come true.</li><li>We only hire nice people. We look after each other and come from diverse backgrounds.</li><li>You work from where you have the greatest opportunity of reaching your goals.</li><li>You're in charge of your time. We value passion, impact and results over hours.</li><li>You're encouraged to share your work, publish, open source and speak at conferences.</li><li>Each project is unique. We need you to use your imagination and push boundaries.</li><li>Each person is unique. We offer individual coaching and support to help you reach your own full potential.</li><li>You will be part of shaping the future of interactive entertainment.</li> </ul>  What’s in it for you? Glad you asked!<br/><br/>We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, RRSP company match and, of course, many other perks! And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives off of creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the “work hard/play hard” credo every day. <br/><br/> More about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal <br/><br/> Contact our Recruiter: shandaw@ea.com
Title: SEED Chercheur en apprentissage profond / Deep Learning Researcher

Job_Description: Overview<br/><br/><strong>Inspire the World, Create the Future.</strong> <br/><br/> Do you believe in the power of technology to help shape a brighter future and a stronger global community? Are you inspired by the possibilities? Are innovation, camaraderie, and the pursuit of excellence part of your innate drive? Then you've got what it takes to succeed at Samsung. <br/><br/> Samsung is building out an AI Research lab located in Toronto, Ontario and we are currently recruiting world-class professionals who share our "Innovation through Passion" philosophy and thrive in a fast-paced, cross-team, results-driven environment with a focus on highly visible, challenging, and interdisciplinary projects. Join us and build technologies that shape the future of mobile and beyond. Participate in the building of research prototypes, play a key role in transitioning research to product, and work to improve product-research integration. Enjoy being able to deploy cutting edge AI into world leading products.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Develop and implement tooling, strategies, and approaches for getting research deployed to product</li> <li>Build tooling to streamline common tasks across the research organization</li> <li>Negotiate and collaborate with product organizations in Samsung to build a tighter research-product integration</li> <li>Participate in the building of research prototypes</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  <li>Excellent communication skills and willingness to work with an international team to deliver rapid prototypes</li> <li>Strong people skills and be comfortable negotiating, collaborating and communicating effectively across a global organization</li> <li>Expertise in software engineering, particularly backend and data scripting work</li> <li>PhD or MSc. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or other AI/ML related field is required.</li>  </ul> And <strong>at least one</strong> of: <ul>  <li>Experience with deep learning (CNN, RNN,DBN,DBM, DNN, RNN,LSTM etc.)</li> <li>Experience with (Deep)/Reinforcement Learning and Inverse Reinforcement Learning</li> <li>Experience with time series data/text/multimedia/language/voice data</li> <li>Excellent knowledge in optimal computational environment required for data processing, mining and machine learning</li> </ul> <br/><br/> Samsung is an equal employment opportunity employer. <br/><br/> We thank you for your interest in working for Samsung; only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> <strong>#LI-DJ1</strong>
Title: Product-Research Engineer, AI

Job_Description: <strong>Opening: Office Manager</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> DeepLearni.ng is a technology company transforming the way enterprises work with AI around the world. Based in Toronto, we work with enterprise leaders to collaboratively build and deploy customized AI systems that solve real business problems. DeepLearni.ngs creation of enterprise AI systems is powered by our end-to-end platform Frontiers, designed to optimize team collaboration on enterprise AI systems. <br/><br/> We are also an active player in the AI community, and have partnerships with industry leaders including NVIDIA, the Vector Institute and Amazon Web Services. In 2017, we were named AI Company of the Year by the DFI Institute and received Series A funding. <br/><br/> <em>A few examples of our work:</em> <ul> <li>Reinforcement learning for the credit risk areas of retail banking</li><li>Image classification for insurance adjudication and claims processing</li><li>Self-optimizing environmental controls for vertical farming</li><li>Machine vision for robot warehouse navigation</li> </ul> <strong>What is the opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for an <strong>Office Manager</strong> who is passionate about building efficient workplace systems, augmenting workflows and fostering team confidence. If you want to be part of a growing team and help build the best applied AI company and industry changing tools, then we want to hear from you! As part of a vibrant and growing team, you will be at the frontier of the AI revolution. <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Foster a strong culture embodying company values, and support in the creation and management of recognition programs and team building events</li><li>Recognize organizational inefficiencies and challenges, and be proactive in improving the quality of office life at the organization</li><li>Support in the planning and execution of community programs</li><li>Assist with the onboarding and orientation of new employees</li><li>Take on office administration needs facilities, purchasing, and general maintenance</li><li>Support in the coordination of logistics for meetings and special events</li><li>Perform asset tracking and inventory</li><li>Reconcile general expenses and reimbursements and assist with payroll as needed</li><li>Book travel for business trips and manage itineraries</li><li>Manage general inbound communications including phone calls and emails</li><li>General support of employee benefits and staff welfare</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Must have:</em> <ul> <li>2+ years office management in a startup environment, or a similarly fast paced, dynamic environment with minimal structure</li><li>Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of people, and in a rapidly changing multi-disciplinary work environment</li><li>Enthusiasm and willingness to create and implement new solutions and processes when there is no by-the-book system already in place</li><li>Proven ability to set priorities, take initiative and work independently with minimal supervision</li><li>Tech-savvy individual who can work solve technical issues with a high level of autonomy</li><li>Highly social personality with strong communication skills</li><li>Natural love of researching information and presenting options including pros, cons, costs and benefits</li><li>Experience working alongside technical or engineering personnel</li><li>Completed post-secondary education</li> </ul> <em>Nice to have:</em> <ul> <li>Knowledge and passion for the AI field</li> </ul> <strong>What's in it for you?</strong> <ul> <li>Opportunity to work alongside leading machine learning experts on cutting-edge problems</li><li>Opportunities to develop relationships with a variety of industry decision-makers, subject-matter experts, software developers, and machine learning specialists</li><li>Enjoy a comfortable company work environment located in downtown Toronto that encourages self-expression, creativity, honesty, and learning</li><li>Participate in feats of strength and lively company events that build your career toolkit while also enjoying a work-life balance</li><li>Amazing quality of life benefits: healthy snacks, gym memberships, travel accommodations, great health benefits, and more!</li><li>Stock options possible after you have proven your impact on the job</li><li>As needed: sponsorship for work visas</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply</strong> <br/><br/> We look forward to receiving your application! Please apply directly online by sending your resume and cover letter addressed to the Hiring Manager. Please note that we will be in touch with applicants that make it to the next phase of the interview process directly. <br/><br/> By submitting your CV and application to this role, you authorize DeepLearni.ng to store your information in our internal recruitment database and to reach out to you as necessary for the purpose of further evaluating your qualifications for this or other career opportunities at the company. <br/><br/> <em>We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.</em>
Title: Office Manager

This is achieved with keen focus on our customers' market challenges and needs, providing excellent communications network solutions and services in order to consistently create maximum value for customers.</div></div> <div><div> Description</div> <div>Huawei Canada’s rapid growth has created an excellent opportunity to build and grow your career and make a big impact to everyone’s life. Python.</li>  <li>Ability to scope and schedule deliverables independently, and be accountable for performance and delivery.</li>  <li>Energetic, self-motivated and execution oriented individuals, deployment on cloud platform such as AWS, Azure or Google.</li>  <li>Knowledge of advanced techniques on statistical modelling, data mining, content based image retrieval and big data search engines.</li>  <li>R&D experience in active learning, transfer learning, reinforcement learning, and their applications for computer vision.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><div>  Why work for us?</div> </ul>  <div>   <ul> <li>encouraging teamwork at every level, to ensure we accelerate productivity</div></div></li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div> Huawei Technologies Canada Co., Ltd. is an Equal Title: AI Researcher Position in Computer Vision

Job_Description: <div> <div>Deep Genomics is a Toronto-based startup company that is changing the future of medicine using artificial intelligence. Founded in 2015, Deep Genomics brings together a multidisciplinary team of world-leading experts in machine learning, genomics, chemistry and biology. Together we are on a mission to develop an AI-powered platform for rapid discovery and development of the best genetic medicines, focusing on oligonucleotide drugs for the treatment of patients with rare genetic diseases.</div><br/>  <div>Ideal Candidate</div> <br/> <div>We are seeking a creative and experienced machine learning scientist to decipher how mutations and genetic medicines influence the molecular world of the cell. The successful candidate will develop machine learning approaches for modeling complex RNA- and protein-level outcomes based on massively parallel assays. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of publishing at top machine learning conferences (NIPS, ICML, ICLR) or has applied deep learning to genomics in a top life sciences journal.</div></div><br/>  <div> <div> Requirements/Qualifications  <ul>    <ul> <li>MSc (Junior Scientist) or PhD (Senior Scientist) trained in machine learning.</li> <li>Extensive practical experience at systematically designing, training, debugging, and evaluating neural networks using modern frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, or Theano.</li> <li>Excellent scientific writing and presentation skills.</li> <li>Senior Scientists must demonstrate leadership and ability to introduce new machine learning techniques.</li></ul>   </ul>  </div> </div>  <br/><strong><div> <div> What we offer:</strong>  <ul>    <ul> <li>A chance to develop machine learning techniques that will save human lives.</li> <li>Inspiring, creative, and fast-moving startup work environment in downtown Toronto</li> <li>Competitive compensation package including stock options</li></ul>   </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div>Deep Genomics thanks all applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.</div><br/>  <div>Deep Genomics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</div></div> <br/>
Title: Scientist – Machine Learning

Job_Description: Job Description<div>What you'll do: <ul> <li>Design, implement and optimize machine learning platform(write extensions when it is the best thing to do)</li><li>Design and experiment machine learning/deep learning models</li><li>Analyze/Debug prediction models</li><li>Collaborate with data team for data collection</li> </ul> You should be able to check off most things from this list: <ul> <li>Knowledge about machine learning theory and algorithms: SVM, random forest, gradient boosting methods, graphical models, bayesian methods, etc.</li><li>Some Knowledge about deep learning theory, algorithms and tricks: RNN, ConvNet, seq2seq, dropout, attention mechanism, data augmentation, batch normalization, adversarial learning, VAE, GAN, etc.</li><li>Knowledge about model optimization methods: 1st/2nd order methods, bayesian optimization, etc</li><li>Algorithm, data structure and object oriented programming skills</li><li>Proficiency in Python</li><li>Experience in applying machine learning algorithms for natural language processing/generation tasks</li><li>Experience with the Linux stack(bash, git, package management etc.)</li><li>Experience in processing large amounts of data</li> </ul> Nice to haves: <ul> <li>Proficiency in mainstream machine learning/deep learning frameworks: sklearn, tensorflow, theano, torch, keras, etc.</li><li>Familarity with data platforms: MongoDB, SQL, Lucence, ElasticSearch, etc.</li><li>Experience with team software development process: design, testing, coding and peer reviews</li><li>Experience in modular design for software development</li><li>Proficient in C++</li> </ul> Perks: <ul> <li>Competitive salary commensurate with experience/qualification: 120K-170K with significant equity</li><li>Regular learning activities: latest paper, neat techniques, best practices</li><li>Flat organization structure set up to help people succeed</li><li>Smart and knowledgeable colleagues</li><li>And of course, catered meals managed by food expert</li> </ul> About the company: <br/><br/> Adeptmind is an AI company innovating in e-commerce search using active learning and deep learning. Its co-founders recently came out of a quite successful sale of their previous company. This time around, they raised a little too much VC capital and are looking to grow a kick-ass Silicon Valley style team right here in downtown Toronto. <br/><br/> Our current ML group has a dual industry and academic focus. We are a group of well published researchers, and seasoned ML and software engineers. You'll get to design and implement ML systems that might not have hit arXiv yet. We plan to participate in the academic community (ie: going to conferences, writing papers, hosting seminars etc.) We really have a shot to create the first learning brain that outputs a fully fledged customer service bot.</div>Company Description<div>About the Company: <br/><br/> Adeptmind is an AI company innovating in e-commerce search using active learning and deep learning. We're the first company boasting 100% accuracy in our results! <br/><br/> Our co-founders recently came out of a quite successful sale of their previous company. This time around, they raised a little too much VC capital and are looking to grow a kick-ass Silicon Valley style team right here in downtown Toronto. <br/><br/> Our current engineering efforts focus on vertical expansion: building more tools and services. Current projects ranges from creating internal service to providing command line utilities as well large scale crawling and data processing. If you are a hacker minded developer like us, you will find it at home. <br/><br/> Of course, life in a young startup can get hectic. Above all, our people matter to us. We truly focus on being a platform on which we the people become the best we can be. We actively hold technical seminars, send our people to conferences and conduct academic research. Of course, a company cannot grow until the people can. <br/><br/> If you feel like being a startup superstar, we'd love to hear from you!</div>
Title: Machine Learning Engineer

Job_Description: Fluent.ai believes that voice has the potential to be the dominant interface for a range of today’s devices, from voice attendants, to wearables, to smart home devises. However, current speech recognition technology is challenged by regional accents, speech impediments, and background noise, making it just a little too unreliable for wide scale adoption. We employ sophisticated neural network and machine learning technology that works entirely in the acoustic domain to create a speech to understanding solution focused on understanding the user – achieving the reliability we need. <br/><br/> Fluent.ai is seeking an experienced scientist with a strong background in speech recognition, signal processing and machine learning. You are a creative and motivated individual with a keen interest in growing in an exciting start-up environment. You will be part of a team that delivers complex, scalable software solutions for applications based on speech recognition. <br/><br/> You will be responsible for design, development, test, and deployment of speech models supporting a range of products and services. With other members of the team, you will push the frontiers of machine learning and speech recognition research in order to develop advanced solutions. As our company grows, you will also be responsible for assisting in hiring other scientists, communicating with the developer team, anticipating bottlenecks, mitigating project risks and making trade-offs with respect to business needs and technical constraints.This position will be located at our vibrant location in Downtown Montreal. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Must have either completed a PhD or be currently enrolled in a PhD program with a focus on machine learning (deep learning, reinforcement learning) and/or speech recognition and/or natural language processing</li> <li>Proficiency in Python and/or C/C++</li> <li>Familiarity with various deep learning techniques</li> <li>Familiarity with scientific computing libraries is a plus</li> <li>Positive team player attitude with strong verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Ability to handle multiple competing priorities</li> <li>Self-motivation and willingness to do what it takes to get the job done</li> <li>Experience working effectively with software engineering teams</li> <li>Creative thinking and a strong research background with good publication record</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Our team is dedicated to the vision of enabling voice control for all – breaking down the barriers presented by our English-centric world. We’re a vibrant startup located in the heart of downtown Montreal. At Fluent.ai, you will be an early team member, leading work on an exciting, disruptive technology that is poised for rapid growth. You will also be an important part of cultivating and shaping our team culture – a culture that challenges you in an open and respectful environment where your ideas are important. We have a team-first attitude and collaboration is not only encouraged, but essential to solve the big problems we have chosen to tackle. <br/><br/> We are assembling a diverse group with variety in age, skillset, and background, so if you share our vision and can keep up with our hustle, we want to connect with you. <br/><br/> <strong>INTERNSHIPS</strong> <br/><br/> We are also accepting interns for 4 or more months for research in machine learning. Please add a cover letter and specify your intent if you are applying for an internship.
Title: Machine Learning Scientist (PhD) -- Fulltime and Internships

Job_Description: Team Lead, Software & Machine Learning  <p> </p>  <p>Grossman Dorland Recruiting (gdR) has been growing Canada’s tech ecosystem for 10 years. We match top talent and executives with leading startups, tech companies and innovation labs, and grow leadership capacity through individual and organizational coaching. Our goal is to advise tech talent and organizations throughout their entire growth journey.</p>  <p> </p>  <p></p>  <p>gdR is recruiting a Lead for a software and machine learning team of a well-funded applied research and development group working to advance AI applications! This an exciting opportunity to work at the forefront of the intersection of machine learning and software to solve complex problems impacting millions of users.</p>  <p>The focus of this position is to architect and develop the software modules of the overall solutions the team is building. You will also lead machine learning engineers to design and integrate machine learning capabilities, but you are not required to be a ML engineer.</p>  <p>Note that this is not a data science or data engineering position.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><b>Company overview:</b></p>  <ul> 	<li> 	<p>Startup-like applied research team of 10-15 developers, data engineers, researchers and ML engineers that is backed by large umbrella organization. This team is set to expand to 30 people in the coming year. This team works very closely with the academic team which is focused on progressing research, publishing their work and creating unique IP that will transform how data is used.</p> 	</li> 	<li> 	<p>Truly cutting-edge, working on a balance that has immediate impact to the business as they can take solutions to market quickly, alongside projects that are 5-10 years ahead. Focus on building proofs of concepts and taking them to a point where they can be productized & deployed to production by other technology teams.</p> 	</li> 	<li> 	<p>Collaborates with leading global AI researchers and institutes. Access to computational resources plus reams of interesting datasets they can run algorithms against.</p> 	</li> 	<li> 	<p>Downtown Toronto location.</p> 	</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><b>You will thrive as the Team Lead, Software & ML if you have...</b></p>  <ul> 	<li> 	<p>5+ years’ software dev experience including REST APIs and Python (full-stack and data applications such as TensorFlow, NLP, etc.) development in a product development environment (e.g. startup, scale-up or large tech company).</p> 	</li> 	<li> 	<p>Expertise with Hadoop, Spark, other distributed computing frameworks is a bonus.</p> 	</li> 	<li> 	<p>Passion for machine learning plus opinions on trends/opportunities. Hands-on experience in the field is a definite bonus.</p> 	</li> 	<li> 	<p>Engineering team management/mentoring experience is required, ideally leading a team of 3+ people. While the team you’ll be leading is larger, there is flexibility to consider up-and-coming leaders who haven’t led large teams.</p> 	</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><b>As the Team Lead, Software & ML you will...</b></p>  <ul> 	<li> 	<p>Provide technical leadership for your team of developers, data engineers, ML engineers and researchers.</p> 	</li> 	<li> 	<p>Architect (approximately 50% hands-on development) leveraging Python and other languages as desired.</p> 	</li> 	<li> 	<p>Brainstorm and create new applications of machine learning that will help solve the organization's current and future challenges.</p> 	</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p>Apply today for the Team Lead, Software & ML role or contact Brandon Shim-Ping (Director, Talent) at brandon AT grossmandorland DOT com to learn more.</p>  <p> </p>   <p>gdR values inclusion in Canada’s tech ecosystem and partners with employers that provide equal opportunities for diversity groups. While we welcome tech talent from overseas, <b>only candidates legally authorized to work in Canada</b> will be considered.</p>  <p>Follow gdR on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook for updates on new roles in tech.</p>
Title: Team Lead, Software & Machine Learning

Job_Description: <strong>Worker Sub-Type:</strong><br/><br/>Regular<br/><br/><strong><strong><strong> Job Description:</strong></strong></strong> <br/><br/> BlackBerry is looking for server-side Software Developers to join our Enterprise software team where we are innovating and advancing technology to help provide comprehensive visibility and control, and delivering unified endpoint management across the entire “Enterprise of Things” – This is <strong>the NEW IoT</strong>! <br/><br/> As part of the Enterprise Identity Management team you would help provide leading edge identity and access management functionality that leverages state of the art technology to go beyond authentication and authorization to assess and manage ever growing threat/risk vectors, and delivers rock-solid security. We are looking for enthusiastic developers who love new technologies and want to learn and thrive in cloud based PaaS and SaaS solutions. <br/><br/> These platform roles demand broad generalized ability – effectively managed through a full stack approach to developing software. There would also be exposure to DevOps functions for delivery to various cloud platforms, including BlackBerry’s own highly secure private cloud infrastructure. <br/><br/> New graduates with an interest in the development of high-quality software using agile software development methodologies, and TDD are preferred. <br/><br/> Our group is committed to innovation, and as a member of our platform team; you will participate in ideation sessions to generate new patentable inventions, then help architect, design, deliver and support these fantastic concepts as they come to life. <br/><br/> Equally, as our service offerings grow and mature, we will be turning our attention to managing big data in interesting and novel ways through the use of Machine Learning, Analytics, and AI, so candidates with an interest or background in these areas would have a great opportunity to learn and grow these skills. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> As a new member of the team, you would be a self-starter. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate would have the following skillsets: <br/><br/> • Have a degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline <br/><br/> • Have an interest in platform software development using an agile methodologies <br/><br/> • Thrive in a high-paced environment <br/><br/> • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to effectively communicate solutions to the team <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Assets:</strong> <br/><br/> In addition, we are looking for motivated self-starters who are passionate about software development, can learn new technologies with minimal guidance, and have a strong interest in cloud platform software development and deployment. <br/><br/> Bonus if you have any of these: <br/><br/> • Develop software with Node.js, J2EE/Java <br/><br/> • Experience with large scale web and cloud service development <br/><br/> • Experience with large scale Cassandra deployments and non-relational database design methodologies <br/><br/> • Knowledge and experience in identity technology, cryptography, authentication. <br/><br/> #LI-TT1 <br/><br/> <strong>Job Family Group Name:</strong><br/><br/>Product Development<br/><br/><strong>Scheduled Weekly Hours:</strong><br/><br/>40
Title: Identity Platform & Security Software Developer (New Grad)

Job_Description: <strong>ABOUT MYLO</strong> <br/><br/> Mylo is a leading Canadian FinTech company that is completely re-imagining personal finance. Our purpose is to empower everyone to achieve their financial goals in a simple and stress-free way by removing the burden of actively managing their finances. <br/><br/> <strong>Problem:</strong> <br/><br/> People are not achieving their financial goals because managing personal finances is complicated, confusing, time consuming and for many, inaccessible. <br/><br/> <strong>Solution:</strong> <br/><br/> First, the Mylo platform automatically rounds up every purchase you make and invests the spare change. Then, once plugged in, Mylo Insights uses data, algorithms and AI to provide users appropriate and optimized financial management insights, recommendations and solutions through a 3rd party API enabled in-app integration. <br/><br/> Mylo is backed by leading investors including Ferst Capital Partners. Learn more here. <br/><br/> We are seeking great people to help us shape the next wave of innovation in the financial services industry. If you enjoy working with talented folks, solving big problems and delighting users - come join us in helping millions of Canadians achieve their financial goals. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> We're looking for a machine learning developer, responsible for owning and delivering a project end to end everything from literature review and data pre-processing to implementing machine learning algorithms. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Our machine learning engineers have a wide range of skills and so your exact duties depend on how your skills align with others. You will certainly:  <ul>   <li>Reviewing scientific literature to identify state-of-the-art algorithms in project-specific areas.</li><li>Prototyping solutions and collaborating with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions.</li> </ul>   <ul> <li>Implementing prototypes into solutions ready for iproduction.</li><li>Extracting, transforming and loading massive datasets using distributed computing framework technologies (Hadoop, Spark etc.).</li> <li>Collaborate with the team in key architectural decisions</li> <li>Participate in daily scrums and weekly sprint planning meetings</li> <li>Share learnings and coach others</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>   <li>3+ years of machine learning algorithms coding experience</li> <li>Computer Science degree</li><li>Demonstrated interest or experience in Traditional Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language  <br/>  Processing, Time-Series Analysis ...</li><li>Familiarity with the Unix command line and bash scripting.</li><li>Proficiency with Machine Learning packages such as Scikit-learn, Matlab, Numpy</li><li>Proficiency with Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow, Theano, Keras and PyTorch.</li><li>Exposure to distributed computing frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases.</li><li>Have an active public profile where you share passion projects.</li></ul>   <ul>   <li>Experience with AWS or a strong desire to learn</li><li>Excellent problem solving, leadership, mentoring, and communication skills</li> <li>Interest in FinTech and startups</li> <li>Commitment to continuous learning</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus points for:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Being a Mylo user and early FinTech adopter</li> <li>Experience with Transactionnal Data</li>   <li>Experience with Docker and microservices</li> <li>Experience in coaching and mentoring other team members</li><li>Knowledge of security infrastructure</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> At Mylo, its our people and their passion that sets us apart. We value transparency, taking initiative & ownership, sharing our wins and learning from our failures. <br/><br/> Youll love:  <ul>   <li>Our open-concept offices at FCP FinTech Studio (dogs are welcome!)</li> <li>Competitive market salary plus stock participation</li> <li>Awesome and comprehensive health benefits package</li> <li>Generous vacation policy as well as flexible work hours and location</li> <li>Support with continuing your skills development, developing your industry knowledge and achieving your career and personal development goals</li> <li>Team activities and get-togethers like our annual oyster shucking Christmas party</li> <li>A casual environment where you will work with smart and passionate people</li> </ul> We believe in being an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and differences of perspectives at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Title: Mylo - Machine Learning Engineer

Job_Description: <div>// See English version below … // <br/><br/> Titre : Spécialiste en apprentissage automatique <br/><br/> Relève de : Directeur de LABS <br/><br/> Fonctions : <ul> <li>Responsable du développement de la vision par ordinateur et des technologies d'apprentissage par machine pour le déploiement de jeux vidéo ;</li><li>Expérimenter avec des données réelles pour valider, évaluer et améliorer les algorithmes ;</li><li>Responsable de la production des algorithmes CV / ML dans les fonctionnalités du produit, avec le soutien et les conseils d'autres équipes d'ingénierie système ;</li><li>Profiler les éléments logiciels, développez et exécutez des tests de performance, aidez à minimiser les inefficacités / la latence et améliorez les performances ;</li><li>Configurer et gérer l''intégration continue' pour les fonctionnalités et les versions ;</li><li>Coordonner le développement avec les équipes interfonctionnelles basées localement, mais aussi ailleurs dans la compagnie ;</li><li>Concevoir, former et déployer des réseaux de neurones pour des fonctions complexes de jeux vidéo ;</li><li>Garder le contact avec les récents résultats de recherche sur l'IA et mettre en œuvre / améliorer les algorithmes DNN gagnants ;</li><li>Enquêter en collaboration avec le directeur, tout partenariat potentiel avec différents départements de nos productions de jeux pour ajouter de l'IA dans ces processus / systèmes.</li> </ul> Expériences et Qualifications : <ul> <li>Baccalauréat, Maîtirse en Progammation, Math, Physique ou dans un domaine quantitative similaire. Doctorat considéré comme un plus.</li><li>Maîtrise des scripts C / C ++, Python, Unix / Linux</li><li>Expérience avec OpenCV ou d'autres bibliothèques de vision par ordinateur</li><li>Expérience avec les méthodes communes d'apprentissage automatique.</li><li>L'expérience avec Caffe, Theano, Keras ou Tensor Flow est un plus</li><li>L'expérience de production de jeux vidéo est un plus.</li> </ul> Qualités interpersonnelles : <ul> <li>Motivé et autonome</li><li>Capable d'initier une conversation avec des pairs, afin de mieux comprendre comment ils fonctionnent et de développer plus de solution basée sur l'intelligence artificielle en interne.</li><li>Curiosité</li> </ul> Motivations et intérêts : La passion et l’ambition pour les jeux vidéo sont essentielles! <br/><br/> Title: Machine Learning Specialist <br/><br/> Report to: Director LABS <br/><br/> Functions: <ul> <li>Responsible for developing computer vision and machine learning based technologies for deployment for the videogames;</li><li>Experiment with real-world data to validate, evaluate and improve the algorithms;</li><li>Responsible for productizing the CV/ML algorithms into product features, with support and guidance from other system engineering teams;</li><li>Profile the software stack, develop and run Performance tests, help minimize inefficiencies/latency and improve performance;</li><li>Setup and maintain ‘Continuous Integration’ for features and releases;</li><li>Coordinate the development with cross functional teams based locally, but also out of other company’s offices;</li><li>Designing, training and deploying neural networks for complex videogames functions;</li><li>Keeping up with recent AI research results and implementing/improving on winning DNN algorithms;</li><li>Investigate with the director, any potentially partnership with different department of our game productions for adding AI into those process/systems</li> </ul> Experience and qualifications: <ul> <li>Bachelors, Masters in Computer Science, Math, Physics or similarly quantitative-heavy background. PhD is a bonus.</li><li>Proficiency in C/C++, Python, Unix/Linux scripting.</li><li>Experience with OpenCV or other computer vision libraries.</li><li>Experience with common Machine Learning methods.</li><li>Experience with Caffe, Theano, Keras or Tensor flow is a plus.</li><li>Videogame production experience is a plus.</li> </ul> Interpersonal skills: <ul> <li>Self-motivated and autonomous</li><li>Capable of initiating conversation with peers, in order to understand better how they work and to develop more AI based solution internally.</li><li>Curiosity</li> </ul> Motivation and interest: Ambition and passion for video games are essential!</div>
Title: Machine Learning Specialist

Job_Description: <strong>Company Description</strong> <br/><br/> null <br/> Job Description<br/><br/>The incumbent develops and executes statistical and mathematical solutions to projects problems. <br/><br/> He/she will deliver solutions to make the processes and systems smarter through the design of predictive models and will also be accountable for creating relevant testing methods to evaluate results in a scientific manner. He/she will have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of projects from computer vision, natural langue processing and other types of predictive analysis. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> The main and routine tasks of this position are to: <ul> <li>Frame problems then determine intended approaches and quantitative methods to develop solutions;</li><li>Research new ways for modeling and predicting behavior and design experiments to answer targeted questions;</li><li>Develop tools to solve complex business problems such as optimizing product performance, revenue and adoption;</li><li>Use analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data, developing actionable insights using advanced statistical techniques such as predictive statistical models, user/player profiling, segmentation analysis, survey design and analysis and data mining;</li><li>Oversee and design various proofs of concept for predictive/prescriptive or AI projects;</li><li>Document and may define projects including data gathering and processing, leading approaches, final algorithm, detailed set of results and analytical metrics;</li><li>Develop materials to explain project findings and solve complex problems in resourceful and effective ways;</li><li>Interact with internal and external peers and managers to share complex information related to area of expertise;</li><li>Receive work in the form of short- and mid-term assignments that often require the use of independent judgment outside of established procedures;</li><li>Participate in determining approaches and in developing new or enhanced technical tools;</li><li>Mentor less experienced members of the team;</li><li>Carry out all other related tasks.</li> </ul>  Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>Training:</strong> <br/><br/> Master&apos;s degree and/or Ph.D. preferred in applied math, statistics, machine learning or equivalent experience. <br/><br/> <strong>Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> 5 to 8 years of complex experience and job related in-depth expertise. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to use and develop machine learning algorithms and related proven methods;</li><li>Ability to use advanced data science techniques;</li><li>Ability to use statistics to understand behavior of systems and/or people;</li><li>Ability to configure, use and develop systems that manage data;</li><li>Being Familiar with Big Data Technology (Hadoop, Casandra, MongoDB, ElasticSearch);</li><li>Software engineering skills;</li><li>Being familiar with distributed computing to train models;</li><li>Passion for using data science to solve problems;</li><li>Ability to quickly assess a problem both qualitatively and quantitatively;</li><li>Team player with excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills;</li><li>Business value oriented;</li><li>Bilingualism (French-English).</li> </ul>  Additional Information<br/><br/><strong><em>We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.</em> </strong>
Title: Data Scientist (Machine Learning)

Job_Description: About Uber Were changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now were a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether its a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it. For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer. And thats just what were doing today. Were thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, were in for the long haul. Were reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.About the Role At ATG, Research scientists create the next generation of artificial intelligence algorithms to help Uber improve the lives of millions of people worldwide. You will collaborate and exchange research ideas with our current team, which includes world-renowned scientists specializing in deep learning, computer vision, and self-driving. You will also interact with the international research community by publishing research papers and attend conferences. We value original, high-impact ideas and rigorous experimental validation. Both senior and junior scientists are welcome to apply.What Youll DoDesign, implement, train, and optimize novel algorithms that run at extremely low-latency on self-driving Uber vehicles and various production systemsUtilize large datasets of of various sources, including raw sensor data such as Lidar, using large GPU compute clustersCollaborate cross-functionally with research and engineering teams at Uber and communicate your work to colleagues and managementWrite patents and submit publications to top machine learning, computer vision, and robotics conferences What You'll Need A degree in a machine learning related discipline -- positions are available at the PhD, MS, and BS levelsA very strong quantitative backgroundExcellent software development skills in C/C++ and/or PythonKnowledge of machine learning commensurate with education/experience level and a strong publication record as relevant to education levelExcellent presentation and communication skillsMachine learning areas of special interests include: CNNs, RNNs, distributed GPU computing, detection, prediction, motion planning, mapping and localization About the Team At ATG, we are ambitious, engaged and excited about transforming the way the world moves. With locations in Pittsburgh, San Francisco, and Toronto, the Advanced Technologies Group is comprised of Ubers self-driving engineering team dedicated to self-driving technologies, mapping, and vehicle safety. Our teams are passionate about developing long-term technologies that advance Ubers mission of bringing safe, reliable transportation to everyone, everywhere. We are a group of diverse researchers, engineers, and computer scientists working to develop perception algorithms for self-driving vehicles. Reliability and scalability are key drivers for us as our software must perform across a large fleet of vehicles in large and diverse operating areas.
Title: AI Research Scientist (Self Driving)

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>IVADO Labs is an AI-powered start-up located in Montreal at the heart of one of the fastest growing AI community in the world. We work with our partner SCALE AI, the Canadian supercluster in Artificial Intelligence, to identify and solve the most complex and highest value business problems that can be addressed through data science techniques. To achieve this, we provide data science, operations research and artificial intelligence solutions and software products to a broad range of industry and technology partners. The core our mission is to seed a new generation of Canadian AI champions and increase global competitiveness of Canadian industry through major forays in AI.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>You will collaborates with our world-renowned Scientific Advisors, CTO and the Agile team to design and implement AI/data science, operations research and optimization algorithms/systems to solve real-world business problems. <br/><br/> <strong>Description</strong> <br/><br/> As a seasoned AI/Data Science Engineer, you will be working closely with some of the best, globally recognized AI/data science experts from the academic world to design and implement applied AI/data science models that solve real-world problems. You will be part of a cross-functional agile team, where you will apply your deep understanding of operations research, optimization and machine learning algorithmic and experience in applied scenarios to develop software solutions with tangible business impact. You thrive on tackling challenging problems head on and take pride in developing elegant technical solutions. You are well versed in the latest developments in AI/data science theory and industry trends, but are laser focused on applying and implementing AI/data science in a practical way to solve real-world problems. You truly believe in the transformative power of AI/decision science and that these technologies can institute change for good. <br/><br/> <strong>Individual Accountabilities:</strong> <ul>  <li>Design, code, train and unit test new AI/data science algorithms/components during the current Sprint in accordance with the Acceptance Criteria defined by the Product Owner and team</li> <li>Contribute to planning Sprints by helping break down Stories into Tasks/Activities</li> <li>Support the Product Owner in defining the appropriate technical and business Acceptance Criteria for the AI/data science algorithms/components.</li> <li>Perform various technical investigative tasks called "Spikes" in order to mitigate technical uncertainty and risk</li> <li>Update progress daily through the tracking tool (Jira) or Kanban/Agile board</li> <li>Complete any required documentation e.g. deployment, maintenance, support and business needs related to the development scope performed</li> <li>Participate in the weekly Look Ahead meetings to assist the Product Owner to refine and prioritize the Product Backlog including providing initial estimates</li> <li>Apply disciplined coding practices to enable agility and delivery of high quality code</li> <li>Provide the team with updated Developer capacity for the Sprint</li>  </ul> <strong>Shared Accountabilities:</strong> <ul>  <li>Help refine the Product Backlog and estimate the Epics and Stories based on defined Acceptance Criteria and Definition of Done</li> <li>Participate in pair programming initiatives</li> <li>Participate in peer code reviews to ensure code quality, adherence to standards and transfer of knowledge</li> <li>Escalate issues in a timely fashion to Team members, stakeholders and management</li> </ul>  <ul> </ul>  Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>Qualities</strong> <ul>  <li>Applied mindset</li> <li>Highly technical and detailed</li> <li>Highly collaborative</li> <li>Problem solver</li> <li>Strong communications skills</li> <li>Strategic, disruptive mindset</li>  </ul> <strong>Required Competencies</strong> <ul>  <li>Deep understanding of one or more of the AI and/or data science applied areas, e.g., operations research, optimization, natural language processing, speech generation, image recognition, one-shot learning, robotics, transfer learning, etc.</li> <li>Deep understanding of one or more of the prominent AI/data science techniques, e.g., linear/dynamic programming, neural networks/deep learning, advanced statistics, probability, information theory, optimization, complex systems, Markov chains, game theory, Monte-Carlo methods, etc.</li> <li>Well versed in AI/data science landscape of technology tools, platforms and related service provider ecosystem.</li> <li>Experience implementing AI/data science algorithms using one or more of the modern programming languages/frameworks (e.g., Python, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Scala, Keras, Gulon, Caffe, MxNet, etc.).</li> <li>Drives adherence to quality standards of work</li> <li>Significant experience working on Supply Chain Management, Logistics or Transportation related software applications would be a plus</li>  </ul> <strong>Preferred Technical and Professional Experience</strong> <ul>  <li>Experience working in an Agile development environment</li> <li>Understanding of related emerging technologies tools and platforms</li> <li>Experience with optimizers such as Cplex and Gurobi</li> <li>Experience developing solutions for supply chain</li> <li>Understanding of development and service delivery/management frameworks (e.g., DevOps, Agile, SRE, ITIL, etc.)</li> <li>Experience developing digital solution concepts and solutions using design thinking/ideation techniques</li>  </ul> <strong>Required Experience</strong> <ul>  <li>At least 3 years of work experience designing and implementing AI/data science algorithms/systems in a variety of business situations uncovering critical insights and driving to concrete business action for a technology services company/division or management consulting firm.</li> <li>At least 3 years of experience interacting with clients at the mid-manager level or higher.</li>  </ul>  Additional Information<br/><br/>We are inviting you to come to meet us at the : <br/><br/> https://www.siliconmilkroundabout.com/ 19 and 20 may 2018 - Truman Brewery, London <br/><br/> http://journeesquebec.gouv.qc.ca/ 26 and 27 may 2018 - Paris
Title: Data Scientists / AI & Machine Learning Engineer

Job_Description: <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 183246 <br/> <strong>Work Area:</strong> Software-Development Operations <br/> <strong>Expected Travel:</strong> 0 - 10% <br/> <strong>Career Status:</strong> Student <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Intern <br/><br/> <strong>COMPANY DESCRIPTION</strong> <br/> SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures. <br/><br/> SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>What is SAP iXp?</strong> <br/><br/> SAP’s Internship Experience Project is a paid program that gives university students the space to find purpose in their careers. We believe that through placing passionate people on the right teams, providing leadership and learning opportunities, and working on impactful projects, purpose is born. Piqued your interest?  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Three reasons to apply for SAP iXp:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>No more fetching coffee:</strong> Work on in-depth projects, emerging products and technologies that drive business results.</li><li><strong>Lifelong learning:</strong> Meet with mentors, make new friends, and attend learning sessions from diverse subject matter experts.</li><li><strong>Gain visibility:</strong> With iXp in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs, and career development opportunities at your fingertips.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Position Title: Full Stack Developer Intern</strong></li><li><strong>Location: Vancouver, Canada</strong></li><li><strong>Expected start date to end date: September 4, 2018 – May 3, 2019</strong></li> </ul>   <ul> <li>Join a cloud engineering team that delivers a collaboration system used by many companies you know and love! Learn how to develop a high traffic web and mobile solution while performing weekly zero-downtime deployments. Our vision is to continue evolving our collaboration capabilities while further automating deployments and introducing AI and machine learning.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong><ul><li>You will also be expected to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Drive, design, and develop and automate new features by working with Product Management, User Experience, and Software Testing to gather and discuss functional and technical requirements, estimate task time, and then quickly write high-quality code for complex features.</li><li>Work in an agile scrum development project model, with a daily team scrum meeting, and a weekly production deployment</li><li>Participate actively in requirement, design, and code reviews</li></ul></li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for someone who can challenge the status quo and likes to stay curious. You enjoy working on meaningful projects and are energized by lifelong learning. <ul> <li>Working toward a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science or Engineering</li><li>Experience with HTML, JavaScript, CSS and one of Java, Objective-C, C++, or .NET on Linux, Windows, iOS, Mac OS or Unix</li><li>Experience with at least one server-side web technology or scripting framework such as Ruby-on-Rails, PHP, Node.js, JavaScript/ASP.NET, Java servlets, Perl, or Python</li><li>Experience with SQL databases</li><li>Experience with source control systems such as git, Subversion, Perforce, etc</li><li>Understand TCP/IP (IPv4 or IPv6) networking (ports and addresses)</li><li>Additional assets:  <ul> <li>Experience with automated deployment tools such as Jenkins, TeamCity, or Travis CI</li><li>Experience with machine learning technology such as TensorFlow or Amazon Machine Learning</li></ul></li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>What you can expect from us:</strong> <ul> <li>An internship packed full of events to ensure you understand our technologies, our competitive landscape, our culture and our leadership philosophy</li><li>Community of mentors and volunteer engagement teams to join and lead</li><li>Collaborative open-concept work environment in the heart of Yaletown</li><li>Games room, fitness classes, massage therapist, and 24/7 access to onsite gym</li><li>Well-stocked snacks, coffee, teas, sodas and candy</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>#iXp</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT YOU GET FROM US</strong> <br/><br/> Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now<em>.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT</strong>  <br/> To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. <br/><br/> SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). <br/><br/> Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Locations</strong>:
