Title: Chercheur Deep learning - Machine Learning Researcher

Job_Description: Job DescriptionWe are looking for an experienced software developer to contribute at the forefront of cutting edge machine learning.If you are passionate about new technology trends in machine learning, cloud services and believe that state-of-the-art product is critical to customer success we would like to talk to you. Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:   <ul>   <li>Learn and use advanced technologies</li> <li>Collaborate with internal engineering teams, leading technology companies around the world and open source community</li> <li>Evangelize deep learning technologies and services</li> <li>Create innovative products, and see them launched in high volume production</li> </ul>  As member of the software application development team in AWS AI, you will be working with cross-functional teams, customers and open source community to build deep learning applications, develop tutorials, presentation and blogs to evangelize and teach the use of Deep Learning, contribute to the deep learning framework development and develop new AI application and services. This position within Machine Learning team presents a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor within a fast growing business and help shape the technology, product and the business. A successful candidate will bring deep technical expertise in machine learning or high performance computing, desire to have an industry wide impact and ability to work within a fast moving, startup environment in a large company to rapidly deliver services that have a broad business impact. <br/> Basic Qualifications   <ul>   <li>Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field or equivalent experience</li> <li>5+ years of software development experience</li> <li>Knowledge in at least 3 languages or frameworks typically used for machine learning</li> <li>3+ years experience in big data processing or machine learning</li> </ul>  Preferred Qualifications   <ul>   <li>5+ years of experience in at least 3 languages or frameworks typically used for machine learning</li> <li>5+ experience developing machine learning applications</li></ul>
Title: Senior Software Development Engineer - AWS AI Deep Learning

Job_Description: <div>// See English version below … // <br/><br/> Titre : Spécialiste en apprentissage automatique <br/><br/> Relève de : Directeur de LABS <br/><br/> Fonctions : <ul> <li>Responsable du développement de la vision par ordinateur et des technologies d'apprentissage par machine pour le déploiement de jeux vidéo ;</li><li>Expérimenter avec des données réelles pour valider, évaluer et améliorer les algorithmes ;</li><li>Responsable de la production des algorithmes CV / ML dans les fonctionnalités du produit, avec le soutien et les conseils d'autres équipes d'ingénierie système ;</li><li>Profiler les éléments logiciels, développez et exécutez des tests de performance, aidez à minimiser les inefficacités / la latence et améliorez les performances ;</li><li>Configurer et gérer l''intégration continue' pour les fonctionnalités et les versions ;</li><li>Coordonner le développement avec les équipes interfonctionnelles basées localement, mais aussi ailleurs dans la compagnie ;</li><li>Concevoir, former et déployer des réseaux de neurones pour des fonctions complexes de jeux vidéo ;</li><li>Garder le contact avec les récents résultats de recherche sur l'IA et mettre en œuvre / améliorer les algorithmes DNN gagnants ;</li><li>Enquêter en collaboration avec le directeur, tout partenariat potentiel avec différents départements de nos productions de jeux pour ajouter de l'IA dans ces processus / systèmes.</li> </ul> Expériences et Qualifications : <ul> <li>Baccalauréat, Maîtirse en Progammation, Math, Physique ou dans un domaine quantitative similaire. Doctorat considéré comme un plus.</li><li>Maîtrise des scripts C / C ++, Python, Unix / Linux</li><li>Expérience avec OpenCV ou d'autres bibliothèques de vision par ordinateur</li><li>Expérience avec les méthodes communes d'apprentissage automatique.</li><li>L'expérience avec Caffe, Theano, Keras ou Tensor Flow est un plus</li><li>L'expérience de production de jeux vidéo est un plus.</li> </ul> Qualités interpersonnelles : <ul> <li>Motivé et autonome</li><li>Capable d'initier une conversation avec des pairs, afin de mieux comprendre comment ils fonctionnent et de développer plus de solution basée sur l'intelligence artificielle en interne.</li><li>Curiosité</li> </ul> Motivations et intérêts : La passion et l’ambition pour les jeux vidéo sont essentielles! <br/><br/> Title: Machine Learning Specialist <br/><br/> Report to: Director LABS <br/><br/> Functions: <ul> <li>Responsible for developing computer vision and machine learning based technologies for deployment for the videogames;</li><li>Experiment with real-world data to validate, evaluate and improve the algorithms;</li><li>Responsible for productizing the CV/ML algorithms into product features, with support and guidance from other system engineering teams;</li><li>Profile the software stack, develop and run Performance tests, help minimize inefficiencies/latency and improve performance;</li><li>Setup and maintain ‘Continuous Integration’ for features and releases;</li><li>Coordinate the development with cross functional teams based locally, but also out of other company’s offices;</li><li>Designing, training and deploying neural networks for complex videogames functions;</li><li>Keeping up with recent AI research results and implementing/improving on winning DNN algorithms;</li><li>Investigate with the director, any potentially partnership with different department of our game productions for adding AI into those process/systems</li> </ul> Experience and qualifications: <ul> <li>Bachelors, Masters in Computer Science, Math, Physics or similarly quantitative-heavy background. PhD is a bonus.</li><li>Proficiency in C/C++, Python, Unix/Linux scripting.</li><li>Experience with OpenCV or other computer vision libraries.</li><li>Experience with common Machine Learning methods.</li><li>Experience with Caffe, Theano, Keras or Tensor flow is a plus.</li><li>Videogame production experience is a plus.</li> </ul> Interpersonal skills: <ul> <li>Self-motivated and autonomous</li><li>Capable of initiating conversation with peers, in order to understand better how they work and to develop more AI based solution internally.</li><li>Curiosity</li> </ul> Motivation and interest: Ambition and passion for video games are essential!</div>
Title: Spécialiste en apprentissage automatique / Machine Learning Specialist

Job_Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities we're just getting started.In this role, you will embed deeply with researchers at Facebook AI Research (FAIR) and develop experiments and prototypes at the frontier of AI Research. You will need to engage with research topics and cover new domains quickly; build deep expertise with Facebook data and tools; apply high standards to the research code around you and develop an ability to identify highly impactful projects in a complex and unexplored domain. You will gain valuable experience in artificial intelligence and AI, publish academic papers and help push forward the understanding of learning and intelligent systems.To learn more about our research, visit https://research.facebook.com (https://research.facebook.com/). <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop highly scalable algorithms based on state-of-the-art machine learning and neural network methodologies.</li><li>Collaborate with Facebook AI Research (FAIR) Scientists to facilitate research that enables learning the semantics of data (images, video, text, audio, and other modalities).</li><li>Apply knowledge of relevant research domains along with expert coding skills to platform and framework development projects.</li><li>Adapt machine learning and neural network algorithms and architectures to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU).</li> </ul>  <strong>Mininum Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Graduating with B.S. degree in Computer Science or related quantitative field.</li><li>Experience in developing and debugging in C/C++ and/or Python.</li><li>Ability to obtain and maintain work authorization in the country of employment in 2018.</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>M.S. degree in Computer Science or related quantitative field.</li><li>Experience building systems based on machine learning (especially deep learning) methods.</li><li>Experience using frameworks like PyTorch, Caffe2, Tensorflow, Theano, Keras, and/or Chainer.</li><li>Experience with storage systems, distributed systems, HPC, compilers, and/or CUDA programming.</li><li>Research and software engineer experience demonstrated via an internship, contributions to open source, work experience, or coding competitions.</li> </ul>
Title: Research Engineer, AI (University Grad)

Job_Description: <div><b>Locations</b></div><div>Openings in <b>Montreal</b> or <b>New York City.</b></div><div><br></div><div><b>Who we are</b></div><div>Datalogue is an engineering first start-up working to eliminate tedious data preparation tasks from the workflows of data scientists and analysts. Our company is completely rethinking the way that people get, understand and transform data by creating AI augmented data pipelinesallowing them to turn data into insights. Fast.</div><div><br></div><div>Our company culture flows through everything that we do, from product to people:</div><div>- in the age of black boxes and algorithms we're building a company and products with a human touch. We are human.</div><div>- we continuously solve tough problems, challenging the status quo and building solutions that scale out from day 1. We are undaunted.</div><div>- we allow companies, partners and the community to build on top of our work. Setting the stage for a new wave of data platforms. We are foundational.</div><div><br></div><div><b>Who were looking for</b></div><div>As a machine learning engineer on our team you will be the brains behind our neural networks. You will partner with our executives to understand each clients unique data landscape and will customize and deploy new machine learning models, applications, and infrastructure. Your passions range from artificial intelligence to natural language processing to deep learning and everything in between. You will be researching on the latest developments in ML and have the opportunities to present on your explorations. Your algorithms and deep knowledge on current ML & AI trends will bridge the gap between product and engineering when it comes to execution.</div><div><br></div><div><b>What we need from you</b></div><div>- BA/BS in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.</div><div>- A foundation in CS, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design.</div><div>- Experience with one or more of: machine learning, recommendation systems, NLP, computer vision, pattern recognition, or AI.</div><div>- Experience with one or more programming languages including but not limited to: Python, Java, or C/C++, R.</div><div>- Some work/projects or educational experience in ML or AI.</div><div><br></div><div><b>Preferred qualifications</b></div><div>- Master's degree or PhD in CS, AI, ML or related technical field.</div><div>- Background in ML and/or AI.</div><div>- Experience working with one or more of the following: NLP, Computer Vision, Text Understanding, Classification, - - Pattern Recognition, Recommendation Systems, Targeting Systems, Ranking Systems and/or similar.</div><div>- Experience in a statistical programming language like R or Python and applied machine learning techniques (i.e. dimensionality reduction strategies, classification, and NLP frameworks).</div><div>- Experience designing and deploying with one or more the following technologies: Tensor Flow, Spark ML, CNTK, Torch, Caffe</div><div>- Research or industry experience in AI, ML models, ML infrastructure, NLP or Deep Learning.</div><div>- Systems design experience with ability to architect and explain data analytics pipelines and data flows.</div><div>- 1+ years of work or educational experience in ML or AI.</div><div>- 4 years of relevant work experience, including software development experience, or 1 year of relevant work experience with a PhD in CS or related technical field.</div><div><br></div><div><b>What youll do</b></div><div>- Participate in technical and design discussions with technical executives, acting to speed adoption and ensure best practices during implementation..</div><div>- Work closely with practice areas, product and engineering to package best practices and lessons learned into thought leadership, methodologies and product strategy.</div><div>- Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve ML Learning models/infrastructure and software that uses these models.</div><div>- Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.</div><div>- Participate in cutting edge research in AI and ML applications.</div><div>- Develop solutions for real world, large scale problems.</div><div><b>What you should expect from us</b></div><div>- Dynamic, constantly-evolving work</div><div>- Hard problems to work on daily</div><div>- A supportive team committed to growing together</div><div>- Do you love cooking, food, and eating? If so, we have frequent team dinners with delicious food.</div><div><br></div><div>If you don't check off all of the boxes in the <b>What we need from you</b> section but think you're the right person for the job, don't hesitate to drop us a line. We love hearing from people who are passionate about what we're doing, so go a bit more in-depth into why you want to connect with us when you send over your resume.</div><div><br></div><div>We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.</div>
Title: Machine Learning Engineer

Job_Description: Fluent.ai, located in downtown Montreal, is disrupting the speech recognition and understanding market using visionary new deep learning and other machine techniques to enable acoustic-only speech recognition. By associating speech to intent without requiring a speech-to-text translation, Fluent.ai opens a wide variety of new applications and provides higher accuracy and more robust performance unattainable using incumbent methods. <br/><br/> Joining Fluent.ai provides you an opportunity to be an early team member would allow you to work on an exciting, disruptive technology poised for rapid growth. The technology has already been validated by world-renowned academic experts as well as major industrial customers in diverse sectors. Now we are looking for the right people to share our vision and hustle to achieve execution excellence in select sectors. You will be joining a diverse, dedicated, smart and fun team. We work hard, we don’t always agree, but we always laugh out loud and we always move forward together; will you be able to keep up? We certainly hope so! <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> You are a creative and motivated individual with a keen interest in growing in an exciting startup environment. As part of a high-performance team, you will be responsible for developing software development kits and delivering complex, scalable software solutions for speech recognition applications. We require someone with a strong background in software performance optimization. Skills in C/C++ and other web development languages are important. <ul>  <li>A graduate degree in Computer Science</li> <li>2+ years of software development experience</li> <li>C++ development experience a big asset.</li></ul>   <ul>  <li>Proficiency with compilers and build script management.</li> <li>Concurrency programming</li> <li>Ability to handle multiple competing priorities</li> </ul> Other beneficial assets: <ul>  <li>Knowledge of fundamental concepts in speech processing</li> <li>Knowledge of fundamental concepts of machine learning and/or matrix computations</li> <li>Knowledge of Python is an asset..</li> <li>Experience with scientific computing libraries based on C++, Java and Python</li> <li>Knowledge or working experience in high transaction scalable micro service environments.</li> <li>Proficient with API and socket connections</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Our team is dedicated to the vision of enabling voice control for all – breaking down the barriers presented by our English-centric world. We’re a vibrant startup located in the heart of downtown Montreal. At Fluent.ai, you will be an early team member, leading work on an exciting, disruptive technology that is poised for rapid growth. You will also be an important part of cultivating and shaping our team culture – a culture that challenges you in an open and respectful environment where your ideas are important. We have a team-first attitude and collaboration is not only encouraged, but essential to solve the big problems we have chosen to tackle. <br/><br/> We are assembling a diverse group with variety in age, skillset, and background, so if you share our vision and can keep up with our hustle, we want to connect with you.
Title: Software Developer C/C++

Job_Description: TandemLaunch brings together brilliant technologists and exceptional entrepreneurs to accelerate early-stage technologies from the world’s top universities. Our Entrepreneur-in-Residence program empowers you to build a start-up team, develop a technology, and validate the market with up to $750,000 in financing. You lead the technical and business development of your venture with the support of the TandemLaunch team, mentors, industry partners, and more. <br/><br/> If you've been working with emerging technologies in a research environment and are ready to follow a path to becoming a Chief Technology Officer in a startup, we are looking for our next Founder. <br/><br/> Our SDX Labs venture is looking for a Technical Co-founder with academic expertise in Acoustics and/or Machine Learning to help commercialize their Audio Diagnostic solutions - www.sdx-labs.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Ph.D. (or M.Sc. with exceptional work experience) with deep academic expertise in Acoustics or Machine Learning</li> <li>Demonstrable technical expertise (through publications, patents, and academic reference)</li> <li>Desire to be fully committed to a start-up venture with ability to relocate to Montreal during the incubation phase of the project</li> <li>Highly self-motivated, able to deal with ambiguity, willing to champion ideas, persistent, and a flexible/creative problem solver</li> <li>Strong leadership and communication skills, a strong sense of ethics and integrity, and the ability to work effectively with others both inside and outside the organization</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Coaching and hands-on support through the first years of your exciting journey</li> <li>A network of hundreds of universities from around the world to source cutting-edge technologies</li> <li>Up to $750,000 in seed financing for early growth of your venture</li> <li>Access to industry partners in the Consumer Technology industry to rapidly build your business and customer pipeline</li> <li>Assistance in high quality talent recruitment</li> <li>Proven track record, as highlighted by the success of our portfolio companies, e.g. LANDR, Music Production AI SaaS/PaaS Provider; SPORTLOGiQ, Computer Vision for Sports Analytics; IRYStec, Perceptual Display Solution for Mobile & Automotive</li> </ul>
Title: Technical Co-founder (Acoustics and Machine Learning)

Job_Description: <div><strong>Service:</strong> Financial Advisory <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Montreal; Toronto; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Deloitte’s <strong>Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning practice (AI and ML)</strong> practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes. <br/><br/> <strong>Your role at Deloitte</strong> <ul> <li>Take a role in building solutions for medium and large enterprises, working with a diverse team consisting of applied scientists, data architects, software developers, information designers, project managers, and business and industry leaders</li><li>Experiment with machine learning models to deliver best-of-breed solutions, leveraging a full suite of supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques</li><li>Work with large amounts of data on a granular level, from structured and unstructured data sources</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Solid programming skills in Python, with experience using Machine Learning related libraries such as sklearn, pandas, etc.</li><li>Experience working in a software development environment, and an understanding of Agile / DevOps / etc. preferred</li><li>Strong understanding of machine learning tools and techniques, including but not limited to deep learning, with applications in image processing or natural language processing</li><li>Experience with deep learning software packages such as tenssorflow, PyTorch, or Caffe2</li><li>Data manipulation and programming languages experience and data manipulation and integration skills using (one or more) SQL, Oracle, Hadoop (Spark or Hive), or similar tools</li><li>Enthusiastic about solving complex problems with a variety of analytical tools</li><li>2+ years relevant experience with developing production machine learning models</li><li>M.Sc. or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or related field is required, Ph.D. preferred</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 35448</div>
Title: Applied Scientist, AI and ML Joint Venture

Job_Description: <DIV><DIV><strong><br/> <DIV>National Bank believes artificial intelligence (AI) is core to the future of financial services. As such, we are seeking to build an AI practice to work with 1) all business units at the Bank 2) all data and analytics teams across the organization and 3) universities and academic institutions, associations and external partners.</DIV> <br/> <strong><DIV>The Bank's objective is to:</strong> <br/> ▪ implement AI and machine learning experts within each of its business lines <br/> ▪ engage broadly with the AI community to offer new solutions, practices and knowledge to address challenges in financial services <br/> ▪ work in conjunction with partners to develop solutions and roadmaps that meet the Bank's needs</DIV> <br/> <strong><br/> <DIV>To accomplish this, the Bank will be appointing: <br/> ▪ several Artificial Intelligence experts <br/> ▪ several Business Leads – Artificial Intelligence practice who will be dedicated to a specific business unit, one for each of the following groups: <br/> ▪ Human Resources & Corporate Affairs <br/> ▪ Wealth Management</DIV><br/>  <DIV><strong>We are currently seeking Business Leads – Artificial Intelligence practice for the Wealth Management and Human Resources & Corporate Affairs business lines. Their main challenges will include:</strong></DIV></DIV> <br/> <DIV>Working closely with leaders/colleagues from the assigned business sector and:   <ul> <li>Building relationships with AI colleagues to understand their activities and strategies</li> <li>Identifying, filtering and prioritizing opportunities to apply AI within the assigned unit</li> <li>Proposing and building business cases for AI projects to address business needs</li> <li>Promoting projects and educating stakeholders about AI</li> <li>Leading the end-to-end execution of AI projects for the assigned business unit</li> <li>Actively participating in large-scale projects that include an AI component</li> <li>Contributing to the success of projects by sharing expertise</li> <li>Leading market trend studies</li> <li>Working with internal and external partners to develop the Bank's AI ecosystem</li> <li>Working with the CDO/Data Strategies team to ensure all Bank technologies and tools support the development of AI capabilities</DIV></li> </ul>  </strong> <br/> <DIV>• Master's degree or equivalent   <ul> <li>Experience executing a portfolio of initiatives from planning through deployment</li> <li>Experience working with unstructured data</li> <li>Experience working with business design utilizing machine learning models</li> <li>Sound technical foundations; experience as a change agent in a business transformation context and in the use of advanced analytics and AI</li> <li>Sound understanding of machine learning use cases</li> <li>Ability to access, manage and analyze complex datasets</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, data-oriented personality</li> <li>Strong ability to influence and manage stakeholders</li> <li>Ability to work with little supervision</DIV></li> </ul>  <strong><br/><br/> We strive to be an inclusive organization where all employees are valued. National Bank stands out for its many initiatives to promote inclusion, making it a Canada-wide leader in diversity. <br/> See how we do it: https://jobs.nbc.ca/diversity</DIV> <br/> <strong><DIV>#LI-CF1</DIV></strong> <br/> <strong></strong> <br/>
Title: Business Lead - Artificial Intelligence Practice

Job_Description: <strong><strong>What youll do:</strong></strong> <br/><br/> As the AI Program Manager, you will define and support the execution of a robust TELUS-wide artificial intelligence (AI) program. Through this program, you will collaborate with stakeholders across TELUS to build up scalable AI and machine learning capabilities and deploy cutting-edge machine learning use cases across TELUS to support priority business, team member, and customer outcomes. You will help shape a growing team of data scientists, data engineers, developers, and strategists at TELUS who are focused on building a scalable model for developing, deploying, and using machine learning responsibly across our organization. <br/><br/> This role is an exceptional opportunity to stretch yourself, continue to build new skills, and accelerate your career. <br/><br/> This is a full-time, renewable 1-year contract position. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>What youll be responsible for:</strong></strong> <ul> <li>Supporting team members from across TELUS to deliver on the vision for the AI Program</li><li>Defining success targets and evaluating the performance of investment streams across the program</li><li>Providing regular program updates at senior leadership forums and managing capital discussions to move TELUS towards its AI goals</li><li>Partnering with stakeholders from across TELUS (digital, marketing, business technology, security, privacy, governance, etc.) and vendors to define the program roadmap, prioritize initiatives, develop governance processes, and facilitate the delivery of valuable use cases for our customers and business</li> </ul> <strong><strong>What YOU Bring:</strong></strong> <ul> <li>Over 5 years of experience managing and scaling strategic programs in an enterprise environment ideally within the communications, media, or tech industries, or equivalent</li><li>Proven track record of defining and delivering measurable outcomes for customers, team members, and the business in a highly complex stakeholder environment</li><li>Demonstrable knowledge of and passion for AI and machine learning (experience with AI and machine learning is a plus)</li><li>Demonstrated experience communicating broad strategic initiatives to key stakeholders and diverse internal teams</li><li>Advanced analytical, verbal, and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to tackle multiple projects and challenges with enthusiasm</li><li>Ability to develop and articulate succinct business rationale supporting recommendations</li><li>Compelling storytelling and presentation skills - ability to understand diverse audiences and tune messages, generate storyboards, develop materials, and communicate effectively stakeholders</li><li>Ability to navigate difficult situations</li><li>Passion to explore uncharted territory that would complement TELUS broader digital strategy</li> </ul> <strong><strong>About TELUS Digital</strong></strong> <br/><br/> Were a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our companys digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most. <br/><br/> TELUS Digitals mission is to make life easier for millions of customers and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app. <br/><br/> Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Were looking for team members who:</strong></strong> <ul> <li>Share our passion for all things digital</li><li>Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment</li><li>Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers</li><li>Are curious, experiment and never stop learning</li><li>Foster diversity & inclusion</li>  </ul> <strong><strong>What you can expect from us:</strong></strong> <ul> <li>An environment where youre encouraged to share and act on your ideas</li><li>Flexible work hours in a central downtown location</li><li>A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code</li><li>A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities</li><li>Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks</li><li>A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing</li> </ul> We aspire to build the best products. Were always a work in progress and looking for people to join our mission and help us digitize telco. Learn about our team at http://labs.telus.com. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Accessibility</strong></strong> <br/><br/> At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Bonus points</strong></strong> <br/><br/> Check out labs.telus.com/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.
Title: AI Program Manager

Job_Description: Job Description<br/><br/>Why work at Sheridan? Click to view our video! <br/><br/> <strong>Faculty/Department:</strong> Research <br/><br/> <strong>Employee Group:</strong> Academic <br/><br/> <strong>Campus:</strong> Trafalgar (May be assigned activities at any Sheridan campus) <br/><br/> <strong>Reference Number:</strong> 18/F/03 <br/><br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong> Open Until Filled<strong>Start Date:</strong> ASAP <br/><br/> <strong>Salary Range:</strong> $62,717 - $108,723 (based on relevant educational qualifications and experience) <br/><br/> Sheridan is looking for an outstanding individual to join our faculty team. The incumbent will be a key research lead and collaborative participant in development of an institutional and regional centre for research, teaching and learning, and commercialization activities focused on virtual agents (Embodied Conversational Agents), with application in entertainment media as well as areas of social and individual well-being. <br/><br/> The incumbent will have expertise and interest in the application of machine/deep learning within Human Computer Interaction (HCI), with a focus on the area of intelligent virtual agents/characters and environments. Work over the first two years will primarily include research projects with industry partners and academic collaborators from within Sheridan and leading universities. The intent of these projects is to develop the capacity for virtual humans - believable and intelligent 3D animated characters capable of real-time verbal and nonverbal behaviour (gestures, facial expressions, speech content, and prosody) within diverse dynamic social situations for multiplatform delivery in gaming, virtual and augmented reality, and other interactive screen experiences. <br/><br/> The incumbent will also be expected to complement research with teaching within interaction design and related areas (e.g. gaming, animation and design). Sheridan faculty provide academic leadership to research, programs and courses within their areas of expertise and contribute to a learning-centred environment, where students can develop to their full potential. The incumbent will play a lead role in facilitating engagement of other faculty and students within Sheridan in virtual human research and learning. The incumbent should be a superior researcher with keen interest and capacity for sharing this knowledge with next generation researchers, as well as possess a passion for leadership in teaching and learning. <br/><br/> <strong>Specific Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Plan and conduct research within the area of virtual humans/intelligent agents</li>   <li>Establish software and hardware test beds for qualitative and quantitative assessment of intelligent agent technologies and platforms, and development of enhancements and new approaches</li> <li>Develop and assess machine and deep learning approaches to human-virtual human interaction</li> <li>Develop prototypes involving rule-based and/or data-driven approaches</li>   <li>Design and conduct user experience studies as part of an iterative process of prototype development</li> <li>Work collaboratively with diverse groups in a team-based approach: other Sheridan faculty and students; artists and technical research leads in areas including motion capture, computer modelling, and animation; domain experts within social sciences and applied health; external industry, community, and academic partners</li> <li>Create an effective environment for research and applied learning which includes defined learning outcomes and that accommodates students’ diverse cultural and educational backgrounds, experiences and learning styles</li> <li>Define, evaluate and validate learning outcomes for research activities and courses</li> <li>Ensure that learning outcomes are current, relevant and reflective of best practices within the relevant professional/program disciplines</li> <li>Design appropriate strategies and tools for facilitating and assessing student research and learning that are consistent with learning outcomes, invitational and reflective of best practices in teaching and learning</li> <li>Contribute to writing/publication of research activities and writing of research proposals</li> <li>Other duties as required</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>:  <ul>   <li>PhD completed or in process in HCI or related area, with a minimum of 2 years of research experience</li> <li>Expertise in AI/machine/deep learning combined with expertise in at least one of advanced game engine programming; or 3D computer graphics/animation</li> <li>Experience in developing innovative interaction systems including hardware prototyping and software development within human-virtual agent Interaction</li> <li>Experience in conducting user experience testing</li> <li>Proven ability to work independently, collaboratively as part of a team and in consultative decision making</li> <li>Demonstrated excellence in interpersonal skills and communication skills</li>   <li>Experience teaching and developing curriculum at the post-secondary level</li>   <li>Excellent communications and interpersonal skills</li>   <li>Ability to convey the conceptual and applied aspects of knowledge to a broad range of students and other audiences</li> <li>Committed to excellence in research, teaching, and learning and to working within a team environment</li> </ul> <strong>Please apply online:</strong> <strong>https://careers-sheridancollege.icims.com</strong> <br/><br/> Sheridan welcomes diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from all qualified individuals, including visible minorities, Indigenous People, and persons with disabilities. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), Sheridan is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. At any stage of the hiring process, Human Resources will work with applicants requesting accommodation. <br/><br/> Note: Copies of educational credentials are requested at the time of an interview. As a condition of employment, Sheridan requires confirmation of educational credentials in the form of an official Canadian transcript or an official evaluation of international credentials which determines Canadian equivalency.
Title: Professor, Intelligent Virtual Agents/HCI/Machine Learning

Job_Description: <strong>Back-End Developer Wanted</strong> <br/><br/> We’re a team of strategists, designers, and technologists, driven by a shared passion for creating thoughtful digital platforms, products, and services that span web, mobile, and connected spaces. Based in Vancouver and New York City, we’re focused on changing how organizations connect with users in an increasingly digital world. If you’re up for that challenge, you should join us. <br/><br/> <strong>The Role</strong> <br/><br/> As an Intermediate Back-End Developer, you’ll contribute a broad range of technical expertise, contributing to the planning and implementation of functionality and logic across web and mobile platforms and products. As part of a project team, you’ll help to define the most effective approach to prioritizing and implementing features and requirements against a roadmap, taking into account performance, stability, and scalability. Your experience in navigating the diverse ecosystem of tools, frameworks, and 3rd party platforms will ensure the team is exploring a range of approaches to deliver the right solutions for our clients and their users. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Support and collaborate in planning, development, testing, and delivery/deployment of solid, structured, and standards-compliant code</li>  <li>Understand scope, project goals, and requirements, and provide input towards practical solutions, innovations, and time estimation</li>  <li>Participate in ideation sessions, workshops, and roadmapping, contributing a perspective on improved production and development approaches, tools, and techniques</li>  <li>Collaborate in strategic planning of desktop and mobile websites, web apps, and native mobile apps, assessing opportunities for driving innovation from a development perspective</li>  <li>Participate in the sourcing and documentation of requirements through stakeholder engagement, research, evaluation</li>  <li>Support the planning and documentation of technical architecture, operations, and maintenance for the code we deliver</li>  <li>Test, refactor, and optimize code to achieve the best performance, and strive for flawless and bug free deliverables by making quality assurance a top priority</li>  <li>Follow industry best practices, and coding standards developed by the agency and contribute to internal and external knowledge sharing</li>  <li>Understand our clients’ business, their needs, and the technical opportunities and challenges that exist within their categories</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills & Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>3-5 years experience in back-end and server-side web and mobile development with a focus on custom applications, Linux/Unix and open source, including Laravel, PHP (LAMP), and Ruby</li>  <li>Thorough understanding and working experience with CS fundamentals including automation, algorithmic processes, data modeling, and design patterns</li>  <li>Experience with database design, solution architecture, and development with MySQL, MongoDB and cloud hosting with AWS and Heroku</li>  <li>Experience integrating with web services APIs via JSON and REST</li>  <li>Experience planning, prototyping, developing, and testing for web, mobile/tablet, SaaS products, connected devices, and other interactive experiences</li>  <li>Experience with setup, implementation, and integration with payment gateways (Stripe) and merchant account providers</li>  <li>Experience in behavioral development, test-driven development, continuous integration and delivery, and agile including scoping and roadmappping, and self-management</li>  <li>Familiarity with secure web application practices (authentication, authorization, encryption), SSL, web application firewall, web service proxy, and multi protocol gateways</li>  <li>Familiarity with both open source and enterprise CMS and ecommerce platforms and integration including WordPress, Adobe Experience Manager, Squarespace, Shopify, and Magento</li>  <li>Familiarity with native mobile development and mobile app frameworks a nice to have</li>  <li>An interest and general understanding of machine learning and AI a nice to have</li>  <li>Digital agency or startup team experience preferred</li>  <li>Degree in Web Development or Computer Science preferred but not required</li>  <li>Candidates should be a resident of Vancouver or willing to relocate and able to travel</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> In addition to an exceptional company culture, we offer the following benefits to all employees:  <ul> <li>A welcome kit, a brand new MacBook, and all the tools you need on day one</li>  <li>Personal learning budget for classes, events, and conferences, and access to General Assembly, Treehouse, Udemy, and One Month to help you expand your skills</li>  <li>Winter holiday break in addition to 3 weeks vacation time to start</li>  <li>Office snacks, coffee, tea, beer, and monthly birthday lunches</li>  <li>Holiday parties, happy hours, and team building activities</li>  <li>Health and dental coverage</li>  <li>Offices in two of the best cities in the world – Vancouver and New York City</li>  <li>An incredible global client list including some of the most recognized brands</li>  <li>Focused yet casual work environment in downtown Vancouver and close to public transit</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply</strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like a fit, please apply through our online application form. Only candidates with an online portfolio or work samples may be shortlisted and contacted. Please clearly state your personal contribution to each project submitted. If you have a Github profile, blog, or other online projects, please send those URLs along too. Extra attention will be given to creative candidates who are active online. <br/><br/> No recruiters, agencies, or phone calls please. <br/><br/> Visit us at www.enginedigital.com
Title: Back-End Developer (Intermediate)

Job_Description: We’re looking to add even more imaging and machine learning expertise to our team. This opportunity involves an exciting mix of research and applied algorithm development with a particular focus on depth. <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are and what we do</strong> <br/><br/> Based in Montreal and spun out of TandemLaunch (www.tandemlaunch.com), AIRY3D has completed its first round of financing. In conjunction with a top-tier camera sensor OEM, the hardware component of our DepthIQ platform has been built at wafer-scale. Our proof-of-concept demonstrations have garnered significant interest from top-tier consumer electronics companies serving the smartphone, AR/VR, automotive and industrial markets. <br/><br/> <strong>What are we looking for?</strong> <br/><br/> As a Machine Learning Research Scientist, you will be working alongside our Chief Research Scientist to drive the technology roadmap and develop new AI capabilities for future generations of 3D computer vision products. You will work closely with the team to bring new and enhanced products to market by ensuring all viable avenues are explored. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do:</strong> <ul>  <li>Defining the role of AIRY3D technology in computer vision applications that incorporate machine learning</li> <li>Filtering and building data models to enable new applications and products</li> <li>Creating new datasets using our 3D sensor</li> <li>Collaborate with other researchers, software and hardware engineers to develop experiments and concepts that advance the entire project</li> <li>Contribute to expanding our patent portfolio, generate publishable research</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What you bring to our team?</strong> <ul>  <li>A Master's Degree or PhD in Computer Science with specialization in machine learning and computer vision</li> <li>Strong knowledge and experience of deep learning algorithms</li> <li>Experience in machine learning for object recognition in visual datasets</li> <li>Experience in the use of statistical analysis methods and machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Theano, or Torch</li> </ul> <em>Bonus points</em> <ul>  <li>Expertise in computer vision, image processing, computational photography</li> <li>Experience with developing a 3D vision algorithm with machine learning</li> <li>Experience with Virtual/Augmented reality applications</li> <li>Experience with object detection/tracking, and gesture recognition/tracking</li> <li>Publications at top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What's it like working in our team?</strong> <br/><br/> We believe in creating disruptive technology in a workplace with great work ethics, where we truly enjoy what we are doing and the diversity of those we work with. All while having fun and not taking ourselves too seriously! We offer a flexible schedule, vibrant Mile End location with rooftop terrace, health insurance and stock options. If you are genuinely excited about contributing to our success, we’d love to hear from you. <br/><br/> <strong>What can I expect when I submit my application?</strong> <br/><br/> Our recruitment partner – Pivot and Edge – will review your application and either schedule a conversation with you or let you know that we’re passing on your candidacy within 5 business days. <br/><br/> <strong>What does the interview process involve?</strong> <br/><br/> The first step is a conversation with Pivot and Edge where the focus will be on the human side of things. If you exhibit a high potential to be successful in our environment, a short video interview will allow you to demonstrate your technical capabilities. After we review your response, you may be asked to talk shop with some of our engineers and leaders. Assuming you’re one of our finalists, we’ll be sure to give you a tour of the office and introduce you to some of your future teammates. Throughout the process, we want to make sure that we’re the right fit for each other – both technically and culturally – so please interview us at every step!
Title: Imaging and Machine Learning Research Scientist

Job_Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities we're just getting started.Facebook is seeking a Research Scientist to join Facebook AI Research (FAIR), a research organization focused on making significant progress in AI. Individuals in this role are expected to be recognized experts in identified research areas such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, computational statistics, and applied mathematics, particularly including areas such as deep learning, graphical models, reinforcement learning, computer perception, natural language processing and data representation. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in producing new science to understand intelligence and technology to make computers more intelligent. <br/><br/> To learn more about our research visit https://research.facebook.com (https://research.facebook.com/). <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Lead research to advance the science and technology of intelligent machines.</li><li>Lead research that enables learning the semantics of data (images, video, text, audio, and other modalities).</li><li>Devise better data-driven models of human behavior.</li><li>Work towards long-term ambitious research goals, while identifying intermediate milestones.</li><li>Influence progress of relevant research communities by producing publications.</li><li>Contribute research that can be applied to Facebook product development.</li><li>Lead and collaborate on research projects within a globally based team.</li> </ul>  <strong>Mininum Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Graduating with a Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field or relevant experience.</li><li>First-author publications at peer-reviewed AI conferences (e.g. NIPS, CVPR, ICML, ICLR, ICCV, and ACL).</li><li>Experience leading a team in solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.</li><li>Experience manipulating and analyzing data from different sources.</li><li>Experience in leading theoretical and empirical research and for answering questions with research.</li><li>Ability to communicate complex research both in writing and orally for public audiences of peers.</li><li>Knowledge in a programming language.</li><li>Ability to obtain and maintain work authorization in the country of employment in 2018.</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Previous internship(s) and/or research assistantship(s) in an AI research organization.</li><li>Experience in developing and debugging in C/C++, Python, C# and/or Java.</li><li>Has previously completed a postdoctoral role in AI research.</li> </ul>
Title: Research Scientist, AI (PhD University Grad)

Job_Description: </strong> <br/><br/> Social media generates a massive volume of data about online interactions in a daily basis. Such interactions provide useful information about users’ behaviours and psychological states. Our client has an AI-based engine that constantly analyzes the patterns behind human written languages and produces psychological insights about user’s emotional and mental health. Our emerging technologies are used to promote the safety and welfare of children. <br/><br/> We are seeking an intermediate to senior full-stack developer to help us create the next generation of technology. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with a multidisciplinary team.</li> <li>Develop high-quality code for both back-end and front-end; i.e. build ad-hoc applications for internal use, such as data labelling and data management.</li> <li>Develop API-driven applications such as REST API services.</li> <li>Develop shell scripts to handle complex task execution and automate procedures such as machine learning scripts.</li> <li>Provide light maintenance of a PHP-based web application. This application presents information to parents about text and image content drawn from the APIs of popular social media platforms.</li> <li>Provide maintenance of integrations with third-party services and APIs.</li> <li>Implement user experiences or improve existing UX designs.</li> <li>Mentor and manage junior or intern developers.</li> <li>Follow best practice of agile continuous delivery, test-driven development (TDD), and development process.</li> <li>Be relentless on product quality, consistency, and performance i.e. optimizing front-end or back-end whenever necessary.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent. <br/><br/> <strong>Technical Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years of experience with full-stack development in terms of the front-end side, back-end side, web services, and database systems.</li> <li>Familiarity with a variety of web frameworks and libraries.</li> <li>High proficiency in Java. The familiarity with the Spring framework and JPA is required (ActiveMQ is an asset).</li> <li>High proficiency in JavaScript (ES6 is an asset), HTML 5, and CSS 3 (SASS is an asset).</li> <li>Proficiency in the Yii PHP framework.</li> <li>Strong SQL skills using MySQL and PostgreSQL.</li> <li>Proficiency in test unit libraries such as JUnit, Mockito, Karma, and Mocha.</li> <li>Proficiency in source control tools such as GIT (Bitbucket and/or Github is an asset).</li> <li>Experience with AWS.</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Developer

We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. <br/><br/> Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com</div> <div> Department Overview<br/><br/>TD Insurance is part of TD Bank Group, one of Canada’s largest financial institutions. TD Insurance helps protect clients from the ‘accidents of life’ with a wide range of products including credit protection, life, health, travel, home and auto insurance. With more than three million clients, TD Insurance authorized products and services are available online, over the phone, and through a network of more than 1,000 TD Canada Trust branches. <br/><br/> In Canada, we have two lines of business, General Insurance and Life and Health. Our General Insurance business is one of the top home and auto insurance groups in Canada and the national leader in group insurance and affinity marketing. Our Life and Health business is the number one provider of critical illness insurance and direct life and health insurance in Canada. <br/><br/> At TD Insurance, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. With a Canada-wide workforce of over 4,000 employees and offices in Atlantic Canada, Quebec, Ontario and Alberta, our company is always growing and can help you to grow. TD Insurance offers a stable and dynamic work environment where talent is appreciated and professional development is taken seriously. More than just a job, we offer rewarding careers.</div> <div> Job Type Regular</div> <div> Job Status Full Time</div> <div> Hours 9-5</div> <div> Business line TD Insurance</div> <div> Job Category - Primary Insurance</div> <div> Job Category(s) Insurance</div> <div> Job Description Deliver Business Insights for TDI Credit Protection Insurance business.  <ul> <li>Perform root cause analysis, A3, Analytical quality control or other method to drive operational, product, customer or market insights.</li><li>Work to fulfill ad-hoc requests such as pulling data and providing it to the functional business teams.</li><li>Drive test and learn strategies</li><li>Introduce opportunities for machine learning and/or advanced AI applications.</li> <li>Apply statistical techniques (i.e. regression, decision trees, etc.) to drive fact based decision making.</li><li>Work with business stakeholders to generate hypotheses.</li><li>Function as an interpreter or an intermediary, identifying data needs and explaining the importance and use of the data.</li> <li>Work collaboratively with data governance partners.</li><li>Provide/present business explanation of analysis results.</li> </ul>  Ensure Solid data  <ul> <li>Flag new data via projects or adhoc asks.</li><li>Filter, tag, join, parse, and normalize data from various system (production and reporting).</li><li>Cleaning and validating the data to ensure accuracy, completeness and uniformity.</li><li>Identifying data issues (via anomaly detection methods or other) and solutions to remedy gaps.</li><li>Explore/perform “what if” analysis to understand potential data and process gaps pertaining to the data.</li> <li>Work with partners to extract, transform, and load data from an extremely wide field of data sources into staging datasets and ultimately into visualization tools</li> </ul>  Fashion compelling visuals  <ul> <li>Create stimulating visualizations to drive analytical proof points to business partners</li><li>Optimize performance of dashboards and/or develop new dashboards</li><li>Use data visualization tools to rapidly generate interactive sessions</li><li>Review and Communication (i.e. explain the meaning) of findings to business teams and management via dashboards.</li></ul></div> <br/> <div> Job Requirements Master’s or Bachelor’s in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering  <ul> <li>7+ years of analytics experience with specific focus on Visualization tools, methodologies, and/or responsibilities (e.g. Tableau, Qlikview, Spotfire, Cognos, SAS, agile/scrum methodologies)</li><li>Programming skills in various languages (SQL, SAS, R). SAS/SQL are mandatory</li><li>Strong applied understanding of Machine learning and data mining (Supervised learning Clustering, dimensionality reduction, anomaly detection, etc.)</li><li>Strong knowledge of data management, practices and standards.</li><li>Must be familiar with various types of data models, such as logical/relational models, dimensional models, etc.</li><li>Strong oral and written communication skills</li> <li>Dynamic problem solver</li></ul></div> <br/> <div> Inclusiveness<br/><br/>At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. Title: Credit Protection Insurance Analytics, Business Insight Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 173785 <br/> <strong>Work Area:</strong> Software-Design and Development <br/> <strong>Expected Travel:</strong> 0 - 10% <br/> <strong>Career Status:</strong> Professional <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Regular Full Time <br/><br/> <strong>COMPANY DESCRIPTION</strong> <br/><br/> As market leader in enterprise application software, SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. From the back office to the boardroom, warehouse to storefront, on premise to cloud, desktop to mobile device – SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. SAP applications and services enable customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES</strong> <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> The digital and physical worlds are converging: Hence, the digital economy consisting of Industry 4.0, IoT, and API-Business rapidly becomes more and more important. By putting the customer into the driver’s seat of their provider and vendor relationships, SAP is redefining the paradigm of customer relationship management. We focus on the customer and the entire journey, including traditional marketing, sales, and service, as well as orchestrating online and mobile commerce and other interaction channels. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/>  This paradigm change is driven by SAP’s business unit Cloud Business Group (CBG) and its cornerstone brand SAP hybris. Within SAP hybris, the product “SAP Hybris Marketing Cloud” plays a dominant role and is a major growth opportunity. Our mission is to deliver the world’s leading Marketing Suite, enabling marketers to engage throughout the whole customer journey in all channels. <br/><br/>  Following the principles of agile software development, we cherish direct feedback from customers by including them in design thinking workshops. Design thinking incorporates the idea of failing early and smart during the design phase rather than during customer usage. We test several different approaches to understand the design from different angles and especially from the customer’s point of view. Thus, we work out problems in an early phase–while enjoying the interactive design process. <br/><br/>  We are seeking an individual who is self-motivated and passionate about Software development and who is eager to be part of a self-organizing, young and dynamic team but also has a strong focus and interest in development, automation, and quality in general. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS</strong> <br/><br/> Working through the entire Software lifecycle, by: <ul> <li>Designing and developing software per product owner specifications</li><li>Making excellent use of Test Driven Development</li><li>Delivering high quality software by implementing necessary QA activities (ex. integration tests, unit tests, test automation)</li><li>Contributing to product documentation</li><li>Maintaining already released software</li><li>Being an active contributor in an Agile development team</li><li>Being flexible to take on additional tasks</li><li>Contributing to team spirit and health<br/><br/>  <br/><br/> By completing these tasks, you will play a crucial role to building the marketing cloud of the future. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES</strong> <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Required skills <br/><br/> From experience, we know that a bachelor’s or master’s degree in software engineering or computer science is a good starting point for your development career in our Cloud Business Group. As part of an interdisciplinary and international team, we build on your communication skills as a team player and your fluency in the English language. While employing the principles of design thinking, your analytical skills enable you to learn from every failure and to go forward with every iteration. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Customers are at the very heart of what we do. The ability to multitask and prioritize is very important to solve error situations which are very stressful for our customers. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Having said this, you should have some solid software development skills and a passion to build meaningful, usable, and high-quality applications for people like yourself: customers. We don’t expect you to be an expert in all topics that are thrown at you. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> However, knowledge of object oriented programming, a passion for test driven development and quality, as well as skills in OData, JavaScript, and SpringMVC, are a clear bonus. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Preferred skills <br/><br/> You will be part of the global development Agile team to:</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>Develop applications using mainly Java EE, SpringMVC, Git, Maven and JavaScript</li><li>Contribute to ensuring high-quality code through following best practices and design patterns</li><li>Think, plan, and act for assuring a high quality product at different stages (before coding, while coding, and after coding</li><li>Design and write automated unit, integration and acceptance tests</li><li>Participate in design workshops and bug hunting sessions</li><li>Actively participate in addressing non-functional requirements such as performance, security, continuous integration, migration and compatibility</li><li>Build and operate highly-scalable cloud solutions</li></ul>  <ul> <li> </li><li><strong>Qualification:</strong></li><li>BA/BS/Master degree in a computer related field (or equivalent work experience)</li><li>3+ years professional experience in Java programming</li><li>3+ years professions experience in Unit testing, integration testing and TDD</li><li>2+ years professional experience in SpringMVC, Node/NPM, Git, JavaScript</li><li>1+ year professional experience with at least one cloud solution such as AWS, Azure, Google, Openstack, or VMWare</li><li>1+ year professional experience with deployment of java enterprise applications (containerized deployment, e.g. docker)</li><li>1+ year professional experience with AzureSQL</li><li>Good understanding of design patterns</li><li>Working experience with UI, API, Unit, Integration, UA, and E2E testing approaches</li><li>Experience of agile & scrum development principles and practices</li><li>Knowledge of peripheral tools: issue tracking (Jira), Wiki (Confluence), source code management (Git), build (Maven) & testing frameworks</li><li>Ability to adapt fast to changing technologies and frameworks</li><li>Ability and willingness to work as part of a self-organizing team</li><li>Self-motivated to bring innovation and support the team challenges</li><li>Passion for delivering high-quality working code frequently</li><li>Desire to continue learning and improving</li><li>Proven experience in working as part of distributed teams</li><li>Good verbal and written English</li> </ul>  Latest trends in the industry like AI, machine learning should pique your interests. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> More information on Hybris. <br/><br/> https://jobs.sap.com/content/Hybris-commerce-cloud/ <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>WORK EXPERIENCE</strong> <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Are you a new graduate or an early talent? We’re happy to receive your application for this exciting position. Of course, that doesn’t mean you shouldn’t apply if you have some years of experience or only have internship experience. We would like to hear from you as well. We are looking for excellent potential and the passion for technology. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT</strong> <br/><br/> To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. <br/><br/> SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Locations</strong>:
Title: SAP Hybris Montreal - Senior Java Developer- ECommerce Cloud

Job_Description: Joining Fluent.ai provides you an opportunity to experience an exciting, disruptive technology startup poised for rapid growth. The technology has already been validated by world-renowned academic experts as well as major industrial customers in diverse sectors. You will be joining a diverse, dedicated, smart and fun team. With other members of the team, you will push the frontiers of machine learning and speech recognition research in order to develop advanced solutions. We work hard, we don’t always agree, but we always laugh out loud and we always move forward together; will you be able to keep up? We certainly hope so! <ul>  <li>Work closely with the architect to implement new features into the SaaS applications</li> <li>Extend system to third party systems by incorporating calls to their API’s</li> <li>Ensuring the security of the system while maintaining the scalability and performance standards</li> <li>Developing new features in a high transaction quick response environment</li> <li>Creating tools that will be add to the SaaS application to ease the integration of the technologies into other systems</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>2+ years of experience in full stack development (Any platform)</li> <li>Experience developing and delivering high transaction SaaS applications</li> <li>Strong JavaScript Node.js experience both on the front-end and back-end</li> <li>Expert knowledge of API creation and integrations</li> <li>Strong experience with a front-end framework (TotalJs, React.js, MEAN or other)</li> <li>Excellent understanding of Redis and Rabbit MQ</li> <li>History of MongoDB usage</li> <li>Solid Socket.IO experience</li> <li>Understanding of Isomorphic web applications</li> <li>Ability to work in a highly flexible agile environment</li> <li>A strong commitment to quality</li> <li>A university degree in Computer Science or relevant work experience</li> </ul> Other beneficial assets: <ul>  <li>Big Data management ( Hadoop, MongoDB Sharding and clustering)</li> <li>Experience with Auth-as-a-Service frameworks (Auth0)</li> <li>Source code management experience (GIT, Github)</li> <li>Development process management (Jira/Confluence)</li> <li>Knowledge/experience with AWS/Azure</li> <li>Machine Learning or Signal processing experience</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Our team is dedicated to the vision of enabling voice control for all – breaking down the barriers presented by our English-centric world. We’re a vibrant startup located in the heart of downtown Montreal. At Fluent.ai, you will be an early team member, leading work on an exciting, disruptive technology that is poised for rapid growth. You will also be an important part of cultivating and shaping our team culture – a culture that challenges you in an open and respectful environment where your ideas are important. We have a team-first attitude and collaboration is not only encouraged, but essential to solve the big problems we have chosen to tackle. <br/><br/> We are assembling a diverse group with variety in age, skillset, and background, so if you share our vision and can keep up with our hustle, we want to connect with you.
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: As a Python QA Analyst, you are a highly skilled individual with technical expertise that spans across multiple technologies. You will be a key part of a team that develops machine learning solutions for digital cameras in self-driving cars. We work with the leading companies in the automotive industry. Your work at Algolux has great chances to end up in the next generation of autonomous vehicles. <br/><br/> Key Responsibilities: <ul>  <li>Design, develop, and execute detail-oriented automation test scripts and test cases based on product specifications.</li> <li>Actively participate in test planning discussions to assure automation coverage is continuously improving.</li> <li>Collaborate with other testers and developers to improve testing processes.</li> <li>Analyze root cause of automation test case failures.</li> <li>Improve exploratory/manual testing in areas where automation is not yet available.</li> <li>Advocate code-level testing and establish good practices within the team.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Expertise in writing test cases and developing test automation code for python applications at all levels (functional, unit, stress, performance).</li> <li>Exceptional Python coding skills and Object-Oriented Design.</li> <li>Deep knowledge of automation frameworks, in particular those relevant to Python development tools (pytest framework)</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of Linux, including system installation, networking configuration, complex shell scripting, etc.</li> <li>Experience with CI tools like Jenkins.</li> </ul> <em>Desirable</em> <ul>  <li>Experience with parallel distributed processing systems.</li> <li>Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc).</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> What can we offer you? Algolux is a tight-knit, collaborative group of individuals from all over the world who are united by a common interest in applying AI to solve big problems in computer vision. On this diverse team, you will be introduced to new perspectives and will acquire knowledge and experience you wouldn’t necessarily gain elsewhere. We also encourage professional development by supporting participation in continuing education, technical conferences, and open source projects. We value individuals who like to push the science, but also have the right attitude and mentality to work on a software version cycle. A unique mix that is critical to scaling up our company. <br/><br/> At Algolux, we offer equity options for our employees so that as the company continues to succeed, so will you. We are currently partnering with major component manufacturers like Intel, Qualcomm, and ARM, as well as major automotive manufacturers, to drive the technology behind the introduction of driver-less vehicles. In fact, we were awarded the “Most Exciting Startup” at AutoSens 2017 - the world’s leading technical summit for ADAS and autonomous vehicle perception technology. <br/><br/> The Algolux office is an inspiring modern work-space situated in the heart of the trendy district of Pointe Sainte Charles, near downtown Montreal. Our open office environment encourages communication, teamwork, and a culture of mutual trust and respect. We work hard, but we don't take ourselves too seriously either and we always make room for fun along the way.
Title: Python QA Analyst

communication with internal stakeholders and external clients</li><li>Take a leading role in delivering advisory services to high growth organizations with a diverse team consisting of data scientists, data architects, software developers, information designers, and business/industry subject matter experts</li><li>Lead the development of the methodology for analytical solutions for clients business problems</li><li>Perform “hands on” statistical modelling, computations, and data ETL to deliver best-of-breed analytical solutions for clients’ business problems</li><li>Work with large amounts of data on a granular level, from structured and unstructured data sources</li><li>Participate in various structured and ad-hoc analysis projects with cross-functional teams within Deloitte</li><li>Lead the planning, data collection and data analysis on client projects, and management of pitches and proposal bids</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Strong track record exemplifying ability to quickly understand business problems, developing solutions and insights, and communicating them by leveraging data and analytics</li><li>Strong oral and written communication skills</li><li>Project management and people management experience is required</li><li>Managing client projects and consulting with internal and external stakeholders directly</li><li>Enthusiastic about solving complex problems with a variety of analytical tools</li><li>Professional services, consulting, or advisory experience is preferred</li><li>Data analysis experience using (one or more): Python, R, SPSS Modeller, SAS, Angoss Knowledge Studio, RapidMiner, or similar tools is required</li><li>Database and programming languages experience and data manipulation and integration skills using (one or more of) SQL, Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL Databases, or similar tools is required</li><li>Strong experience with statistical modeling techniques, data mining, and predictive models is required</li><li>Strong experience working with large amounts of data with significant ambiguity, developing creative approaches to analytical problems, and interpreting data and results from a business/industry perspective</li><li>Experience with social media analytics and/or natural language processing and/or optimization is an asset</li><li>Strong oral and written communication skills is required</li><li>5 – 8 years relevant work experience with applying analytics or working with data in any industry, and experience leading teams on data science projectsMinimum of BA/BSc degree in a quantitative degree including Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Epidemiology, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field is required. Advanced degree (MA/MSc, equivalent or higher) is preferred</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different.
