The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 35452
Title: Data Science Manager, AI and ML Joint Venture

Job_Description: Company Overview <br/> <div>Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. <br/><br/> Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com</div>  <br/>Department Overview <br/> <div><strong>Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team</strong> <br/><br/> We can’t afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD’s technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway. <br/><br/> <strong>Enterprise Information Management (EIM)</strong> is the Enterprise Big Data team within TD responsible for the Enterprise Data Provisioning Platform (EDPP) and Hadoop Enterprise Analytics Tool (HEAT) technologies, part of the Akora ecosystem. The IT Manager is part of the Analytics team within EIM. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Analytics Solutions, this role is responsible for delivering data analytics and insights to enable data-driven decision making across the organization. <br/><br/> There’s room to grow in all of it. <br/><br/> There’s room to grow in all of it.</div> <br/> <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <div><strong>About This Role</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for someone to manage and lead a team of ambitious technology professionals as they deliver a wide range of analytics solutions and capability enhancements to the Enterprise Big Data ecosystem. You’ll also have the opportunity to provide technical guidance and leadership beyond your immediate team. Important objectives of the team are to put Machine Learning (ML) models into Production and to improve the Data Science experience at TD. This role, in particular, will focus on building and implementing cutting edge AI/ML technology to enable the enterprise. <br/><br/> Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. <strong>Here’s some of what you may be asked to perform:</strong> <ul>  <li>Lead development teams and own responsibility for the delivery of development solutions and component/unit testing efforts.</li> <li>Oversee and report on project status, manage project team resources and assignments, ensure project milestones are met and up to standard.</li> <li>Build a ‘Get Things Done’ culture</li> <li>Work with technology partners to develop the content for development and solutions design deliverables, ensure project estimates cover all activities within scope, including project management and application development, software quality assurance reviews, and vendor and contract management activities.</li> <li>Ensure all requirements, project plans, and changes to commitment are communicated to all affected team members.</li> <li>Ensure the project team follows all quality assurance processes.</li> <li>Drive stakeholder communications, develop effective stakeholder management required for team delivery.</li> <li>Act as an escalation point for all risks and issues affecting the development team, and for working to define and implement mitigation strategies.</li> <li>Control change to development project scope through accepted change management processes, impact assessment and documentation.</li> <li>Responsible for delivering in line with financial forecast / plan, and achieving benefits targets as defined for Application Development teams.</li> <li>Manage and track costs in line with investment governance to deliver agreed outcomes and service-level within budget.</li> <li>Oversee demand management and project intake process, ensuring the development team can deliver on intake requirements and financial cost estimations are reviewed and approved.</li> <li>Identify all development related project dependencies and risks and ensures mitigation/contingency plans are in place for identified risks.</li> <li>Responsible for management of the overall development / design teams providing both leadership and technical guidance.</li> <li>Set targets and objectives for the team, and deliver results.</li> <li>Grow team expertise to meet demand and to support TD’s technology direction; assess team capabilities, always look for ways to enhance value delivered!</li> </ul></div>  <br/><strong>Requirements</strong> <br/> <div><strong>What can you bring to TD?</strong> Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have: <ul> <li>Post secondary degree: Computer Science, Engineering or similar degree preferred</li><li>8+ years relevant experience.</li><li>Expert knowledge of the business, technology standards, managing people and projects.</li><li>Advanced understanding of businesses and/or organizational practices/ disciplines.</li><li>Strong knowledge of external competition, and/or market trends.</li><li>Readiness and motivation to manage a sizeable group or team of IT professionals (e.g. <li>Proven success in problem solving and coming up with strategies and plans for operational improvement.</li></ul></div>  <br/><strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/> <div><strong>Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:</strong> <ul> <li>Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.</li><li>Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others.</li><li>Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals.</li><li>Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners.</li><li>Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency.</li><li>Embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside.</li> </ul> <strong>Make your mark. Join a dynamic team. Explore new ideas.</strong> This is your opportunity to impact the future of banking technology in areas and ways you’ve never imagined (at a bank)! Visit techjobs.td.com to learn more.</div> <br/> Hours <br/> <div>M-F, 9-5</div> <br/> Inclusiveness <br/> <div>At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.</div> <br/>
Title: IT Manager, Development

Job_Description: Overview<br/><br/><strong>Inspire the World, Create the Future.</strong> <br/><br/> Do you believe in the power of technology to help shape a brighter future and a stronger global community? Are you inspired by the possibilities? Are innovation, camaraderie, and the pursuit of excellence part of your innate drive? Then you've got what it takes to succeed at Samsung. <br/><br/> Samsung is building out an AI Research lab located in Toronto, Ontario and we are currently recruiting world-class professionals who share our “Innovation through Passion” philosophy and thrive in a fast-paced, cross-team, results-driven environment with a focus on highly visible, challenging, and interdisciplinary projects. Join us and build technologies that shape the future of mobile and beyond. Participate in the building of research prototypes, play a key role in transitioning research to product, and work to improve product-research integration. Enjoy being able to deploy cutting edge AI into world leading products.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul>   <li>Develop and implement tooling, strategies, and approaches for getting research deployed to product</li> <li>Build tooling to streamline common tasks across the research organization</li> <li>Negotiate and collaborate with product organizations in Samsung to build a tighter research-product integration</li> <li>Participate in the building of research prototypes</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul>   <li>Excellent communication skills and willingness to work with an international team to deliver rapid prototypes</li> <li>Strong people skills and be comfortable negotiating, collaborating and communicating effectively across a global organization</li> <li>Expertise in software engineering, particularly backend and data scripting work</li> <li>PhD or MSc. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or other AI/ML related field is required.</li>  </ul> And <strong>at least one</strong> of:  <ul>   <li>Experience with deep learning (CNN, RNN,DBN,DBM, DNN, RNN,LSTM etc.)</li> <li>Experience with (Deep)/Reinforcement Learning and Inverse Reinforcement Learning</li> <li>Experience with time series data/text/multimedia/language/voice data</li> <li>Excellent knowledge in optimal computational environment required for data processing, mining and machine learning</li> </ul> <br/><br/> Samsung is an equal employment opportunity employer. <br/><br/> We thank you for your interest in working for Samsung; only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> <strong>#LI-DJ1</strong>
Title: Product-Research Engineer, AI

Job_Description: <br/><br/> <strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 27221 <br/><br/> <strong>Branch / Department:</strong> Decision Sciences, Analytics <br/><br/> <strong>Transit Number:</strong> 80754 <br/><br/> <strong>Employee Referral Program – Potential Reward:</strong> $2,500.00  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> The Digital Factory is an innovation hub with a clear and well-supported mandate to transform the way banking technology is delivered, by re-imaging the customer experience, to deliver new digital value propositions. We have the support and experience of one of the world’s largest banks behind us and a talented, and growing, team of industry leaders driving us forward. <br/> Do you want to help us reinvent how people bank? At the Scotiabank Digital Factory, we are passionate about transforming the customer experience. <br/><br/> We’re looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done. <br/><br/> By joining our team, you will make an impact on our customers, the banking industry, and ultimately, the world. <br/><br/> <strong>Senior Data Scientist</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>WHO ARE WE?</strong> <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> The AI and Machine Learning team within the Decision Sciences organization at Scotiabank is focused on a single mandate – provide scalable, easily accessible and always-on ML services to augment humans and business applications. With a startup-like culture and an agile approach, the team focuses on rapid development and integration of analytics into all facets of the bank’s work. At an organizational level, the team sits within Scotiabank’s Digital Banking organization which focuses on reimagining the experience of our customers for the digital age. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?</strong> <ul> <li>Opportunity to make an impact in the digital transformation of Scotiabank, with nearly 200 years of history</li><li>Personalized assessment of development areas, setting up goals and training to add new skills</li><li>Assignment in seasoned product groups with well-established business owners, with opportunities to gain new knowledge, build innovative products and make an impact – team’s work has been presented in Scotiabank Investor relations and public conferences</li><li>Training and learning program with resources like books, conference attendance and networking with Subject Matter Experts</li><li>A compensation program with competitive salary, opportunities for annual performance incentives based on performance thresholds, a competitive benefits program and continuing education programs. </li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WILL YOU DO?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Process and Technology</strong>: <ul> <li>Identify and pitch opportunities to drive business value by leveraging AI and Machine Learning across the bank</li><li>Articulate the solution, propose the right mix of Data Scientists and solicit support from partner teams like Data engineering and DevOps Engineering</li><li>Participate in a hands-on manner by setting sprint roadmap for the AI solutions, scope for him/herself and others and contributing with hands-on technical development and evaluation/testing of team members’ contributions</li><li>Drive the process of UAT, Deployment and Integration while working with senior technical and business leaders</li><li>Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.</li> </ul> <strong>AI and Machine Learning:</strong> <ul> <li>Ingest massive volumes of structured and unstructured format data, model, transform and store it in variety of data stores</li><li>Leverage distributed computing, machine learning and AI techniques for analysis, data mining and modeling</li><li>Build scalable, RESTful microservices to surface analytics results for stakeholders</li><li>Create and deploy model and algorithm testing strategies to ensure model predictability holds</li><li>Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models and algorithms used and developed</li><li>Present results to business line stakeholders and help drive real data-driven culture</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?</strong> <ul> <li>Proven track record of building, deploying and usage of AI/ML solutions for at least 2 years</li><li>Appetite to remain hands-on with technical work and grow leadership skills in tandem</li><li>Entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to strike long term vision with tactical development and constant measurement and course correction</li><li>Strong programming fundamentals and knowledge of Python or equivalent (Java/Scala/R)</li><li>Hands-on experience with structured(SQL) and unstructured(noSQL) datastores, data object models and queries</li><li>Experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, audio, image)</li><li>Knowledge of Data tools and ecosystem (e.g., Hive, Sqoop, Spark, Kafka, Tensorflow)</li><li>Experience with common machine Learning libraries in R, Python, Spark and Deep Learning/AI frameworks</li><li>Familiarity or experience with deployment mechanisms for machine learning algorithms (one of TIDAL, Docker, DC/OS, Kubernetes)</li><li>Experience in one or more of following considered an asset: DevOps, SaaS</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> We thank all candidates; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  <br/><br/> As Canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. Scotiabankers hail from over 120 countries, speak more than 100 languages and serve over 23 million customers globally. As a highly diverse company, we know that an inclusive environment for employees and customers helps everyone achieve their best. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide a positive recruitment experience.
Title: Sr. Data Scientist Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

Job_Description: Do you want to take part in the AI revolution? <br/><br/> Thales is a global leader in digital technologies with expertise in aerospace, space, transportation, defense and security. We help our customers to think smarter and act faster; from the bottom of the oceans to the depth of space and cyberspace. <br/><br/> As an early adopter of open, creative and collaborative innovation model, Thales has built the Centre of Research and Technology in Artificial Intelligence eXpertise (cortAIx). Led by Thales, cortAIx, in collaboration with the MILA (Artificial Intelligence Institute of Quebec), the IVADO (Institute of Data Valorization) and the Vector Institute of Toronto, is located in Montreal’s famous Little Italy, in the heart of Montreal’s innovation community. <br/><br/> With the exciting implementation of our Artificial Intelligence organization <strong>cortAIx,</strong> we are seeking a Full Stack Developer for a full time role in Montreal. The Full Stack Developer will be a part of a humble and driven team, participating in the elaboration, architecture, design, development, testing, deployment, operation, maintenance, and enhancement of tools, libraries, frameworks, platform and full stack software solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Main Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Designing, implementing and operating friendly and scalable APIs and microservices;</li><li>Collaborating with the Machine Learning research group to productize the models and research findings as well as maintain AI models deployed in production;</li><li>Working on both the backend and front-end aspects of complex solutions;</li><li>Participating in the evaluation and selection of the appropriate technology platform, frameworks and deployment architecture for each given problem to solve;</li><li>Embracing and promoting Continuous Delivery, Test Driven Development, AI and UX First approach, iterative development (YAGNI) and other SaaS best practices and principles;</li><li>Fostering a strong DevOps culture;</li><li>Participating in the continuous improvement of development and delivery best practices.</li> </ul> <strong>Essential Skills and Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>At least 3 to 5 years of experience on large scale projects, preferably continuously delivered SaaS projects;</li><li>Experience and mastery of a few programming languages among: Python, Java, JavaScript, C#, Scala, F#, Go, C/C++, etc.</li><li>An open mind and a desire to learn and use the best language/technology to solve a given problem;</li><li>Experience developing and delivering on a public cloud provider like Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services; or have built an in-house cloud with all that this involves in terms of tools, monitoring, diagnostic, etc.;</li><li>Experience or knowledge of Web GUI frameworks like Angular, React, ExtJS, Backbone, etc. as well as HTML and CSS; Experience with Continuous Delivery of cloud native, microservice-based large scale solutions in a DevOps culture;</li><li>Experience with and belief in TDD and the testing tools for the different portions of the technology stack;</li><li>Experience with Continuous Delivery and its toolchain (e.g. Git workflow, CI systems like Jenkins, CircleCI, SnapCI, Team Foundation, jFrog Artifactory, etc);</li><li>Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or other container-based deployment along with the automation tools;</li><li>Work experience on AI projects with Tensor Flow and CAFFE an asset.</li> </ul> Thales is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applicants from the four designated groups (women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and aboriginals) to apply for employment. At Thales, we provide accessibility to people with disabilities. Should you require accommodations, please consult with your recruitment office and they will work with you to make any adjustments that best suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> Thales thanks all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 68,000 employees in 50 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!<br/><br/>.
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Service:</strong> Financial Advisory <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Montreal; Toronto; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Deloitte’s <strong>Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning practice (AI and ML)</strong> practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes. <br/><br/> We are looking for candidates that display initiative, creativity, out-of-the-box thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving, high design sensibility, attention to details and executing deliverables to a variety of clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Your role at Deloitte</strong> <ul> <li>Conducting detailed requirements gathering sessions and articulating client needs within briefing documentation</li><li>Brainstorming solutions and creative ideas to complex business problems through working sessions, wireframing and developing mockups</li><li>Developing static infographics, low and high-fidelity wireframes for interactive data visualizations and concept presentation deck</li><li>Conduct Information Design best practices, and effectively communicate business insights back to clients</li><li>Working through iterative cycles, incorporating feedback and completing user testing and quality checks</li><li>Collaborating extensively with clients and other Deloitte teams</li><li>Managing multiple project timelines and deliverables</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Infographics, data visualization and/or annual reporting portfolio is a must</li><li>Persuasive communicator - able to explain complex concepts to stakeholders at all levels</li><li>University / college degree in disciplines of design, preferably graphic design</li><li>Extensive experience with Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator) specifically with publication /editorial design, website mockups</li><li>Versatile designer, who has ability to execute a variety of deliverables, even using out of non-traditional design tools such as Microsoft PowerPoint and Wor</li><li>Experience with in the application of Information Design best practices to create static or interactive visualizations for client deliverable</li><li>Excellent critical thinking and analysis skills</li><li>Experience with iterative development and agile competencies</li><li>Ability to convert ideas quickly into design artifacts</li><li>Ability to work conceptually and solve problems through white-boarding and creating mockups</li><li>Strong presentation and communication skills to convey ideas and solutions to various target groups in both business and technology sectors</li><li>Good listener - weighs input from multiple perspectives when forming opinions and recommendations</li><li>Strong design aesthetic: ability to apply graphic design best principles, understands importance of spatial dynamic, grid system, colour theory and typography</li><li>Ability to apply user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) principles</li><li>Keen eyes for systematic solution and attention to details</li><li>Collaborative and team-oriented work approach</li><li>Ability to create and execute concepts, visuals and/or design assets based on verbal and/or written direction</li><li>Solid understanding of user-centered design processes and ability to balance customer needs with business goals in developing solutions</li><li>Web design and/or knowledge of front end web development and prototyping is a plus</li><li>Experience working for consulting firms, financial institutions and public sector is a plus</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. Title: Design Analyst, AI and ML Joint Venture

Job_Description: Do you want to take part in the AI revolution? <br/><br/> Thales is a global leader in digital technologies with expertise in aerospace, space, transportation, defense and security. We help our customers to think smarter and act faster; from the bottom of the oceans to the depth of space and cyberspace. <br/><br/> As an early adopter of open, creative and collaborative innovation model, Thales has built the Centre of Research and Technology in Artificial Intelligence eXpertise (cortAIx). Led by Thales, cortAIx, in collaboration with the MILA (Artificial Intelligence Institute of Quebec), the IVADO (Institute of Data Valorization) and the Vector Institute of Toronto, is located in Montreal’s famous Little Italy, in the heart of Montreal’s innovation community. <br/><br/> With the exciting implementation of our Artificial Intelligence organization <strong>cortAIx,</strong> we are seeking a Full Stack Developer for a full time role in Montreal. The Full Stack Developer will be a part of a humble and driven team, participating in the elaboration, architecture, design, development, testing, deployment, operation, maintenance, and enhancement of tools, libraries, frameworks, platform and full stack software solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Main Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Designing, implementing and operating friendly and scalable APIs and microservices;</li><li>Collaborating with the Machine Learning research group to productize the models and research findings as well as maintain AI models deployed in production;</li><li>Working on both the backend and front-end aspects of complex solutions;</li><li>Participating in the evaluation and selection of the appropriate technology platform, frameworks and deployment architecture for each given problem to solve;</li><li>Embracing and promoting Continuous Delivery, Test Driven Development, AI and UX First approach, iterative development (YAGNI) and other SaaS best practices and principles;</li><li>Fostering a strong DevOps culture;</li><li>Participating in the continuous improvement of development and delivery best practices as well as mentor junior team members.</li> </ul> <strong>Essential Skills and Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>At least 10 years of experience on large scale projects, preferably continuously delivered SaaS projects;</li><li>Experience and mastery of a few programming languages among: Python, Java, JavaScript, C#, Scala, F#, Go, C/C++, etc.</li><li>An open mind and a desire to learn and use the best language/technology to solve a given problem;</li><li>Experience developing and delivering on a public cloud provider like Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services; or have built an in-house cloud with all that this involves in terms of tools, monitoring, diagnostic, etc.;</li><li>Experience or knowledge of Web GUI frameworks like Angular, React, ExtJS, Backbone, etc. as well as HTML and CSS; Experience with Continuous Delivery of cloud native, microservice-based large scale solutions in a DevOps culture;</li><li>Experience with and belief in TDD and the testing tools for the different portions of the technology stack; work experience on AI projects with Tensor Flow and CAFFE an asset.</li><li>Experience with Continuous Delivery and its toolchain (e.g. Git workflow, CI systems like Jenkins, CircleCI, SnapCI, Team Foundation, jFrog Artifactory, etc);</li><li>Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or other container-based deployment along with the automation tools.</li> </ul> Thales is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applicants from the four designated groups (women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and aboriginals) to apply for employment. At Thales, we provide accessibility to people with disabilities. Should you require accommodations, please consult with your recruitment office and they will work with you to make any adjustments that best suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> Thales thanks all those that apply but only those selected for interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 68,000 employees in 50 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!<br/><br/>.
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <strong>WHO WE ARE</strong> <br/> Terramera is an award-winning Vancouver, Canada-based sustainable agriculture cleantech company using chemistry, machine learning and AI technologies to develop and optimize safer, more effective plant-based replacements to toxic chemical pesticides and synthetic fertilizers. <br/><br/> Our company name comes from the Latin word ‘terra’ (Earth) and the Hindi and Punjabi words ‘tera’ (yours) and ‘mera’ (mine), meaning: Our Earth (yours and mine). <br/><br/> <strong>WHY US?</strong> <br/> Our goals are big, hairy and audacious. We’re striving to reduce the use of toxic chemical pesticides by 80%, help increase global food production by 20% and benefit over a billion people. Our unique and proprietary technologies enable us to increase the efficacy of active ingredients by delivering them into target cells, which results in revolutionary, high-performance plant-based products for conventional and organic agriculture, professional and home use. <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR MISSION</strong> <br/> In collaboration with our Software and Machine Learning Engineers, your mission will be to support the physical and mechanical design of autonomous (robot and track platform) imaging systems to augment our scientists with robots that will speed up their scientific research. Your work will include physical enclosures and locomotion systems for autonomous devices employing stereo cameras, motors and an array of sensors (e.g. lidar, ultrasonic, piezoelectric, temperature, moisture, light), as well as software employing Python and C/C++ SDKs. Together, these will enable functional, real-time systems to facilitate effective bioscience research and help displace toxic chemical pesticides in the world. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Support the design and implementation of automation platforms to facilitate laboratory operations;</li>  <li>Support the design and implementation of mechanical / electrical solutions for greenhouse and field imaging;</li>  <li>Select appropriate electronic components, produce and solder basic circuit layouts, design PCBs for manufacturing;</li>  <li>Design and print 3D components used to construct mechatronics artifacts;</li>  <li>Integrate component SDKs and APIs on the Arduino platform, as well as the Raspberry Pi and Nvidia Jetson TX2 into available and reliable software that operates in real time using Python and C++;</li>  <li>Instantiate machine vision algorithms on hardware with guidance from the ML Engineers; and</li>  <li>Supervisor and mentor Robotics Co-op Students as needed.</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree in Mechanical/Electrical/Systems Engineering, Mechatronics or a related discipline;</li>  <li>2+ years of experience in C++/Python programming;</li>  <li>3+ years of experience assembling and integrating electronic components (i.e. reading circuit diagrams, prototyping on breadboards, soldering final pieces, etc.);</li>  <li>Proven ability to rapidly prototype mechatronics solutions (creativity and lateral thinking is welcomed at Terramera);</li>  <li>Solid programming skills with a focus on writing clean/maintainable code;</li>  <li>Solid knowledge around theory and practices in robotics;</li>  <li>Highly conscientious with strong follow-through;</li>  <li>Capable of performing research on best practices and making in consumable for other team members;</li>  <li>Responsive to feedback;</li>  <li>Willing to experiment; and</li>  <li>Able to apply domain knowledge to ambiguous and novel situations.</li> </ul> <strong>PREFERENCES</strong>  <ul> <li>Portfolio of completed robotics projects available for review;</li>  <li>Exposure to Java;</li>  <li>Knowledge of JSON / XML;</li>  <li>Familiarity with six-axis robotic arm systems;</li>  <li>Exposure to machine learning terminology and concepts; and</li>  <li>Knowledge of the Agile project management methodology.</li> </ul> <strong>LOCATION</strong>  <ul> <li>Terramera Head Office – 333 Seymour Street, Suite 1100, Vancouver, BC</li> </ul> <strong> <br/> Terramera is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer.</strong> <br/><br/> Our success begins with our people. We’re looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team. <br/><br/> While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on Terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com
Title: Robotics Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>About Us</strong><br/><br/>Aeryon Labs is the global leader in high performance small unmanned aerial systems (sUAS) that set the standard for technical innovation, reliability, and performance. Our teams are passionate about solving problems, which help our customers do difficult and (often) dangerous tasks – safely and efficiently. We are equally passionate about the people who make this happen. Our team. We offer careers that allow you to exceed your potential and collaborate with some of the most creative minds in the industry.<br/><br/><strong>About the Position</strong><br/><br/>We are looking to hire an experienced candidate to work on artificial intelligence and machine learning applications and capabilities for our UAVs and our SaaS platform. In our quest to make gathering the right data with our aircraft as easy as possible to use, we are looking to build capabilities that will help the pilot in their mission, or even do the mission for the pilot. Having AI capabilities on the drone is key to this. Also, having AI capabilities on our SaaS platform will allow us to sift through large amounts of data automatically - showing end users only what matters to them. <br/><br/> As an AI Developer, you will be building AI technology that will be used by both the aircraft and SaaS platform to provide the capabilities mentioned above. You will work closely with the other software teams in the department, and with the product managers to ensure capabilities and technology you build will be used to their full potential. <br/><br/> <strong>**We are currently recruiting for MULTIPLES of this exciting role, to build up the AI team for all skill levels of Junior, Intermediate and Senior!**</strong> <br/><br/> To carry out this work, you will need solid expertise in the following areas: <ul> <li>Linear algebra, optimization, filters, real time image processing, embedded programming, numerical methods and understanding of classical computer vision</li><li>Developing and training deep neural networks for classification, detection and image segmentation</li><li>One or more of the following deep learning frameworks: Caffe, Tensorflow, or Torch, and understanding of convolutional neural networks (CNN).</li> </ul> As part of the Artificial Intelligence and Computer Vision team you will: <ul> <li>Develop frameworks needed to train neural nets - these can include anything needed to support data curation, model training, and automated testing</li><li>Build new neural nets that can run in real time on the aircraft and can run in a SaaS environment</li><li>Assist other software teams with integration and productization of neural nets you developed</li><li>Work with data curator to ensure the data sets needed for training the neural net are in place</li> </ul>  <strong>About You</strong><br/><br/>You want to work for a technology company that is innovative and growing. You are motivated by solving problems and making sure the solution works for all stakeholders. You want to work with like-minded people and enjoy being part of the team. You are a seasoned engineer and have a passion for computer vision and computer learning. You want to be in an environment where continuous learning is not only encouraged – but also expected. You are passionate about quality – but more importantly the customer experience and ensuring this is the best it can be.<br/><br/><strong>What You Bring</strong>  <ul> <li>MS / PhD specializing in Computer Vision or Bachelors with equivalent experience</li><li>2+ years experience as an AI developer, Data Scientist or similar role</li><li>Proven track record of taking neural net models from concept to production</li><li>Experience with two or more of the following: C, C++, Python</li><li>Knowledge in machine learning and deep learning libraries such as keras, tensorflow, sklearn, Caffe, OpenCV, TensorRT</li><li>Experience with two or more mathematical libraries and frameworks like Octave, Matlab, OpenCV, and Eigen</li> </ul> <em>Aeryon Labs Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that does not unlawfully discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion, gender identity, gender expression, creed, sex, sexual orientation, age, record of offences, marital status, family status or disability.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Aeryon is committed to a fair and inclusive work environment. We will endeavor to accommodate the needs of qualified applicants in all parts of the hiring process.</em> <br/><br/> <em>If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process please email careers @aeryon.com or call (519) 489-6726.</em>
Title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Software Developer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Applications are currently closed for this role. Applications for the 2019 program will open in Fall 2018. If you would like to be notified when applications are open, submit your details here: g.co/airesidencysignup</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Toronto, ON, Canada; Montreal, QC, Canada</strong></div><div><strong>About the Program:</strong> The Google AI Residency Program (formerly known as the Google Brain Residency Program) is a 12-month role designed to advance your career in machine learning research. Residents will work alongside distinguished scientists from various Research teams. The goal of the residency is to help residents become productive and successful AI researchers. <br/><br/> We created the Google Brain Residency Program in 2015, and we are now expanding it into a broader program that involves not just the Google Brain team, but a broader group of research teams doing machine learning research. Residents will have the opportunity to do everything from conducting fundamental research to contributing to products and services used by millions of people. We encourage our Residents to publish their work externally. Take a look at what some have done in previous years. <br/><br/> We are looking for people who want to learn to conduct machine learning research in collaboration with our researchers. You may have research experience in another field (e.g., mathematics, physics, bioinformatics, etc.) and want to apply machine learning to this area, or you may have limited research experience but a strong desire to do more. Of course having machine learning research experience is great. <br/><br/> Current students will need to graduate from their current degree program before the residency begins. We encourage candidates from all over the world to apply. If a candidate requires a work visa, Google will explore what options are available on a case by case basis. <br/><br/> The Google AI Residency Program is primarily based in Mountain View, California and is expanding to new locations in 2018. Depending on resident interests, project fit, and team needs, accepted residents may be based in locations outside of Mountain View, including New York; Cambridge (Massachusetts); Montreal; and Toronto. Residents are expected to work on site. <br/><br/> <strong>To apply, please read all instructions below and submit the following required materials:</strong> <ul>  <li>Resume</li> <li>Cover Letter</li> <li>Transcript</li> </ul> Your application should show evidence of proficiency in programming and in prerequisite courses, notable performance in competitions, or links to an open-source project that demonstrates programming and mathematical ability. Your application should present a strong interest in the field. This can be demonstrated through links to publications and blog posts, or implementations of one or more (even slightly) learning algorithms, including an explanation for what makes it novel. <br/><br/> <strong>Step 1</strong> <br/><br/> Prepare the following documents to complete your application: <ul> <li>Current CV (including links to GitHub, papers and/or blogs if applicable).</li><li>Cover letter including a statement on why you think you'd be great for the Google AI Residency Program.</li><li>Transcripts from your most recent degree.</li> </ul> <strong>Step 2</strong> <br/><br/> Click on the “Apply Now” button on this page to provide the above required materials in the appropriate sections (PDFs preferred): <ul> <li> In the “Resume Section:” attach an updated resume.</li><li> In the “Optional Section:” attach your cover letter that includes a statement on why you think you'd be great for the Google AI Residency Program. This section is mandatory for the program even though it is optional, as noted on the website, for other jobs at Google.</li> <li>In the “Education Section:” attach a current unofficial or official transcript in English. (Under “Degree Status,” select “Now attending” to upload a transcript.)</li> </ul> <strong>Note:</strong> We will ask you to provide a Letter of Recommendation once you have passed an initial review. If so, please have your recommender submit their letter to aires-app-external@google.com.<br/><br/><strong>Questions?</strong> See our FAQ.<br/><br/>There is always more information out there, and the Research and Machine Intelligence team has a never-ending quest to find it and make it accessible. We're constantly refining our signature search engine to provide better results, and developing offerings like Google Instant, Google Voice Search and Google Image Search to make it faster and more engaging. We're providing users around the world with great search results every day, but at Google, great just isn't good enough. We're just getting started.</div><div><div> Responsibilities <div>  <ul>  <li>Quickly learn and understand a large body of research in deep learning and/or machine learning algorithms.</li> <li>Work with research mentors to formulate research project(s) and/or novel application(s) of machine learning.</li> <li>Conduct research and publish it in competitive venues.</li> <li>Implement algorithms in TensorFlow.</li></ul> </div> <br/> <div> Qualifications <div>Minimum qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  <li>BA/BS degree in a STEM field such as Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics, or equivalent practical experience.</li> <li>Completed coursework in calculus, linear algebra, and probability, or their equivalent.</li> <li>Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: C/C++ or Python</li> <li>Experience with machine learning or deep learning, applications of machine learning to NLP, computer vision, speech, systems, robotics, algorithms, optimization, on-device learning, social networks, economics, information retrieval, journalism, or health care.</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Research experience in machine learning or deep learning (e.g. links to open-source work or link to novel learning algorithms).</li> <li>Strong open-source project experience that demonstrates programming, mathematical, and machine learning abilities and interest.</li></ul> </div> </div></div></div><div><div>At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.</div></div><div><div><strong>To all recruitment agencies:</strong> Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other company location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.</div></div></div>
Title: Google AI Resident, 2018 Start (Fixed Term Employee)

work experience on AI projects with Tensor Flow and CAFFE an asset.</li><li>Experience with Continuous Delivery and its toolchain (e.g. Git workflow, CI systems like Jenkins, CircleCI, SnapCI, Team Foundation, jFrog Artifactory, etc);</li><li>Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or other container-based deployment along with the automation tools.</li> </ul> Thales is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applicants from the four designated groups (women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and aboriginals) to apply for employment. At Thales, we provide accessibility to people with disabilities. Should you require accommodations, please consult with your recruitment office and they will work with you to make any adjustments that best suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> Thales thanks all those that apply but only those selected for interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. Job_Description: <strong>Requisition ID</strong>: 29826 <br/> Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. <br/> What your role will be... <br/> Manager, Collections Strategies and Analytics <br/><br/> Purpose of Job <br/> GRM Retail Credit Risk Collections is leader in developing innovative solutions impacting Banks profitability. This is accomplished through the use of advanced analytics, collections efficiency and disciplined risk governance. <br/> You, as a Manager Collections Strategy, contribute to the success of the Collections function by defining, implementing and tracking best-in-class collections practices, consistent process execution, and oversight. You are a rigorous logical thinker, curious, flexible and have great teamwork abilities. Your background and experience is at the intersection of math/stats, computer science, communication, and domain knowledge in Retail Risk Managemen or Marketing Analytics. <br/> You understand business requirements, use enterprise-level data, and leverage your strong background in advanced analytics to identify and recommend actionable collections strategies that improve the Banks profitability. In this position, you will partner with risk, product, operations and IT teams to generate benefits impacting provisions. <br/><br/> Key Job Accountabilities <br/> Leverage your strong analytical background in order to collaborate with various business partners to:  <ul> <li>Develop statistical segmentations to further enhance risk collections strategies, forecast customer payment behavior, and improve customer targeting within Risk Appetite thresholds</li> <li>Deliver on analytical projects that provide actionable insights to improve collection efforts and recoveries to existing in-house and outsourced processes and strategies</li> <li>Introduce changes under a test/control framework to help drive objective, evidence based decisions that improve profitability</li> <li>Lead the gathering and processing of structured and unstructured data into a form suitable for analysis (for instance writing scripts, web scraping, calling APIs, write SQL queries, etc.)</li> <li>Design and implement policies to help our customers in need of loan modification programs</li> <li>Provide analytical oversight of collections actions, as well as customer/financial benefits tracking and communication. Develop performance reports and early warning triggers</li> </ul> Skills, Experience and Functional Competencies  <ul> <li>Three years experience designing and deploying credit risk strategies</li> <li>University degree in relevant STEM discipline (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) and strong background in statistical and quantitative analysis</li> <li>Strong collaboration skills with ability to translate technical knowledge into business value</li> <li>Ability to clean, transform and work with large volumes of structured and unstructured non-traditional data and with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, XML, flat files)</li> <li>Solid SQL skills for querying relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, DB2, MySQL, Sybase) and using statistical software such as R or SAS</li> <li>Working experience of strategy optimization leveraging operations research principles would be an asset</li> <li>Effective communication skills with ability to prepare project documentation and presentations</li> <li>Experience with TRIAD or similar collections risk platforms strongly desired</li> <li>Experience with using and/or developing credit risk scores and their application in strategies</li> <li>Results driven individual with high level of curiosity and ability to dive into details without loosing sight of the big picture</li> <li>Exceptional organization skills to prioritize, manage, and implement a variety of competing initiatives, on a concurrent or staggered basis</li> <li>Experience with big data tools and programming languages such as Hive, R, Python, Spark and with NoSQL databases (Hbase as an example) would be an asset</li> <li>Experience with machine learning and other AI techniques for strategy design would be an asses</li> </ul> Education and Other Requirements <br/> A Master's degree in Economics, Finance, Industrial Engineer, Mathematics, Computer science, or Information technology related discipline <br/><br/> <strong>Location(s)</strong>: Canada : Ontario : Toronto <br/> As Canadas International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
Title: Manager, Collections Strategies and Analytics

Job_Description: <strong>Role: Product Manager</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Company: integrate.ai,</strong> https://www.integrate.ai <br/><br/> <strong>Location: Downtown Toronto</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Role</strong> <br/><br/> At integrate.ai, we are looking for a <strong>Product Manager</strong> who aspires to improve customer experiences through innovative products. You will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming the next product innovation to working directly with customers and engineers to implement features and convey your vision through bold product roadmaps. You will be expected to push the boundaries of what’s possible while sharing in our healthy obsession for quality and attention to detail. <strong>You will work with our Machine Learning Engineers and Data Modelling experts to gather insights and identify opportunities to build a world class AI platform.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>integrate.ai</strong> <br/><br/> Our mission is to build a future in which AI enriches people’s lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. To do this we are building an AI powered platform for B2C enterprises that integrates with business processes to make customer interactions more natural and valuable. Founded by Steve Irvine, former Facebook executive, we are proud to be based in Toronto, Canada at the center of an exciting AI ecosystem. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Responsibilities</strong></strong> <ul>  <li>Leading the ideation, technical development, and launch of innovative products for our enterprise B2B platform.</li> <li>Weaving together an empathetic understanding of customers with your knowledge of technology and competition, to create product strategies and features.</li> <li>Prioritizing what we should build and when by collaborating with stakeholders on product vision and strategy.</li> <li>Managing the release and sprint backlog through planning, backlog grooming, development, and review.</li> <li> Seeing features through documentation, prioritization of bugs and enhancements, and usage analysis.</li> <li>Writing specifications that stakeholders can review and provide feedback, and finding ways to keep readers engaged.</li> <li>Defining and analysing metrics that inform the success of products to our enterprise B2C customers.</li> <li>Understanding our company's strategic and competitive position to deliver products that make an impact to our clients.</li>  </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>You have shipped features that correspond to the 'a-ha' moments: uncovering the types of interactions that are the greatest predictors of long, healthy customer/company relationships</li> <li>Thought through entire customer journeys and how to maximize mutual lifetime value, but you are probably happily lopsided in one of these areas: customer acquisition, upsell, or retention</li> <li>Built recommender systems that have increased customer satisfaction and/or the dashboards you've spec'ed and designed help users take specific actions</li> <li>Strong experience and background in an Agile environment</li> <li><strong>Technical fluency: you may not be a developer but you have an understanding of the technical architecture of complex web and mobile applications and can work with engineers to make intelligent technical trade-offs.</strong></li> <li><strong>Experience designing simple and intuitive user interfaces – ability to create examples through wireframes and mockups</strong> </li> <li><strong>You are a Strategic Product Manager, however, you don't mind working on the tactical, day-to-day, hands on execution activities</strong></li> <li><strong>You have approximately 4-8 years of progressive Product Management or Senior Product Management working experience.</strong></li> <li>Created and managed both short-term and medium-term product roadmaps</li> <li>Found and developed unique data assets that improve experiences for our clients and their customers</li> <li>Experience developing social products, technologies and platforms is strongly desired.</li> <li>An entrepreneurial spirit: you’re a self-starter, can identify opportunities, understand potential impact and effectively prioritize across multiple competing priorities.</li> <li>NICE TO HAVE: Actual machine learning expertise is great, but at minimum you have participated in a data science bootcamp</li> </ul> The diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ai’s team members help us make better decisions and drive great results. We foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. We're committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. We hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and growth. We are naturally curious and have strong attention to detail. We love working in a team where trust is key and try our best to make an impact every day. If this sounds like the right fit, please apply and come work with us.
Title: Product Manager (AI PLATFORM)

Job_Description: Rebels are visionaries, trail blazers, risk takers, and fearless in their endeavours. Rebels dream big with big resolve. Rebel is both our name and our identity. It defines us. It shapes the work we do, guides the products we build and enhances the experiences we share. <br/><br/> <strong>Position</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for an experienced application developer to work within a small nimble development team. You will be collaborating with our CEO on experimental product development projects where you will contribute to design and development while taking a minimum viable product to market. The subject matter will vary, but your common thread will be experimenting with modern approaches to server software and cloud computing. <br/><br/> In this position, you will contribute to both development and operations of a small and existing cloud application, and will code on fast-paced, high energy, and exploratory product development team. <br/><br/> For this position, we require a Computer Science or related degree and 5+ Years of development experience. <br/><br/> <strong>You will have experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Managing multiple development projects to achieve real world objectives</li> <li>Designing and coding fast, secure, and scalable applications</li> <li>Leveraging Cloud Computing Services and Approaches (AWS/Google Cloud)</li> <li>Architecting Object Oriented and SOA systems (Java, NodeJS, Perl, PHP, or C#)</li> <li>Developing Relational databases (MySql, MSSql)</li> <li>Integrating with partners, customers, and third-party systems via Web API/WebSockets</li> <li>Front End Development skills including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.</li>  </ul> <strong>You know or are willing to quickly learn:</strong>  <ul> <li>Agile & Scrum project management techniques</li> <li>Minimum Viable Product Development</li> <li>Analytical skills for performance measurement and data driven decisions</li> <li>How to leverage advanced cloud platform services and techniques</li> <li>Managing Linux based servers and applications</li>  <strong><li>Development project hygiene:</strong>   <ul> <li>Source Control, Automated Build and Continuous integration</li> <li>Maintainable & Testable Code</li> <li>Progressive Release</li> </ul>  </li> </ul> <strong>Our approach</strong>  <ul> <li>We strive for Simple, Clean and Testable code</li> <li>We love cloud computing (AWS) and service architecture</li> <li>You support your team and raise everyones game</li> <li>You support what you build</li> <li>You are brave and take action</li> </ul> <strong>You will be working on:</strong>  <ul> <li>Contributing towards development and operations of an existing cloud based server application.</li> <li>Development and operations of experimental product development projects. Below is a sample of technologies you may explore:   <ul> <li>Block Chain / Crypto Currency</li> <li>Business Intelligence, Machine Learning and AI</li> <li>Server-less Architecture - Micro-Service Architecture</li> <li>iOS/Android and Mobile App Development</li> <li>E-Commerce Development</li> </ul>  </li> </ul> <strong>About Rebel</strong> <br/><br/> We celebrate contribution. We work hard and we respect balance. Were agile, open concept and collaborative. We stock our kitchen so you can grab breakfast, lunch and snacks anytime. Were smoke free but love beer. We are located in downtown Ottawas Byward Market, but we are also accepting applications from those who live outside of Ottawa and are willing to work remotely. <br/><br/> <strong>NON-SMOKERS ONLY, PLEASE!</strong>
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Service:</strong> Financial Advisory <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Montreal; Toronto; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Deloitte’s <strong>Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning practice (AI and ML)</strong> practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes. <br/><br/> <strong>Your role at Deloitte</strong> <ul> <li>Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, NoSQL, on-premises or cloud including ‘big data’ technologies</li><li>Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Ingest data sets provided to team</li><li>Prepare Analytical datasets (ADS) to support the data science and modeling/AI team in building and deploying statistical models (e.g., predictive models) to support client engagements</li><li>Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. Build and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture</li><li>Use ETL tools such as SSIS, Informatica or similar tools</li><li>Use data mining and analytical tools (Microsoft SSAS, Hadoop, Impala, Spark and other proprietary software) to query large data sets. Be able to discover patterns, analyze and filter data to deliver targeted information</li><li>Create and document data models to host client data for relational data, dimensional data, NoSQL, graph, unstructured data</li><li>Maintain, develop, and enhance data quality procedures and controls</li><li>Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.</li><li>Work with stakeholders including the Strategy, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs</li><li>Work with the lead of data architecture to implement data management standards</li><li>Share your knowledge and experiences with the team</li><li>Provide production support and on-call support when needed</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Advanced working SQL knowledge & experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases including SQL Server, Oracle</li><li>5+ years of experience in Database / BI development</li><li>Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures & data sets</li><li>Exp. performing root cause analysis in order to identify opportunities for improvement</li><li>Exp. in supporting multiple production environments including debugging production issues (3–5 y.)</li><li>Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency & workload management</li><li>Must have data modeling skills to address relational data, dimensional data, NoSQL, graph, unstructured data & master data (3-4 y.)</li><li>A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets</li><li>Strong project management and organizational skills</li><li>Strong capability to understand relevant business parameters along with an ability to select appropriate processes or procedures from multiple options</li><li>A proven ability to work independently to determine, articulate & solve a problem</li><li>Exp. supporting & working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment</li><li>A University degree in Computer Science, Information Management or related field is required</li><li>Candidate with 5+ years of exp. in a Data Engineer role, with a university degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. An advanced degree is preferred</li><li>Experience using the following software/tools: RDMS and NoSQL databases, big data technologies, AWS cloud services, Microsoft Azure cloud services, data pipeline and workflow management tools, ETL, Data Quality and Data Cleansing and Master Data Management tools, Stream-processing systems, Programming competency with Python (or Java, C++), shell scripting languages (for Windows and Linux)</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 35453
