Job_Description: <strong>Data Scientist</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Location: Toronto, ON</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Term: 12 months</strong> <br/><br/> You will be responsible for producing algorithmic methodology and codes, developing machine learning techniques, using modern technology tools to mine the unstructured data, leveraging visualization toolkits to discover strategic insights and providing prescriptive solutions in support of evidence-based decision making and execution of the corporate strategic plan and goals. <br/><br/> You will be developing predictive models to be used in helping the organization make real time decisions through integrating analytic data sets, models and operational systems. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Integrate and prepare of large, varied datasets, architect specialized database and computer environments; monitor the establishment of analytical data sets that combine various data sources with needed transformation to serve planned analytical needs; operationalize predictive models for the purposes of feature generation and implementing recommendation engines, class classifiers, NLP algorithms as well as chat boxes (AI)</li> <li>Manage the data resource identification and verification, including internal and external data sources, the leverage of new data collection processes and collaboration with subject matter experts to select the relevant sources of information.</li> <li>Work with external stakeholders to ensure that proper data models are maintained when ingesting external data. Follow proper protocol when dealing with confidential data sets within the organization.</li> <li>Use algorithms, information retrieval and various modeling methodologies to support the identification of trends, scrape information from unstructured data sources and provide automated recommendations to all areas of the business around specific actions.</li> <li>Work around making data driven models and technology factory to aggregate various data sources into a feature and knowledge generating products; make recommendations to senior management about options.</li> <li>Collaborate with other teams to assist with making evidence-based decisions.</li> <li>Perform reporting and analytic quantification assessments and make recommendations and/or develop new analytical solutions or optimizations.</li> <li>Provide advice to the design and development of new information management products, including the data visualization and enhancements to existing analytical products e.g. canned reports, tools</li> </ul> <strong>Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience in design and administration of analytical ecosystems</li> <li>Extensive experience in use of Oracle databases (query design, index optimization, administration)</li> <li>Experience in NoSQL content management and database design</li> <li>Experience in cloud computing</li> <li>Hands on experience to build up quick proof of concept environments for Big Data</li> <li>Experience with machine learning methodologies with focus on dimension reduction, text mining, NLP and recommender systems</li> <li>Being comfortable with programing languages including Java, .Net, SAS, R/Python</li> <li>Experience with Big Data solutions and Map-Reduce methodology</li> <li>Extensive experience with data wrangling and data cleansing techniques</li> </ul> <strong>Education:</strong>  <ul> <li>Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering or Data Science</li> </ul> Job URL: https://01millennium.com/jobs/data-scientist
Title: Data Scientist

Job_Description: 1QBit is dedicated to solving the world’s most intractable challenges by recasting problems to harness the power of quantum computing. We identify demanding industry problems and apply breakthroughs in computation to machine intelligence and optimization science to build software that allows applications to continually benefit from advances in both quantum and classical hardware. <br/><br/> We believe that quantum technologies will form the next pillar of computational progress. We research, benchmark, and build software development kits, online platforms, and applications that make the power of quantum computers accessible to researchers, developers, and industry-leading organizations so they can solve their most difficult problems in fields such as optimization, simulation, and machine learning. <br/><br/> As an interdisciplinary team of world-class mathematicians, physicists, engineers, operations research scientists, software developers, quantum computing experts, and business leaders, we share a curiosity and drive to uncover new ways of solving currently intractable problems. <br/><br/> Our work is guided by a shared set of values focused on five fundamental principles:  <ul> <li>Audacity – A drive to pioneer and apply new methods. To dream without limit and then do the hard work of bringing your ideas into reality.</li> <li>Open Thinking – A belief in the sharing of ideas. To approach each exploration with a receptive mindset and collaborate openly to produce the best possible results.</li> <li>Interdisciplinary Collaboration – A respect for the diversity of people, backgrounds, and skills. A wide range of perspectives reveals a more complete landscape and yields deeper insights.</li> <li>Ownership – A feeling of pride in the work of the team and a deep sense of purpose and accomplishment from your contribution.</li> <li>Beginner’s Mindset – A desire to improve as an expert while retaining the curiosity and openness that inspired you to begin.</li> </ul> <strong>Your Role</strong> <br/><br/> As a member of our Machine Learning Team, you will be working in collaboration with people from across multiple disciplines. As a Quantum Machine Learning Researcher at 1QBit, you will utilize your background in quantum information and computation, quantum complexity theory, quantum machine learning, and quantum algorithms, to address a wide range of the world’s most challenging computational problems. At the core of this role you will have the opportunity to advance quantum AI by investigating, designing, implementing, and analyzing applied quantum–classical algorithms. This is a unique opportunity for someone with a passion for working at the frontier of new technologies. You will have the opportunity to work with the world’s most advanced quantum and classical computing hardware architectures to develop new tools and techniques for applications to interface with and leverage new computing processes. You will use your experience in rapid prototyping to implement effective and powerful computational solutions. You will leverage the scale of 1QBit’s proprietary data, designing the applications and classical and quantum computing infrastructure, in conjunction with commercial tools and data sources, to develop powerful computing solutions. <br/><br/> Operating within 1QBit’s Agile team structure, it is largely you who will drive your own schedule and work in collaboration with fellow researchers, industry experts, and software developers. You will use the Scrum methodology to take an ownership role in autonomously managing your work and supporting your team in finishing project Sprints. You will contribute to 1QBit’s continuous improvement through Sprint Retrospectives and by providing input and ideas on every aspect of how our company operates. <br/><br/> Peer feedback and mentorship will allow you to immerse yourself in our team’s thinking from day one and will, in turn, support the development of your own ideas through active, iterative collaboration with teammates on papers, patents, and technical reports. You will also join multidisciplinary teams composed of our own fundamental and applied researchers and software developers, alongside industry researchers, to explore the solution space of open questions in the field of quantum computing. Together, you will consider the fundamental implications of each project throughout the research and software development process. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Bring</strong> <br/><br/> Members of our team bring a confluence of personality, skills, and intent that contributes to their individual development and our collective growth as an organization. The knowledge and mindset you will bring to our team includes the following:  <ul> <li>Eligibility for the Mitacs Elevate program (www.mitacs.ca/en/programs/elevate)</li> <li>A PhD in quantum computing, the physics of quantum computation and information, quantum algorithms, quantum machine learning, or a related field. A PhD candidate with extensive experience in any of the above may also be considered.</li> <li>A prominent research track record in one or more of the following fields:   <ul> <li>quantum machine learning,</li> <li>quantum complexity theory,</li> <li>quantum information science, or</li> <li>quantum algorithms.</li> </ul>  </li> </ul> This is typically demonstrated by your international reputation, research publications, presentations, and external research grants.  <ul> <li>Extensive experience in structuring and solving complex problems.</li> <li>The ability to conduct research in an interdisciplinary environment, as well as independently.</li> <li>Self-motivation and the ability to take initiative and follow through reliably.</li> <li>Familiarity with quantum computing software simulation environments.</li> <li>Familiarity with quantum computing hardware platforms and their stages of development.</li> <li>Familiarity with data science and machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., random forest, support vector machine, neural networks, deep learning, scikit-learn, R, MATLAB) is a plus.</li> <li>Commitment to challenging the status quo, taking smart risks, and being open to possible failure.</li> <li>Proactively seeking out opportunities to help move projects forward, and contributing to their improvement.</li> <li>Openness to soliciting feedback to improve your performance and in turn continually providing input to team members to elevate team performance and contribute to 1QBit’s culture.</li> <li>An eagerness to learn about new trends, tools, and technologies and continually consider how these will influence our projects and the implications and opportunities that they bring.</li> <li>Dedication to maintaining team unity and effectiveness through the sharing of information and expertise, and striving for team success.</li> </ul> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> You share our belief that principles, not policies, enable individuals and teams to apply their unique lens in making decisions. Like all 1QBit team members, you thrive in our flat hierarchy of empowered individuals. You embrace the rigorous examination of the thoughts and work of diverse minds from multiple disciplines because you know it uncovers deeper insights and produces robust results. You believe there is no failure in exploration because new breakthroughs often require rigorous examination of multiple paths before a conclusion is reached. You have a desire to apply yourself to purposeful work that is inspiring, meaningful, and fun, to create value for the world by advancing the ability to solve complex problems. You have a relentless curiosity for exploring new methodologies and you have an intrinsic drive to architect the foundation of the quantum ecosystem because you love the challenges and understand the rewards that the next paradigm of computation will bring.
Title: Mitacs Intern - Quantum Machine Learning Researcher

Job_Description: <strong>Service:</strong> Financial Advisory <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Montreal; Toronto; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Deloitte’s <strong>Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning practice (AI and ML)</strong> practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes. <br/><br/> <strong>Your role at Deloitte</strong> <br/><br/> As a Senior Manager, you may be involved in any one of these activities: <ul> <li>Take a leading role in designing, executing and delivering advisory services to high growth organizations with a diverse team consisting of data scientists, data architects, software developers, information designers, and business/industry subject matter experts</li><li>Lead, guide, and perform “hands on” statistical modelling and mathematical modeling, and work with junior resources to lead solution design and ensure quality of models and analysis</li><li>Play a leading role in the overall sales process, including creating and fostering client relationships, identifying new approaches and opportunities, and managing leads across the entire sales cycle</li> </ul> · Manage different components of projects including managing teams of analysts and senior analysts of various sizes, day-to-day execution of the analytical solution and overall project, and communication with internal stakeholders and external clients. <br/><br/> · Lead the development of the methodology for analytical solutions for clients business problems <br/><br/> · Lead teams to integrate, and aggregate large amounts of data on a granular level, from structured and unstructured data sources to prepare analytical data set. <br/><br/> · Participate in various structured and ad-hoc analysis projects with cross-functional teams within Deloitte <br/><br/> Lead the planning, data collection, and data analysis on client projects, and lead pitches and management of proposal bids <br/><br/> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Strong experience with applied statistical analytical techniques, data mining, and predictive models. Experience in clustering / segmentation, graph analysis, natural language processing, and / or other machine learning techniques preferred</li><li>Specifically, 5-8 years work experience in the field of data science. Practical experience in building and deploying predictive models within large organizations, as well as building and data science leading teams</li><li>Applying supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to applied problems such as customer segmentation, fraud or risk analysis, revenue or product usage forecasting, etc.</li><li>Experience in working with databases and Big Data platforms to collect, transform and extract the right information for a machine learning use case</li><li>Experience in translating machine learning solutions to business value and driving deployment and adoption across organizations</li><li>Minimum of Honors Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline including Econometrics, Marketing Science, Decision Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative field is required. Advanced degree (MA/MSc, Ph.D. equivalent or higher) is preferred</li><li>Statistical software experience using (one or more): Python, R, SPSS Modeller, SAS, Angoss Knowledge Studio, RapidMiner, or similar tools is required</li><li>Database and programming languages experience and data manipulation and integration skills using (one or more) SQL, Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL Databases, or similar tools is required</li><li>Project management and people management experience is required</li><li>Professional services, consulting, or advisory experience is preferred</li><li>Strong track record exemplifying ability to quickly understand business problems, developing solutions and insights, and communicating them by leveraging data and analytics</li><li>Experience with social media analytics and/or text mining and/or optimization is an asset</li><li>Enthusiastic about solving complex problems with a variety of analytical tools</li><li>Strong oral and written communication skills are required</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. Title: Data Science Senior Manager, AI and ML Joint Venture

Job_Description: <strong>WHO WE ARE</strong> <br/><br/> Terramera is an award-winning Vancouver, Canada-based sustainable agriculture cleantech company using chemistry, machine learning and AI technologies to develop and optimize safer, more effective plant-based replacements to toxic chemical pesticides and synthetic fertilizers. <br/><br/> We help farmers grow the healthiest food possible by increasing yields and reducing crop losses from insects and plant diseases. Our plant-based solutions are proven to be more effective than conventional chemical pesticides – all of which are EPA-registered and OMRI-listed for use in organic production. <br/><br/> <strong>WHY US?</strong> <br/> Our goals are big, hairy and audacious. We’re striving to reduce the use of toxic chemical pesticides by 80%, help increase global food production by 20% and positively impact a billion people by 2027. Our unique and proprietary technologies enable us to increase the efficacy of active ingredients such as neem oil by delivering them into target cells, which results in revolutionary, high-performance plant-based products for conventional and organic agriculture use. <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR MISSION</strong> <br/> As a key member of our growing Commercial Agriculture Sales team, your mission will be to help farmers, ranchers and producers grow the healthiest food possible, increase yields, reduce crop losses and make organically produced food more affordable for everyone. You will do this by making phone calls and presentations to promote the proper use of Terramera’s crop protection, crop nutrition and other innovative organic products, which are proven to be more effective than conventional chemical pesticides. You will help develop new business potential while retaining current business by completing frequent sales calls to develop relationships, understand customer needs and offer the correct solutions in a timely manner. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Partners with clients in a courteous and professional manner to understand their unique needs;</li>  <li>Delivers effective presentations of Terramera’s solutions to clients;</li>  <li>Follows up on inbound sales leads and prospects for new customers;</li>  <li>Provides timely and relevant information regarding crop performance, marketing and pricing;</li>  <li>Ensures customer satisfaction by working with sales support and customer service teams;</li>  <li>Maintains accurate records of all sales and prospecting activities in the CRM system;</li>  <li>Demonstrates complete understanding of pricing and proposal models, effectively communicating with business owners and decision makers;</li>  <li>Ensures federal and state regulations pertaining to crop protection products and fertilizers are observed and adhered to;</li>  <li>Plans for the demand of upcoming sales seasons;</li>  <li>Supports the planting and harvesting of agronomic product knowledge plots;</li>  <li>Maintains positive business relationships to ensure future sales; and</li>  <li>Represents Terramera at relevant tradeshows as needed.</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years of proven sales experience in sustainable or organic agriculture, including hands on experience with customer service;</li>  <li>Post-secondary degree in Horticulture, related field in Agriculture or other relevant discipline;</li>  <li>Knowledge of industry and marketing information, as well as crop nutrients, crop protection and insect/disease management;</li>  <li>Experience with CRM software and MS Office (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint);</li>  <li>Strong understanding of key sales performance indicators (KPIs);</li>  <li>Ability to travel domestically and internationally as required; and</li>  <li>Ability to work extended hours in season.</li> </ul> <strong>PREFERENCES</strong>  <ul> <li>Certified Crop Advisor Certification; and</li>  <li>Knowledge in Integrated Pest Management (IPM) and organic production processes, systems and technologies.</li> </ul> <strong>QUALITIES WE’RE LOOKING FOR</strong>  <ul> <li>Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills;</li>  <li>High degree of professionalism, flexibility and adaptability;</li>  <li>Identifies clients’ needs and increase customer engagement;</li>  <li>Addresses clients’ needs and facilitates sales, education and the product performance process from beginning to end;</li>  <li>Meets established sales goals, contributes to an increase in sales performance and maintains company-client relationships at a high standard; and</li>  <li>Identifies clients’ needs and increases customer engagement.</li> </ul> <strong>LOCATION</strong>  <ul> <li>Terramera Head Office – 333 Seymour Street, Suite 1100, Vancouver, BC</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Terramera is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer.</strong> <br/><br/> Our success begins with our people. We’re looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team. <br/><br/> While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on Terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com
Title: Agronomy Sales Representative

Job_Description: <strong>WHO WE ARE</strong> <br/> Terramera is an award-winning Vancouver, Canada-based sustainable agriculture cleantech company using chemistry, machine learning and AI technologies to develop and optimize safer, more effective plant-based replacements to toxic chemical pesticides and synthetic fertilizers. In doing so, we cultivate healthy homes, as well as make organic food and sustainable farming more productive and abundant. <br/><br/> Our company name comes from the Latin word ‘terra’ (Earth) and the Hindi and Punjabi words ‘tera’ (yours) and ‘mera’ (mine), meaning: Our Earth (yours and mine). <br/><br/> <strong>WHY US?</strong> <br/> Our goals are big, hairy and audacious. We’re striving to reduce the use of toxic chemical pesticides by 80%, help increase global food production by 20% and benefit over a billion people. Our unique and proprietary technologies enable us to increase the efficacy of active ingredients by delivering them into target cells, which results in revolutionary, high-performance plant-based products for conventional and organic agriculture, professional and home use. <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR MISSION</strong> <br/> As part of Terramera’s Supply Chain Management team, your mission will be to align procurement plans between our head office in Vancouver, operations in the US, as well as processing facility in India. You will lead the materials planning process and implement effective strategies for inventory control. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Purchasing:</strong>  <ul> <li>Procure packaging and raw materials for manufacturing in the US;</li>  <li>Align procurement plans for India and Vancouver – working closely with the CFO and Sales regarding forecast, procurement of KPIs, as well as the Country Head in India for feedstock procurement plans and expectations;</li>  <li>Update procurement model in SAP and resolve discrepancies and issues in procurement model;</li>  <li>Source and procure packaging materials for the company; and</li>  <li>Implement industry best practices and strategies in the procurement process (i.e. chemical, packaging, feedstock and co-packing vendors) and look for continuous improvement for cost savings.</li> </ul> <strong>Materials Planning & Inventory Management:</strong>  <ul> <li>Run materials planning for the company;</li>  <li>Implement industry best practices and strategies for inventory control (i.e. spend analysis, Pareto ABC analysis, safety stock calculation based on normal distribution and historical consumption rates, min-max calculations, supply planning and control);</li>  <li>Manage deadlines on materials deliveries for new projects;</li>  <li>Track lot numbers of all materials in all 3PLs and warehouses;</li>  <li>Manage aging inventory in the system by identifying aging and inactive inventory and proposing possible asset recovery programs;</li>  <li>Process production orders in SAP;</li>  <li>Build BOMs and COGS for Finished Goods; and</li>  <li>Manage regular monthly/quarterly/year-end counts for all locations.</li> </ul> <strong>Logistics:</strong>  <ul> <li>Manage inbound shipments of local/imported raw materials – which includes coordinating with customs brokerages, booking truck pickups, securing and sending shipping documents;</li>  <li>Prepare and issue shipping documents to carriers and custom brokers;</li>  <li>Coordinate reverse logistics (i.e. returning materials that are damaged or with quality issues);</li>  <li>Plan supplies of packaging materials to 3rd party production sites; and</li>  <li>Execute supply plans for key accounts by sharing forecast and locking down key supplies.</li> </ul> <strong>Receiving:</strong>  <ul> <li>Ensure raw and packaging materials are received accurately;</li>  <li>Plan and implement SOPs for shipping and receiving;</li>  <li>Ensure all materials that are received has a PO in SAP;</li>  <li>Resolve receiving discrepancies as required; and</li>  <li>Review invoices and match them with PO prior to payment approval.</li> </ul> <strong>Quality Assurance:</strong>  <ul> <li>Resolve and coordinate quality issues for both raw materials and finished goods; and</li>  <li>Identify SOPs that are needed within Supply Chain department and draft such procedures.</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree in Supply Chain Management, Operations Management or similar discipline;</li>  <li>Procurement or Logistics certification (or working towards certification);</li>  <li>5+ years of experience in procurement processes, including strategy development and implementation in both procurement and import/export documentation;</li>  <li>Strong knowledge in supply chain management, including materials planning, supply planning and inventory control;</li>  <li>Excellent understanding of Incoterms;</li>  <li>Seasoned ERP systems user (i.e. SAP, Navision); and</li>  <li>Expert level in MS Excel.</li> </ul> <strong>QUALITIES WE’RE LOOKING FOR</strong>  <ul> <li>Attention to detail;</li>  <li>Analytical skills;</li>  <li>Ability to anticipate stakeholder needs;</li>  <li>Ability to multi-task and work independently, as well as in a group;</li>  <li>Excellent negotiation skills and ability to network; and</li>  <li>Strong aptitude in decision-making and working with numbers.</li> </ul> <strong>LOCATION</strong>  <ul> <li>Terramera Head Office – 333 Seymour Street, Suite 1100, Vancouver, BC</li> </ul> <strong>APPLICATION DEADLINE</strong>  <ul> <li>May 25, 2018</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Terramera is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer.</strong> <br/><br/> Our success begins with our people. We’re looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team. <br/><br/> While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on Terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com
Title: Manager, Purchasing & Materials Planning

Job_Description: Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc. <br/><br/> As a member of the software engineering division, you will take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures. You will be responsible for defining and developing software for tasks associated with the developing, designing and debugging of software applications or operating systems. <br/><br/> Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience.<br/><br/>The Oracle Cloud <br/> Applications team is looking for a Principal Application Developer to help <br/> transform the way that customers use, interact, configure and personalize Oracle <br/> Cloud Apps by leveraging the latest <br/> and greatest technologies, from powerful client-side technology to machine <br/> learning and AI capabilities. <br/><br/> Due to the scope of responsibilities and domain knowledge required, this role calls for a highly technical, passionate and <br/> result oriented candidate who will work with developers, product managers, and <br/> architects, using cutting edge technologies to develop component-based UI and <br/> tools and ensure successful uptake by Oracle Cloud Apps.<br/> <div><strong>In this role you will need to:</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Work in a SCRUM team to design and successfully deliver new <br/> components and required supporting tools to Cloud Apps teams.</li><li>Work closely with Cloud teams during the uptake of these <br/> components to ensure successful release of Cloud Apps using the next generation <br/> of UI.</li> <li>Work with Product Management, Architecture and Oracle PaaS <br/> teams to make sure the deliverables are <br/> aligned with Cloud Apps functional and technical requirements</li> </ul>  <div><strong>The ideal candidate will have the following:</strong></div>  <ul> <li>7 year experience in product development</li> <li>Strong <br/> experience in Java design and development</li><li>Strong experience in JavaScript/Typescript/HTML and related <br/> Client-side technologies (e.g. jQuery, RequireJS)</li><li>Strong <br/> knowledge of REST and related Server-side technologies (e.g. SWAGGER, OpenAPI, <br/> NodeJS)</li><li>Experience with Cloud Applications and technologies. Experience in scalability, performance, security, concurrency for cloud-based Apps is <br/> a plus.</li><li>Very strong communication and analytical skills</li><li>Ability to take ownership and work on multiple tracks in a <br/> fast-paced distributed environment</li><li>Experience with SCRUM and Agile development methodology</li> </ul>

like:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Work with counterparts to architect, design, and lead the building of high-quality analytical delivery solutions</li> <li>Play a key role embracing agile processes and driving deployment cycles that deliver high valued/high quality commercial software to our customers</li> <li>Advance the technology vision through collaboration and strong leadership</li> <li>Mentor principles</li> <li>Initiate advanced research exercises that will lay the foundation of next-generation data architecture and data engineering capabilities</li> <li>Advance the building and documentation of a comprehensive library of design patterns across multiple technology stacks</li> <li>Act as a point of escalation on strategic initiatives by applying strong oversight to all aspects of the project</li> <li>Lead, lead, and lead more</li>  </ul> <strong>What qualifications we’re looking for:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Extremely strong leadership and mentorship skills</li> <li>Incredible talent related to complex data systems design</li> <li>Endless appetite for creative (yet pragmatic) solutions</li> <li>Excellent organization, critical-thinking and personal leadership skills</li> <li>Self-starter with the ability to deliver with minimal supervision</li> <li>Team player/Team Mentor</li> <li>10+ years as a lead developer/architect in complex data management solutions</li> <li>10+ years working with large scale data repositories (>10 Terabytes at a minimum)</li> <li>5+ years experience shipping enterprise grade commercial software</li> <li>Proven ability to deliver a major project initiative</li> <li>Ability to articulate with specificity, most of the following key technology and process components of a data management system (primarily cloud based)   <ul>   <li>ETL/ELT</li> <li>BI/Analytical</li> <li>Data Quality</li> <li>Master Data</li> <li>Audit</li> <li>Metadata</li> <li>Statistical/Machine Learning/AI</li> <li>API Data Access Gateway</li> <li>Production Monitoring</li> </ul>  	</li> <li>Familiarity with Service Oriented Architectures</li> <li>Strong experience with Advanced KPI and Predictive model solutions</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus points for having:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Java/Python development skills</li> <li>Test Driven Design experience</li> <li>API driven integration techniques</li> <li>Hadoop (Cloudera) Technology Stack solutions</li> </ul> <strong>Education</strong>: <br/><br/> Degree or Masters in Computer Science or any related degree in Information Technology centric studies <br/><br/> Working at PointClickCare Title: BI Software Architect

Job_Description: <div>// See English version below … // <br/><br/> Titre : Spécialiste en apprentissage automatique <br/><br/> Relève de : Directeur de LABS <br/><br/> Fonctions : <ul> <li>Responsable du développement de la vision par ordinateur et des technologies d'apprentissage par machine pour le déploiement de jeux vidéo ;</li><li>Expérimenter avec des données réelles pour valider, évaluer et améliorer les algorithmes ;</li><li>Responsable de la production des algorithmes CV / ML dans les fonctionnalités du produit, avec le soutien et les conseils d'autres équipes d'ingénierie système ;</li><li>Profiler les éléments logiciels, développez et exécutez des tests de performance, aidez à minimiser les inefficacités / la latence et améliorez les performances ;</li><li>Configurer et gérer l''intégration continue' pour les fonctionnalités et les versions ;</li><li>Coordonner le développement avec les équipes interfonctionnelles basées localement, mais aussi ailleurs dans la compagnie ;</li><li>Concevoir, former et déployer des réseaux de neurones pour des fonctions complexes de jeux vidéo ;</li><li>Garder le contact avec les récents résultats de recherche sur l'IA et mettre en œuvre / améliorer les algorithmes DNN gagnants ;</li><li>Enquêter en collaboration avec le directeur, tout partenariat potentiel avec différents départements de nos productions de jeux pour ajouter de l'IA dans ces processus / systèmes.</li> </ul> Expériences et Qualifications : <ul> <li>Baccalauréat, Maîtirse en Progammation, Math, Physique ou dans un domaine quantitative similaire. Doctorat considéré comme un plus.</li><li>5 ans d'expérience ou plus en Programmation d'intelligence artificielle ou expérience équivalente.</li><li>Maîtrise des scripts C / C ++, Python, Unix / Linux</li><li>Expérience avec OpenCV ou d'autres bibliothèques de vision par ordinateur</li><li>Expérience avec les méthodes communes d'apprentissage automatique.</li><li>L'expérience avec Caffe, Theano, Keras ou Tensor Flow est un plus</li><li>L'expérience de production de jeux vidéo est un plus.</li> </ul> Qualités interpersonnelles : <ul> <li>Motivé et autonome</li><li>Capable d'initier une conversation avec des pairs, afin de mieux comprendre comment ils fonctionnent et de développer plus de solution basée sur l'intelligence artificielle en interne.</li><li>Curiosité</li> </ul> Motivations et intérêts : La passion et l’ambition pour les jeux vidéo sont essentielles! <br/><br/> Title: Machine Learning Specialist <br/><br/> Report to: Director LABS <br/><br/> Functions: <ul> <li>Responsible for developing computer vision and machine learning based technologies for deployment for the videogames;</li><li>Experiment with real-world data to validate, evaluate and improve the algorithms;</li><li>Responsible for productizing the CV/ML algorithms into product features, with support and guidance from other system engineering teams;</li><li>Profile the software stack, develop and run Performance tests, help minimize inefficiencies/latency and improve performance;</li><li>Setup and maintain ‘Continuous Integration’ for features and releases;</li><li>Coordinate the development with cross functional teams based locally, but also out of other company’s offices;</li><li>Designing, training and deploying neural networks for complex videogames functions;</li><li>Keeping up with recent AI research results and implementing/improving on winning DNN algorithms;</li><li>Investigate with the director, any potentially partnership with different department of our game productions for adding AI into those process/systems</li> </ul> Experience and qualifications: <ul> <li>Bachelors, Masters in Computer Science, Math, Physics or similarly quantitative-heavy background. PhD is a bonus.</li><li>5+ years in AI Programming or equivalent experience.</li><li>Proficiency in C/C++, Python, Unix/Linux scripting.</li><li>Experience with OpenCV or other computer vision libraries.</li><li>Experience with common Machine Learning methods.</li><li>Experience with Caffe, Theano, Keras or Tensor flow is a plus.</li><li>Videogame production experience is a plus.</li> </ul> Interpersonal skills: <ul> <li>Self-motivated and autonomous</li><li>Capable of initiating conversation with peers, in order to understand better how they work and to develop more AI based solution internally.</li><li>Curiosity</li> </ul> Motivation and interest: Ambition and passion for video games are essential!</div>

Job_Description: Chez Nuance, nous donnons aux gens la possibilité d'interagir naturellement avec leurs divers appareils connectés et le monde numérique autour d'eux. Nous créons un monde où la technologie pense et agit de la façon dont les humains le font en concevant des modes d'interaction avec la technologie plus intuitifs. <br/><br/> Notre technologie agile utilise des analyses et des algorithmes avancés pour transformer l'inanimé en animé et transformer des processus complexes en processus simples. <br/><br/> Joignez-vous à notre équipe mobile ... où les systèmes intelligents sont maintenant prêts pour la route. Nous sommes passionnés par le développement d'interfaces intelligentes qui permettent aux gens de parler à leurs voitures, leurs téléphones et tous autres appareils intelligents. <br/><br/> At Nuance, we empower people with the ability to seamlessly interact with their connected devices and the digital world around them. We are creating a world where technology thinks and acts the way people do by designing the most human, natural, and intuitive ways of interacting with technology. <br/><br/> Our nimble technology uses analytics and advanced algorithms to transform the inanimate into animate and reduce complicated processes into simple ones. <br/><br/> Join our Mobile team…intelligent systems now ready for the road. We are passionate about developing intelligent interfaces that enable people to talk to their cars, phones, devices, and other smart “things”. <br/><br/> English will follow <br/><br/> Résumé : À titre de membre du groupe de recherche sur le traitement des langues naturelles (TLN), la personne travaillera sur des problèmes de recherche ambitieux qui auront des répercussions concrètes sur des applications de la vie courante prometteuses. Ce poste est axé sur le développement d'un système de compréhension statistique et multilingue des langues naturelles en vue de l'application d'assistants virtuels de nouvelle génération. Cette application a pour but de traiter des phrases complexes du point de vue linguistique afin que l'assistant virtuel puisse interagir avec l'utilisateur de la manière la plus naturelle possible. <br/><br/> Principales responsabilités : <ul> <li>Faire des recherches et des expériences pour améliorer la précision et la vitesse et étendre les caractéristiques des systèmes d'intelligence artificielle de Nuance</li><li>Mettre en œuvre, analyser et améliorer le rendement des algorithmes internes et externes</li><li>Proposer et évaluer des méthodes de développement évolutives dans les différents domaines et les différentes langues</li><li>Transmettre les résultats de recherche sous forme de rapports et de présentations techniques; formulation d'inventions en vue de la demande de brevet</li><li>Participer à l'intégration de nouveaux algorithmes dans une plateforme de démonstration ou de production</li> </ul> Compétences requises : <ul> <li>Expertise dans au moins un des domaines suivants : apprentissage machine, modélisation statistique, apprentissage profond, optimisation numérique, exploration de données, conception d'algorithmes</li><li>Expérience dans au moins un des domaines suivants : reconnaissance vocale, traitement des langues naturelles, dialogue, questions et réponses, représentation des connaissances, raisonnement</li><li>Fortes aptitudes de programmation, de débogage et d'analyse de données; capacité de prototyper des idées de recherche efficacement</li><li>Expérience dans l'exécution d'expérimentations de précision et l'amélioration systématique du rendement</li><li>Doit être capable de prendre des initiatives, mais aussi de suivre un plan et de travailler au sein d'une équipe</li><li>Bonnes aptitudes de communication (écrites et orales)</li> </ul> Compétences privilégiées : <ul> <li>Solide expérience en programmation (C++ ou Java) et en langage script (ex. Python)</li><li>Solide expérience de travail dans l'environnement Linux</li><li>Expertise avec des infrastructures d'apprentissage profond à source ouverte (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Theano, CNTK, etc.)</li><li>Bonne connaissance des gros groupes informatiques et l'informatique parallèle</li> </ul> Études : <ul> <li>Diplôme en sciences informatiques ou dans un domaine connexe (ou expérience de travail similaire)</li><li>Un grade supérieur (maîtrise ou doctorat) dans les domaines ci-dessus est fortement privilégié</li> </ul> Les niveaux seront déterminés en fonction des qualifications des candidats <br/><br/> Principal Responsibilities: <ul> <li>Conduct research and experiments to improve accuracy, speed and expand features of Nuance AI systems</li><li>Implement, analyze and improve performance of in-house and external algorithms</li><li>Propose and evaluate methods for scalable development across domains and languages</li><li>Report research results in the form of technical reports and presentations, formulation of inventions towards patent applications</li><li>Participate in integration of new algorithms into a demo or production platform</li> </ul> Required Skills: <ul> <li>Expertise in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, statistical modeling, deep learning, numerical optimization, data mining, algorithm design</li><li>Experience in one or more of the following areas: speech recognition, natural language processing, dialog, question and answering, knowledge representation, reasoning</li><li>Strong programming, debugging and data analysis skills; able to prototype research ideas effectively</li><li>Experience running accuracy experiments and systematically improving performance</li><li>Should be able to take initiative, but also follow a plan and work well as part of a team</li><li>Good communication skills (written and oral).</li> </ul> Preferred Skills: <ul> <li>Strong experience in a programming (C++ or Java) and a scripting language (e.g. Python)</li><li>Strong experience working in Linux environment</li><li>Expertise with open source deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Theano, CNTK etc)</li><li>Familiar with large computing cluster and parallel computing</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Degree in computer science (or similar field) or equivalent work experience</li><li>Advanced degree (MS/PhD) in the above listed fields are strongly preferred</li> </ul> Levels will be determined based on candidate qualifications <br/><br/> In Montreal: <br/><br/> What we offer ! <br/><br/> <strong>Unique environment for collaborative teamwork on cutting-edge technology:</strong> <ul> <li>Location is in the heart of downtown</li><li>Flexible hours</li><li>Transit reimbursement and parking</li> </ul> <strong>Contributing to and collaborating with international teams that drive innovation</strong> <ul> <li>Competitive benefit package:</li><li>4 weeks’ vacation</li><li>10 paid sick days</li><li>Bonus Plan, Group RRSP, Deferred Profit Sharing Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li> </ul> <strong>Award-winning Top Employer:</strong> <ul> <li>Canada's Top 100 Employers – 7 consecutive years</li><li>Montreal’s Top Employers – 6 consecutive years</li><li>Canada's Top Employers for Young People - 3 consecutive years</li> </ul> Ce que nous offrons! <br/><br/> <strong>Un environnement unique et collaboratif où vous travaillez avec les technologies de pointe :</strong> <ul> <li>Situé au cœur du centre-ville de Montréal</li><li>Horaire flexible</li><li>Allocation de transport en commun et de stationnement</li><li>Travail de concert avec des équipes à l’international afin de repousser les limites de l’innovation</li> </ul> <strong>Programme d’avantages sociaux concurrentiel :</strong> <ul> <li>4 semaines de vacances</li><li>10 congés de maladies payés</li><li>Régime de bonus annuel, REER collectif, Régimes de participation différée aux bénéfices (RPDB), Régime de rachat d’action pour les employés</li> </ul> <strong>Gagnant de prix à titre de meilleurs employeurs :</strong> <ul> <li>Canada's Top 100 Employers – pour 7 années consécutives</li><li>Canada's Top Employers for Young People - pour 3 années consécutives</li> </ul> In Waterloo: <br/><br/> What We Offer! <br/><br/> <strong>Unique environment for collaborative teamwork on cutting-edge technology:</strong> <ul> <li>Convenient location</li><li>Free parking</li><li>Flexible hours</li><li>Contributing to and collaborating with international teams that drive innovation</li> </ul> <strong>Competitive benefit package:</strong> <ul> <li>4 weeks’ vacation</li><li>10 paid sick days</li><li>11 paid holidays</li><li>Bonus Plan, Group RRSP, Deferred Profit Sharing Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li> </ul> <strong>Award-winning Top Employer:</strong> <ul> <li>Canada’s Top 100 Employers – 7 consecutive years</li><li>Canada’s Top Employers for Young People – 3 consecutive years</li> </ul>

Job_Description: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Web/Java) <br/> Location Richmond Hill <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> We provide electronic bill payment solutions and looking for high performers to join our development team building FinTech solutions across a range of industries. <br/> You will contribute to a massively scalable data platform, that is built on top of a world-class enterprise platform, supporting thousands of clients and into the millions of transactions daily. <br/> You are a self-driven senior developer seeking to understand and transform client requirements into core features of an evolving payment platform, who collaborates with expert team members to enhance <br/> user experience within the payment space, and enjoys writing great code! You challenge yourself to go beyond the original request and solve the root problem, build test-driven code, embrace new <br/> technologies and innovate on a fin-tech platform that continues to evolve and expand at a fast pace. <br/> Your exposure will cover areas of JavaEE, Web 2.0, mobile, IVR, micro-services, NoSQL big-data scalability, with ownership to deliver from inception to production through an agile process. <br/><br/> We're looking for more than just plain Java devs, ideally they would bring something that makes them stand out, like experience in new stack technologies such as nodeJS, Docker, microservices or work with AI, bots, NLP, etc. <br/><br/> <strong>You Enjoy:</strong>   <ul> <li>Playing a role in the analysis of challenging projects, proposing designs, and embracing feedback to build a leading-edge solution.</li> <li>Working with talented developers from diverse backgrounds, continually learning, and applying best practices to development.</li> <li>Making an impact on a business that translates your efforts directly to production.</li> <li>Contributing to a team-first agile environment.</li> <li>Continually learning new technologies, to bring client-focused solutions to production faster.</li> <li>Mastering your craft as a software engineer, honing your skills in Enterprise Java / Web 2.0 development, and distributed, horizontally scalable and containerized architecture built on</li> </ul>  micro-services.   <ul> <li>Actively contributing to developer communities such as Github, Apache, StackOverflow, TopCodFpaymener, Google Developer Groups.</li> <li>Working intelligently to surpass expectations, while maintaining a work-life balance.</li> <li>Joining an organization in a rapid growth phase, with career growth opportunities.</li> </ul>  <strong>This Role’s Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>B.S. Degree in Computer Science or Engineering from a leading University.</li> <li>3-5 years of experience with Java development, and/or other object-oriented programming languages.</li> <li>Experience building scalable web applications built around micro-services architecture</li> <li>Capable of writing and optimizing native HTML5 / JavaScript/ECMAScript6+ / CSS3.</li> <li>1+ years experience with one or more JS frameworks: NodeJS/Express, Angular, React, ExtJS, Vue</li> <li>Working understanding of relational database and No-SQL database concepts.</li> <li>A passion for technology, exceeding client expectations, and building great products.</li> <li>A proven high-performer and team-player, with the ability to take the lead on projects</li> <li>Exceptional communication skills; strong writing and speaking skills.</li> </ul>  <strong>Next Level Skills:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience building RESTful services in NodeJS or SpringBoot.</li> <li>Java Servlets, and J2EE frameworks such as Spring MVC, Struts 1.x/2.x.</li> <li>Docker containerization, Kubernetes container orchestration</li> <li>Apache, Nginx, Tomcat 8.x</li> <li>2+ years database experience with Oracle 11g and PL/SQL</li> <li>2+ years NoSQL experience with one of Couchbase, Dynamo, Hbase, InfluxDB, Mongo</li> <li>Implementation of a TICK / TIG stack</li> <li>JQuery, Freemarker, JSON, XML/XSD, SOAP</li> <li>Mobile web development targeting Android / iOS</li> <li>Testing frameworks including Selenium, JUnit, Mocha, Jest</li> <li>Cloud technologies such as AWS, GCP, Azure</li> <li>Machine Learning approaches to build UI, eg. chatbots, recommendations</li> <li>Eclipse IDE, IntelliJ, WebStorm</li> <li>GIT, or similar distributed source control with Mercurial, Subversion, etc.</li> <li>.NET experience (integration purposes)</li> <li>Familiarity with Linux or BSD</li> <li>Demonstrated contributions to software projects in the public realm</li> </ul>  <strong>What We Offer:</strong>   <ul> <li>An environment for continual learning, mentoring, & embracing the best technology for the problem.</li> <li>Competitive salary and bonus structure</li> <li>A collaborative and supportive environment that encourages innovation, and offers opportunities to advance your career</li> <li>Group Health & Dental Benefits plan</li> <li>Family day of your choosing, subsidized</li> <li>Discounted Goodlife membership</li> <li>Team building events. Eg. Team lunches, group dinners, escape room challenges, axe throwing, bowling, rock climbing, nerf gun wars, bubble soccer, archery tag.</li> <li>Kitchen stocked weekly with premium coffee selections, tea, pops, juices, snacks, chocolates</li> <li>Bagel Monday mornings, and catered lunch Fridays</li> <li>Ping Pong: challenge a colleague!</li> </ul>

Job_Description: <DIV><DIV><DIV><strong>Job Summary</strong></DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>The Solution Implementation and Planning department is part consultancy, part innovation lab, part project implementation and part Business Unit support. We challenge existing processes and technologies in pursuit of seamless customer experiences, process improvement, and efficiency.</DIV>  <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>This Consultant will be responsible to implement an infrastructure that includes design, development, testing and implementation of RPA at Canadian Tire Bank. They will develop new processes/tasks/objects using core workflow principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>Canadian Tire Bank is seeking an experienced, highly motivated and results focused Process Automation Consultant to build an RPA Centre of Excellence at CTB. We are looking for a candidate that will leverage their industry experience drive best practices, tool selection and opportunity identification strategies that deliver optimal business results.</DIV>  <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>Our goal is to build a team of people with experience in Robotic Process Automation. This team will work with business units to help identify process improvement opportunities and build business cases that will prioritize development efforts. Business processes will benefit from a suite of automation tools, and this team will recommend the best solution for each unique opportunity.</DIV>  <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV><strong>Responsibilities</strong></DIV> <br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><ul> <li>This position will provide the expertise to build an RPA delivery team from the ground up, making recommendations on design, tools, structure and delivery processes,</li> <li>Using deep RPA experience, lead a team through opportunity identification, process documentation and business case processes that delivers business benefit through RPA implementations.</li> <li>Prioritization and demand management of evolving lists of automation requests, working with stakeholders to determine priority, set turn around expectations and establish a pipeline process to move new requests from ideation to production deployment.</LI>   <li>Defining systems strategy, developing system requirements, designing, prototyping, and testing custom technology solutions, and supporting system implementation.</li> <li>Coordinate with robotics shared services for robotic process automation (RPA) implementations.</LI></ul></DIV>  <br/><strong></strong><br/>  <DIV><strong>Qualifications</strong></DIV> <br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><ul> <li>Robotics Process Automation expertise (Workfusion, Nice, Pega, OpenSpan, Kofax and similar products).</li> <li>Fluent in Agile Methodology / Scrum deliveries and DevOps.</li> <li>Consulting experience in a Financial Services / Operations environment.</li> <li>Solid track record of identifying processes that are feasible for automation with recommendations for benefits and savings.</LI>   <li>Strong and demonstrated stakeholder management, risk management and budgeting skills and experience.</li> <li>Any experience in Machine Learning, AI, Natural Language Processing.</li> <li>2 years of relevant RPA bot development experience with one of the market leading RPA platforms (Workfusion, Nice, Pega, OpenSpan, Kofax and similar products).</li> <li>5 years of experience in programming (.NET, Java, ETL etc.)</li> <li>Understanding of Process Design documents, Technical Design documents on Automation space.</li> <li>5 years of experience in business client-facing role involving process design/process improvement work directly aligned to the specific responsibilities of this role. Experience with features and functionalities of RPA tools.</li> <li>Certification in Robotics Automation products is an asset</li> <li>Exposure to different business areas (e.g. Operations, Finance, Marketing, Products, Sales & Distributions, Technology)</LI>   <li>Ability to prioritize, organize and complete multiple tasks with a high attention to detail</li> <li>Strong commitment to professional client service excellence</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams</li> <li>Bachelor's Degree or equivalent professional experience</LI></ul> </DIV>  <br/>Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Business Analyst, Robotics Process Automation - 1 year contract

Job_Description: <strong>Worker Sub-Type:</strong><br/><br/>Regular<br/><br/><strong><strong><strong> Job Description:</strong></strong></strong> <br/><br/> BlackBerry is looking for server-side Software Developers to join our Enterprise software team where we are innovating and advancing technology to help provide comprehensive visibility and control, and delivering unified endpoint management across the entire “Enterprise of Things” – This is <strong>the NEW IoT</strong>! <br/><br/> As part of the Enterprise Identity Management team you would help provide leading edge identity and access management functionality that leverages state of the art technology to go beyond authentication and authorization to assess and manage ever growing threat/risk vectors, and delivers rock-solid security. We are looking for enthusiastic developers who love new technologies and want to learn and thrive in cloud based PaaS and SaaS solutions. <br/><br/> These platform roles demand broad generalized ability – effectively managed through a full stack approach to developing software. There would also be exposure to DevOps functions for delivery to various cloud platforms, including BlackBerry’s own highly secure private cloud infrastructure. <br/><br/> New graduates with an interest in the development of high-quality software using agile software development methodologies, and TDD are preferred. <br/><br/> Our group is committed to innovation, and as a member of our platform team; you will participate in ideation sessions to generate new patentable inventions, then help architect, design, deliver and support these fantastic concepts as they come to life. <br/><br/> Equally, as our service offerings grow and mature, we will be turning our attention to managing big data in interesting and novel ways through the use of Machine Learning, Analytics, and AI, so candidates with an interest or background in these areas would have a great opportunity to learn and grow these skills. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> As a new member of the team, you would be a self-starter. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate would have the following skillsets: <br/><br/> • Have a degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline <br/><br/> • Have an interest in platform software development using an agile methodologies <br/><br/> • Thrive in a high-paced environment <br/><br/> • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to effectively communicate solutions to the team <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Assets:</strong> <br/><br/> In addition, we are looking for motivated self-starters who are passionate about software development, can learn new technologies with minimal guidance, and have a strong interest in cloud platform software development and deployment. <br/><br/> Bonus if you have any of these: <br/><br/> • Develop software with Node.js, J2EE/Java <br/><br/> • Experience with large scale web and cloud service development <br/><br/> • Experience with large scale Cassandra deployments and non-relational database design methodologies <br/><br/> • Knowledge and experience in identity technology, cryptography, authentication. <br/><br/> #LI-TT1 <br/><br/> <strong>Job Family Group Name:</strong><br/><br/>Product Development<br/><br/><strong>Scheduled Weekly Hours:</strong><br/><br/>40

Job_Description: SEED Chercheur en apprentissage <br/> profond / Deep Learning Researcher - <br/> (Montréal) <br/> Français<br/><br/>SEED est une organisation de R et D chez Electronic Arts dont la mission est de rechercher et de développer lavenir du divertissement et des jeux interactifs. Nos domaines de recherche comprennent la réalité virtuelle et augmentée, la conception des mondes de jeu de demain, la génération de contenu procédural et lapprentissage profond, cest- -dire réseaux neuronaux et autres techniques dapprentissage machine appliquées lIA de jeu et la conception de jeux. <br/> Nous collaborons avec les franchises de jeu comme Battlefield, Mass Effect, Need for Speed et Dragon Age, et des jeux comme Star Wars: Battlefront, Mirrors Edge: Catalyst et EA Sports FIFA. <br/> SEED a besoin dun <strong>chercheur spécialisé en apprentissage profond</strong>. Nous misons actuellement sur lapprentissage par renforcement et les modèles génératifs.<br/><br/>Quelles sont les compétences recherchées par SEED?<br/><br/>À titre de chercheur travaillant avec léquipe dapprentissage profond, vous devrez avoir une <em>passion</em> pour le domaine. <br/> Signes de passion : <ul> <li>Arxiv.org est votre site Web préféré.</li><li>Vous êtes impatient d'implémenter le tout dernier GAN dans Pytorch ou TensorFlow.</li><li>Les mystères entourant les hyperparamètres vous empêchent de dormir.</li> </ul> Si cest le cas, poursuivez votre lecture. <br/> Le candidat idéal sera ouvert et curieux, impatient dapprendre et denseigner. Il doit prendre plaisir utiliser des techniques dapprentissage machine avant-gardistes, les étudier et les adapter des cas concrets de jeu et de divertissement interactif. Nous travaillons en petites équipes et vous demanderons davoir non seulement de linitiative, mais également de travailler concrètement nos projets.<br/><br/>Compétences recherchées :  <ul> <li>Connaissance experte en apprentissage machine ou en apprentissage par renforcement, PhD ou expérience équivalente misant sur les réseaux neuronaux profonds, les réseaux convolutionnels, les réseaux récurrents et les modèles génératifs</li><li>Compétences mathématiques; calculs, algèbre linéaire, optimisation et théorie des probabilités</li><li>Compétences en vision artificielle et traitement de signaux</li><li>Compétences en ingénierie logicielle; Python et C++ ou C#</li><li>Capacité de lire, de comprendre et dexpliquer aux autres des textes scientifiques sur lapprentissage machine de pointe et linformatique, et capacité détablir un prototype, dévaluer et daméliorer les idées décrites</li> </ul>  <strong>Avec SEED:</strong>  <ul> <li>Tout est possible. Allez au bout de vos rêves.</li><li>Nous n'engageons que des personnes sympathiques, de milieux variés, qui s'intéressent au bien-être de leurs collègues.</li><li>Travaillez de l'endroit optimal pour atteindre vos objectifs.</li><li>Gérez votre temps. Passion, impact et résultats sont plus important que le nombre d'heures.</li><li>Partagez votre travail: vous êtes encouragé publier, contribuer des projets ouverts ou présenter lors de conférences.</li><li>Chaque projet est unique. Utilisez votre imagination pour repousser les limites.</li><li>Chaque personne est unique. Nous offrons un encadrement personnalisé pour vous permettre d'atteindre votre plein potentiel.</li><li>Vous façonnerez le futur du divertissement interactif.</li> </ul>  Qu'avons-nous vous offrir? Bonne question!<br/><br/>Nous adorons vanter les avantages que nous offrons comme des régimes d'assurance-maladie et d'avantages sociaux complets, le remboursement des frais de cours, un régime d'épargne-retraite avec cotisation équivalente et, bien sûr, plusieurs autres -côtés. Nous savons que pour créer des jeux de renommée mondiale, il nous faut des talents de classe mondiale. C'est pourquoi nous offrons une rémunération concurrentielle ainsi qu'une culture basée sur la créativité et l'individualité. Chez EA, nous incarnons le modèle « travail-loisir » chaque jour. <br/><br/> Plus sur notre emplacement : http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal <br/><br/> Communiquez avec notre responsable du recrutement : shandaw@ea.com<br/><br/>English<br/><br/>SEED is an R&D organization within Electronic Arts whose purpose is to research and develop the future of interactive entertainment and games. Our areas of research include virtual and augmented reality, how to build the game worlds of the future, procedural content generation, and deep learning, i.e. neural networks and other machine learning techniques applied to game AI and game design. <br/> We collaborate with game franchises like Battlefield, Mass Effect, Need for Speed and Dragon Age, as well as games such as Star Wars: Battlefront, Mirrors Edge: Catalyst and EA Sports FIFA. <br/> SEED is looking for a Researcher with a specialization in deep learning. We are currently focusing on deep reinforcement learning and generative model<em>s</em>.<br/><br/>What skills is SEED looking for?<br/><br/>As a <strong>Researcher working in the deep learning</strong> team we expect you to have a <em>passion</em> for the subject. <br/> Signs of passion can be: <ul> <li>Arxiv.org is your favorite web site</li><li>You can't wait to implement the latest GAN code in Pytorch or TensorFlow.</li><li>Hyperparameter mysteries keep you awake at night</li> </ul> If thats the case, continue reading. <br/><br/> We think that you are an open and curious person who is eager to learn and teach. You get a kick out of taking bleeding-edge machine learning techniques, investigating and adapting them to real use cases for gaming and interactive entertainment. We work in small teams, and we expect you to not only to take initiative, but also work hands-on in our projects.<br/><br/>We also think you have:  <ul> <li>Expert knowledge in machine learning and/or reinforcement learning, PhD or similar level of experience, focusing on deep neural networks, convolutional networks, recurrent networks and generative models</li><li>Math skills; you know your calculus, linear algebra, optimization and probability theory</li><li>Some 3D Computer Vision and Signal Processing experience</li><li>Software engineering skills, you know Python and C++ or C#</li><li>The ability to read, understand, and explain to others, scientific papers on state-of-the-art machine learning and computer science, as well as the ability to prototype, evaluate and improve the ideas described</li> </ul>  <strong>At SEED:</strong>  <ul> <li>The sky is the limit of your ideas. Pursue dreams and start working on making them come true.</li><li>We only hire nice people. We look after each other and come from diverse backgrounds.</li><li>You work from where you have the greatest opportunity of reaching your goals.</li><li>You're in charge of your time. We value passion, impact and results over hours.</li><li>You're encouraged to share your work, publish, open source and speak at conferences.</li><li>Each project is unique. We need you to use your imagination and push boundaries.</li><li>Each person is unique. We offer individual coaching and support to help you reach your own full potential.</li><li>You will be part of shaping the future of interactive entertainment.</li> </ul>  Whats in it for you? Glad you asked!<br/><br/>We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, RRSP company match and, of course, many other perks! And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives off of creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the work hard/play hard credo every day. <br/><br/> More about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal <br/><br/> Contact our Recruiter: shandaw@ea.com

Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures. <br/><br/> SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives. <br/><br/> <strong>PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES</strong> <br/><br/> The Innovation Center Network (ICN) is a development unit within SAP, combining software engineering excellence with entrepreneurial spirit. Across various focus areas we pioneer game-changing solutions in close collaboration with startups, customers & partners in industry and research as ideas and developing inspiring proofs of concepts, we push the state of the art in computer science and its applied fields to provide SAP with foresights into future trends. <br/><br/> The ICN is also well known at executive level, resulting in various projects coming directly from the Executive Board and Supervisory Board. In a flexible and fast manner, the Chairman Projects team, consisting of developers, designers, software architects, and infrastructure experts, comes up with tangible solutions for these high-priority inquiries. Our technology-focused team realizes strategic projects such as implementing proof of concepts, supporting keynotes and papers, and creating reports about state of the art technologies. <br/><br/> <strong>EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS</strong> <br/><br/> Software engineering is your passion? Great! Join the SAP Innovation Center as a Student for the Chairman Projects team. You will be part of a technology-focused team that was built to help shaping the future generations of SAP software. You will be working closely with the team on dedicated software engineering challenges. This is a great opportunity to gain practical experience and increase your knowledge. <br/><br/> At the Chairman Projects team, we are dealing with a wide range of different projects using the technologies which enable us to tackle challenges best. You will be working on one or multiple projects. Examples are:  <ul>  	<li>Kaleidoscope – an interactive project overview developed in ReactJS</li> <li>The Room – the central hub to explore ideas build with JavaScript using Polymer Web Components and Java</li> <li>Project Portfolio Overview – a web-based application to manage the ICN project portfolio (SAP UI5, SAP HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud)</li> <li>Showcases – Keynote and show floor ready applications presenting latest SAP technology as Machine Learning, Blockchain, Conversational AI and other technologies</li> <li>Conversational AI – Build conversation interfaces leveraging Machine Learning using Python, Django, and Node.js</li> </ul> <strong>EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS/ SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Student at a university or university of applied sciences</li> <li>Preferred field(s) of study: Computer Science or a related field</li> <li>Computer skills: Excellent programming skills in frontend (e.g. JavaScript, Polymer, ReactJS) and/or backend (e.g. Java, SQL, Node.js) technologies as well as source code management (e.g. git)</li> <li>Knowledge in database systems are a plus (e.g. SAP HANA, CouchDB)</li> <li>Experience in DevOps are a plus (e.g. Continuous Integration using Jenkins or Travis)</li> <li>Language skills: Fluent in English or German (written and spoken)</li> <li>Soft skills: Eager to learn and hands-on working</li> <li>Reliable and open-minded</li> <li>Strong team working skills</li> <li>Determined to reach a goal in time</li> <li>Ability to work independently and to prioritize tasks</li> </ul> Your set of application documents should contain a brief cover letter and a resume in table form as well as a current university transcript of records. Please describe your experiences and skills in programming languages. <br/><br/> #Internship #Praktikum #Workingstudent #Werkstudent #Germany #Deutschland #Student <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT YOU GET FROM US</strong> <br/><br/> Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. <br/><br/> A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now<em>.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT</strong> <br/> To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. <br/><br/> SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). <br/><br/> Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Locations:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Segment:</strong>  <br/>  Intern, Developer, Engineer, ERP, Chemical Engineer, Entry Level, Technology, Engineering</div><br/>   <div> Apply now »<br/>   <div> Apply now    <ul>    <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with LinkedIn</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Facebook</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Xing</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/>  Apply Now</li><br/>  <div> <div> <div> Start</div>  </div>  </div>  <br/><li>  <div> <strong>Please wait...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div> </div>  <br/>
