Job_Description: <div>Our public sector client is seeking an AI/ML Researcher and Developer to join their team for a contract opportunity Downtown Toronto. The successful candidate will be passionate about the application of Data Science to solve problems. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Work on some pre-defined problems and apply AI (Artificial Intelligence) and ML (Machine Learning) tools.</li> <li>Explore new generation of analytics using AWS, IBM Watson, SQL server, bots.</li> <li>Develop workable solutions.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Strong background with data science and manipulating large data sets.</li> <li>Solid grounding in data modeling, machine learning algorithms and software development techniques and languages used to implement analytics solutions.</li> <li>Resourceful, able to drive towards results in a start-up style environment.</li> <li>Some proficiency with Python, R, Java, and other important ML and analytics languages (e.g. Scala).</li> <li>Basic understanding of building solutions on AWS, IBM Watson, SQL and SQL server, bots.</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Artificial Intelligence Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Service:</strong> Financial Advisory <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Montreal; Toronto; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Deloitte’s <strong>Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning practice (AI and ML)</strong> practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes. <br/><br/> <strong>Your role at Deloitte</strong> <ul> <li>Be a well-rounded design enthusiast who focuses on design and user centric / data driven design principles</li> <li>Work closely with our Product Owners, Project Managers, Designers, and Technical teams to detail and create new products and new/update features for existing products</li><li>Own the creation of consistent experiences across platforms</li><li>Balance business goals with optimal user experience</li><li>Work closely with our development teams to implement your designs</li><li>Be able to articulate the thinking & strategy behind your work and why you’ve made certain design decisions</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Are overall design generalists, love great typography, and want to build delightful experiences</li><li>Have worked on a client facing applications or products</li><li>Can execute on beautiful visual design as well as strategic UX thinking</li><li>Understands proactive (user research) and reactive (usability testing) user research</li><li>Understands task analysis and user workflows</li><li>Understands solution automation</li><li>Understands walk-through analysis - i.e. identify areas of interrupted flow, required knowledge, etc…, aside om highlighting UI related issues like, button colour, visual clutter, etc…</li><li>Believe simple is better, and like to create systems that complement each other</li><li>Value open communication and working on a small and exceptionally transparent team</li><li>Take ownership of product design and user experience while taking initiative to create the best products possible</li><li>Take on the responsibility of driving the product forward and take the initiative to receive feedback and iterate on design</li><li>3+ years in a similar role</li><li>Strong skills in the design tool of your choice</li><li>Demonstrated ability to design and present polished and well-thought-out experiences</li><li>Demonstrated ability to design for enterprise deployed applications</li><li>Bonus but not required: ability to code HTML and CSS / SASS</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 35454
Title: UX Product Design Manager, AI and ML Joint Venture

Job_Description: Our goal at Microsoft Research Montreal is to achieve Artificial General Intelligence by teaching machines to think, reason and communicate. We’re an early leader in using deep learning to solve language-understanding problems and in training machines to model the decision-making capabilities of the human brain. Based in Montreal, a global hub for AI, our team brings together experts in various machine-learning domains such as deep learning, reinforcement learning, NLP, machine reading, computational linguistics and more. <br/><br/> As an Applied Researcher you will leverage your skills and experience to help build state-of-the-art machine learning capabilities that will be deployed within products used by millions of people around the world. You will develop deep learning algorithms and systems to achieve human-like natural language understanding for machine comprehension and dialogue systems. You will work closely with our Research and Engineering teams and have access to some of the largest machine learning infrastructure in the world to maximize your experiments and push the boundaries of cutting edge language understanding technology. Our research philosophy encourages knowledge sharing, so you will also contribute to the AI research community by publishing papers, collaborating with leading academic institutions, and participating in prominent industry events and conferences.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Perform research in machine learning, natural language understanding, dialogue modeling, and reinforcement learning and apply this research to modern real-world problems</li><li>Work closely with other research teams to design and evaluate new algorithms</li><li>Present experimental results and research findings clearly and concisely both internally and externally</li><li>Evaluate applied products end-to-end to determine where and how to apply deep learning techniques and how to evaluate different approaches</li><li>Contribute findings to the AI research community by publishing papers, collaborating with academic institutions, and participating in industry events and conferences</li> <li>Conceive and execute ambitious projects aiming to make disruptive changes to the way humans interact with machines</li><li>Collaborate with engineering teams to deliver new product capabilities that improve or enhance the user experience</li>  </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>PhD degree in computer science, applied mathematics or related technical fields, or a comparable level of research and development experience in industry</li><li>Strong working knowledge of machine learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, natural language processing, or related technical fields</li><li>Experience applying natural language understanding, natural language generation, or related technologies to real world problems</li><li>Strong implementation skills in developing and applying neural networks using PyTorch, Tensorflow, or other similar deep learning toolkits</li><li>Software development experience using Python</li></ul>  <ul> <li>A record of publishing papers in journals or conferences demonstrating contributions to your field of study</li>  </ul> Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. <br/><br/> Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
Title: Applied Researcher

Job_Description: <p><b>Solutions Prototype Developer, Co-op (Multiple Opportunities) - Fall 2018 – Montreal/ Concepteur, Solutions prototypes, Programme coopératif – Automne 2018 Montréal</b><b></b></p><p> </p><p>The Research Exploration and Development/Design (RED) Lab is the innovation outpost for Manulife Canada. We’re a small and lean team of coders, designers, and geeks who love tackling business challenges using modern technologies while keeping our end-customers at the center of everything we do. We care deeply about the end user experience and subscribe to the idea of rapidly testing and iterating on solutions. </p><p> </p><p>We’ve worked on a variety of technologies including web, iOS, hybrid apps, voice interfaces, and wearables – if it’s something that has a compelling potential to provide value to our business and customers, we’ll give it a serious consideration.</p><p> </p><p>We typically work in rapid sprints closely with our business stakeholders who represent departments ranging from insurance to banking and everything in between. If getting experience across a variety of challenges, business and technical, is your cup of tea, then this is the café of choice.</p><p> </p><p>Le laboratoire de recherche, d’exploration, de développement et de conception de Manuvie (RED Lab) est le centre de l’innovation de Manuvie Canada. Nous sommes une petite équipe de codeurs, de concepteurs et de technophiles aimant résoudre des problèmes qui touchent les affaires au moyen de technologies modernes, tout en plaçant constamment nos clients finaux au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Nous accordons une place importante à l’expérience de l’utilisateur final et adhérons à l’idée de rapidement effectuer des tests et reproduire le cycle de déploiement de solutions.</p><p>Nous travaillons sur un éventail de technologies, y compris le Web, iOS, des applications hybrides, des interfaces vocales et des technologies prêt-à-porter. S’il s’agit d’un projet présentant un potentiel intéressant et pouvant apporter une valeur à notre entreprise et à nos clients, nous allons y songer sérieusement.</p><p>Nous travaillons habituellement dans des sprints rapides, en collaborant étroitement avec nos parties prenantes qui représentent des services, comme les assurances ou les opérations bancaires, ou tout autre service. Si acquérir de l’expérience en surmontant divers obstacles opérationnels et techniques vous intéresse, alors n’hésitez pas à joindre nos rangs.</p><p> </p><p><b>About the Role</b></p><p> </p><p>If you were to sit in a time machine and travel a term into the future, you should be able to look back at your time here as a Solutions Prototype Design Co-op and be able to claim the following:</p><ul>  <li>I played with some of the coolest technologies  on the market (e.g. Amazon Alexa or Apple’s Swift programming language)</li>  <li>I worked on fun projects that solved  meaningful problems to help make financial services better (e.g. built an  Apple Watch app that tracks health information for insurance purposes)</li>  <li>I built a handful of prototypes that I pitched  and demoed to my peers and senior business stakeholders</li>  <li>I worked with a rad team that challenges each  other to keep questioning the status quo and push the boundaries in a lean  and collaborative environment</li>  <li>I had a lot of free food (no joke - Communitech  has a bunch of networking events where free food and drinks are provided)</li> </ul><p><b>À propos du poste</b></p><p>Si vous pouviez voyager dans le temps et passer ainsi à la session suivante, vous devriez être en mesure de repenser à votre séjour à Manuvie en qualité de concepteur, Solutions prototypes, Programme coopératif et d’affirmer ce qui suit :</p><p>                                    </p><ul>  <li>J’ai  joué avec certaines des technologies les plus géniales du marché (p. ex.,  l’appli Alexa d’Amazon ou le langage de programmation Swift d’Apple).</li>  <li>J’ai  travaillé sur des projets amusants qui ont permis de résoudre des  problèmes importants et j’ai ainsi contribué à améliorer les services  financiers (p. ex., le développement d’une appli Apple Watch qui fait le  suivi de renseignements sur la santé aux fins d’assurance).</li>  <li>J’ai  construit quelques prototypes, et j’en ai fait la présentation et la  démonstration à mes pairs et principaux partenaires d’affaires.</li>  <li>J’ai  travaillé avec une équipe cool dont les membres se mettent mutuellement au  défi pour remettre en question le statu quo et repousser les limites, dans  un esprit de simplicité et de collaboration.</li>  <li>J’ai  mangé gratuitement très souvent (sans blague, Communitech organise beaucoup  d’événements de réseautage où la nourriture et les boissons sont  fournies).</li> </ul>   <p></p><p><b>About You<br> <br> </b>If you’ve read this far, you’re a pretty cool cat. But to help you a little more, here are some things we’d like to see in you, considering we’re going to be sharing a space with you for almost a quarter of a year:</p><p> ·   You have a strong eye for design who uses this super-power as a tool to solve real world problems. Our tool kit involves everything from whiteboards and dry-erase markers for ideation to Sketch and InVision for high-fidelity interactive prototypes. And we're always playing around with new tools, so we invite any suggestions from you too.</p><p> ·   You thrive in an entrepreneurial environment where you don’t always have the answers to the challenges you’re tackling but are eager to discover them. You accept the fact that you might fail a few times, but you persist.</p><p> ·   You get rapid prototyping. We’re all people with ideas and we love ideating together, but we’re partial to action. We operate in 2 week sprints in which we see our ideas go to demo-able state. You have to be comfortable with learning-while-doing as there will be plenty of that.</p><p> ·   You care about customer experiences. You don’t have to be a UX guru, but you should appreciate well-designed customer experiences and strive to work towards them in your projects</p><p> ·   You are a naturally curious person and are not afraid to try new things. Usually this is best demonstrated by side-projects or attendances at hackathons or the like. Either way, the more you can tell us about your personal initiatives, the more brownie points you get.</p><p> </p><p>If any of the above struck a chord with you, then let's talk! Help us in making financial services better for everyone.</p><p><br></p><p><b>Votre profil</b><b></b></p><p>Si vous avez lu jusqu’ici, vous êtes sur le bon chemin. Mais pour améliorer vos chances, voici une liste des compétences qui nous intéressent, étant donné que nous allons nous côtoyer pendant pratiquement un trimestre :</p><ul>  <li>Vous  êtes un excellent programmeur, et vous utilisez vos compétences pour  résoudre de réels problèmes. Bien que le RED Lab soit ouvert à toutes les  technologies, nous utilisons principalement HTML5, Javascript/node.js,  Angular et iOS. Nous sommes toujours curieux de savoir si vous souhaitez  approfondir certaines technologies.</li>  <li>Vous  êtes dans votre élément quand l’esprit d’entreprise est à l’honneur; vous  n’avez pas toujours la réponse aux défis qui vous sont lancés, mais vous  faites tout pour l’obtenir. Vous savez que le succès n’est pas garanti,  mais vous persistez.</li>  <li>Vous  OBTENEZ rapidement des prototypes. Nous avons tous plein d’idées et nous  adorons en discuter ensemble, mais nous avons une préférence pour  l’action. Nous travaillons dans des sprints rapides de deux semaines  durant lesquels nous partons d’une idée et en concevons une version de  démonstration. Vous devez être à l’aise dans un contexte d’apprentissage  par l’action, car c’est de cela que seront faites vos journées.</li>  <li>Vous  vous souciez de l’expérience des clients. Nous ne vous demandons pas  d’être un gourou de l’expérience utilisateur, mais une bonne expérience  client est importante à vos yeux et cela fait partie de vos objectifs  lorsque vous menez un projet.</li>  <li>Vous  avez une soif insatiable de créer. Que vous tentiez de l’étancher dans le  cadre de marathons de programmation, de projets que vous menez en  parallèle ou de vos propres entreprises en démarrage, vous avez la  curiosité et les aptitudes techniques nécessaires pour réussir ici. Plus  vous avez de choses à nous raconter sur vos projets personnels, plus vous  nous intéressez.</li> </ul><p>Si l’un des éléments susmentionnés vous parle, faites-nous signe! Aidez-nous à améliorer les services financiers pour tout le monde.</p><p> </p><p> </p><p><b>About Manulife</b></p><p> </p><p>Manulife is a leading Canada-based financial services group with principal operations in Canada, Asia and the United States. We operate as John Hancock in the U.S. and as Manulife in other parts of the world. We provide strong, reliable, trustworthy and forward-thinking solutions for our customers’ significant financial decisions. Our international network of employees, agents and distribution partners offers financial protection and wealth management products and services to millions of clients. We also provide asset management services to institutional customers. Assets under management by Manulife and its subsidiaries were approximately CAD $477 billion in 2017. </p><p> </p><p>Manulife Financial Corporation trades as ‘MFC’ on the TSX, NYSE and PSE, and under ‘945’ on the SEHK. Manulife can be found on the Internet at manulife.com</p><p> </p><p><b>Manuvie/John Hancock</b></p><p> </p><p>La Société Financière Manuvie, groupe mondial et chef de file des services financiers, aide les gens à réaliser leurs rêves et leurs aspirations en priorisant leurs besoins et en leur fournissant de bonnes solutions et recommandations. Elle exerce ses activités sous les noms John Hancock aux États-Unis et Manuvie ailleurs dans le monde. Elle propose des conseils financiers ainsi que des solutions d’assurance, de gestion de patrimoine et de gestion des actifs à des particuliers, à des groupes et à des institutions. À la fin de 2016, elle comptait environ 35 000 employés, 70 000 agents et des milliers de partenaires de distribution au service de plus de 22 millions de clients. Au 30 juin 2017, son actif géré et administré se chiffrait à plus de mille milliards de dollars canadiens (780 milliards de dollars américains) et, au cours des 12 mois précédents, elle avait versé à ses clients près de 26,7 milliards de dollars.</p><p> </p><p>Elle exerce ses activités principalement en Asie, au Canada et aux États-Unis, où elle est présente depuis plus de 100 ans. Son siège social mondial se situe à Toronto, au Canada, et elle est inscrite aux bourses de Toronto, de New York et des Philippines sous le symbole « MFC », ainsi qu’à la Bourse de Hong Kong sous le symbole « 945 ».</p><p>                                                  </p><p> </p><p></p>

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div> Data Science Developer Intern</div> </div>  </div>  </div><br/>  <div> <div> <div> <div> Location:  <br/> <br/>  Calgary, AB, CA</div>  </div>  </div>  </div><br/>   <div> <div> <div> <div> Company:  <br/> <br/>  ExxonMobil</div>  </div>  </div>  </div><br/>  <div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>Job description</strong> <br/><br/> As a member of the Architecture & Technology team, you will work closely with Technology Architects to develop prototype solutions using machine learning and deep learning to address challenging business problems. <br/> This may involve technologies, such as Python, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, cognitive API frameworks and others. This includes interfacing with business and technical contacts, seeking new and innovative approaches, developing prototypes and explaining ideas to a broad audience. <br/><br/> Examples of specific job responsibilities: <br/><br/> Development of Prototype Solutions Leveraging Machine Learning  <ul>  	<li>Learning about a spefic business opportunity or problem</li> <li>Seeking innovative solution approaches involving data science/machine learning/artificial intelligence</li> <li>Acquisition and preparation of data needed for development of models</li> <li>Development of predictive models</li> <li>Documentation and presentation of key ideas</li> </ul> Evaluation of New Technologies and Frameworks  <ul>  	<li>Participate in evaluation of new products and solutions</li> <li>Advise on technologies used by these products</li> </ul> Development of prototype solutions Using Pre-built Components  <ul>  	<li>Utilize technologies, such as Amazon Alexa, Cognitive APIs from Microsoft/Google/Amazon and Microsoft Bot Framework to build prototypes and demonstration solutions</li> </ul> Technology Awareness  <ul>  	<li>Learn about latest advances in deep learning and data science</li> <li>Reproduce algorithms described in published research in the area of deep learning using company’s computing plafroms and data</li> <li>Learn about latest AI offerings from vendors, such as Microsoft, Amazon, Google and others</li> <li>Learn about existing tools/technologies that are offered by ExxonMobil IT</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Academic:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>3rd or 4th year Computer/Electrical/Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics students interested in a career in data science. Preferably enrolled in Masters-level degree program in the area of Machine Learning, Data Science or Computer Science</li> <li>To be considered for employment, your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application</li> </ul> <strong>Other</strong>:  <ul>  	<li>Ability to build data preparation scripts using Python and other higher-level tools</li> <li>Ability to write machine learning models in Python utilizing libraries, such as Scikit-Learn and Tensorflow</li> <li>Interest in learning about latest advances in machine learning and deep learning</li> <li>Strong interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Ability to work effectively in a team environment to accomplish organizational goals</li> <li>Demonstrate sound analytical and problem-solving skills</li> <li>Highly motivated individual able to work with minimum supervision</li> <li>Capability to rapidly learn and apply new IT technologies and then to teach and train others</li> <li>Flexibility in dealing with changing priorities and short deadlines</li> </ul> <strong>Start date:</strong>September 2018 (start date negotiable) <br/><br/> <strong>Work term:</strong> 12 months preferred, 8 months considered <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>Your benefits</strong> <br/><br/> This position will provide you with an opportunity to leverage your skills in support of a large integrated energy company. For example:  <ul>  	<li>Work in a high caliber, collaborative learning environment</li> <li>Receive on-the-job experience, coaching and training</li> <li>Gain technical and business background in the operations of the oil & gas resource industry through participation in various networking programs</li> <li>Work with a geographically dispersed team</li> <li>Work directly with the client business unit to deliver IT solutions to meet critical business needs</li> </ul> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> At ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada ULC (EMBSCC) we are an integral part of a worldwide network of business support centres that provide financial, technical, information service, transactional, and customer service support for ExxonMobil’s global operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Other considerations</strong>  <ul>  	<li>For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.</li> <li>We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.</li> </ul> <strong>Eligibility to work in Canada</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Proof of eligibility must be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence or work permit. Document must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Work permit must be valid for the duration of the term. Proof of eligibility is required if an offer is made. Failure to provide the appropriate documentation within a reasonable timeframe (generally 6 weeks prior to your start date) may result in the offer being rescinded or a delay in your start date. <br/><br/> <strong>Application deadline:</strong> June 3, 2018</div> <br/>The ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. <br/><br/> In certain situations, ExxonMobil may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions within the Company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including Imperial Oil and affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.</div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/><strong>Job Segment:</strong>  <br/>  Database, Developer, Electrical, Engineer, Computer Science, Technology, Engineering<br/><br/>Apply Now
Title: Data Science Developer Intern

Job_Description: Finn is a rapidly-growing fintech startup located in beautiful Vancouver, BC. We work with banking clients worldwide to deliver products that reduce operational costs and allow banks to engage more deeply with their customers. Our flagship product Finn is an AI-powered banking assistant that banking customers can interact with through chat or voice to manage their personal finances. <br/><br/> As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you’ll:  <ul> <li>Validate functionality of bots against requirements.</li>   <li>Develop test plans from existing requirements.</li>   <li>Monitor supported channels for updates changes which may impact bot functionally.</li>  <li>Establish streamlined process for management of releases, environments and deployment cycles.</li>   <li>JIRA workflow and software master.</li>  <li>Initially testing will be manual, but increasingly automated.</li>  </ul> You:  <ul> <li>At least 1 year experience in a Quality Assurance Engineer, or similar role.</li>  <li>Undergraduate degree in a related field (Engineering, Computer Science)</li>  <li>Experience with JIRA or similar ticketing system.</li>   <li>Experience having worked in a structured environment with organized deployments.</li>   <li>Strong attention to detail.</li>  <li>Self-motivated and organized.</li> </ul> Bonus Points:  <ul> <li>Have experience with test automation and test automation principles.</li>   <li>Have worked in a customer delivery environment.</li>   <li>Speak more than one language.</li>  <li>Experience working in a SAAS organization.</li>  <li>Experience working in a professional services organization.</li>   <li>Experience working with machine learning / data science.</li> </ul> At Finn, we care about our team’s health and happiness. We offer:  <ul> <li>Stock options in a fast-growing company</li>  <li>Competitive compensation rates and vacation time</li>  <li>Medical, dental, and extended health benefits</li>  <li>Flexible working hours</li>  <li>Feedback based on regular 1:1s and annual touchpoints</li>  <li>A collaborative, team-based environment</li>  <li>Monthly team lunches and birthday celebrations</li> </ul> As a financial technology company, our team is trusted with highly sensitive information. We require successful candidates to undergo security screenings including a criminal record check before coming on board. We focus strictly on offenses that are directly relevant to employment at Finn, and abide by all applicable human rights and privacy legislation. Questions? Ask us - we’re here to help.
Title: Quality Assurance Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>FULL-TIME POSITION</strong> <br/><br/> Terramera is an award-winning Vancouver, Canada-based sustainable agriculture cleantech company using chemistry, machine learning and AI technologies to develop and optimize safer, more effective plant-based replacements to toxic chemical pesticides and synthetic fertilizers. <br/><br/> Our mission is to use technology to unlock the power in nature, so we can live healthier, make clean food affordable and feed the world. We’re striving to reduce the use of toxic chemical pesticides by 80%, help increase global food production by 20% and positively impact a billion people. <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR MISSION</strong> <br/><br/> With an ever-increasing technological footprint (including multiple physical locations), we are moving toward in-sourcing our IT infrastructure management. Reporting to the VP, Engineering & Consumer Science, your mission will be to oversee this transition over the course of 6 months and ultimately build out an in-house IT support capability. This role requires a high degree of personal initiative, great interpersonal skills and broad technical expertise with the ability to consistently and efficiently perform hands-on work. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Document policies, procedures and configurations of existing outsourced IT service provider;</li>  <li>Manage, maintain and test disaster recovery plans;</li>  <li>Create and install computer images for Windows and Macintosh computers;</li>  <li>Maintain inventory of spare desktops and laptops for deployment as needed;</li>  <li>Setup and maintain a Windows Server/Active Directory environment with machine management via group policies;</li>  <li>Implement enterprise firewall and antivirus capabilities using Sophos hardware and software;</li>  <li>Implement OSPF routing across multiple enterprise sites;</li>  <li>Engage with network and fiber providers (e.g. Shaw) to implement network upgrades;</li>  <li>Perform ad hoc support work to resolve computer hardware related / software issues;</li>  <li>Provide recommendations for new enterprise software solutions (e.g. video conferencing);</li>  <li>Setup of AV equipment for corporate presentations and intra-office communication; and</li>  <li>Manage interns and full-time employees ultimately assigned to this group within Engineering.</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree or diploma in Computer Science, MIS or relevant field;</li>  <li>Proven experience working as an IT Manager, including 3+ years of experience managing a Windows Network with Active Directory;</li>  <li>Excellent knowledge of technical management, information analysis and of computer hardware/software systems;</li>  <li>Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP);</li>  <li>Experience deploying and managing virtuals on HyperV;</li>  <li>Experience managing Active Directory;</li>  <li>One or more networking certifications (e.g. Networking+, WCNA);</li>  <li>Solid grasp of principles of information security (Security+ Certification ideal); and</li>  <li>Experience working with Sophos products (enterprise firewalls and antivirus).</li> </ul> <strong>PREFERENCES</strong>  <ul> <li>One or more Sophos certifications;</li>  <li>One or more MCSE certifications; and</li>  <li>Familiarity with KVM and Linux.</li> </ul> <strong>COMPETENCIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Excellent Communicator</li>  <li>Strong Organization & Planning</li>  <li>High Attention to Detail</li>  <li>Proactive</li>  <li>Flexible & Adaptable</li>  <li>Strong Work Ethic</li>  <li>High Standards</li>  <li>Reliable & Follows Through on Commitments</li>  <li>Good Judgement & Discretion</li>  <li>Efficient</li>  <li>Honest</li>  <li>Responsible to Feedback</li>  <li>Willingness to Experiment</li>  <li>Creativity/Innovation</li> </ul> <strong>LOCATION</strong>  <ul> <li>Terramera Head Office – 333 Seymour Street, Suite 1100, Vancouver, BC</li> </ul> <strong>APPLICATION DEADLINE</strong>  <ul> <li>May 25, 2018</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Terramera is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer.</strong> <br/><br/> Our success begins with our people. We’re looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team. <br/><br/> While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on Terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com
Title: Senior IT Manager

Job_Description: 1QBit is dedicated to solving the world’s most intractable challenges by recasting problems to harness the power of quantum computing. We identify demanding industry problems and apply breakthroughs in computation to machine intelligence and optimization science to build software that allows applications to continually benefit from advances in both quantum and classical hardware. <br/><br/> We believe that quantum technologies will form the next pillar of computational progress. We research, benchmark, and build software development kits, online platforms, and applications that make the power of quantum computers accessible to researchers, developers, and industry-leading organizations so they can solve their most difficult problems in fields such as optimization, simulation, and machine learning. <br/><br/> As an interdisciplinary team of world-class mathematicians, physicists, engineers, operations research scientists, software developers, quantum computing experts, and business leaders, we share a curiosity and drive to uncover new ways of solving currently intractable problems. <br/><br/> Our work is guided by a shared set of values focused on five fundamental principles:  <ul> <li>Audacity – A drive to pioneer and apply new methods. To dream without limit and then do the hard work of bringing your ideas into reality.</li> <li>Open Thinking – A belief in the sharing of ideas. To approach each exploration with a receptive mindset and collaborate openly to produce the best possible results.</li> <li>Interdisciplinary Collaboration – A respect for the diversity of people, backgrounds, and skills. A wide range of perspectives reveals a more complete landscape and yields deeper insights.</li> <li>Ownership – A feeling of pride in the work of the team and a deep sense of purpose and accomplishment from your contribution.</li> <li>Beginner’s Mindset – A desire to improve as an expert while retaining the curiosity and openness that inspired you to begin.</li> </ul> <strong>Your Role</strong> <br/><br/> As a member of our R&D Team, you will work with people from across multiple disciplines, utilizing your background in reinforcement learning to address a wide range of the world’s most challenging computational problems. You will have the opportunity to work with computer scientists, quantum information scientists, and physicists experimenting with the world’s most advanced quantum computing hardware prototypes to develop novel quantum algorithms for revolutionary artificial intelligence applications using the emerging paradigms of quantum computation. At the core of this role, you will have the opportunity to invent, design, implement, and analyze hybrid quantum–classical algorithms in reinforcement learning. <br/><br/> You will use your creativity to tackle the bottlenecks of artificial intelligence. You will use your experience in scientific research for experimental implementations, rapid prototyping, and deployment of powerful computational solutions. Towards this end, you will leverage the scale of 1QBit’s proprietary data and software infrastructure in conjunction with commercial tools and exotic hardware prototypes. <br/><br/> <strong>What You'll Bring</strong> <br/><br/> Members of our team bring a confluence of personality, skills, and intent that contributes to their individual development and our collective growth as an organization. The knowledge and mindset you will bring to our team include the following:  <ul> <li>A PhD in either mathematics, computer science, statistics, or physics, specializing in one or more of the following fields:   <ul> <li>Machine learning</li> <li>Deep learning</li> <li>Reinforcement learning</li> <li>Deep reinforcement learning</li> <li>Stochastic control</li> <li>Dynamic programming</li> <li>Optimization theory</li> </ul>  </li> <li>A solid understanding of, and previous experience in, deep learning and reinforcement learning</li> <li>A strong track record in research demonstrated by your peer reviewed publications, presentations, open source contributions (e.g., on GitHub), or other relevant indicators of a strong portfolio for a scientist in ML and AI</li>  <strong><li>Working experience in:</strong>   <ul> <li>Programming languages: Python and/or C/C++</li> <li>Machine learning development kits: TensorFlow, etc.</li> <li>Hyperparameter tuning</li> <li>Designing numerical experiments</li> <li>Performing careful benchmarking</li> <li>Writing scientific papers</li> </ul>  </li> </ul>    <ul> <li>An eagerness to interact with a multidisciplinary team working on quantum information, computational physics, and quantum computation</li> <li>The ability to conduct research in an interdisciplinary environment, as well as independently</li> <li>Self-motivation and the ability to take initiative and follow through reliably</li> <li>A drive to proactively seek out opportunities to help move projects forward and contribute to their improvement</li> <li>An openness to soliciting feedback to improve your performance and, in turn, continually providing input to team members to elevate team performance and contribute to 1QBit’s culture</li> <li>An eagerness to learn about new trends, tools, and technologies, and to continually consider how these will influence our projects and the implications and opportunities that they will bring</li> <li>A dedication to maintaining team unity and effectiveness through the sharing of information and expertise, and striving for team success</li> <li>A commitment to challenge the status quo, take smart risks, and be open to possible failure</li> </ul> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> You share our belief that principles, not policies, enable individuals and teams to apply their unique lens in making decisions. Like all 1QBit team members, you thrive in our flat hierarchy of empowered individuals. You embrace the rigorous examination of the thoughts and work of diverse minds from multiple disciplines because you know it uncovers deeper insights and produces robust results. You believe there is no failure in exploration because new breakthroughs often require rigorous examination of multiple paths before a conclusion is reached. You have a desire to apply yourself to purposeful work that is inspiring, meaningful, and fun, to create value for the world by advancing the ability to solve complex problems. You have a relentless curiosity for exploring new methodologies and you have an intrinsic drive to architect the foundation of the quantum ecosystem because you love the challenges and understand the rewards that the next paradigm of computation will bring.
Title: Reinforcement Learning Scientist

Job_Description: Efficient receipt management is critical to the health of any business. Since 2013, Sensibill has been committed to building an AI-powered tool that makes capturing, organizing, and retrieving receipts as magical as possible. We work with banks to offer our receipt solution through their mobile banking apps. Banking customers use the service to keep track of important receipts for returns, exchanges, expenses, accounting, and taxes. Our mission? We want to give time back to freelancers and small business owners so that they can focus on the things they love. To find out more, visit www.getsensibill.com. <br/><br/> <strong>What does the job entail?</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a Full Stack Developer who wants to be a key contributor as we expand our client base, who requires minimum oversight and who is eager to collaborate with developers across the Engineering team. <br/><br/> We work on a full Javascript stack including Node, Angular, and MongoDB. If these aren’t in your wheelhouse, don’t let that deter you. This is a role for a smart developer, with a willingness to grow in the role. Your experience with Javascript is less important than your overall software development chops. The language, you can pick up on the job. We need a Full Stack Developer who can work efficiently and effectively in an Agile environment. Who can scale with us. Someone who is excited by the challenging problems that unstructured data poses and who is passionate about the promise of machine learning. <br/><br/> If you are a Full Stack Software Developer who is seeking the chance to make an impact on a company, a solution, and the end users, all while building a career for yourself, this is the opportunity to consider. If you are excited by mobile, cloud, analytics, and anything #fintech, this is the company for you. <br/><br/> <strong>A day in the life</strong>  <ul>  <li>Develop. Work on our high availability receipt processing pipeline using Node.js and MongoDB, and on our web app using Angular JS.</li>    <li>Develop some more. Write test cases for automated testing as you write your code.</li>    <li>Experiment. Work on improving our machine learning algorithms for extracting receipt data.</li>    <li>Improve. Actively contribute to our evolving processes; we are always seeking greater efficiency.</li>    <li>Deploy. Contribute to DevOps automation.</li>    <li>Collaborate. Engage with our team in discussing architectural improvements to our system.</li>    </ul> <strong>A bit about you.</strong>  <ul> <li>An experienced developer. Your background is in computer science, math or engineering. You have a minimum of 3-6+ years relevant experience in the information technology industry. Ideally, you bring experience working with a DevOps team for a live SaaS offering.</li>  <li>A technology enthusiast. You have experience with some, or all, of the following:   <ul> <li>API services</li> <li>Browser based web applications</li> <li>Machine learning algorithms</li> <li>Performance optimization</li> <li>Scalable, secure, distributed systems</li> <li>MongoDB or other NoSQL databases</li></ul></li> </ul>    <ul> <li>A creative problem solver. You truly enjoy creating the best solutions to complex, tricky problems, using the latest technical methodologies / processes.</li>  <li>A bonus points seeker. You may have familiarity with financial services and/or receipt processing.</li>  <li>A mentor. You have a natural inclination to coach and guide junior software developers, and assist with their professional development.</li> </ul> <strong>What’s in it for me?</strong> <br/><br/> We love #pie. Our culture is like that perfect piece of pie; humble and delivers exactly what you expect. Why #pie? That’s our acronym. We are a team of people that work to #getshitdone, all while ensuring Passion, Integrity, and Excellence. <br/><br/> Joining a startup in the early days is pretty much the greatest adventure you can embark on in your career. You have the opportunity to make meaningful contributions; to make an impact. We are lean, we are smart, and we live for balance – there are no mandatory 60-hour work weeks here. <br/><br/> This is not a top-down culture. We want everyone’s input during critical decisions. To that end, if you have ideas, we want to hear them. Together, we can build out your role, build our product, and our company. We want new core team members who want to invest in us the way we invest in them. We want your ideas, your energy, your skills, your dedication, and if you have any, we’ll take your #receipts too. <br/><br/> <strong>What can I expect when I submit my application?</strong> <br/><br/> A real person will review your application (no bribes or 8x10 glossies please) and either schedule a conversation with you or let you know that we’re passing on your candidacy within 5 business days. <br/><br/> <strong>What if I have more questions before I apply?</strong> <br/><br/> No worries at all! If you have additional questions prior to submitting your application, please feel free to reach out to Omar Khan, our recruiter at omar@getsensibill.com. <br/><br/> <strong>What does the interview process involve?</strong> <br/><br/> The first step is a conversation with Omar. He'll focus on the human side of things and answer any questions you may have. From there, we’ll provide an opportunity for those that exhibit a high potential to be successful in our environment to demonstrate their technical capabilities and then talk shop with some members of the Technology team. Assuming you’re one of our finalists, we’ll be sure to give you a tour of the office and introduce you to some of your future teammates. <br/><br/> We’re not just interviewing you. We want to make sure that we’re the right fit for each other, so please feel encouraged to interview us at every step. <br/><br/> Sensibill is an equal opportunity employer. Should you require accommodation in any aspect of our selection process, please contact Omar Khan at omar@getsensibill.com / 416.832.0723
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <strong>WHO WE ARE</strong> <br/> Terramera is an award-winning Vancouver, Canada-based sustainable agriculture cleantech company using chemistry, machine learning and AI technologies to develop and optimize safer, more effective plant-based replacements to toxic chemical pesticides and synthetic fertilizers. In doing so, we cultivate healthy homes, as well as make organic food and sustainable farming more productive and abundant. <br/><br/> Our company name comes from the Latin word ‘terra’ (Earth) and the Hindi and Punjabi words ‘tera’ (yours) and ‘mera’ (mine), meaning: Our Earth (yours and mine). <br/><br/> <strong>WHY US?</strong> <br/> Our goals are big, hairy and audacious. We’re striving to reduce the use of toxic chemical pesticides by 80%, help increase global food production by 20% and benefit over a billion people. Our unique and proprietary technologies enable us to increase the efficacy of active ingredients by delivering them into target cells, which results in revolutionary, high-performance plant-based products for conventional and organic agriculture, professional and home use. <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR MISSION</strong> <br/> To undertake a wide range of duties related to People Operations, so that we’re staying organized and operating efficiently in order to attract, hire and develop the best talent and Terramera. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Support the recruitment and selection process, including drafting and uploading job postings, completing phone screens, scheduling interviews, administering online assessments and completing reference checks;</li>  <li>Draft, format and revise documents, including job descriptions, job postings and correspondence;</li>  <li>Prepare new hire packages and workstations, submit IT requests, as well as conduct initial orientations for new team members;</li>  <li>Provide administrative assistance with grant funding and wage subsidy programs, including preparing new applications;</li>  <li>Support the administration of group benefit plans;</li>  <li>Compile and maintain HR metrics and produce summaries as needed;</li>  <li>Prepare credit card purchase request forms and make online payments;</li>  <li>Support the company’s Health & Safety initiatives;</li>  <li>Assist in the coordination of company-related events and recognitions; and</li>  <li>Assist with special projects as needed.</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years of related experience in HR or an administrative role;</li>  <li>Post-secondary degree or diploma in HR Management or relevant field;</li>  <li>Proven experience with MS Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel;</li>  <li>Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise a high level of diplomacy, tact and discretion;</li>  <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills;</li>  <li>Excellent organizational skills;</li>  <li>Proven attention to detail and accuracy;</li>  <li>Ability to work well under pressure and achieve results within acceptable timeframes; and</li>  <li>Ability to be proactive, exercise initiative and manage multiple priorities.</li> </ul> <strong>LOCATION</strong>  <ul> <li>Terramera Head Office – 333 Seymour Street, Suite 1100, Vancouver, BC</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Terramera is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer.</strong> <br/><br/> Our success begins with our people. We’re looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team. <br/><br/> While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on Terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com
Title: HR Assistant

Job_Description: </strong> <br/><br/> Social media generates a massive volume of data about online interactions in a daily basis. Such interactions provide useful information about users’ behaviours and psychological states. Our client has an AI-based engine that constantly analyzes the patterns behind human written languages and produces psychological insights about user’s emotional and mental health. <br/><br/> We are seeking a senior data scientist who will help in the development of text analytics based on machine learning and NLP. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with a multidisciplinary team.</li> <li>Work in a constantly evolving development environment with a massive amount of data.</li> <li>Build production-worthy training sets from multiple sources and assess their quality; i.e. data fusion.</li> <li>Have a deep understanding of the analytical pipelines utilized in NLP.</li> <li>Build tools and scripts to help assess and manage data from multiple sources.</li> <li>Develop efficient algorithms that are designed to work on large corpora.</li> <li>Manage the configuration, execution, and evaluation of machine learning tests on large datasets.</li> <li>Develop performance benchmarks and perform hyperparameter optimization to report the optimal model parameters.</li> <li>Analyze, interpret, and communicate results to the data science, engineering, product, and QA leads as required.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> A M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in STEM such as Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, Information Systems, Statistics, or equivalent. <br/><br/> <strong>Technical Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years of experience in a data scientist role (or equivalent).</li> <li>High proficiency in machine learning and deep learning methods (having a commercial ML model is an asset).</li> <li>High proficiency in Python or Java, Scikit, and one or more of some of the existing DL libraries such as Keras, TensorFlow, and Torch.</li> <li>High proficiency in statistical and quantitative analysis; i.e. regression, properties of distributions, and statistical tests.</li> <li>Proficiency in source control tools such as GIT. Bitbucket and/or Github experience is an asset.</li> <li>Experience with NLP and text processing libraries such as NLTK and CoreNLP.</li> <li>Experience with big data libraries, such as Pandas, and data visualization tools, such as SciPy, and matplotlib.</li> </ul>
Title: Data Scientist

Job_Description: <strong>Location:</strong><br/><br/>40 Hanna Ave, Toronto, Ontario, M6K 0C3 Canada<br/><br/>At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started. <br/><br/> <strong>Why is this role important?</strong> <br/><br/> Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. <br/><br/> At<strong> Loblaw Digital</strong>, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine. <br/><br/> The <strong>Senior Director of Data Science</strong> will be leading a team of Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and BI Developers, responsible for designing and implementing groundbreaking solutions utilizing large-scale data sets. This individual is also responsible for developing the long-term AI strategy, evangelizing the results of the Data Science team’s research, coordination & collaboration with various internal teams, and working closely with engineering to integrate solutions into our production systems. <br/><br/> <strong>What You'll Do:</strong> <br/><br/> - Lead a team of 12 Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and BI Developers, providing vision, direction, and day-to-day management <br/><br/> - Define data science and AI/ML strategy across the eCommerce and retail business <br/><br/> - Work with functional businesses (Trading, Marketing, Operations, Supply Chain etc.) on solving problems such as customer segmentation, customer engagement, inventory forecasting, and more <br/><br/> - Lead the development and implementation of scalable, data-driven solutions using Hadoop (HDFS, Map/Reduce, Hive, Hbase, Sqoop, Spark, etc.) <br/><br/> - Lead the BI efforts to centralize data warehousing, and empower business users to self-serve data for insights and analytics using Tableau and Microstrategy <br/><br/> - Recruit top talent to continue to invest in Loblaw’s Data Science capabilities <br/><br/> <strong>What You'll Need:</strong> <br/><br/> - Masters degree/PhD in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Engineering/Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, Applied Math, or equivalent work experience <br/><br/> - 10+ years of relevant experience in data science or similar field <br/><br/> - Creative problem solver, resourceful in getting things done, and productive working independently or collaboratively <br/><br/> - Experience in working with Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Hbase and related big data technologies <br/><br/> - Experience working with large structured and unstructured data sets from multiple sources <br/><br/> - Experience with recommendation systems & personalization <br/><br/> - Strong passion for empirical research and data driven decisions   <ul> <li>Deep knowledge in data mining and machine learning <br/><br/> - Strong knowledge of and experience with statistics <br/><br/> - Data visualization experience to present findings at the appropriate level of detail for both business and technology teams. <br/><br/> - Excellent written and spoken communication skills <br/><br/> #LI-NK2 <br/><br/> <strong>How You’ll Succeed:</strong> <br/><br/> At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. <br/><br/> We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. <br/><br/> If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine. <br/><br/> Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. <br/><br/> Apply today. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Employment Type:</strong></strong><br/><br/>Full time<br/><br/><strong><strong>Type of Role:</strong></strong><br/><br/>Regular<br/><br/>Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.<br/><br/><strong>Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.</strong></li> </ul>
Title: Senior Director, Data Science

working with other designers and developers who want to build great products using the latest technology.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Implementing features for the conversational user experience, across modalities (messaging, voice) and platforms (SMS, Google Assistant, Siri, Alexa, and more)</li> <li>Work on primarily frontend feature development as part of a small team, and able to participate in backend and platform activities where it make sense</li> <li>Prototyping ways to iteratively learn, optimize for growth, and improve the user experience</li> <li>Working on exciting Proof of Concept projects related to Conversational Agents (Alexa, Google Assistant, Cortana, etc.), Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Augmented/Mixed/Virtual Reality, and more.</li> <li>Collaborating within a cross-functional team, helping to create elegant systems that maximize reuse across technologies</li> <li>Dogged focus on software quality, performance analysis, and system tuning where possible</li> <li>Applying lessons learned to other exciting client projects, and vice versa</li> </ul> Desired Skills & Experience  <ul> <li>5+ years experience developing commercial shipping products</li> <li>BS or MS in Computer Science, equivalent degree and/or equivalent experience</li> <li>Experience with any of the following: distributed compute environments, application development, mobile development, big data analytics, cloud computing including virtualization, hosted services, multi tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks.</li> <li>Experience in writing software in one or more languages such as Javascript (React, Angular.js, Node.js), Python, Go, C++, Objective-C, Swift, Java, etc.</li> <li>Experience working in customer-facing technical roles.</li> <li>Development pipeline experience (Versioning, Automation, Testing, Continuous Integration, etc.) is an asset</li> <li>A well-trained eye for design, and the ability to collaborate with designers, are definite assets</li> <li>Familiarity with Unix, Speech Interfaces, AI/Machine Learning, and conversational UIs are assets</li> <li>Referenceable track record of positively impacting a team, and caring about your fellow human</li> </ul> Benefits & Perks  <ul> <li>Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship</li> <li>Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical development shop: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities</li> <li>Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated Awesome time (self-directed professional development) annually and quarterly training budgets</li> <li>Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage</li> <li>Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere</li> <li>Additional perks based on employee feedback and interest, including in-house mindfulness training, yoga, group get-togethers and more!</li> </ul> <strong>About Myplanet</strong> <br/><br/> Were a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the worlds most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, Ukraine, and Chicago, we're a team of 90 designers, product managers & engineers hell-bent on making the workplace better. <br/><br/> <strong>A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace</strong> <br/><br/> We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Job_Description: KodaCloud is looking for an Enterprise WLAN/LAN System Engineer responsible to define and validate the evolution of our WLANaaS Cloud AI Product Suite. <br/><br/> We are looking for someone with strong WLAN and LAN protocol knowledge with hands-on experience managing enterprise networks. The candidate must show a great ability to work closely with product management, software architects and our CTO to define the evolution of the product and take responsibility for architecture validation in our labs and at the customer sites.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul>  	<li>Define the Use Cases and Requirements driving product evolution</li>  <li>Define the key algorithms to continue improving automatic management of WLAN and LAN network elements in the enterprise including QoE modelling, automatic root cause analysis and mitigation.</li>  <li>Develop test plans to validate the algorithms</li>  <li>Run the test plans in KodaCloud's R&D labs</li>   <li>Collaborate with our Customer Support team to ensure successful deployment of the new algorithms to customer networks.</li>  <li>Opportunity for this role to evolve to a team leader or management position</li>  </ul>  Requirements:   <ul>  	<li>Excellent English communication skills</li>  <li>Bachelor degree in Engineering</li>  <li>Ability to define and document complex algorithms to ensure proper implementation by the software teams</li>  <li>5+ years working on the development and validation of Enterprise WLAN products , switching and routing protocols, either in a system group or a development team.</li>  <li>Strong balance of OSI layer 1,2,3 communication theory and hands-on experience</li>  <li>You have exceptional leadership ability to drive product evolution</li>  </ul>  Even Better:   <ul>  	<li>Experience working with both product manufacturer and Service Providers (SP, MSPs, Enterprise IT)</li>  <li>Hands-on software development (Python, Java)</li>   <li>Experience with Rule Based Systems</li>  <li>Knowledge of Data Science and Machine Learning technologies</li> </ul>  Some ways to stand out:   <ul>  	<li>Show experience of both product development and support work in a enterprise or Service Provide environment</li>  <li>Show example of strong technical leadership experience</li> </ul>
Title: Enterprise WLAN/LAN System Engineer

Job_Description: <div>In the last 5 years, Prodigy has gone from 3,000 to over 30,000,000 students across North America (including 80% of all Ontario students), and is currently the fastest growing educational startup in North America. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to help an entire generation of students to LOVE learning while working alongside some of the brightest and most passionate people in education and gaming.</div><br/> <div>We are looking for analytics gurus to join our growing data teams. You will have the chance to apply your data science / engineering skills to help our development and customer teams to make better decisions.</div> <div>Our data teams are responsible for all aspects of data, including data ingestion, storage, transformation, analysis, and visualization using our business intelligence and analytics infrastructure. You will be working alongside many of our teams to help build and manage data pipelines, and create reports and visualizations which are used to help drive crucial decisions. The work you do here at Prodigy will aid the educational advancement of millions of students.</div>You Will:  <ul> <li>Apply your analytics and data science expertise to better serve our users.</li><li>Create and manage key data pipelines, including developing new solutions for batch and real-time data and analytics use cases.</li><li>Work cross-functionally to explore and propose solutions to business problems using insights from data and algorithms.</li> </ul>  <strong>What you'll need:</strong>  <ul> <li>Demonstrated ability to do data science, data engineering, and / or user analytics.</li><li>Passion and persistence for solving hard problems.</li><li>Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Stats, Mathematics, or related quantitative discipline, followed by graduate degree or 2 years of equivalent experience.</li><li>Experience in requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing of software solutions (especially data related using Python, R, or similar programming languages).</li><li>Experience with relational databases and SQL</li><li>Ability to oversee and work simultaneously on different projects with a variety of timelines</li><li>A team and customer centric mindset.</li><li>Love for our mission of helping kids everywhere enjoy learning.</li> </ul>  <strong>Bonus points for:</strong>  <ul> <li>Demonstrated ability to solve hard mathematical, algorithmic, and statistical problems.</li><li>Experience with applied Machine Learning and AI techniques.</li><li>Experience working with cloud platforms like AWS, real-time data processing, and agile software development.</li><li>Drive to understand key issues and subtleties in complex systems.</li><li>Significant accomplishments that required both technical and strategic capabilities, such as research projects, open source software contributions, and entrepreneurship.</li> </ul>  <div>We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Prodigy Game will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.</div>
Title: Data Scientist

Job_Description: You've read job posts that promise you'll change the world. Then you discover they're for yet another social media app, marketing agency, or consulting firm. You click away. And you wonder: "Aren't there opportunities where I can make a big impact? While I earn recognition and rewards for my efforts? And get to work with exceptional people on exciting new technology?" If that sounds like you, meet BenchSci. You will be a great fit. <br/><br/> <strong>About us</strong> <br/><br/> We use machine learning to accelerate drug discovery by helping scientists execute successful experiments. <br/><br/> <strong>We focus on a huge problem in drug discovery</strong> <br/><br/> Each year, biomedical researchers waste over a billion combined hours. The problem is with products they purchase to influence and measure proteins. There are millions of them, from hundreds of vendors. Finding the right products for specific experiments is tough. Researchers spend hours and sometimes days searching through published papers for guidance. But even then, many products they buy don't work. Some aren't right for a specific experiment. Others are poor quality. This delays scientific discoveries by weeks or months. And it slows availability of breakthrough treatments while making them more expensive. <br/><br/> <strong>We apply artificial intelligence to solve it</strong> <br/><br/> Thanks to improvements in machine learning, we can now solve this problem. We spent more than two years teaching a computer to read science papers like a human scientist. It decodes the information, which we present to researchers in an easy-to-use, web-based platform. They can then find products for experiments in minutes, not days, and see data that builds trust. The time and money they save has led to rapid adoption by top pharmaceutical companies and hundreds of academic institutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Product video</strong>: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPs5xzYYHSs <br/><br/> <strong>News about us:</strong> https://www.theglobeandmail.com/business/article-alphabets-ai-venture-capital-firm-makes-first-investment-in-canada/ <br/><br/> <strong>About you</strong> <br/><br/> If our story excites you, let us describe who we would love on our team. You are passionate about machine learning, science, and making a positive impact. You are high-reaching, results-focused, and always learning. You act fast. You are open, honest, and transparent. You come to work inspired. You take your job seriously, but not yourself. You leave work satisfied. You wonder how to make every single day better than the last. For this specific role: <br/><br/> <strong>Your responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> As a UI Designer at BenchSci, you are a visual thinker who merges skills in visual design with your understanding of user experience to create delightful and usable interfaces. You translate and communicate complex information through understandable digital and printed visuals.  <ul>  <li>You will use your striking visual designs to make the BenchSci platform a world-class website for our scientist users</li>    <li>You will help the company communicate the platform’s value by creating stunning digital and printed assets like posters, decks, and booklets</li>    <li>Work with the Head of User Experience to guide the look, behavior, and feel of the platform by creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes</li>    <li>Advance and implement BenchSci’s style guide to create a consistent and accessible platform for all scientists</li>    <li>Follow trends and best-practices in design, and ensure that BenchSci design tracks them closely</li>    <li>Collaborate with scientists from our team and user base to ensure designs are usable and intuitive</li>    <li>Work closely with front-end developers and QA to see designs through to production</li>    </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  <li>2+ years experience in UI design with a strong portfolio of sample projects</li>    <li>1+ years of industry experience or summer internship</li>    <li>Excellent tactical visual design skills with a sensitivity to user experience</li>    <li>Able to prioritize projects, communicate progress, and deliver on time</li>    <li>Able to present your work and articulate the reasoning behind choices you made in the designs</li>    <li>Experience working in an Agile process</li>    <li>You can’t help but evaluate the user experience of both digital and non-digital products you encounter</li>    <li>You don’t compromise on your designs and don’t stop until you are proud</li>    <li>You are fearless, a fast learner, and thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments</li>    <li>You love to learn about science and are always up to date with cutting-edge concepts and technologies</li>    <li>You think like a scientist - question your assumptions and strive for data-driven decisions</li>    <li>Proficient in HTML, CSS, and can explain how your designs will be implemented with code</li>    <li>You can skillfully employ both Photoshop and Illustrator</li>   <li>Proficiency in Sketch and InVision is a plus</li>   <li>Bachelor’s or Master’s level education in Graphic Design, Visual Design, Interactive Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, or related is a plus</li>    <li>Background in life sciences is a strong asset</li>   <li>Candidate must be eligible to work in Canada</li> </ul> <strong>What you get:</strong><ul> <li>Competitive salary and options at a well-funded startup</li>  <li>High-growth position in the early stage of a promising company</li>  <li>Key placement with important responsibilities in the organization</li>  <li>Benefits package that includes medical, vision, dental and life insurance</li>  <li>Alignment of your professional growth with the company’s growth</li>  <li>An opportunity to help transform and improve scientific research</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply</strong> <br/><br/> Please submit a resume, portfolio or a website link, and a short paragraph stating why you are interested in BenchSci. The deadline to apply is June 8th, but we review applicants on an ongoing basis so please apply ASAP. <br/><br/> <strong>A bit more about us</strong> <br/><br/> BenchSci was one of three finalists for "New Startup" in the sixth annual Canadian Startup Awards. As one of the leading machine learning startups in Canada, we raised over $2,700,000 in a seed round from preeminent Canadian and American venture capitalists. We are affiliated with top machine learning researchers at the University of Toronto, including advisor Richard Zemel, research director of the Vector Institute. Our office is located in downtown Toronto (aka “the 6”), near great coffee shops, restaurants, and summer patios. <br/><br/> <strong>At BenchSci we value the following:</strong>  <ul> <li>Freedom and accountability. We do not want or have time to micromanage.</li>  <li>Hard work. We have an amazing and rare opportunity to make an impact and we work hard to make sure we capture it.</li>  <li>Personal growth. We put aside a growth budget for each employee.</li>  <li>No bullshit. No politics. Just results.</li> </ul> BenchSci is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All four of our co-founders are immigrants to Canada, as are more than 75% of our employees. We welcome your fresh perspectives and ideas.

Job_Description: Element AI is one of the worlds largest applied artificial intelligence companies and one of Canada fastest growing startups. We constantly push the frontier of knowledge, tackling the world's biggest and most interesting challenges in artificial intelligence, machine learning and operations research. <br/><br/> <strong>What youll do</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Build:</strong> You will build application security metrics, research threats and attack vectors that impact applications and infrastructure. Build threat models and perform application penetration testing to proactively discover risk as well as develop methods to validate remediation. <br/><br/> <strong>Execute:</strong> Youll conduct security scans and assist in the prompt investigation of security incidents. Analyze/prioritize defects and track resolution, including coordinating with developers, to ensure timely remediation of security vulnerabilities. In addition, you will work to automate security processes. <br/><br/> <strong>Lead:</strong> As the second AppSec Analyst on the team, youll perform technical security assessments, secure code and design reviews all the while evangelizing security requirements during all phases of SDLC. Maintain job knowledge by understanding emerging security standards and participating in educational opportunities. <br/><br/> <strong>What were looking for</strong> <br/><br/> Passion for learning about new technologies and emerging security threats. Experience with both application penetration testing and process automation implementation. A Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent practical experience. You also have experience with Python, Go, and with security information and event management systems as well as source code analyzers and vulnerability scanners. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you</strong> <br/><br/> The chance to work with one of Canadas most prolific, passionate and dedicated community of ML & AI researchers, developers and scientists. <br/><br/> Fully paid benefits, flexible hours and participation in our employee stock option program. <br/><br/> A brand new office (coming summer 2018) in the heart of Montreals new AI cluster near the Beaubien & De Castelnau metro stations. <br/><br/> Lots of food, snacks and coffee
