Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/><strong>The Mariner group of companies</strong> is known for investing in and building technology companies with themes of big data, software innovation, commitment to customer success and developing international growth markets. Mariner consists of Mariner xVu, Mariner Innovations, Shift Energy, and East Valley Ventures. <ul> <li><strong><em>Mariner xVu</em></strong> is the world leader in Software Defined Monitoring for managed and unmanaged IP video, streaming and broadband/Wi-Fi networks. Our software helps operators centrally manage the complexity required to deliver new video services with real-time visibility into subscriber experience anywhere.</li><li><strong><em>Mariner Innovations</em> </strong>is a leading provider of professional IT services, offering unique expertise in application development, information security, data management and support/ maintenance services across communications, industrial, utility and the public sector.</li><li><strong><em>East Valley</em></strong>, the start-up acceleration division of Mariner Partners, has made over 30 investments, with multiple exits, including Q1 Labs, Internet Security for Banking, sold to IBM; and Radian6, Marketing Cloud Analytics sold to SalesForce.com. The organization specializes in mentoring and providing support to entrepreneurs.</li> <li><strong><em>Shift Energys</em></strong> Energy Optimization System [EOS] automates the real time tuning of independent energy systems for large building complexes. The worlds leading building managers are using Internet-based Big Data and low cost IoT sensors to drive down energy operational costs.</li> </ul> Founded in 2003, Mariner Partners head office is located in Saint John, New Brunswick. We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work our team and our customers are located in major cities across Canada and in North and South America and Europe. <br/><br/> <strong>Why Mariner Partners?</strong> <br/><br/> We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work our team is located in major cities all across Canada, throughout the US and internationally. We are proud to be headquartered here, and are passionate about growing a strong technology sector here in Atlantic Canada and beyond. We offer competitive compensation; benefits packages and training and development. <br/><br/> We are proud to have been recognized by <em>Progress</em> magazine as one of Atlantic Canadas TOP 101 companies, ranking #46 on 2015s list, up from #62 in 2014. <br/><br/> We recognize that empowered employees are more innovative, more efficient, deliver better customer service and can flat out-perform conventional organizations. Our people have built products for national deployments at the worlds largest TV and Internet companies and leading real estate, financial and government organizations. <br/><br/> We are looking for passionate IT professionals who are curious about data, who love solving problems for customers and who want to grow their careers. <br/><br/> In order to keep up with constant demand for talent, we are regularly on the lookout for best-in-class candidates. As opportunities arise, we will reach out to potential candidates that meet the requirements of projects we look to undertake. <br/><br/> Thank you for your interest in Mariner. <br/><br/> <strong>Join our growing team!</strong> <br/><br/> If you are an adaptable, results-oriented, team player with a positive, professional attitude and looking to work in a dynamic and challenging environment, we should talk! While we thank all candidates for their interest, only those candidates to be interviewed will be contacted.<br/><br/>Job Description  <ul> <li>Collaborate with client IT teams and business owners on the development of a data strategy that addresses broad enterprise requirements; including a comprehensive vision for how data will flow through an organization</li><li>Assess current state data capabilities and develop roadmaps to close the gap between current state and future business objectives and goals.</li><li>Map the systems and interfaces used to manage data and set standards for data management.</li><li>Develop data models for database structures; design, document, construct and deploy database architectures and applications.</li><li>Consult business stakeholders on the value and opportunities presented by emerging data technologies and tools, including but not limited to big data, NoSQL databases, predictive analytics, data visualization, unstructured data, artificial intelligence.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>7+ years of experience as a data architect</li><li>Experience across some combination of the following: data integration, EDW, database administration, data modeling, master data management, metadata management, AI, predictive analytics, machine learning, data governance, data & information privacy, and data visualization.</li><li>Strong understanding of system development life cycle, software project management, technical requirements definition, and design and test techniques.</li><li>Bachelor degree in a related discipline</li><li>Specific experience as a client facing consultant preferred.</li><li>CDMP, CBIP, or other relevant certifications preferred.</li> </ul>  Additional Information<br/><br/><strong>Knowledge of the following would be beneficial, but not required:</strong> <ul> <li>Angular</li><li>.NET development</li><li>Java RMI, Corba, SOAP and Clustering Technologies</li><li>Python scripting</li><li>Performance tuning</li><li>Source Code Repository (e.g. GIT)</li><li>Dev Ops tools (e.g. Maven, Ansible, Jenkins, etc.)</li><li>Defect management</li><li>Basic MS Office tools</li> </ul>
Title: Data Architect - Mariner Innovations (Future Opportunities)

Job_Description: <strong>What is the opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> The Solution Architect partners with the business and technology product and application owners to transform and implement technology strategy and solutions within application portfolio. You will translate business needs into solutions and capabilities in support of overall Financial Crime (FC) strategy, with a particular focus on development of architectural blueprints and leading development effort towards identified solution. You will also be responsible for transforming FC Architecture practice with a focus on effectively managing the complete architecture lifecycle and aligning solution delivery to objectives and priorities within FC and Technology and Operations organization. Does this sound like you? Then consider joining our team! <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Assess and analyze business strategy, business requirements, current state environment and technology choices to evaluate solution alternatives that meet business sponsor needs</li><li>Work with Delivery Team and assist in the development of the program roadmap. Work with Data Architecture, Security Architecture and Infrastructure SMEs to ensure that all aspects of the solution architecture are defined and elaborated</li><li>Serve as the lead technical authority on the program responsible for planning all activities leading to the development of the overall solution architecture. Provide critical thinking, technical leadership to the program right from the idea creation stage</li><li>Provide input, guidance and direction for the development of project-level solution architecture</li> <li>Develop architecture artifacts (architecture blueprint, architecture decisions) as defined by the project management framework (PMF) or software development cycle (SDLC)</li><li>Identify possible third-party vendor solutions and lead the technical evaluation of the identified vendor solution. Participate in the evaluation of third-party vendors and software as well as due diligence exercises</li><li>Develop and present solution alternatives along with recommendations to senior leaders, architecture review board and others</li><li>Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders and interface groups using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to closure and facilitate knowledge transfer and collaboration</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Must Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Proficient documentation, written, facilitation and presentation communication skills with at least 10 years of experience in information technology roles, development, design and architecture; at least 3 years experience developing solution architectures on large projects and proven experience in leading the architecture of a large program from initiation to implementation</li><li>Experience developing a variety of enterprise technologies and architecture approaches (e.g., BigData, Cloud, distributed, online/mobile, Artificial Intelligence, and digital)</li><li>Expertise in architecture including, business,application, information and technology and associated concerns such as security and risk; Agriculture frameworks and tools(i.e., TOGAF, Zachman, UML, RUP etc.),</li><li>Applying different architecture/design techniques (i.e., OO, Top-down, structured analysis, component-based design) and tools (i.e., RSM, RSA)</li><li>Variety of technologies/approaches/patterns including J2EE, .NET, mainframe platform, packaged applications, multi-platforms applications, human workflow, EAI, SOA</li><li>Complex integration of disparate types of technologies/platforms focus on BigData, Cloud, AI- Machine learning</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to have:</strong> <ul> <li>Project management skills</li><li>Knowledge of the banking and financial services industry including operations, technology and the business environment</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. <ul> <li>A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable</li><li>Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities</li><li>Ability to make a difference and lasting impact</li><li>Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team</li><li>A world-class training program in financial services</li><li>Flexible work/life balance options</li><li>Opportunities to do challenging work</li><li>Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities</li><li>Opportunities to building close relationships with clients</li> </ul> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Join our Talent Community</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 88 Queens Quay West <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salaried <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  No <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2018-06-15 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 164728 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em>
Title: Sr. Solution /Application Architect

Job_Description: What to expect... <br/> Are you passionate about data visualization? Do you get excited about telling a great story in a way that helps people see and understand data? Maybe you'll become the next member of our Data & Analytics team! <br/> We are a fast growing team in need of a talented and forward thinking individual to design, create, deploy, and evolve our visualization platforms. Our growing scope on Data Analytics, AI, and Digital Innovation requires an experienced Data Visualization Expert to accelerate the development of our various visual analytics in support of our business stakeholders (Finance, Marketing, HR, IT, Audit, Tax, Advisory & Consulting). <br/> Some of your key responsibilities and accountabilities will include...  <ul> <LI>Working directly with engineers on the back-end, business analysts and end users on the front-end throughout the entire engagement life cycle.</LI> <LI>Coaching and growing new and interested designers across the firm.</LI><LI>Turning complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectives.</LI><LI>Developing a user experience that is simple, yet flexible.</LI><LI>Incorporating data governance and access controls in Tableau.</LI><LI>Visual storytelling through Tableau and D3 web applications.</LI> </ul>  Who you are...  <ul> <LI><STRONG>A Designer.</STRONG> You have a solid understanding of the design process and best practices around dashboards and visual perception.</LI><LI><STRONG>Experienced.</STRONG> 5+ years of experience, including a rich portfolio of design use cases demonstrating user experiences. Experience in developing and designing dashboards and reports in Tableau, and D3.js web applications. Other BI platforms such as PowerBI and QlikSense are a plus. Some basic SQL knowledge is preferable as well.</LI><LI><STRONG>End-to-End Developer</STRONG>. Ability to create complex calculations (including LOD expressions), action filters, user filters and implement advanced dashboard best practices in Tableau. Understand data modeling based on user specs. Experience with embedding Tableau applications is a plus.</LI><LI><STRONG>Optimizer.</STRONG> Experience tuning the performance of Tableau Server dashboards to optimize user experience.</LI><LI><STRONG>A Team Player.</STRONG> A willingness to listen, challenge, communicate, and respect team member's ideas and opinions openly. Taking a 360 degree view of data, connecting technical data solutions to product, business, and organizational focuses of the team.</LI><LI><STRONG>Agile.</STRONG> Able to work in a fast paced environment, similar to a startup. Comfortable with uncertainty and effective in delivering iterative solutions. Familiar with using agile methodology.</LI><LI><STRONG>Curious.</STRONG> A desire to learn, share and collaborate. Always looking for better, more efficient ways to get things done.</LI><LI><STRONG>Creative Data Rockstar.</STRONG> A passion for data visualization, design and software development. A creative individual who isn't afraid of introducing disruptive thinking in the design and implementation of visual solutions.</LI> </ul>  You can work with...  <ul> <LI>Data Scientists and Data Analysts for building effective data production pipelines and processes for analytics and machine learning solutions.</LI><LI>Business Analysts and Product Owners for mapping business requirements to technical solutions provided by our enterprise data warehouse / data lake.</LI><LI>Systems, IT, and DevOps Engineers for database implementation, performance monitoring and optimization.</LI> </ul>  If this sounds like you and you have a passion for tech innovation, a startup mindset, and a desire to work with a growing team of Scientists, Analysts, and Business Innovation specialists, let's start the conversation

We treat analytics not as a project but as a business enabler. Our culture, team, innovation driven growth, strategic alliances and enabling facilities and infrastructure provides practitioners lots of opportunity to challenge yourself, learn, develop and make a difference. <br/><br/> <STRONG>What you will do</STRONG> <ul> <LI>Understand and empathize - Work closely with clients, facilitate workshops and whiteboard to understand the business issues and underlying people, process, data and technology</LI><LI>Get your hands dirty and figure it out - Formulate and develop innovative vanilla to advanced analytics solutions to solve complex business problems</LI><LI>Story tell – Use your effective verbal, written and visual communication skills to provide the right message to the right audience in order to turn insights into buy-in, action and outcome</LI><LI>Be a servant leader - Lead engagements and teams to successful outcomes with a focus on supporting your team, client needs and generating value</LI><LI>Come to work with an intrinsic curiosity and desire to make a positive impact</LI><LI>Inspire a very smart and talented team to be better at what they already do and innovate</LI> </ul> <STRONG>What you bring to the role</STRONG> <ul> <LI>Post-Secondary education equivalent to a university degree in disciplines such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or Business</LI><LI>An insatiable curiosity, an aptitude to figure it out and a hunger to make a difference</LI><LI>Business acumen and strong facilitation, communication (written, verbal and visual) and interpersonal skills</LI><LI>Ability to think critically and laterally – problem solve and innovate within a team environment</LI><LI>Proven data engineering skills, such as extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality assessment and manipulation skills, as well as experience with big data</LI><LI>Strong experience in analytics, statistics, data mining, machine learning, natural language processing. AI and data mining frameworks</LI><LI>Well versed in Agile, DevOps, DataOps, Software Development Lifecycle, Product Management, Principles of Software Engineering</LI><LI>Proficiency in scripting (Perl, PowerShell, etc.)</LI><LI>Experience with programming languages such as (R, Python, Java, C, C++, etc.) and exposure to tools like Alteryx, Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI, D3 etc.</LI><LI>Experience with Hadoop (HDFS, Hive, Pig, Informatica, ErWin, etc.), databases (SQL Server, Oracle, etc.), solution Definition and Application, and methods (SDLC, PMLC)</LI><LI>Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and their data engineering and analytics related toolset is a plus</LI><LI>Experience with embedded OS for IoT is a plus</LI><LI>Experience with Microsoft Hololens is a plus</LI><LI>Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, Access and Word</LI> </ul> <STRONG>Why Choose KPMG?</STRONG> Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG.   <ul> <li>At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this.</li> </ul>  #LI-SS1

Job_Description: Element AI is one of the worlds largest applied artificial intelligence companies and one of Canada fastest growing startups. We constantly push the frontier of knowledge, tackling the world's biggest and most interesting challenges in artificial intelligence, machine learning and operations research. <br/><br/> Our Montreal team is growing at dizzying speed! We are a talented, fun and dynamic group that thrive on getting the job done. We need a motivated, high energy, hardworking and flexible Admin Assistant to support our People team. <br/><br/> <strong>What youll do</strong> <br/><br/> You'll provide support to the whole people team, be in charge of our VP's calendar and schedule, will use your creativity to create support materials for highly sensitive meetings, and could be assigned all types of projects belonging to the People org. <br/><br/> <strong>What were looking for</strong> <br/><br/> Someone who walks the fine line between a structured, organized, strong ethic and the creativity needed to do things differently when necessary. An experienced administrative assistant who has worked in HR departments before, who doesn't shy away from all types of work and who enjoys supporting many people across different levels. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you</strong> <br/><br/> A brand new office (coming summer 2018) in the heart of Montreals new AI Cluster near the Beaubien & De Castelnau metro stations. <br/><br/> Fully paid for benefits, flexible hours and participation in the employee stock option program. <br/><br/> The chance to work with one of Canadas most prolific, passionate and dedicated community of ML & AI researchers, developers and scientists. <br/><br/> Lots of food, snacks and coffee. <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Title: Admin Assistant, People & Talent

Job_Description: <DIV><DIV><DIV><strong>Job Summary</strong></DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>The Solution Implementation and Planning department is part consultancy, part innovation lab, part project implementation and part Business Unit support. We challenge existing processes and technologies in pursuit of seamless customer experiences, process improvement, and efficiency.</DIV>  <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>This Consultant will be responsible to implement an infrastructure that includes design, development, testing and implementation of RPA at Canadian Tire Bank. They will develop new processes/tasks/objects using core workflow principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>Canadian Tire Bank is seeking an experienced, highly motivated and results focused Process Automation Consultant to build an RPA Centre of Excellence at CTB. We are looking for a candidate that will leverage their industry experience drive best practices, tool selection and opportunity identification strategies that deliver optimal business results.</DIV>  <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>Our goal is to build a team of people with experience in Robotic Process Automation. This team will work with business units to help identify process improvement opportunities and build business cases that will prioritize development efforts. Business processes will benefit from a suite of automation tools, and this team will recommend the best solution for each unique opportunity.</DIV>  <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV><strong>Responsibilities</strong></DIV> <br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><ul> <li>This position will provide the expertise to build an RPA delivery team from the ground up, making recommendations on design, tools, structure and delivery processes,</li> <li>Using deep RPA experience, lead a team through opportunity identification, process documentation and business case processes that delivers business benefit through RPA implementations.</li> <li>Prioritization and demand management of evolving lists of automation requests, working with stakeholders to determine priority, set turn around expectations and establish a pipeline process to move new requests from ideation to production deployment.</LI>   <li>Defining systems strategy, developing system requirements, designing, prototyping, and testing custom technology solutions, and supporting system implementation.</li> <li>Coordinate with robotics shared services for robotic process automation (RPA) implementations.</LI></ul></DIV>  <br/><strong></strong><br/>  <DIV><strong>Qualifications</strong></DIV> <br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><ul> <li>Robotics Process Automation expertise (Workfusion, Nice, Pega, OpenSpan, Kofax and similar products).</li> <li>Fluent in Agile Methodology / Scrum deliveries and DevOps.</li> <li>Consulting experience in a Financial Services / Operations environment.</li> <li>Solid track record of identifying processes that are feasible for automation with recommendations for benefits and savings.</LI>   <li>Strong and demonstrated stakeholder management, risk management and budgeting skills and experience.</li> <li>Any experience in Machine Learning, AI, Natural Language Processing.</li> <li>2 years of relevant RPA bot development experience with one of the market leading RPA platforms (Workfusion, Nice, Pega, OpenSpan, Kofax and similar products).</li> <li>5 years of experience in programming (.NET, Java, ETL etc.)</li> <li>Understanding of Process Design documents, Technical Design documents on Automation space.</li> <li>5 years of experience in business client-facing role involving process design/process improvement work directly aligned to the specific responsibilities of this role. Experience with features and functionalities of RPA tools.</li> <li>Certification in Robotics Automation products is an asset</li> <li>Exposure to different business areas (e.g. Operations, Finance, Marketing, Products, Sales & Distributions, Technology)</LI>   <li>Ability to prioritize, organize and complete multiple tasks with a high attention to detail</li> <li>Strong commitment to professional client service excellence</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams</li> <li>Bachelor's Degree or equivalent professional experience</LI></ul> </DIV>  <br/>Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Business Analyst, Robotics Process Automation - 1 year contract

Job_Description: We are looking for a great <strong>Intermediate Java Developer,</strong> to join Wysdom.AI a fast-growing company providing the worlds most advanced AI-based cognitive customer care solutions. <br/><br/> Wysdom is a mature full-stack virtual assistant platform that uses machine intelligence for cognitive customer care management over social, web chat, and voice. We give businesses a powerful new way to connect to customers, answer questions, and transact any time, using natural language. <br/><br/> Wysdom provides the framework, the tools, and a massive AI training data corpus to enterprises needing to quickly implement cognitive care. Our experienced team of AI experts continuously trains the system, ensuring businesses provide the best customer experience in whatever channel their customers choose. <br/><br/> We are growing and expanding our team — please join us as a <strong>Intermediate Java Developer</strong> based in our Richmond Hill Headquarters. <br/><br/> As an <strong>Intermediate Java Developer</strong>, you will: <ul> <li>Contribute to design and implementation of new systems or new components in existing systems</li><li>Enhance and improve our existing Java back-end system</li><li>Update data models, database schema and working on database queries</li><li>Work on algorithms and production-ready solutions to hard problems</li><li>Optimize applications and DB performance</li><li>Solve concurrency issues and many more</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>About You</strong> <ul>  <li>You understand Computer Science fundamentals from school or from practical experiences</li> <li>You have solid Java / Java EE knowledge</li><li>You know Web services especially REST</li> <li>You are familiar with Maven, Spring, JEE Servers (Jboss/Wildfly), JUnit technologies</li> <li>You know about the concept of Design Patterns</li> <li>You have experience with application and database performance tuning</li> <li>You have experience with relational databases, preferably Postgres.</li> <li>You have experience with or eager to learn NoSQL databases, for example Mongodb, Redis</li> <li>You like to write clean and concise code</li> <li>You understand concurrency in scalable systems</li> <li>You have Python experience (nice to have)</li> <li>You have Machine Learning / NLP experience (nice to have)</li> </ul> <strong>About Our Technology And Tools</strong> <ul>  <li>We use many modern technologies where Core Java and Java EE</li><li>We use SQL and No-SQL approaches</li> <li>We love containers (e.g Docker) and believe in micro-service architectures</li> <li>We also constantly explore new technologies to improve our tech stack</li> </ul> <strong>About Wysdom.AI</strong> <br/><br/> Wysdom.ai is a VC-funded start-up, and is led by an experienced team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products. We offer a terrific work environment in all our offices, full company-paid benefits from your first day, and a stock option program, to ensure you participate in the growth we see ahead. Head here to read more about what its like to work at Wysdom.
Title: Intermediate Java Developer

Job_Description: Element AI is one of the worlds largest applied artificial intelligence companies and one of Canada fastest growing startups. We constantly push the frontier of knowledge, tackling the world's biggest and most interesting challenges in artificial intelligence, machine learning and operations research. <br/><br/> Our team is growing at dizzying speed! We are a talented, fun and dynamic group that thrive on getting the job done. We're hiring a Head of Software Architecture in Montreal or Toronto. <br/><br/> <strong>What you'll do</strong> <br/><br/> Software architecture is a critical part of creating usable, reliable and trustworthy AI systems. Due to the recency of the AI field and the lack of established best practices, software architecture often takes a back seat to engineering and research considerations. As a result, the world is full of bloated and unreliable AI solutions that fail to delight their users. <br/><br/> At Element AI, were not satisfied with the status quo. We have a strong focus on the intangibles of software: architecture, design, user experience and agility. The Head of Software Architecture will ensure that architecture is a strength of the company: defining (as a joint effort with the Chief Architect and other architects in the company), implementing and maintaining our vision of software architecture as it pertains to AI and ensuring that it is used and optimally consistent across the company. <br/><br/> This is an influential leadership role; you will work with software architects embedded in the research, development and product teams, and with our solution architects working with customers (but your impact comes from your experience and your ability to improve outcomes). You can develop and evangelize a vision, but youre not dogmatic and can equally help to make it practical and beneficial in the short term. Youll also play a key contributor role to the overall architectural vision of the company, including our neural architecture efforts. <br/><br/> <strong>What we are looking for</strong> <br/><br/> Youve got good people skills, have probably led large teams before and have certainly written code. More importantly, you are very strong analytically: you usually know the outcome of an experiment before its run due to a deep understanding of what is happening under the covers. You understand the many layers of software from IT up to the high level design, and people you work with seek you out for this reason. <br/><br/> You have existing knowledge of modern AI including deep learning and real-world deployment strategies. Your are proud of the strength of your communication skills and the breadth of your knowledge, and can have meaningful conversations about AI with nearly anybody. Youre known for listening to others, but others know to listen to you. You can operate with uncertainty and are comfortable in a fast moving startup environment. <br/><br/> This position will require some travel, with approximately one trip every month, and occasional speaking engagements at conferences and industry events. You'll be reporting to the Chief Architect. <br/><br/> <strong>In addition, you also have the following experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>15+ years of experience, including 5+ in a senior leadership position</li> <li>Strong knowledge of system architecture and proven leadership ability leading to deployed production systems</li> <li>Either a degree in CS, engineering or similar with masters or PhD or equivalent experience strongly preferred</li> <li>Close ties to the AI research community or demonstrated experience with research commercialization over several years</li> <li>Demonstrated hands-on in technical work in AI over 3+ years</li> <li>3+ years of experience in a cloud environment</li> <li>Working knowledge of application, data and IT security</li> <li>Strong written and spoken English is required</li> <li>French language skills are a strong plus</li> <li>Strong knowledge of the storage, compute and networking environments peculiar to large AI environments</li>  </ul>
Title: Head of Software Architecture

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> Technology works as a strategic partner with Morgan Stanley business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Morgan Stanley's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modelling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients' businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Corporate and Funding Technology is comprised of three primary areas: Operations & Risk, Corporate and Client Financing. <br/><br/> Operations & Risk helps the Firm’s businesses while maintaining a strong risk profile. The group includes Operations, Funding, Finance and Risk Technology. <br/><br/> Corporate improves our operating environment and is made up of Legal, Compliance & Corporate Governance, Digital & Corporate Communications and Human Resources Technology groups. <br/><br/> Client Financing platforms provide technology and service to our hedge fund and Asia high-net-worth clients. Groups include Prime Brokerage, Private Wealth Management Asia and Counterparty Risk Technology. <br/><br/> Position Description: <br/><br/> Client Technologies, with over 10,000 users across the Firm, form a consistent set of platforms for Operational control of client servicing activities. It was one of the first areas to start the journey of advanced automation with cognitive solutions leveraging Machine Learning in email-workflows and reconciliations. With the recent focus on, and demand for, automation across a spectrum of options, Client Technologies has established a new focus area to provide intelligent tooling that seamlessly integrates core services and practices necessary for the success of AI solutions. <br/><br/> We are looking for a candidate with strong expertise in Python to work with our machine learning experts to standardized tooling, help to structure, code review, unit test codes and automate the deployment process. <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <br/><br/> The main functions of this position are to   <ul> <li>Develop modular and scalable application using design patterns and best practices;</li> <li>Utilize and integrate various Firm tools and infrastructure;</li> <li>Develop, integrate and maintain automation and monitoring tooling from QA to Production;</li> <li>Share acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels. <br/><br/> Skills Required: <br/><br/> - At least five years of relevant experience</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in a related field</li> <li>Experience with Python</li> <li>Experience with Git</li> <li>Knowledge of Agile methodology</li> <li>Problem solving and critical thinking</li> <li>Creative and innovative</li> <li>Responsible and accountable for his/her actions</li> <li>Persevering, autonomous, takes initiative</li> <li>Good team player, able to accept constructive criticism and give feedback, facilitates effective team interactions</li> <li>Strong analytical, verbal & written skills <br/><br/> Nice to have: <br/><br/> - SKLearn, Python NLTK, SparkML.</li> <li>Service Design Concepts, OO and Functional Development concepts.</li> <li>Web Services, XML, REST, SOAP, JSON.</li> <li>Banking / Financial Services experience is a plus. <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.<br/><br/></li> </ul>
Title: Python developer

Job_Description: Position: User Support Technician (Intermediate to Senior) - renewable every march with the potential for eventual permanent employment <br/> Location: North Bay, Ontario <br/> Rate: $29.90/hour <br/> <strong>SUMMARY</strong> <br/> Our public sector client is seeking a client-centric individual with a passion for enhancing the end-user experience to provide front-line technical support services. While working with a diverse team, you will act as the single point of contact for client partners (vendors) while keeping current with all requirements specific to client and account services. <br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>   <ul> <li>Collect contact and information from users, open new or update existing tickets; responding to user requests to investigate and resolve hardware and software problems</li> <li>diagnose and identifying problems utilizing tools from a knowledge management system, specialized hardware and software tools</li> <li>Provide assistance to users by recommending the most effective utilization of computers, standard software packages and their applications and related equipment (workstation and LAN)</li> <li>Classify and categorize incidents; prioritize problems to ensure timely resolution either through first tier support or assignment to Tier 2 or Tier 3 through the established escalation system.</li> <li>Track and follow up on problems reported to the IT Service Desk to ensure proper diagnosis at various levels and service levels are being met in accordance with established service level agreements.</li> <li>Monitor incidents and advise support group of potential/upcoming and actual Service Level breaches</li> <li>prepares related documentation on system service and maintenance including service request forms, service logs and records</li> <li>Notify Incident Coordinator when a potential Severity 1 incident has been detected.</li> <li>Assign unresolved requests to the appropriate Sr. Service Desk Analyst/Subject Matter Lead.</li> <li>Ensure assigned tickets are handled appropriately during off shift, turnover ongoing activities to next on-site analyst</li> <li>Provide technical services as part of a systems project team by carrying out investigations of new hardware and software developments, assessing potential application to client systems and preparing reports with recommendations to the Team Lead, Sr Analysts/SMEs</li> <li>Maintain contact with external service suppliers and software manufacturers to discuss and evaluate new services and hardware/software for applications.</li> <li>Prepare communications/information materials in conjunction with Team Lead/Sr. Analysts/SMEs, maintain current knowledge for respective accounts/services and of the IT field through attendance at related courses, seminars, presentations, demonstrations, and trade shows.</li> <li>Provide technical services to support system projects for the investigation of new technology developments.</li> </ul>  <strong>KNOWLEDGE</strong>   <ul> <li>Job requires knowledge of all Microsoft OS Platforms, Microsoft Office Suite, Desktop Hardware troubleshooting, Blackberry troubleshooting packages to utilize structured troubleshooting techniques and diagnose user/account/client system hardware and software problems</li> <li>the ability to provide advice on effective use of computers and standard software for their business applications and carry out assessments of new hardware and software technologies</li> <li>knowledge of LAN/WAN and telecommunications, desktop networks (e.g. Token Ring) and related hardware (e.g. Intel-based PC's, network adapters, modems, CD-ROMS, printers and plotters) to install and configure new computer hardware and software, prepare service and maintenance documentation, develop and test desktop software components to meet client needs, prepare information materials for clients on computer equipment utilization, analyze problems and conduct minor repairs to ensure desktop and notebook systems are operating in accordance with service level agreements.</li> </ul>  <strong>WORKING HOURS</strong>   <ul> <li>This resource will work anywhere from 20 to 36.25 hours per week.</li> </ul>  <strong>SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/> Mandatory (Must Haves)   <ul> <li>5+ Years of previous help desk/technical support/service desk experience in a Big Desk, high volume contact centre environment</li> <li>analytical and problem solving skills to identify and assess user/account/client system problems resulting from equipment failures, operating system configurations and application errors, recommend/initiate solutions using diagnostic hardware and software applications and techniques and recommend most effective utilization of computers and software applications.</li> <li>the ability to plan, organize and prioritize tasks in a high-pressure environment.</li> <li>a strong customer service orientation with a bias for action in order to meet client and service level agreement requirements.</li> <li>analytical and evaluative skills to classify and categorize incidents and to notify Incident Coordinators when a potential Severity 1 incident has been detected.</li> <li>interpersonal and oral communication skills to discuss system failures with clients and recommend/explain solutions and concepts in non-technical term.</li> Job_Description: Position: User Support Technician (Intermediate to Senior) - renewable every march with the potential for eventual permanent employment <br/> Location: St. Catharines, Ontario <br/> Rate: $29.90/hour <br/> <strong>SUMMARY</strong> <br/> Our public sector client is seeking a client-centric individual with a passion for enhancing the end-user experience to provide front-line technical support services. While working with a diverse team, you will act as the single point of contact for client partners (vendors) while keeping current with all requirements specific to client and account services. <br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>   <ul> <li>Collect contact and information from users, open new or update existing tickets; responding to user requests to investigate and resolve hardware and software problems</li> <li>diagnose and identifying problems utilizing tools from a knowledge management system, specialized hardware and software tools</li> <li>Provide assistance to users by recommending the most effective utilization of computers, standard software packages and their applications and related equipment (workstation and LAN)</li> <li>Classify and categorize incidents; prioritize problems to ensure timely resolution either through first tier support or assignment to Tier 2 or Tier 3 through the established escalation system.</li> <li>Track and follow up on problems reported to the IT Service Desk to ensure proper diagnosis at various levels and service levels are being met in accordance with established service level agreements.</li> <li>Monitor incidents and advise support group of potential/upcoming and actual Service Level breaches</li> <li>prepares related documentation on system service and maintenance including service request forms, service logs and records</li> <li>Notify Incident Coordinator when a potential Severity 1 incident has been detected.</li> <li>Assign unresolved requests to the appropriate Sr. Service Desk Analyst/Subject Matter Lead.</li> <li>Ensure assigned tickets are handled appropriately during off shift, turnover ongoing activities to next on-site analyst</li> <li>Provide technical services as part of a systems project team by carrying out investigations of new hardware and software developments, assessing potential application to client systems and preparing reports with recommendations to the Team Lead, Sr Analysts/SMEs</li> <li>Maintain contact with external service suppliers and software manufacturers to discuss and evaluate new services and hardware/software for applications.</li> <li>Prepare communications/information materials in conjunction with Team Lead/Sr. Analysts/SMEs, maintain current knowledge for respective accounts/services and of the IT field through attendance at related courses, seminars, presentations, demonstrations, and trade shows.</li> <li>Provide technical services to support system projects for the investigation of new technology developments.</li> </ul>  <strong>KNOWLEDGE</strong>   <ul> <li>Job requires knowledge of all Microsoft OS Platforms, Microsoft Office Suite, Desktop Hardware troubleshooting, Blackberry troubleshooting packages to utilize structured troubleshooting techniques and diagnose user/account/client system hardware and software problems</li> <li>the ability to provide advice on effective use of computers and standard software for their business applications and carry out assessments of new hardware and software technologies</li> <li>knowledge of LAN/WAN and telecommunications, desktop networks (e.g. Token Ring) and related hardware (e.g. Intel-based PC's, network adapters, modems, CD-ROMS, printers and plotters) to install and configure new computer hardware and software, prepare service and maintenance documentation, develop and test desktop software components to meet client needs, prepare information materials for clients on computer equipment utilization, analyze problems and conduct minor repairs to ensure desktop and notebook systems are operating in accordance with service level agreements.</li> </ul>  <strong>WORKING HOURS</strong>   <ul> <li>This resource will work anywhere from 20 to 36.25 hours per week.</li> </ul>  <strong>SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/> Mandatory (Must Haves)   <ul> <li>5+ Years of previous help desk/technical support/service desk experience in a Big Desk, high volume contact centre environment</li> <li>analytical and problem solving skills to identify and assess user/account/client system problems resulting from equipment failures, operating system configurations and application errors, recommend/initiate solutions using diagnostic hardware and software applications and techniques and recommend most effective utilization of computers and software applications.</li> <li>the ability to plan, organize and prioritize tasks in a high-pressure environment.</li> <li>a strong customer service orientation with a bias for action in order to meet client and service level agreement requirements.</li> <li>analytical and evaluative skills to classify and categorize incidents and to notify Incident Coordinators when a potential Severity 1 <li>written skills to prepare system service documentation, develop reports with recommendations for improvements to systems architecture and prepare aspects of information materials.</li> </ul> ability to seamlessly multi-task, subject matter expertise, and keeping the chat going towards a defined solution</li> <li>Knowledge of cognitive computing (Artificial Intelligence AI, Machine Job_Description: Lead Full-Stack Developer (Web/Java) <br/> Location Richmond Hill <br/> We're looking for more than just plain Java devs, ideally they would bring something that makes them stand out, like experience in new stack technologies such as nodeJS, Docker, microservices or work with AI, bots, NLP, etc. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> We provide electronic bill payment solutions and looking for high performers to join our development team building FinTech solutions across a range of industries. <br/> You will contribute to a massively scalable data platform, that is built on top of a world-class enterprise platform, supporting thousands of clients and into the millions of transactions daily. <br/> You are a self-driven lead developer seeking to understand and transform client requirements into core features of an evolving payment platform, who demonstrates collaboration by example, to enhance user <br/> experience within the payment space, and enjoys writing high quality code! You challenge yourself to go beyond the original request and solve the root problem, research and introduce new technologies <br/> and innovate on a fin-tech platform that continues to evolve and expand at a fast pace. Your exposure will cover areas of JavaEE, Web 2.0, mobile, IVR, micro-services, NoSQL big-data scalability, leading the <br/> design process and development on teams that deliver through an agile process. <br/><br/> <strong>You Enjoy:</strong>   <ul> <li>Leading - play a leadership role in the analysis of challenging projects, creating designs, and embracing your team’s feedback to build a leading-edge solution.</li> <li>Working with talented developers from diverse backgrounds, continually learning, and applying best practices to development.</li> <li>Making an impact on a business that translates your efforts directly to production.</li> <li>Contributing to a team-first agile environment.</li> <li>Continually innovating and learning new technologies, to bring client-focused solutions to production faster.</li> <li>Mentoring your team members to master their craft as a software engineer, honing your skills in Enterprise Java / Web 2.0 development, and distributed, horizontally-scalable and containerized architecture built on micro-services.</li> <li>Actively contributing to developer communities such as Github, Apache, StackOverflow, TopCoder, Google Developer Groups.</li> <li>Working intelligently to surpass expectations, while maintaining a work-life balance.</li> <li>Joining an organization in a rapid growth phase, with career growth opportunities.</li> </ul>  <strong>This Role’s Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>B.S. Degree in Computer Science or Engineering from a leading University.</li> <li>5+ years of experience with Java development, and/or other object-oriented programming languages.</li> <li>2+ years experience building scalable web applications built around micro-services architecture, including RESTful services in NodeJS or Java.</li> <li>Capable of writing and optimizing native HTML5, JavaScript/ECMAScript6+, CSS3 and Boostrap.</li> <li>1+ years experience with one or more JS frameworks: NodeJS/Express, React, Angular, ExtJS, Vue</li> <li>Working understanding of relational database and No-SQL database concepts.</li> <li>A passion for technology, exceeding client expectations, and building great products.</li> <li>A proven high-performer and team-player, with the ability to lead teams of 3-5 people</li> <li>Exceptional communication skills; strong writing and speaking skills.</li> </ul>  <strong>Next Level Skills (optional):</strong>   <ul> <li>Java Servlets, and J2EE frameworks such as Spring MVC, Struts 1.x/2.x.</li> <li>Docker containerization, Kubernetes</li> <li>Apache, Nginx, Tomcat 8.x</li> <li>2+ years database experience with Oracle 11g and PL/SQL</li> <li>2+ years NoSQL experience with one of Couchbase, Hbase, InfluxDB, Mongo</li> <li>Demonstrated contributions to software projects in the public realm</li> <li>Implementation of a TICK / TIG stack</li> <li>JQuery, Freemarker, JSON, XML/XSD, SOAP</li> <li>Mobile web development targeting Android / iOS</li> <li>Testing frameworks including Selenium, JUnit, Mocha, Jest</li> <li>Cloud technologies such as AWS, GCP, Azure</li> <li>Machine Learning approaches to build UI, eg. chatbots, recommendations</li> <li>Eclipse IDE, IntelliJ, WebStorm</li> <li>GIT, or similar distributed source control with Mercurial, Subversion, etc.</li> <li>.NET experience (integration purposes)</li> <li>Familiarity with Linux or BSD</li> </ul>  <strong>What We Offer:</strong>   <ul> <li>An environment for continual learning, mentoring, & embracing the best technology for the problem.</li> <li>Competitive salary and bonus structure</li> <li>A collaborative and supportive environment that encourages innovation, and offers opportunities to advance your career</li> <li>Group Health & Dental Benefits plan</li> <li>Family day of your choosing, subsidized</li> <li>Discounted Goodlife membership</li> <li>Team building events. Eg. Team lunches, group dinners, escape room challenges, axe throwing, bowling, rock climbing, nerf gun wars, bubble soccer, archery tag.</li> <li>Kitchen stocked weekly with premium coffee selections, tea, pops, juices, snacks, chocolates</li> <li>Bagel Monday mornings, and catered lunch Fridays</li> <li>Ping Pong: challenge a colleague!</li> </ul>
Title: Lead Full-Stack Developer (Web/Java)

Job_Description: At integrate.ai, our mission is to build a future in which AI enriches peoples lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. To do this we are building an AI powered platform for B2C enterprises that integrates with business processes to make client interactions more natural and valuable. We are proudly based in downtown Toronto, Canada at the center of an exciting AI ecosystem. <br/><br/> We are looking for a Platform Scientist who is passionate about taking AI to the next level and interested in being a part of our core science team. This role will play a key role in the development of what makes our platform unique and push our science team to build new and innovative machine learning models. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will be doing:</strong>  <ul> <li>Researching and developing generalizable models to power the platform capabilities and automate client-facing business processes.</li> <li>Researching and developing innovative methods to better facilitate a wide-variety of machine learning tasks including feature engineering and selection, hyperparameter tuning, optimization, etc.</li> <li>Researching and developing unsupervised machine learning methods to discover behavioural patterns across multiple datasets using representation learning, transfer learning, deep nets, etc.</li> <li>Working with business stakeholders and product managers to translate product requirements into machine learning research and development activities.</li> <li>Working with architects, data and quality assurance engineers to develop statistical inference processes, monitoring and testing automation frameworks to ensure data, insights, and model quality while delivering analytical insights into the product.</li> </ul> <strong>You have:</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of research and hands-on machine learning experience, ideally in a high growth software development environment with big data frameworks.</li> <li>A Degree in Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative discipline.</li> <li>Deep understanding of statistical modelling and machine learning.</li> <li>Passion for research and innovation in multiple state-of-the-art algorithms.</li> <li>Experience in the use of statistical analysis and machine learning tools, packages, and languages such as Python scikit, R, Spark MLlib, TensorFlow, Theano, or PyTorch.</li> </ul> The diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ais team members help us make better decisions and drive great results. We foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. We are committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. We hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and growth. <br/><br/> We are naturally curious and have strong attention to detail. We love working in a team environment where trust is key and we all strive to make an impact every day. If this sounds like the right fit, please apply and come work with us.
Title: Platform Scientist

Job_Description: <strong>What We Are Building:</strong> <br/><br/> We believe that Retail and Data Science are changing at an unprecedented pace. We are building an advanced machine learning platform focused on predicting consumer behaviour on behalf of retailers. Over the past three years, we have been able to connect with over 150,000 retail point of sales location in 10 countries and create a database of over $100 billion in first party retail transactional data. And the numbers are only growing! <br/><br/> <strong>Who We Are Looking For:</strong> <br/><br/> Named as one of Deloitte’s Fast 50 2015 Companies to Watch, we are rapidly growing. We are looking for a highly experienced VP of Marketing to oversee and drive our marketing practice across the company. As part of the senior management team, you will be responsible for the overall branding and story telling of Rubikloud to various audiences (retail industry, tech industry, and local community). The concept of AI in the enterprise is still in its nascent stages and you will have the opportunity to drive the narrative with real use cases and an industry leading product! <br/><br/> <strong>What You Will Be Doing:</strong> <ul>  <li>Build and lead a diverse and dynamic marketing organization that focuses on branding, product marketing, analyst relations, PR, events, and digital.</li>  <li>Develop and execute our communications strategy as well as create and refine strategic positioning and messaging both internally and externally.</li> <li>Drive our long term goal of lead generation and top of funnel sales activities.</li>  <li>Develop short and long term strategies for evangelizing the mission of Rubikloud to help retailers leverage AI for tangible results.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are:</strong> <ul>  <li>Extensive experience and in-depth understanding of the dynamic nature of marketing including but not limited to public relations, analyst relations and product marketing.</li> <li>Past experience evangelizing cutting edge technology to early adopters.</li> <li>Past experience in high tech or start up experience building their brand and company story.</li> <li>Past experience building and growing a multi-faceted Marketing team to collaborate with stakeholders across the company.</li> <li>Extensive experience crafting public profiles for C-suite executives and key speakers for speaking engagements and overall company branding.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What We Offer:</strong> <br/><br/> We are a group of intellectually curious people who are passionate about making a big splash in the world of retail. We offer competitive compensation including equity options - we want all the members of Rubikrew to own part of the Company. You will have a full health benefits package including extended health care, dental, vision etc. Lunch is catered Monday to Thursday so you won’t have to worry about packing a lunch! Healthy snacks and drinks are also provided to keep you energized. We want our employees to feel like they’re always developing personally and professionally so we offer a a personal development budget that you are free to use for knowledge expansion or as a fitness allowance. <br/><br/> Thank you to all who apply. We are only contacting applicants who is moving on to the next stage of the process. If you don’t hear from us, please check back for any future opportunities! <br/><br/> Rubikloud welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: VP of Marketing

Job_Description: <strong><u>CNC Machine Operator</u></strong> <br/><br/> Active Industrial Solutions is currently recruiting CNC Machinists for our Windsor Ontario Mold & Specialty Machining Divisions. The successful machinist will experience a high energy, fast paced work environment that's both competitive and rewarding. AIS is a privately owned corporation with headquarters in Windsor, Ontario. We engineer, manufacture and service complex plastic injection molds, sophisticated automation and secondary processing equipment, gauges and fixtures, and specialty machined components. We are committed to adding value to our worldwide customer base and to being globally best-in-class. Please visit our website at www.activeindustrialsolutions.com to learn more about our growing company <br/><br/> <strong><u>Job terms</u> </strong>  <ul> <li>Permanent full time CNC Machinist Position</li> </ul> <strong><u>Position Responsibilities:</u></strong>  <ul> <li>Set up and run CNC machines</li>   <li>Maintain a clean and organized work area</li>  <li>Work with limited supervision while staying on task to meet strict deadlines</li>  <li>Develop peer relationships to ensure quality of work</li>  <li>Machine to tight tolerances and adhere to company standards and processes</li>   <li>Ability to multi-task, while paying attention to detail</li>  <li>Work alone and with other team members to ensure tasks are completed on schedule</li>  </ul> <strong><u>Minimum Qualifications:</u></strong>  <ul> <li>3 axis or 5 axis CNC background or boringmill experience required</li>  <li>3+ years of CNC machining experience</li>  <li>Strong computer skills will be considered an asset</li>  <li>Willingness and ability to learn required controllers</li>  <li>Shift rotation required</li>  <li>Powermill, Tebis or Lemoine programing experience is an asset</li> </ul> <strong><u>Benefits</u></strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive wages</li>  <li>Full Benefit coverage</li>  <li>RRSP Matching</li>  <li>Profit sharing</li> </ul> AIS encourage applications from all qualified candidates. When requested AIS will accommodate people with disabilities at all stages of the recruitment, assessment and hiring process.
Title: CNC Machinist

Job_Description: Position: Data Scientist<br/><br/>About BioConnect <br/><br/> BioConnect is a rapidly-growing biometric technology and software company. We have set out on a mission to change the way society verifies identity. We believe that people want to use their true, biometric identity to verify who they are instead of relying on approximations of identity like keys, fobs, passwords and PINs that can be lost, forgotten or stolen. <br/><br/> BioConnect has an incredibly unique vision and way of doings things, much like our team members. Our team is forward thinking, self-fuelled, relentlessly passionate and centered around unbeatable customer service. Our modern, open-concept office in the heart of Liberty Village, Toronto, is filled with energy, passion, and… dare we say it? Fun. <br/><br/> What you’ll do: <br/><br/> Do you have a drive for problem resolution? Are you someone who can get things done? Does “following data” get you all excited? We are on the search for a Data Scientist that can analyze, visualize and shape solutions from client data. Our ideal candidate has skill sets in the following three buckets: Math/Statistics, Databases/Programming, and Business. You understand the concepts to do data science work like statistics and model building. You are highly skilled at pulling data from a source and processing it into an insight – your technical knowledge allows you to do both very well. As a result, you have a fundamental knowledge of relational databases using SQL as well as exposure to the latest technologies like Cassandra or Hadoop. And of course, to tie it all together, you have keen business knowledge. With your technical and communication skills, you will work closely with the Engineering teams to create real-world, practical insights based on learned needs and then communicate those insights and devise solutions that anyone – even those with no exposure to data science can understand and use. <br/><br/> If you have a passion for building and you are a mixture between statistician, scientist, machine learning expert and engineer, then this could be your next dream job. <br/><br/> Key Responsibilities/Requirements:  <ul> <li>End-to-end model development: Build prediction models from the ground up, from data exploration through feature generation and into model construction and optimization.</li>  <li>Lead collaboration with teams across the company: Architecture, Engineering, Product, and Business</li>  <li>Work with our architecture and engineering teams on technically complex projects.</li>  <li>Communicate key results to senior management in verbal, visual, and written media.</li>  <li>Own the implementation of your models and insights and see them deliver real results.</li> </ul> Must Haves:  <ul> <li>Data is your passion and you love to innovate and invent.</li>  <li>Self-starter excited to learn unfamiliar concepts on the job (no fear, right?).</li>  <li>Strong applied experience.</li>  <li>A keen understanding of the value of your work within a business context.</li>  <li>Several years of relevant working experience and/or have a PhD specifically studying AI, ML, or Data Science.</li>  <li>Creative thinker who knows how to create real-world products.</li>  <li>Strong communication skills; verbal, written and illustrative. You must be able to effectively communicate complex concepts and abstractions to all stakeholders.</li>  <li>Strong consensus building skills to help your innovations see the light of day in a fast-paced organization with competing priorities.</li>  <li>Solid history of Acquisition, Curation and Maintenance of Datasets.</li>  <li>You can create and Manage data in traditional and non-traditional ways.</li>  <li>Have developed processes using Java, Scala, SQL, Shell etc.</li>  <li>You can estimate, plan & roll out changes.</li>  <li>Key technologies: Micrsoft SQL Server, MySQL, NoSQL, Python, Big Data systems e.g.: Hadoop, Pig, Spark, H2O etc.</li>  <li>An excellent understanding of both traditional statistical modeling and Machine Learning techniques and algorithms: Regression, clustering, ensemble (random forest, gradient boosting), deep learning (neural networks), etc.</li>  <li>Proficiency with SQL and extensive experience working with databases.</li>  <li>Delivery-oriented approach - ability to get things done within a strict time frame and the ability to juggle multiple assignments.</li>  <li>Deep interest in learning both the theoretical and practical aspects of working with and deriving insights from data.</li> </ul> Great to Haves:  <ul> <li>Completed a Master's or PhD degree from an accredited College or University in Computer Science, Statistics.</li>  <li>Previous experience working in a start-up, fast-paced environment (nobody really understands start-up until you’ve been there).</li>  <li>Resourceful with keen problem-solving abilities (you can figure things out really well).</li> </ul> “Imagination is more important than knowledge.” Albert Einstein <br/><br/> Do you relish in the art, patterns and secrets of data and do you find that the answers are whispered into your ear? While we believe that technical skills are indeed important, we also believe that truly great work springs from a passion to invent and uncover the hidden value in data. We are looking for a Data Scientist who can invent and create and help us unlock the hidden value of data. <br/><br/> <strong>So, do you think you have what it takes to join this fast-growing team?</strong> <br/><br/> Please contact us at careers@bioconnect.com to apply for this position or visit www.bioconnect.com/careers to apply online. We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please let the recruiter know when contacted and we will do our best to provide you with accommodation. Thank you.
Title: Data Scientist

Job_Description: <strong>What is the opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> Were looking for an <strong>experienced full-stack Java Tech Lead</strong> who will be working on Innovative products that will be the future of technology, such as Natural Language Processing voice channels (e.g. Google Home), machine learning / AI and natural language interfaces, and <strong>integrating RBC's internal landscape with external vendors</strong>. As a Tech Lead, youll be working with a first-class team and brilliant minds in tackling extremely challenging problems while delivering a high level of application and product knowledge, technical expertise and problem solving unique to one or more area(s), <strong>acting as a trusted resource for less-experienced department personnel</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Set the technical direction for all development, maintenance and architecture initiatives, ensuring adherence to overall IT architectural direction.</li><li>Provide expert consulting on technical and managerial direction for strategic projects with a focus on cross-divisional strategies.</li><li>Function as an in-house consultant / expert for the resolution of complex technical issues</li><li>Research emerging trends / best practices and determine the implications of proposed solutions on business unit strategy.</li><li>Perform code review of the code delivered in-house, ensuring adherence to RBC IT policies and guidelines.</li><li>In collaboration with other stakeholders, determine the best mix of development, interfacing applications and third party vendor solutions to meet business requirements and project objectives.</li><li>Develop criteria to evaluate third party vendors and software and develop due diligence exercises, conducing due diligence for very complex projects and overseeing the diligence process for less complex projects.</li><li>Collaborate with the Architecture group to contribute to the creation of technical strategy for Innovation projects within RBC IT; identify technical and business opportunities to take advantage of cross-project knowledge, best practices and reusability to expedite projects.</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Must-have</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of experience with different programming languages (e.g. Java / Spring Framework / Node.js / Angular.js / React.js / HTML / JavaScript / Python / T-SQL) and 2+ years of lead experience</li><li>Experience with Cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Pivotal)</li><li>Experience with DevOps capabilities (e.g. Jenkins, Maven, Chef, Puppet, UrbanCode)</li><li>Experience with microservices architecture platforms (e.g. Node.js, Spring Boot)</li><li>Experience providing guidance and support to developers within a team</li><li>Experience with SQL, NoSQL and Big Data platforms (e.g. Cassandra, Mongo DB)</li></ul></li> <li><strong>Nice-to-have</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with the Agile Methodology</li><li>Experience in or understanding of Innovation products (e.g. Chat-bots, Machine Learning / AI, NLP / NLU)</li><li>Experience with native mobile development (e.g. iOS [preferred], Android)</li><li>Experience with data streaming technologies (e.g. Kafka)</li></ul></li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <ul> <li>Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential.</li><li>Working in a unique atmosphere dedicated to Innovation.</li><li>Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.</li><li>Work on Next Gen Technology to lead the way in Innovation.</li> </ul> <strong>SFDG</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Join our Talent Community</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 88 Queens Quay West <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salaried <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0-25 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  Yes <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2018-04-22 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 160473 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em><br/><br/>Apply Now!
Title: Innovation Tech Lead - Java Developer

Job_Description: <p><b>Location:</b></p>1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5<p></p><p></p><p>The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.</p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p><b>Why is this role important?</b></p><p> <b>Position overview:</b> </p><p></p><p>The Expert Data & Analytics (Data Science) will work closely with clients, data stewards & SME’s, information architects, data engineers, project/program managers, and other teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. This includes providing data that is congruent and reliable. They need to be creative thinkers and propose innovative ways to look at problems by using data mining (the process of discovering new patterns from large datasets) approaches on the set of information available. They will need to validate their findings using an experimental and iterative approach. Also, Data Scientists will need to be able to present back their findings to the business by exposing their assumptions, validation and work in a way that can be understood by their business counterparts.</p><p></p><p> The Data Scientist is responsible for modeling complex analytical problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytical skills, the individuals in this role should be proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, overseeing advanced analytical solutions development and communicating results.</p><p></p><p><b>WHAT YOU WILL DO:</b></p><ul><li><b>Use Case Understanding</b>: Works with senior stakeholders to understand business problems, goals and objectives, translate them into data science projects and appropriately prioritize. Work closely with business, engineering and technology teams to develop solution to data-intensive business problems. Supervise internal and external science teams. Perform quality control of deliverables. Prepare reports and presentations, and communicate with executives. Provide thought leadership in algorithmic and process innovations, and creativity in solving unconventional problems.</li><li><b>Data Requirements</b>: Identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources; leverage new data collection processes such as smart meters, SCADA, and social media; Collaborate with information architects and Data Stewards/SME’s to select relevant sources of information; Make strategic recommendations on data collection, preparation, integration, quality, exploration, and retention. </li><li><b>Data Preparation</b>: Facilitate selection and preparation of data to be used for specific use cases; Develop and recommend data sampling techniques; Develop data cleaning specifications and approaches. Apply missing data treatments as needed. Develop and/or implement tools for data acquisition, extraction, transformation, management, and manipulation of large and complex data sets.
