Explore, model, mine, and experiment with data to answer critical business issues.</li><li><b>Modeling & Deployment</b>: Design, develop and evaluate highly innovative models for predictive learning. Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation. Use machine learning, data mining and statistical techniques to create new, scalable solutions for business problems. Translate business problems into mathematical problems. Perform variable selection and other standard modeling tasks. Develop simple visualizations of results. Produce model performance metrics. Prepare deliverable reports for business teams</li></ul><p></p><p></p><p><b>WHAT YOU WILL NEED:</b></p><ul><li>Five or more years of experience in Data Science with both structured and unstructured data</li><li>Proficiency in some combination of SQL, R, Python, Scala, Java , C#, C++ , VB.NET or other similar scripting or programming language</li><li>Experience in predictive modeling and analysis, and predictive algorithm development</li><li>Experience using machine learning algorithms esp. Deep learning framework like pyTorch, Tensorflow, CNTK.</li><li>Proficiency in the use of statistical packages, statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting & predictive analytics, multivariate testing, or optimization algorithms.</li><li>Experience with data visualization solutions</li><li>Experience with large datasets and developing insights on large data using Hadoop and its components.</li><li>Experience with Cognitive Framework and AI.</li></ul><ul><li>Data modeling knowledge and skills</li><li>Data integration knowledge and skills</li><li>Experience in data mining, large scale data acquisition, transformation, and cleaning</li><li>Data life cycle management knowledge and skills</li><li>Hadoop Ecosystem knowledge (HDFS, YARN, MapReduce, HBase, Pig, Sqoop, Spark, Hive, Kafka, Flume, Kylin, Presto).</li><li>Knowledge of Data Warehouse and BI concepts including ETL/ELT Data Pipelines.</li><li>Fluent in BASH shell and SQL.</li><li>Any Experience with AWS or Azure or Google and other cloud computing</li><li>Past experience of Programming with Python or Java, Scala, R or C or VB (or VB.NET) or C#.</li><li>Demonstrated experience with database technologies (e.g. Oracle, SAP, DB2, Teradata, MS SQL Server, Vertica, Greenplum, SAP HANA, MySQL, Netezza)</li><li>Experience with NoSQL database technologies (e.g., Hbase, MongoDB, Cassandra, CouchDB)</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>EDUCATION:</u></b><br>Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Sciences such as Business Analytics, Informatics or other related fields.</p><p><br>The highest level of education desired for candidates in this position is a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience</p><p></p><p><b><u>To be successful you will: </u></b></p><ul><li>Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Work in a team environment and develop/cultivate relationships with senior staff.</li><li>Proven problem solving ability and a willingness to think “outside-the-box”.</li><li>Possess or be working towards Hortonworks certification and DataScience Certification or equivalent.</li><li>Solid problem solving skills with the demonstrated ability to develop quick and sound solutions to resolve issues of moderate complexity.</li><li>Demonstrated technical and analytical skills, including the proven ability to understand and communicate complex technical information.</li><li>Strong knowledge of information systems concepts.</li></ul><p></p><p></p><p><b>How You’ll Succeed:</b> </p><p>At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. </p><p>If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.</p><p></p><p></p><p><b>Employment Type:</b></p>Full time<p></p><p></p><p><b><b>Type of Role:</b></b></p>Regular<p></p><p></p><p></p><p>Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.</p><p></p><p></p><p></p>Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.
Title: Expert, Business Intelligence & Analytics

Job_Description: C2RO Cloud Robotics is a high-tech software startup, located in Montreal, graduated from an incubator named TandemLaunch, and has secured a $800K seed financing round. It offers robot-agnostic AI-enabled software for robots including robotic vision and multi-robot collaboration to enable them to perform complex tasks. C2RO Cloud Robotics SaaS Platform connects robots and processes their sensor data in real-time in a secure and reliable manner. It dramatically augments the perceptive, cognitive and collaborative abilities of robots with a software-only solution, even the robots with limited sensing and computation resources. Using our products, robots can understand their environment, and share useful knowledge using the latest advancements in artificial intelligence and computer vision.<br/><br/>The Opportunity<br/><br/>We are looking for a <strong>Senior Software Developer</strong> to develop our software platform. You need to be "hands-on" Java/Node.js/Linux programmer while having responsibility for the design, development, integration, and testing of our products in an innovative and dynamic technology environment. Working with our technical lead, product owner, the development team, our goal is to develop a world-class Cloud Robotics SaaS platform that achieves overall business success. Watch how the product that you will work on it will used for service robots here.<br/><br/><strong>Your Key Contributions</strong>  <ul> <li>Development of the C2RO software robotics platform, the dashboard, and the integration of the developed software modules:</li>   <li>Ensure that the product is fully and correctly defined, built, tested, and documented</li> <li>Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of the solution</li> <li>Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation</li> <li>Diagnose technical issues and guide the team towards an optimal solution</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred Skills & Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of enterprise software development experience</li> <li>front end user interface design experience on either mobile devices or web applications is highly desirable.</li> <li>experience with Node.js and Total.js desirable</li>   <li>Familiar with cloud and pub/sub messaging, NoSQL databases, pub/sub message queues and Web Services.</li>    </ul>  <strong>Additional Assets</strong>  <ul> <li>inclined toward clean code and test first coding practices</li> <li>Start-up experience</li> <li>Experience with the development of a Cloud SaaS platform</li> <li>High-level knowledge of computer vision and machine learning algorithms</li> </ul>  About C2RO<br/><br/>We are an experienced team - agile and highly passionate - who want to change the way service robots are used for businesses. Using our product, we are working with robot manufacturers and integrators to provide their robots with end-to-end software solutions using cloud-based AI technologies. <br/><br/> Take a closer look... <ul> <li>Watch our Demos on our Youtube Channel</li> <li>Some recent news about us  <ul> <li>Montreal Gazette Features C2RO as 1 of 4 Startups Leading Montreals AI Charge</li>C2RO Announces Partnership with Qihan Sanbot Robotics to bring Cloud AI to the Sanbot<li>MIT Uses C2ROs Cloud Platform to Process Smart City Sensor Data</li><li>Smart Cities: 10 Companies Using AI to Build Cities of The Future</li><li>Learning in the Sky: Collaborative Robots Embrace Cloud Computing</li></ul></li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong>  <ul> <li>Awesome company culture</li>   <li>Being surrounded with cool robots and work on them to make them smarter</li>   <li>Life-changing work - solve real, hard problems youll want to brag about</li> <li>Sharp, motivated co-workers - work with the best</li> <li>Medical, dental, life, and AD&D, flexible time off, 15 days paid vacation</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>WHO WE ARE</strong> <br/><br/> Terramera is an award winning sustainable clean technology company using chemistry, machine learning and AI technologies to develop and optimize safer, more effective plant-based replacements to toxic chemical pesticides and synthetic fertilizers. <br/><br/> Using our transformational Molecular Delivery System (MDS) technologies and organic cold-pressed neem oil as the active ingredient, we have developed several chemical-free, 100% effective, EPA-registered consumer products, which are now in 6000+ brick and mortar retail stores across the United States, including Walmart, Home Depot, Walgreens, Target, as well as Amazon. Our consumer products are all about adhering to our mission of developing natural solutions that are safe for the environment, our family and pets – and actually work! <br/><br/> <strong>POSITION SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> The GM / President of Consumer Solutions leads all facets of our consumer channel in order to take it to the next level, including sales, marketing, product development, packaging and merchandising, product branding, pricing models and technical services. This position coordinates with all work units and marketing channels to translate revenue objectives and desired customer experiences into successful retail and e-commerce strategies via a unified retail story – differentiating Terramera from competitors and driving both consumer interest, as well as exceptional revenue performance. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Founder/CEO, this position works cross-functionally with Product Research & Development and Supply Chain, as well as is responsible for quarterly business reviews with the Board of Directors. <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR MISSION</strong> <br/><br/> To increase sales and revenue 10X over the next 2 years by driving and executing consumer product sales, marketing and go-to-market strategies in existing and new markets. Your mission will also be to work with Product Development to develop new product solutions, identify growth opportunities, refine existing product portfolios and execute new product initiatives to meet our growth targets. <br/><br/> <strong>DELIVERABLES & OUTCOMES</strong>  <ul> <li>Expand ACV coverage 50% within first calendar year;</li>  <li>Develop PR, marketing and trade campaigns in Year 1;</li>  <li>Hire, retain and develop a team of A-Players in Year 1;</li>  <li>Increase EBITDA margin to 10% by Year 3;</li>  <li>Build out a key disruptive brand in the pest control space;</li>  <li>Deliver budget, weekly and monthly forecast reports on retail product sales P&L; and</li>  <li>Ensure existing and new accounts meet company standards and performance expectations for sales growth targets.</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>15+ years of experience in CPG, retail/wholesale, B2B and key account management (experience in the United States is required);</li>  <li>Proven exeperience of having achieved retail success (i.e. Walmart, Home Depot, Target, Walgreens);</li>  <li>Proven experience of having achieved ecommerce success (i.e. Amazon);</li>  <li>Post-secondary degree in a relevant discipline. MBA preferred;</li>  <li>Proven successful track record working in similar industries;</li>  <li>Strong science and/or technical background preferred; and</li>  <li>Recent experience in start-up or entrepreneurial companies of similar size and life stage.</li> </ul> <strong>COMPETENCIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Entrepreneurial</li>  <li>Can-Do, Get Sh*t Done Attitude</li>  <li>Strategic & Tactical</li>  <li>Empowering Leader & Team Builder</li>  <li>Strong Follow Through</li>  <li>Organization & Planning</li>  <li>Analytical</li>  <li>Proactive</li>  <li>Creative & Innovative</li>  <li>Communication</li>  <li>Efficient</li>  <li>Honesty & Integrity</li> </ul> <strong>LOCATION</strong>  <ul> <li>Terramera Head Office – 333 Seymour Street, Suite 1100, Vancouver, BC (Relocation assistance will be provided)</li> </ul> <strong>Terramera is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer.</strong> <br/><br/> Our success begins with our people. We’re looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team. <br/><br/> While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on Terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com
Title: General Manager / President

Job_Description: <strong>Data is our core DNA</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About Project X</strong> <br/><br/> We work with clients to solve problems and gain insight through the use of data and analytics. Our clients give us their most challenging situations and no problem is too big or small for our team. <br/><br/> Every day at Project X is a call to address the challenges our clients have. Thats the life of a team of trusted advisors creating data and analytics solutions for complex client problems. We do this through collaboration, creativity and an innate need to solve tough data problems. <br/><br/> Data can be messy and problematic and our teams generally land somewhere in the middle of it. And thats where the passion comes in; to work at Project X you must share our obsession for the essence of data, to break through and make sense of it all and of course, add value at every stage of the process. <br/><br/> Data is our core DNA. What makes Project X unique is our custom methodology that delivers results rapidly and allows for our teams creativity to solve the problems were trusted to work on. This, paired with the fact that data runs deep in our veins and is what makes up who we are, individually and as a team, allows us to do the work were passionate about. It is the foundation that translates into a common understanding, a way of being, that is apparent not just to us at Project X, but to our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>What we do</strong> <br/><br/> At Project X, we work side-by-side with our clients to create a tailored approach that meets their needs. From strategy through execution to delivery, Project X works with our clients to achieve results in a quick and cost-effective manner using our rapid results methodology. This approach defines our success and sets us apart. <br/><br/> <strong>Who we need</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director of Sales, we need to add a <strong>Senior Account Manager</strong> to play a critical end-to-end sales role on our team and further our rapid growth. We need a Senior Account Manager with the sales expertise, relationship building finesse and technical confidence to actively seek new sales opportunities, develop new business from existing clients and oversee a portfolio of assigned customers. This is an opportunity for someone with a passion for what they do, looking for new challenges and an uncapped commission structure. The growth potential for a business savvy hunter comfortable in the Enterprise IT space is unlimited. This is a role for someone who can capitalize on insights and take action. <br/><br/> <strong>What our Account Manager will do:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop and maintain a deep understanding of Project X Ltd. Service offerings, capabilities, and differentiating value.</li> <li>End-to-end sales management. From account and territory planning to rigorous pipeline/forecasting. From sales cycle management to strategic selling including discovery, ROI, negotiations and multi-year deal structuring.</li> <li>Build relationships. Initiate conversations with prospective clients, fostering a trusting relationship to gain an in-depth understanding of their critical business issues and technical environment. Propose a Project X solution by bringing a point of view on various topics in the marketplace (i.e., Analytics, AI, Machine Learning, Big Data) and the unique advantages we offer.</li> </ul> <strong>And how do we know thats you? You have:</strong>  <ul> <li>The right combination of education and experience. A university degree or college diploma combined with direct experience:   <ul> <li>Ideally, you have 10 or more years in Business Development, Account Management or Sales as a key contributor at a <strong>software professional services</strong> organization. Experience selling in the <strong>Insurance, Financial Services and/or TeleCo is ideal.</strong></li> <li>You have a proven track record selling to C-Suite executives and consistently exceeding sales quotas; outperforming peers; building up a new business with enterprise customers and laying the foundation for future opportunities.</li> </ul>  </li> <li>The initiative, curiosity and work ethic. You have a contagious enthusiasm to unlock doors and find new opportunities. You are flexible to travel 25%+, driven, organized and a self-starter.</li> <li>The practical knowledge. You have in-depth knowledge of and passion for Analytics, enterprise software, user experience design, and strategic services.</li> <li>The relationship building skills. You have a history of successfully building and maintaining relationships with key industry players and experience working with engagement teams to ensure account work is projected accurately and efficiently allocated.</li> <li>The communication skills. You can communicate complex information and issues to all levels of the organization. You excel at making presentations, negotiating terms of engagement, navigating obstacles, and responding strategically to clients needs. The written materials you produce are equally impressive and effective.</li> <li>A consulting state-of-mind. Its a thing. Youll know if you have it. So will we. You can work autonomously and away from headquarters for long periods of time. And still find your way back home and into the open - mentally and physically - space of our office on a regular basis.</li> </ul> <strong>Why join Project X?</strong> <br/><br/> Project X Ltd drives success by focusing on building teams of incredibly talented, fun, dedicated people. <br/><br/> At Project X, we work hard for our clients but we also work hard to continue to be an employer of choice. We reward hard work and forward thinking with recognition, a fun company culture, opportunity to advance your career and a competitive salary. <br/><br/> We also offer other employment benefits like:  <ul> <li>Health and dental benefits package</li> <li>Gym membership discount</li> <li>Casual dress code and working environment</li> <li>Holiday parties and BBQs</li> <li>Getting together for team socials and sporting events</li> </ul> While we often work onsite with our clients, we make sure we spend lots of time together to ensure everyone feels connected to the mission, company culture and is a valued member of the team. <br/><br/> If you believe in working collectively to raise the bar, we want to meet you. Express your interest here and follow us on Twitter, Facebook or LinkedIn. <br/><br/> Project X welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Senior Account Manager

Job_Description: <div>Airlab, a company created by the founders of Ubisoft, is looking for a Developer for its artificial intelligence team. This position will be working within a small and entrepreneurial team, you will participate to the development of innovative application. Open mindedness, a strong interest in mathematics, and a desire to keep on learning are key qualities for this position.</div> <div>You will work on future technologies, among them artificial intelligence, language recognition, Big Data processing, applied to specific fields as user acquisition for mobile apps, automated QA and customer care automation.</div> <br/> <div><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></div><ul><li>Design and develop optimized and performing programs using all server resources ( parallelism, client-server technologies, GPU).</li><li>Participate in the conception of mathematic models in artificial intelligence.</li><li>Develop prototypes to validate models.</li><li>Implement databases.</li><li>Develop web interfaces to present results.</li><li>Debugging and maintenance.</li><li>Technology watch.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Requested Qualifications:</strong></div><ul><li>Minimum A Level in programming, mathematics or equivalent.</li><li>1 to 2 years of experience on an artificial intelligence project.</li><li>Very good level in C++ programming and python.</li><li>Very good Linux skills.</li><li>Skills in web technology is a plus (PHP & javascript).</li><li>Experience in one or several of those technologies : deep learning, language processing and recognition, classification, neuronal networks.</li><li>Very sharp analytic skills.</li><li>Autonomy.</li> </ul>  <div>  <li>Airlab, société créée par les fondateurs du Groupe Ubisoft, est la recherche dun(e) programmeur(e) pour son équipe dintelligence artificielle. Au sein dune petite équipe dynamique, vous serez amené concevoir et développer des applications dans des domaines comme lachat de publicité en ligne, le test automatisé ou encore le support consommateur automatisé dans lesquels linnovation a un rôle prépondérant.</div><div>Vous allez être amené travailler sur les technologies du futur dont entre-autre lintelligence artificielle, le traitement du langage, et la manipulation de mega données. Louverture desprit et lintérêt très marqué pour les mathématiques sont des qualités essentielles pour ce poste.</div></li>  <div><strong>Responsabilités:</strong></div><ul><li>Concevoir et développer des programmes optimisés et très performants utilisant toutes les ressources des serveurs (parallélisme, technologies client-serveurs, GPU).</li> <li>Participer la conception de modèles mathématiques en intelligence artificielle.</li><li>Développer des prototypes pour valider des modèles.</li><li>Mettre en place des bases de données.</li><li>Développer des interfaces web pour présenter les résultats.</li><li>Débuggage et maintenance.</li><li>Veille technologique.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Qualifications requises:</strong></div><ul><li> Minimum Baccalauréat en informatique, mathématique ou équivalent.</li><li>1 2 ans dexpérience sur un projet dintelligence artificielle.</li><li>Très bon niveau en programmation C++ et python.</li><li>Bonne maitrise du langage SQL.</li><li>Maitrise de Linux.</li><li>Des connaissances en technologie web sont un atout (PHP & javascript).</li><li>Expériences dans une ou plusieurs de ces technologies: apprentissage profond, traitement & compréhension du langage, classification, réseaux de neurones.</li><li>Esprit danalyse très développé.</li><li>Bilingue français et anglais.</li><li>Grande autonomie.</li> </ul>  <strong>About Airlab</strong><br/><br/>The Airlab team is composed of worldwide specialists in Artificial Intelligence and cutting-edge technologies with many years of experience in developing Machine Learning and Deep Learning applications. Airlab management also includes experts in mobile apps development. Airlab is currently deploying AI techniques in areas such as Advertising, User Acquisition, Automated QA and Automated Customer Care, in order to provide Mobile apps developpers with powerful tools to boost their business.
Title: Developer (Artificial Intelligence)

Job_Description: Lets talk shop: Lightspeed is on the lookout for a passionate full-time Data Engineer to join our Montreal-based Development team. The primary role for this position is to work on our cloud-based software, Lightspeed Retail. <br/><br/> Dont mistake us for a typical corporation. We are not looking for just a team member, were searching for someone to enrich our family. We will let you write the code and bring your ideas. We will believe in you and give you creative freedom to allow you to do the best work of your life. Sounds familiar? Perfect! Weve got what it takes to keep you feeling challenged and empowered. <br/><br/> Heres a little song we wrote about you: You have worked on large projects and your background is in Java or in any other object-oriented language. Youre a natural-born problem-solver and always game to develop products that solve real-world problems for customers around the globe. <br/><br/> You enjoy learning things that youve never touched before. This is your chance to intimately collaborate with a small team, to take on big projects that greatly improve the product. We love critical thinkers who like to question why we do things this way and want to do better. Change agents are everywhere at Lightspeed, are you one of them? That comes with taking ownership of the code you write, coupled with strong architectural skills. If you want to do the best work of your life while being surrounded by talented colleagues, we think we should talk. <br/><br/> Now we get to brag about us: Lightspeed provides retailers and restaurateurs the simplest way to build, manage, and grow their business while crafting a better customer experience. Lightspeed empowers small business owners with a complete overview of their business in one place - more than 50,000 businesses processing over $15 billion in transactions annually use Lightspeeds mobile Point of Sale software and newly acquired eCommerce platform to manage inventory, customer preferences, sales, and analytics to get a complete overview of their business in one place. Founded in 2005 with offices in Canada, USA, and Europe, Lightspeed is backed by Accel Partners, iNovia Capital, Caisse de dépôt et placement du Québec (CDPQ), and Investissement Québec (IQ). We're passionate about enabling people to do their best work. Come work with us and find out what you can do. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Design, build and develop ETL pipelines consolidating various data sources (streaming or batch) into application specific Data Warehouses</li> <li>Design, build and develop Analytical and Business Intelligence solutions</li> <li>Prototyping and developing solutions using statistical methods; Data Mining, Machine learning, AI, etc.</li> <li>Work as part of a team to deliver product features and functionality</li> <li>Translate requirements into conceptual and detailed designs with estimates</li> <li>Develop clean, maintainable code in a continuous integration + continuous deployment environment</li> <li>Assist QA and Support staff in troubleshooting software issues as well as implementing bug fixes</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years experience developing reliable, highly available and scalable software</li> <li>BS/BA in Computer Science, or equivalent experience</li> <li>Good knowledge of Java and Python</li> <li>Experience writing automated unit and functional tests</li> <li>Experience with relational (SQL) and non-relational (NoSQL) databases</li> <li>Proven skills in server side resource profiling, optimization and debugging</li> <li>Strong interest in Data Mining, Machine learning, statistical methods, AI, etc.</li> <li>Basic proficiency in a UNIX/Linux environment</li> <li>Excellent communication skills</li> <li>Experience working in an Agile development environment</li> <li>Experience with Git/Github</li> </ul> <strong>Assets</strong>  <ul> <li>MSc in Computer Science, Statistics or related fields</li>   <li>Research or work experience in AI, automation and/or Data Engineering</li> <li>Good understanding of Design Patterns</li> <li>Experience in a continuous delivery model</li> <li>Experience in building APIs</li> <li>Experience with event based and messaging systems</li> <li>DevOps background</li> </ul> <strong>And when youre not programming?</strong> <br/><br/> In addition to the perks you see in the Careers page, youll get access to:  <ul> <li>Flexible working hours - No punch in no punch out!</li> <li>Brand new office in a castle, one of the best development center in Montreal</li> <li>Even if we became bigger everyone has an impact on the company as a whole</li> <li>We encourage initiatives and leadership</li> <li>Tech talks - Sharing is caring :)</li> <li>Happy hour every Friday afternoon</li> <li>Birthday treats every month - 300 people in Montreal, thats a lot of cakes!</li> <li>Fun activities with your teammates - Be part of the Lightspeed Family!</li> <li>Work with highly skilled people</li> </ul>
Title: Data Engineer (Java)

Job_Description: We are looking for a Computer Scientist to join our Adobe Campaign engineering team in Ottawa. If you have a strong software engineering background and looking for an opportunity to define real-time, data-driven user engagement through AI and machine learning, then this is the role for you! The Adobe Campaign engineering team is responsible for developing robust and intuitive software that allows our customers to quickly and easily create amazing campaigns that use personalized, contextual, and real-time email messages to deliver a compelling customer experience. <br/><br/> As a key member of a high-achieving team, you will be responsible for the design and implementation of new cross-channel micro-services (delivery, tracking, subscriptions, and content authoring) that are built on the new Adobe Cloud Platform (ACP). <br/><br/> <strong><u>What you need to succeed</u></strong> <ul> <li>Awesome development skills</li> <li>Experience with Java/J2EE development in the Cloud</li> <li>Ability to work as part of a high-performing team</li> <li>Passion for planning, analyzing, developing, testing, releasing and supporting great software</li> <li>Understanding and passion for Iterative and Incremental Development (IID)</li> <li>Ability to articulate and sell your ideas</li> <li>Ability to partner with Product Management in defining the best solution for our market</li> <li> Passion for Open Source Development and Open Development concepts</li> <li>Working knowledge of Azure and/or AWS knowledge highly desirable, but not essential</li><li>Spring framework knowledge highly desirable, but not essential; ability to learn Spring framework is equally good</li> <li>Bachelor of Engineering / Bachelor of Science (computer science and/or mathematics)</li> <li>3-7 years of applicable work experience</li>  </ul> At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on <u>Best Companies lists</u>. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique <u>Check-In</u> approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. <br/><br/> If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. <br/><br/> Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.
Title: Computer Scientist

Job_Description: Junior QALocationToronto, ONJob TypeFull-time<br/><br/><strong>The PB Story</strong> <br/><br/> PostBeyond turns employees into Social Advocates. Customers use PostBeyond to empower their workforce, amplify their brand and spark social conversations that lead to sales. Based in Toronto, Ontario, PostBeyond is a venture-backed software company lead by David Lloyd, former CEO at IntelliResponse (acquired by247.ai). PostBeyond prides itself on delivering an innovative platform with a core focus on Customer Success. Our mission is to create new opportunities by connecting employees to today's social customer. <br/><br/> <strong>Why We Exist</strong> <br/><br/> Our vision is to create new opportunities by connecting employees to today’s social customer. <br/><br/> <strong>What We Do</strong> <br/><br/> We provide customers with an enterprise employee advocacy platform focused on delivering a brands messaging through employees into the social web. We are focused on 4 key pillars including;  <ul>   <li>Attribution: connecting the posts shared by employees to sales outcomes</li> <li>Compliance: ensuring that posts placed on social channels are appropriate</li> <li>Focus on the employee: increasing their social IQ and expertise</li> <li>Intelligence: applying machine learning techniques to improve the presentation and relevance of the posts provided to individuals on the platform while helping to curate the highest performing content.</li> </ul> We deliver a platform that can be used to engage the entire company’s workforce to drive internal communications and effectiveness. <br/><br/> <strong>Who We’re Looking For</strong> <br/><br/> PostBeyond is seeking a top-notch, self-directed Software Developer in Test to join the development team. Working with our development team, the successful candidate will grow their skills in test automation, help expand our automated testing efforts, review changes to the product to ensure correct functionality, and assist during deployment of new code to production. <br/><br/> <strong>The Routine – How You Will Do It</strong>  <ul>   <li>Develop and maintain automated tests for our front end application that are used to ensure correct functionality at all steps of development of new features</li> <li>Manually test new functionality under development to ensure that requirements are matched and does not cause new bugs</li> <li>Participate in code reviews to learn best practices, and to ensure the new code remains maintainable while following industry best practices</li> <li>Assist in final testing during scheduled deployments of new code on our different testing environments</li> </ul> <strong>What You’ve Done to Date</strong>  <ul>   <li>Experience with automated browser testing software (Selenium)</li> <li>Experience with some form of source control tool (Git or Subversion)</li> <li>Experience with some form of Javascript</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to Haves</strong>  <ul>   <li>Experience with Protractor, AngularJS, and Python</li> <li>Experience working on an Agile team</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> You can look forward to flexible hours, healthy snacks, free coffee/tea, a gym membership program (if you're up for it), flexible vacation, a supportive work culture, occasional team outings, and a great work from home policy. <br/><br/> <strong>Join Our Growing PB Family</strong> <br/><br/> Joining us now means being a direct contributor to the next evolution of business communications. Apply now, refer a friend, or stay on top of what’s new by following us on LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube or Facebook. <br/><br/> Posted 4 hours ago<br/> <div></div>
Title: Junior QA

Job_Description: We are looking for a great <strong>Digital Marketing Manager</strong> to join Wysdom.AI a fast-growing company providing the worlds most advanced AI-based cognitive customer care solutions. <br/><br/> Wysdom is a mature full-stack virtual assistant platform that uses machine intelligence for cognitive customer care management over social, web chat, and voice. We give businesses a powerful new way to connect to customers, answer questions, and transact any time, using natural language. <br/><br/> We are growing and expanding our team — please join us as a <strong>Digital Marketing Manager</strong> based in our King West downtown office. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role</strong> <br/><br/> If you live and breathe marketing, we need to talk. Reporting to the VP Marketing, this newly-created role will be joining our growing marketing and sales team in downtown Toronto. <br/><br/> The right candidate will have a winning mix of digital marketing experience, proven ability to develop campaigns to drive demand and funnel conversions, solid analytic skills to measure and report on the effectiveness of programs, and technical skills to quickly adopt new trends and solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>About you:</strong> <ul>  <li>Youre a flexible and versatile marketeer with a minimum of 2 years experience shaping a companys digital strategy</li> <li>Experience setting up and using marketing automation tools</li> <li>Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement</li> <li>Co-ordinate and execute multi-touch, integrated demand generation programs using a variety of organic and paid acquisition channels, and ABM tactics</li> <li>Measure and report performance of marketing campaigns, gain insight, and assess against goals</li> <li>Create and enhance ad hoc marketing collateral to help sales close business</li> <li>Create and oversee our new social influencer program</li> <li>Good taste, a sense of aesthetics, and demonstrable experience in marketing together with the potential and attitude required to learn</li> </ul> When applying, tell us a story in your cover letter: What was the most successful marketing project you've ever worked on — and what made it so successful? <br/><br/> <strong>About Wysdom.AI</strong> <br/><br/> Wysdom.ai is a VC-funded start-up, and is led by an experienced team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products. We offer a terrific work environment in all our offices, full company-paid benefits from your first day, and a stock option program, to ensure you participate in the growth we see ahead. Head here to read more about what its like to work at Wysdom.
Title: Digital Marketing Manager

Job_Description: <strong>Title:</strong> Director, Security and Privacy <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Toronto, Canada <br/><br/> Georgian Partners is a thesis-driven growth equity firm that invests in business software companies across all industries. Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of key technology trends by all the software companies we invest in and partner with. <br/><br/> We are looking for an experienced security and privacy leader to join our team. You will lead the research and development of our Security first thesis roadmap, partner with our portfolio company CEOs, CPOs, CTOs and other executives on their product strategy and execution, and assess potential investments. <br/><br/> <u><strong>What youll be doing:</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>Research and Development</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Working with product leadership to plan and deliver products to portfolio companies, and driving the adoption of differential privacy techniques and security first architectural approaches.</li> <li>Leading our firms primary research into and the development of our Security first thesis.</li> <li>Frameworks to help simplify and explain the topic to potential investments and portfolio companies, and to identify opportunities.</li> <li>Processes and organizational recommendations to support companies in their security and privacy roadmap.</li> <li>Market landscapes mapping industries and investment opportunities.</li> <li>Publishing articles and speaking at top-tier events to demonstrate our firms leadership in security and privacy.</li> <li>Establishing and maintaining relationships with industry leaders and top-tier universities developing programs supportive of security, privacy, and cryptography.</li> <li>Keeping abreast of emerging technology trends and supporting the firm in the evolution of our investment thesis areas.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Portfolio</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Developing and executing workshops to help portfolio companies identify, prioritize and gain executive commitment for security and privacy initiatives.</li> <li>Leading engagements with portfolio companies towards the adoption of security and privacy as part of product, architecture, and operations.</li> <li>Creating opportunities for interactions between business and product leaders within portfolio companies, including conferences, newsletters and blogs.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Due Diligence</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Supporting investment due diligence processes, by evaluating company security and privacy maturity, risks and opportunities, and company relevance to the firms Security first investment thesis.</li> <li>Documenting presenting and defend findings to the investment team lead on the deal.</li> </ul> <u><strong>You have:</strong></u>  <ul> <li>Strong experience in security and privacy as a CSO or Security Architect in a high growth software development environment</li> <li>Experience as a security and privacy consultant.</li> <li>Deep background in cryptography and interest in machine learning.</li> <li>A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related field.</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li> <li>A strong interest in venture capital and growth equity investing.</li> </ul> You will be working with software companies that are positioned to create value by adopting trends such as: <br/><br/> <em><strong>Applied artificial intelligence:</strong> use AI/ML to design, optimize and automate business processes and human decision making.</em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>Security first:</strong> lead and differentiate with security and privacy built into software.</em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>Conversational business:</strong> enable customers to transact via messaging channels and text and voice-based conversational interfaces.</em> <br/><br/> If this sounds like an opportunity you are interested in, we would love to chat. Please apply by telling us why you think you would be a great fit for this role. We look forward to hearing from you! <br/><br/> <strong>THE GEORGIAN PARTNERS TEAM.</strong>
Title: Director, Security and Privacy

Job_Description: Were looking for a Data Scientist to fill a mid-level full time position. If youre looking for a new adventure, join our team of talented Data scientist and Researchers to help us build innovative Computer Vision solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul>  <li>Brainstorm with the team to understand requirements and discuss solutions.</li> <li>Read state-of-the-art scientific papers related projects and develop knowledge.</li> <li>Develop solutions for achieving specific goals of extracting information from 2-D, 3-D (LiDAR) images and other types of data.</li> <li>Develop experimental pipelines for processing data, training models, predictions and tests.</li> <li>Optimize and compromise for speed, size or accuracy of productions pipelines.</li> </ul> <strong>Must Skills / Knowledge</strong> <ul>  <li>Masters degree in Machine Learning or Computer Vision or Computer Science or a related field.</li> <li>Minimum 1 years or relevant professional work experience.</li> <li>Experience in deep learning frameworks such Keras, TensorFlow, Theano, Torch or Caffe.</li> <li>Experience in Machine Learning APIs, frameworks, and AI tools.</li> <li>Experience in coding with Python (or Java or Scala or C++).</li> <li>Experience in image processing with OpenCV.</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Skills / Knowledge</strong> <ul>  <li>Experience in writing software in company, startup, or other industrial framework.</li> <li>Experience with large data sets.</li> <li>Experience in using relational databases and Big Data tools (such as Hadoop and Spark).</li> <li>Familiarity with state-of-the-art in computer vision is nice to have.</li> <li>Ability to build and evaluate predictive models.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>A natural curiosity and desire to learn</li> </ul>
Title: Computer Vision Data Scientist

Job_Description: <div>At Dynatrace, our drive for innovation is unparalleled, and thats why customers like Apple, Delta, SAP and others succeed with our products. Our fast-paced Sales team is growing. Were looking for a highly motivated Account Executive who is a seasoned hunter, experienced in selling software solutions to large enterprises and can do so successfully within a designated territory.</div> <br/> <div>Come be part of one of the fastest growing companies in the Cloud world right now.</div>Qualifications  <ul> <li>Several years experience in software sales</li><li>Motivated and tenacious self-starter who consistently delivers high performance against quota driven by VP- and C-level relationships</li><li>Proven ability to manage enterprise sales cycle within complex organizations; while compressing decision cycles</li><li>Outstanding communication (written and oral), negotiation and presentations skills</li><li>Collaborate internally across all supporting resources within sales to maximize your effectiveness and advance the sales process</li><li>APM experience is a plus, but not necessary</li> </ul>  You will love the benefits of selling Dynatrace  <ul> <li>We are a market share leader & a 7x magic quadrant leader</li> <li>We invest more in R&D than some of our competitors total revenue, assuring market-leading customer value and quick adoption</li><li>Enjoy our culture of excellence with competitive compensation packages that recognize and reward greatness</li><li>Working with the largest of the Cloud players like AWS, Azure, Pivotal and Google Cloud allows our customers to have the best of 3rd Generation Monitoring in the world. Not to mention were fully automated from the start, providing the most advanced solution leveraging our AI machine learning technology</li> </ul>  Your future role in the team  <ul> <li>Execute on account plans to deliver maximum revenue potential within a pool of regional named accounts</li><li>Drive new logo acquisition; while working with existing customers to retain and expand Dynatrace usage</li><li>Consult with VP- and C-level executives to develop and implement an effective enterprise wide strategy that maximizes the value delivered by Dynatrace; position Dynatrace relative to the competition</li><li>Evangelize the Dynatrace vision through product demonstrations, in-market events and account specific initiatives</li><li>Develop a contact network within named accounts and channel partners to ensure Dynatrace can be sold broadly and effectively</li><li>Work closely with and establish engagement between Dynatrace functional areas such as sales engineering, marketing, legal, finance and other lines of business to develop and execute a solution strategy to meet customer business needs</li><li>Champion your customers implementations to ensure wild success</li> </ul>
Title: Account Executive (Remote Office)

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>B.Yond provides IP-led products and solutions to operators and enterprises for the fully automated deployment and management of virtualized networks and applications. B.Yond is leveraging data science, machine learning, and automation to create an Infinite Network built on mega data centers and edge-clouds.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>The Data Scientist will help develop the Research and develop statistical learning models for data analysis and keep up-to-date with latest technology trends. <br/><br/> <strong> The primary responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Develop flexible and robust runtime algorithms</li><li>Develop, maintain and improve our state-of-the-art AI systems, including path-finding, navigation, perception, behavior execution, vehicle control, and autonomous decision making</li><li>Develop robust and reusable AI frameworks</li><li>Responsible for implementing and refining the AI for components of our games</li><li>Implement AI behavioral features and refine as needed</li> </ul> <strong>The challenges...</strong> <ul> <li>Networks and Clouds are complex, multi-tiered ecosystems with a high level of integrated components. They also service millions of users and generate massive amounts of data. This makes the management and control highly challenging, but also very susceptible to automation, especially AI. Our challenge is to translate this wealth of data and information into processes and procedures that improve the services for everyone from enterprises to digital lifestyles.</li><li>Building the intelligence that makes our product stand out above anyone elses in the market. This involves on one part selecting the problems where making a difference has an impact but also developing top-performing models for these solutions.</li> </ul> <strong>What success looks like...</strong> <ul> <li>Development and delivery of successful algorithms that address defined business problems</li><li>Continuous experimentation to achieve above and beyond what the current technology enables</li><li>Innovating new methods and novel solutions in data science</li> </ul> <strong>What makes it rewarding...</strong> <ul> <li>Transforming an industry with cutting-edge technology</li> <li>Working in some of the most data-driven industries that are actively looking to monetize and automate</li><li>We are open to experimenting and trying new things. We give our scientists the freedom to innovate, explore, and create.</li> </ul>  Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>How others describe you...</strong> <ul> <li>Being a team player in the truest sense, with an ability to work with partners across different time zones.</li><li>Expert problem solver, always looking for multiple solutions.</li><li>A work ethic to drive projects and tasks to finish on time, overcoming any obstacles along the way.</li><li>A desire to take the initiative, seizing opportunities when you see them.</li> </ul> <strong>The skills and experience that will help you succeed...</strong> <ul> <li>2+ years hands-on experience implementing Machine Learning solutions and optimizing machine learning algorithms</li> <li>Data mining and statistical analysis expertise</li><li>2+ years Python and SQL experience</li><li>1+ year of R experience, plus Spark, Scala, or Java</li><li>2+ years of Software development, understanding of various data structures, common methods in data transformation, object-orientated programming</li><li>Strong interest in researching and implementing new AI-related technologies</li><li>BS/MS degree in computer science, Statistics, Applied Math or related field, Ph.D. desirable</li> </ul>  Additional Information<br/><br/>When applying for the job, take the opportunity to tell us in five sentences or less what makes you the best candidate for this position and for our company, and why B.Yond is a fit for you. <br/><br/> Please Note: This job description is not intended to be a complete list of all responsibilities, duties or skills and due to the changing nature of the job is subject to review and change at any time, with or without notice. B.Yond uses E-verify and third party background check services, including drug screening, as part of the hiring process. <br/><br/> All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Title: Data Scientist

Job_Description: <p><b>Location:</b></p>1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5<p></p><p></p><p>The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.</p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p><b>Why is this role important?</b></p><p> <b>Position overview:</b> </p><p></p><p>The Expert Data & Analytics (Data Science) will work closely with clients, data stewards & SME’s, information architects, data engineers, project/program managers, and other teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. This includes providing data that is congruent and reliable. They need to be creative thinkers and propose innovative ways to look at problems by using data mining (the process of discovering new patterns from large datasets) approaches on the set of information available. They will need to validate their findings using an experimental and iterative approach. Also, Data Scientists will need to be able to present back their findings to the business by exposing their assumptions, validation and work in a way that can be understood by their business counterparts.</p><p></p><p> The Data Scientist is responsible for modeling complex analytical problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytical skills, the individuals in this role should be proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, overseeing advanced analytical solutions development and communicating results.</p><p></p><p><b>WHAT YOU WILL DO:</b></p><ul><li><b>Use Case Understanding</b>: Works with senior stakeholders to understand business problems, goals and objectives, translate them into data science projects and appropriately prioritize. Work closely with business, engineering and technology teams to develop solution to data-intensive business problems. Supervise internal and external science teams. Perform quality control of deliverables. Prepare reports and presentations, and communicate with executives. Provide thought leadership in algorithmic and process innovations, and creativity in solving unconventional problems.</li><li><b>Data Requirements</b>: Identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources; leverage new data collection processes such as smart meters, SCADA, and social media; Collaborate with information architects and Data Stewards/SME’s to select relevant sources of information; Make strategic recommendations on data collection, preparation, integration, quality, exploration, and retention. </li><li><b>Data Preparation</b>: Facilitate selection and preparation of data to be used for specific use cases; Develop and recommend data sampling techniques; Develop data cleaning specifications and approaches. Apply missing data treatments as needed. Develop and/or implement tools for data acquisition, extraction, transformation, management, and manipulation of large and complex data sets. Explore, model, mine, and experiment with data to answer critical business issues.</li><li><b>Modeling & Deployment</b>: Design, develop and evaluate highly innovative models for predictive learning. Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation. Use machine learning, data mining and statistical techniques to create new, scalable solutions for business problems. Translate business problems into mathematical problems. Perform variable selection and other standard modeling tasks. Develop simple visualizations of results. Produce model performance metrics. Prepare deliverable reports for business teams</li></ul><p></p><p></p><p><b>WHAT YOU WILL NEED:</b></p><ul><li>Five or more years of experience in Data Science with both structured and unstructured data</li><li>Proficiency in some combination of SQL, R, Python, Scala, Java , C#, C++ , VB.NET or other similar scripting or programming language</li><li>Experience in predictive modeling and analysis, and predictive algorithm development</li><li>Experience using machine learning algorithms esp. Deep learning framework like pyTorch, Tensorflow, CNTK.</li><li>Proficiency in the use of statistical packages, statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting & predictive analytics, multivariate testing, or optimization algorithms.</li><li>Experience with data visualization solutions</li><li>Experience with large datasets and developing insights on large data using Hadoop and its components.</li><li>Experience with Cognitive Framework and AI.</li></ul><ul><li>Data modeling knowledge and skills</li><li>Data integration knowledge and skills</li><li>Experience in data mining, large scale data acquisition, transformation, and cleaning</li><li>Data life cycle management knowledge and skills</li><li>Hadoop Ecosystem knowledge (HDFS, YARN, MapReduce, HBase, Pig, Sqoop, Spark, Hive, Kafka, Flume, Kylin, Presto).</li><li>Knowledge of Data Warehouse and BI concepts including ETL/ELT Data Pipelines.</li><li>Fluent in BASH shell and SQL.</li><li>Any Experience with AWS or Azure or Google and other cloud computing</li><li>Past experience of Programming with Python or Java, Scala, R or C or VB (or VB.NET) or C#.</li><li>Demonstrated experience with database technologies (e.g. Oracle, SAP, DB2, Teradata, MS SQL Server, Vertica, Greenplum, SAP HANA, MySQL, Netezza)</li><li>Experience with NoSQL database technologies (e.g., Hbase, MongoDB, Cassandra, CouchDB)</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>EDUCATION:</u></b><br>Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Sciences such as Business Analytics, Informatics or other related fields.</p><p><br>The highest level of education desired for candidates in this position is a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience</p><p></p><p><b><u>To be successful you will: </u></b></p><ul><li>Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Work in a team environment and develop/cultivate relationships with senior staff.</li><li>Proven problem solving ability and a willingness to think “outside-the-box”.</li><li>Possess or be working towards Hortonworks certification and DataScience Certification or equivalent.</li><li>Solid problem solving skills with the demonstrated ability to develop quick and sound solutions to resolve issues of moderate complexity.</li><li>Demonstrated technical and analytical skills, including the proven ability to understand and communicate complex technical information.</li><li>Strong knowledge of information systems concepts.</li></ul><p></p><p></p><p><b>How You’ll Succeed:</b> </p><p>At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. </p><p>If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.</p><p></p><p></p><p><b>Employment Type:</b></p>Full time<p></p><p></p><p><b><b>Type of Role:</b></b></p>Regular<p></p><p></p><p></p><p>Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.</p><p></p><p></p><p></p>Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.
Title: Expert, Business Intelligence & Analytics

Job_Description: <strong>Senior Vision Developer (2 open positions)</strong> <br/><br/> Senstar Corporation has been safeguarding people, places and property with the world’s largest portfolio of perimeter intrusion detection sensors for over 35 years. Now combined with world-class video management systems and analytics (formerly Aimetis), Senstar offers a comprehensive suite of proven technologies that work together to reduce complexity, improve performance and unify support. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Position</strong> <br/><br/> Senstar is looking for talented individuals to push the boundaries of video analytics and build the next generation of smart surveillance software. As part of a highly-skilled team of researchers and software engineers, you will use cutting edge advancements in deep learning to build solutions for real-world surveillance problems like multi-camera tracking, person re-identification, facial recognition, and license plate recognition. At Senstar, you will develop systems that will be rapidly deployed in production at customer sites around the world. <br/><br/> You need strong understanding of at least two of the following:  <ul>  <li> <div>Convolution neural networks (CNN) - particularly training deep neural networks for detection and classification.</div></li>   <li> <div>Multi-target tracking and detection-based tracking.</div></li>   <li> <div>Facial Recognition.</div></li>   <li> <div>Person Re-Identification.</div></li>   <li> <div>License Plate Detection and Recognition.</div></li>   </ul> <strong>You will:</strong>  <ul>  <li> <div>Research and develop computer vision algorithms for cutting-edge surveillance applications.</div></li>   <li> <div>Create efficient, production-ready systems complete with automated tests and performance metrics.</div></li>   <li> <div>Work with the product team and customers to discover new ways that AI can revolutionize video analytics.</div></li>   <li> <div>Be fluent in English and have strong written, oral, and presentation skills.</div></li>   </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  <li> <div>MS / PhD specializing in Computer Vision/Machine Learning or Bachelors with equivalent experience</div></li>   <li> <div>3+ years of experience in C++</div></li>   <li> <div>3+ years of experience designing and implementing computer vision algorithms</div></li>   <li> <div>Experience with libraries such as OpenCV, IPP, Tensorflow, Caffe</div></li>   <li> <div>Experience deploying machine learning / computer vision algorithms for real world problems</div></li>   <li> <div>Some experience in Matlab/Octave and Python</div></li>   <li> <div>Willing to travel occasionally</div></li>   </ul> <strong>Location</strong> <br/><br/> Waterloo, Ontario, Canada
Title: Sr. Vision Developer

Job_Description: About the role<br/>   <div>The Support Operations team at Shopify is responsible for supporting and enabling our Merchant Support team. Our mission is to make conversations effortless and valuable. To do that we support, manage, develop and implement business systems that power the thousands of conversations our Merchant Support team has everyday. From self-help through to matching a merchant and a Guru and all the tools they need to get their job done. <br/><br/> The Support team is fast evolving and fast moving, that means we need to be faster and work to anticipate requests and solve problems before they happen. To do that we’re looking for a Program Manager to help us manage and ship projects. <br/><br/> In this role is based in our Ottawa head office, you’ll be working closely with Stakeholders, Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and other teams within Support to ship projects from concept through to delivery. You’ll be managing cross-team projects that impact business systems that drive our Support team. We’re not a traditional Contact Centre and neither is our approach to how we solve problems. You’ll need to take your knowledge of best practices and tailor them to our culture. <br/><br/> This will require oversight and understanding of the various ongoing projects and requests. You will help to drive projects forward, manage priority with the Senior Support Leadership Team and keep all stakeholders updated. And, you’ll have a great opportunity to shape the future of the Support Operations team and impact thousands of conversations a day.</div> <br/>  <div> <div> <div> Responsibilities<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>Manage a portfolio of projects and assist in building and improving project management best practices across the team.</li><li>Define project scope, timelines and resources needed to ship projects.</li><li>Draft project briefs, RFP/RFQ documents, and heavily engage in vendor selection and management.</li><li>Capture and provide transparency to project plans, status, and issues to project teams, stakeholders and the Senior Support Leadership Team.</li><li>Collaborate with product owners and business stakeholders to document epics and user stories, and build project backlogs.</li><li>Work with product owners and business analysts to build project backlogs including epics and user stories.</li><li>Take teams through Scrum ceremonies on an operational level.</li><li>Help teams to recognize and produce Agile artifacts.</li><li>Proactively monitor and assess team health and project needs.</li><li>Report on budget, schedule and resource allocation.</li><li>Act as and/or work with product manager to craft product roadmaps.</li><li>Manage release train.</li><li>Collaborate with the Senior Support Leadership team on priority of cross-departmental projects that the team will tackle.</li><li>Define project team roles and responsibilities and drive task completion.</li><li>Define acceptance criteria for each activity and deliverable.</li><li>Create an environment where everyone on the team has the opportunity to be creative and influence decisions.</li> <li>Hold the team and stakeholders accountable to deadlines and commitments.</li><li>Determine the downstream impact of change to workflows and behaviours and work with stakeholders to maximize user adoption.</li></ul></div> </div></div> <div> <div> Requirements for the role:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>Years of experience; We won’t count up your years of experience, but the content of those years is important.</li><li>Expert level experience in project management methodologies and practices (Waterfall, Agile/SCRUM).</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as relationship building skills.</li><li>20% travel is expected.</li><li>Able to improve our time to ship and reduce delays.</li><li>Good understanding of Machine Learning and AI.</li><li>Overriding ambition and proactive nature combined with the ability to inspire others.</li><li>Problem solver. Evaluate the impact and scope of changes and determine the impact to delivery dates and assess options.</li><li>Find new opportunities to grow yourself and those around you.</li><li>Explore technologies, improve project management and agile practice.</li><li>Results driven–always. Must be willing to do what it takes to make each project or task a success. All within a healthy work-life balance!</li><li>Curious; ask questions to adequately understand needs, assess impact, anticipate potential roadblocks, and mitigate risk.</li></ul></div> </div></div> <div> <div> Projects you could work on:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>Customer Relationship Management (CRM),</li><li>Call Centre and IVR tools,</li><li>Forums, Knowledge Management tools and other type of platforms,</li><li>Other projects for sure.</li></ul></div> </div></div> <div> <div> What you'll get at Shopify:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>A collaborative, creative environment where we value experimentation and learning</li><li>Autonomy. We don’t believe in micro-management.</li><li>A healthy work-life balance with flexible benefits including health and wellness perks, parental leave, flexible work hours, and catered meals to give you more time for the things you care about most</li><li>Learning and growing with the best in the business and getting the support you need to do the best work of your career</li><li>A culture that values authenticity, openness, and diversity</li></ul></div> </div></div></div> <br/>We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time! <br/><br/> Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, consider applying. We know that diversity of thought makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.
Title: Agile Project Manager

Job_Description: Position Overview <br/><br/> As a member of the Mi9 Intelligence R&D team, you will be contributing to a best-in-breed Retail Analytics/Business Intelligence solution – while using the latest technologies, adding new and enhancing existing features. The position is based in our Toronto office, which includes on-site parking, and on-site gym, and regular company-sponsored lunches and social events. <br/><br/> What you’ll be doing  <ul> <li>Design, develop, and modify database objects, SQL scripts/procedures, and ETL</li>  <li>Gather and analyze business requirements, and transform them into innovative analytical solutions.</li>  <li>Contribute to design, architecture, and development standards and best practices on product development team</li>  <li>Research and engage in technical product roadmap development, including Cloud BI development, big data, and AI/Machine Learning initiatives.</li>  <li>Analyze industry trends and latest analytical trends, and suggest opportunities for product enhancements and new features</li>  <li>Troubleshoot, optimize, analyze, and improve SQL performance of reports, dashboards, and ETL.</li>  <li>Mentor other developers and participate in peer review</li>  <li>Participate in Agile Scrum processes as a member of a Scrum team</li>  <li>Some travel may be required (less than 25%)</li> </ul> The impact you’ll have <br/><br/> You will be contributing to our industry-leading Analytics Solution, used by many retail companies to make the right strategic business decisions. Depending on your experience, you may also have opportunities to mentor junior members of the team. <br/><br/> What you bring to the table <br/><br/> Required  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field</li>  <li>2+ Years of experience as a database/SQL/BI developer</li>  <li>Strong Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence knowledge</li>  <li>Excellent knowledge of Microsoft T-SQL</li>  <li>Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2016/2017 and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)</li>  <li>Very strong problem solving and analytical skills</li>  <li>Excellent teamwork and communication skills</li>  <li>A demonstrated dedication to continuous learning</li> </ul> Nice to have  <ul> <li>Experience with AWS (and Redshift in particular), Azure, or other Cloud-based data warehouse/BI solutions.</li>  <li>Experience with data science/machine learning languages, tools, packages (e.g. scikit-learn, Tensorflow, R)</li> </ul> <strong>About Mi9 Retail</strong><br/> <div>Mi9 Retail is committed to helping retailers create great experiences for their customers – online, in store, or wherever they occur. We believe that a great experience takes place when optimized product planning and inventory management intersects with skillful customer engagement and point-of-purchase execution. We are a rapidly growing tech company that develops leading Demand Management, Merchandising, Business Intelligence, e-Commerce and Point of Sale systems for large and mid-sized retail enterprises. Our clients include globally recognized names, including Levi’s, Abercrombie & Fitch, BevMo!, Billabong, Dolce & Gabbana, Tommy Bahama, Barney’s New York, Tory Burch, Home Depot, and Nike. Our global and diverse workforce has driven our significant growth, and our commitment to outstanding customer service earned us the top vendor in retail concentration designation from the RIS Software LeaderBoard for 2017. We’re on a mission to make the retail industry great! <br/><br/> We are a successful, global, fast-growing company with a start-up work vibe, where your ideas will be heard and you can have an impact. Are at the forefront of tech and the retail industry. We are passionate about our clients and live/breathe the client experience. We believe in autonomy, taking initiative and holding each other accountable for shared success </div><br/>  <div><strong>Free parking onsite.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Local candidates only.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Must be legally authorized to work without visa sponsorship for employment.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Mi9 Retail is an Equal Opportunity Employer.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>No phone calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Mi9 Retail participates in e-Verify for all positions based in our US offices. For more information, please click here (English | Español).</strong></div> <br/>
Title: BI/Analytics Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>What it’s like working at CBC/Radio-Canada</strong></div> <div><div>At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance.</div> <br/> <div>Do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? Whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to Canadians.</div></div> <div></div> <div><strong>Your team:</strong></div> <br/> <div><div>CBC Digital Products is the country’s biggest digital startup, taking on the challenges of innovating how media is made, sent and received. We are also part of Canada’s oldest and truest broadcasting company. We are trying new things. We are growing. As an entity of our own. As a voice for our country. As a team.</div><br/> <div>Digital is a part of our present and all of our future. CBC’s strategy is focused on becoming a digital-first organization that provides a digital platform for storytellers. Our mission is to engage our audience with stories they care about.</div> <br/> <div><strong>The opportunity:</strong></div><br/> <div>If you want to enter the world of digital media and be part of the change and growth of one of Canada’s long-established and respected broadcasters, this is your chance. CBC Digital Products is looking a Senior Systems Integration Developer to join our AV Platform team and drive the integration of our Digital Audio/Video Systems that deliver on-demand and live audio and video content to millions of Canadians. It is a highly collaborative, high exposure role with a chance to attend highly specific A/V integration conferences in Canada and the US.</div><br/> <div>CBC’s Audio/Video Content Management System comprises of a suite of tools used to manage the vast library of on-demand and live streaming content. Our new Integration Developer will implement and enhance the systems, workflows and presentation of A/V streaming on all platforms. As part of a core team supporting the bigger organization, this is an opportunity to work with live broadcasting machinery and content and interact with all of the teams in the department and teams across the organization.</div><br/> <div>If you're passionate about Canada and you love technology, learning and bringing out the best in others, you’ll love working at CBC.</div> <br/> <div><strong>Who you are and where are you now?</strong></div><br/> <div>You are a Backend Developer with a focus on integrating systems and implementing workflows for large amounts of audio or video streaming content. You are looking for new challenges and an opportunity to spearhead both new development and the modernization of connecting the workflows and systems.You want to join an organization that is shifting towards digital-on-demand for the web. You want to make an impact bringing forward new tools and ideas that will meet the demand of a national audience and support the internal stakeholders’ need to digitally deliver as much content as we can efficiently.</div> <br/> <div><strong>What’s in it for you?</strong></div><br/> <div><strong><u>C</u></strong>utting edge tech. CBC has more than 25 digital sites, all of which are mandated to reach Canadians online everywhere and every way, with a high emphasis on mobile devices. To achieve that goal, with no down-time, takes a robust infrastructure, powerful technologies, reliable solutions and rewarding work. Java, JEE, PHP and Python are just part of our rich technology landscape.</div> <br/> <div><strong><u>B</u></strong>elonging. CBC/Radio-Canada is a Canadian institution. By joining our dynamic Digital Products team, you will be exposed to the best of all worlds. Corporate. Public. Startup. You will be part of a team that embraces diversity and at its core, truly cares about the country and the world.</div> <br/> <div><strong><u>C</u></strong>areer growth. CBC is fully invested in our people. Whatever it is you want to pursue whether it’s a new programming language or a technical solution, whether it’s expanding your Agile knowledge or building an audience-facing platform. We will provide you with the time, resources and championing that you need to keep your career here rewarding.</div> <br/> <div><strong>How you will contribute to the team, you will:</strong></div><br/> <div>  <ul> <li>Provide technical expertise for online digital Audio/Video systems. You will integrate multiple complex systems to ensure the successful delivery of A/V content.</li><li>Collaborate with internal groups. You will work closely with Engineering, Media Presentation, IT, Content Producers, Revenue, etc. to achieve integration.</li><li>Build and implement key deliverables. You will develop delivery systems for streamlining live Audio/Video workflows; middleware custom tools using various APIs; and more.</li><li>Manage the production systems. You will oversee the complete development and support lifecycle of specific systems. You will provide quality product support to end-users.</li></ul></div> </div> <br/> <div><div><strong>What you bring:</strong></div><br/> <div>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent.</li><li>The direct experience. You have three years experience in software development (Java, Python, PHP), with a focus on integrating systems. You have a proven track record of administering an Audio Video delivery system. You have experience operating in Windows, Apple and Unix environments and have a working knowledge of Apache, Tomcat, Docker/Containers, Cloud services.</li><li>The hands-on A/V technical knowledge. You have a passion for the technologies and workflows relating to online A/V presentation, with hands-on experience using:  <ul> <li>Akamai or other CDN media delivery.</li><li>Video Streaming Delivery Protocols (RTMP, HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, UDP).</li><li>Video Formats and Codecs (HLS, HDS, MP4, MPEG-DASH, CMAF, AV1, etc.).</li><li>Video Encoders (FFMPEG, Digital Rapids, Vantage, Elemental).</li></ul></li> <li>The desire to learn. You have a keen interest in AI, Machine Learning, Product Intelligence. You can quickly pick up new tools and technologies including Video CMS such as the Platform or Brightcove; Google Advertising Platform (DFP) or Freewheel.</li><li>The communication skills. You know how to listen and relay empathy and understanding for diverse perspectives.</li><li>The Agile approach. You believe in the Agile methodology deeply, but you are flexible and open to the real-world twists and turns.</li><li>The flexibility. You are available to participate in a rotating on-call shift one out of every four or five weeks, for which you will earn additional compensation.</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Why join us?</strong> </div><br/> <div>CBC/Radio-Canada reflects the Canadian identity and promotes democracy. We are rooted in the communities we serve and committed to sharing stories as Canadians live them, each and every day.
