Job_Description: <DIV><B>WHO WE´RE LOOKING FOR?</B> </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B></B> </DIV> <DIV><B>Core Skills & Qualifications</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>5+ years of experience with software development and architecture, including prototyping and rapid development processes</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>3+ years of experience leading software development projects, or acting as a solution architect (or an equivalent role)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>3+ years of experience in developing with Java / Kotlin / Scala (including Spring Boot) </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>3+ years of experience in developing front and backend solutions with JavaScript (specifically ES6), e.g. with Node.js, Typescript / Flow, React.js / React.native, Angular</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>3+ years of experience in architecting full stack solutions, including expertise in at least two of the following domains: Business/Enterprise Architecture, Application Architecture, Infrastructure Architecture, Data/Information Architecture</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>2+ years of experience in HTML and CSS for responsive web design</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>2+ years of experience in RESTful API design and implementation, including API documentation (Swagger/OAI, RAML), API versioning, Data formats (JSON, XML) and data serialization (Protobuf, Thrift)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>2+ years of experience in testing and test automation of full stack solutions (behavior, unit, integration/system, e2e, load; e.g. with Cucumber, Selenium, Gatling, Karma, Jasmin, Jest, etc.)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>1+ years of experience in monolith application decomposition and microservices architectures including Domain Driven Design (DDD), design patterns, polyglot persistency with emphasis on NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redis, etc.) and Modern fast data streaming architectures and frameworks (e.g. Kafka, Kinesis)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>1+ years of experience in modern DevOps workflows (including tools such as Git, Jira, Jenkins, Maven/Gradle), Containers (Docker and Kunernetes) and PaaS (OpenShift, CloudFoundry)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>1+ years of experience in agile methodologies (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>1+ years of experience in Linux and scripting skills</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>It is currently our objective to assign our people to work on Liquid Studio projects in the Greater Toronto Area. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients our employees must be available to travel when needed (up to 20%)</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B>Bonus Skills (Not Mandatory)</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Bachelor Degree or higher in Computer Science</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Scrum Master certificate and experience</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience in AI and machine learning</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience in Functional programming</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience in implementing API gateways</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience in native Mobile development</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience in VR/AR development</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>WHAT´S IN IT FOR YOU? </B></DIV> <UL> <LI>Competitive benefits, including a fair and balanced parental leave policy.</LI> <LI>Fantastic opportunities to develop your career across industries, local and global clients</LI> <LI>Performance Achievement and Career Mentorship our performance management process that focuses on your strengths, progress and career possibilities.</LI> <LI>Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work.</LI></UL> <DIV>To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired from Day 1, please visit our website at accenture.ca/careers.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients our employees must be available to travel when needed.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces.<BR> <BR>We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functionsunderpinned by the worlds largest delivery networkAccenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 442,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV> </DIV>
Title: Accenture Innovation Center - Full Stack Architect/Lead

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> Technology works as a strategic partner with Morgan Stanley business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Morgan Stanley's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modelling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients' businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Corporate and Funding Technology is comprised of three primary areas: Operations & Risk, Corporate and Client Financing. <br/><br/> Operations & Risk helps the Firm’s businesses while maintaining a strong risk profile. The group includes Operations, Funding, Finance and Risk Technology. <br/><br/> Corporate improves our operating environment and is made up of Legal, Compliance & Corporate Governance, Digital & Corporate Communications and Human Resources Technology groups. <br/><br/> Client Financing platforms provide technology and service to our hedge fund and Asia high-net-worth clients. Groups include Prime Brokerage, Private Wealth Management Asia and Counterparty Risk Technology. <br/><br/> Position Description: <br/><br/> Client Technologies, with over 10,000 users across the Firm, form a consistent set of platforms for Operational control of client servicing activities. It was one of the first areas to start the journey of advanced automation with cognitive solutions leveraging Machine Learning in email-workflows and reconciliations. With the recent focus on, and demand for, automation across a spectrum of options, Client Technologies has established a new focus area to provide intelligent tooling that seamlessly integrates core services and practices necessary for the success of AI solutions. <br/> We are looking for a candidate with strong programming abilities with deep knowledge of systems architecture to lead the role of DevOps. Preferred candidates should be well-organized with a solid record of leading and delivering automation solutions at scale. <br/><br/> Key Responsibilities: <br/><br/> - Technical analysis and software development   <ul> <li>Infrastructure engineering for stability and scalability, capacity planning</li> <li>Architecture and system design</li> <li>Develop, maintain and track detailed delivery plans</li> <li>Hands on development, testing, change management (full SDLC) <br/><br/> Skills Required: <br/><br/> - Hands on Core Java skill is a must</li> <li>Hands on with build and continuous integration tools (Ant, Gradle, Jenkins)</li> <li>Unix/Linux, K-Shell/Python, and Automation build</li> <li>Agile development methodologies such as Scrum and XP</li> <li>Able to identify project risks and dependencies before they become issues, drive mitigation where possible and escalate where not</li> <li>Able to communicate effectively and confidently with colleagues of all levels of seniority, from different backgrounds and based in other (global) locations</li> <li>Strategic thinker with a commercial and pragmatic approach</li> <li>Have strong analytical skills and be a creative thinker, able to analyze an issue and help develop multiple solutions <br/><br/> Nice to have: <br/><br/> - Service Design Concepts and Functional Development concepts</li> <li>Hands on TDD practice using JUnit, Mockito, code coverage and other related tools</li> <li>Banking / Financial Services experience is a plus <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential. <br/><br/> </li> </ul>
Title: Dev Ops Lead

Job_Description: <strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Durham College is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from qualified individuals, including members of visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities.</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>RESEARCHERS (Part-time)</strong> <br/><br/> Durham College is seeking experienced and motivated professionals who share our commitment to quality and student success. The Office of Research Services, Innovation and Entrepreneurship is currently seeking applications from qualified individuals who are interested in joining the AI Hub, on a part-time, project-based contract to oversee the development of real-world solutions for industry partners through applied research and knowledge transfer projects. <br/><br/> Teams of expert faculty, students and recent graduates collaborate with industry partners and their staff to deliver innovative AI-based solutions to pressing business problems and opportunities. Projects can include producing and testing prototypes, evaluating new technologies, and developing new or improved products or processes for small- and medium-sized businesses (SMEs). All projects are funded by provincial or federal government grants. <br/><br/> The AI Hub is located at the Oshawa Campus and provides SMEs access to facilities, equipment, technical expertise, and project services to assist them in product development, technology adoption, expansion into new markets and commercialization of new products, services and processes. <br/><br/> <strong>The responsibilities of Durham College researchers include, but are not limited to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Conducting applied research projects in collaboration with college staff and industry partners.</li>  <li>Developing work plans in collaboration with industry partners, including specific resource requirements, milestones and deliverables.</li>  <li>Identifying human resource needs and interviewing / hiring student research assistants.</li>  <li>Supervising student research assistants.</li>  <li>Providing technical expertise and leadership for applied research projects.</li>  <li>Preparing and implementing dissemination activities, including assisting Research Assistants in the preparation of final materials/reports.</li>  <li>Assisting college staff and students with development and completion of final reports and collection of metrics.</li>  <li>Assisting with follow-up activities with industry clients or funders.</li>  <li>Presenting findings at internal and external events, including conferences and seminars, as required.</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>The ideal candidate will meet or exceed the following qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>An undergraduate degree in Computing Science, Information Technology, Business or a related field, preferably a masters degree.</li>  <li>Three to five years of relevant industry experience and demonstrated ability in fields and technologies relevant to project opportunities.</li>  <li>Demonstrated research skills and project delivery abilities preferably with experience carrying out research projects.</li>  <li>Excellent organizational and time management skills, with excellent attention to detail, and the ability to multi-task and prioritize projects.</li>  <li>Strong written and verbal communication and analytical skills, with ability to work and communicate effectively in an office environment with frequent interruptions and dynamic deadlines.</li>  <li>Proficient computer skills with recent working knowledge of Microsoft applications (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) in a Windows environment.</li>  <li>Self-motivated and independent worker who also functions well in a collaborative team environment.</li>  <li>Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to present and interact with a variety of stakeholders including students, other faculty members, support staff, administrators, other departments within the college and with external partners.</li>  <li>Uncompromised commitment to confidentiality.</li> </ul> <strong>The ideal candidate will possess the following technical skills:</strong>  <ul> <li>Established track record of delivering commercial projects involving Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Recommendation Systems, Pattern Recognition, Large Scale Data Mining.</li>  <li>Experience with deep learning applications in speech, vision, audio, NLP, semantic analysis, and/or multi-modal data.</li>  <li>Experience in open source deep learning frameworks including TensorFlow, MXNet, Theano, and/or Caffe. Solid understanding of underlying algorithmic and architectural concepts.</li>  <li>Hands-on coding experience with C/C++, Python, Scala, Lua, R, Matlab, and/or Java.</li>  <li>Strong experience with systems for large scale data analysis including Spark, Hadoop, Kafka and their subcomponents.</li> </ul> <strong>Working conditions:</strong>  <ul> <li>Up to 24 hours per week, Monday to Friday.</li>  <li>Occasional weekend and evening hours may be required.</li>  <li>Some travel to industry partner premises.</li> </ul> To apply, please submit your resume online below. <br/><br/> Durham College provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring Durham College provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process. If you require this information in alternate format; require communication supports; an accommodation in applying for a posting and/or if you are selected for an interview, please contact our Human Resources (HR) department and an HR assistant will work with you to meet your needs. <br/><br/> T: 905.721.3073 <br/><br/> F: 905.721.3134 <br/><br/> E: HumanResources@durhamcollege.ca <br/><br/> In person: Campus Corners building, 2069 Simcoe Street North, Oshawa, ON. <br/><br/> <strong>Please apply below by submitting your cover letter and resume to the online portal. Applications will be accepted until 4:00 pm on May 22, 2018. Competition number SP18-07.</strong> <br/><br/> We thank you for your interest in employment with Durham College however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.<br/><br/>Required Skills <br/><br/> <strong>Required Experience</strong> <br/>
Title: Researchers (Part-Time)

Job_Description: <div>Location: Toronto- Canada</div><div>Job ID: 18WD27796</div><br/> <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><div>Autodesk Research is seeking a highly motivated and seasoned Software Engineer with Management skills to work within the User Interface Research group to develop robust research prototypes and to assist in productization efforts. Projects will focus on interactive visualizations, AI/machine learning, software learnability, and AR/VR. The role will involve 70> software engineering and 30> managing a small team of software engineers. You will work closely with Research Scientists to build state of the art systems (full stack development) and maintain awareness and research the most recent APIs / Technologies / Architectures / SDKs / Cloud Services / etc. to ensure strategic decisions are made for projects. If you are a hands-on Software Engineer that enjoys working in a dynamic, fast-paced team with innovative technologies, we would love to hear from you!</div><br/> <div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Manage and lead a team of software developers, while also contributing as a developer</li><li>Work closely with scientists to implement software systems for research projects</li><li>Plan and manage the successful completion of software development releases</li><li>Prototype, design, code, test, debug, document, deploy and maintain production-quality applications and software components</li><li>Collaborate with product teams to transfer code into products</li><li>Keep abreast of technology industry trends, solutions, standards and methodologies</li><li>Maintain awareness of relevant development efforts in other organizations within Autodesk</li><li>Provide encouragement to team members, including communicating team goals and identifying areas for new training or skill checks</li><li>Create an inspiring team environment with an open communication culture</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Significant experience with both front- and back-end web development; Modern Javascript, Node.js; HTML, CSS; UI frameworks (React, Vue.js); NoSQL databases; RESTful APIs</li><li>Experience with revision control systems (GitHub)</li><li>Experience with test- (or behavior-) driven development; automated testing</li><li>Experience with applying Agile software development methodologies</li><li>Ability to learn quickly and to adapt to frequent change</li><li>Ability to communicate effectively and to collaborate across organizations</li><li>Performance management; team management</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Experience with cloud development and architectures (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)</li><li>Experience with computer graphics and web frameworks (Three.js)</li><li>Experience with data visualization and web frameworks (D3.js)</li><li>Experience with web analytics</li><li>Experience with machine learning and frameworks (TensorFlow)</li><li>Experience with GraphQL; containerization (Docker); SQL databases; Webassembly</li><li>Experience with mobile application development (Android and/or iOS)</li><li>Experience with C , Python, Go, Rust</li><li>Knowledge of user interface design concepts</li><li>Knowledge of Autodesk products</li></ul></div><br/>  <div></div>
Title: Software Development Manager

Job_Description: <DIV><B>Join our team</B></DIV> <DIV><BR></DIV> <P>The Network & Supply Transformation - Strategic Analytics team is unique as it combines a strong management consulting-style strategy practice with the expertise of data science. This allows the team to tackle a broad range of problems that span marketing, procurement, supply chain, customer experience and technology. The diverse and complementary blend of backgrounds: telecommunications and non- telecommunications, Master of Business Administration (MBA), Master of Science (MSc) and Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) is our strength, enabling us to learn from each other and better translate analytical insights into recommendations or opportunities for stakeholders.</P> <DIV><BR></DIV> <P>Our team provides data intelligence and predictive models on which senior leaders make strategic decisions impacting growth, operational excellence and technology investments. We unabashedly admit to being drawn to things we’re unfamiliar with or the unknown, learning about them, and leverage data science to introduce new concepts and challenge the status quo. Our team takes pride in earning a reputation for being collaborative partners and knowing that the many transformational programs and initiatives can be traced back to our data science expertise.</P> <DIV><BR></DIV> <P><B>Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together</B></P> <DIV><BR></DIV> <P>As a Data Scientist, you’re in great company, working alongside some of the brightest and unpretentious data scientists and strategy consultants. You’ll propose, guide and lead the way we tackle diverse problems and data sets to solve complex business problems. Your work will help transform and inform strategic decision making, improve capital deployment plans, and enhance revenue opportunities and customer experiences. More specifically, you’ll customize the “how to” identify, extract and transform the data needed to perform analysis to inform capital optimization decisions, causal relationships between investment decisions and business outcomes, and enhance revenue opportunities. </P> <P><BR></P> <P>Applying thought leadership, you’ll combine your expert knowledge of networks and business analytics in applying machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) to drive actions and decisions. Our partnership with the Vector Institute will ensure you can leverage leading research in AI. In close collaboration with teams across the company, you’ll seek out various data sources and identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. This role will shape transformational strategies and you’ll be presenting your findings, ideas and project updates the senior executive sponsor.</P> <DIV><BR></DIV> <DIV><B>Here’s how</B></DIV> <UL> <LI>Leading, managing and prioritizing multiple, concurrent projects in an “Agile” environment from conception to delivery</LI> <LI>Leading analytics projects to support the strategic product direction, sales and customer efforts</LI> <LI>Supporting project teams to overcoming challenges by helping to remove roadblocks and developing options and solutions</LI> <LI>Evaluating and providing input on potential business intelligence solutions</LI> <LI>Communicating findings in simple terms, including in a visual format</LI> <LI>Quantifying, capturing and articulating the value on insights and recommendations to business leaders and executives in order to influence how business challenges and opportunities are approached</LI> <LI>Collaborating across business unit and industry subject matter experts to develop data driven solutions to solves business problems and challenges</LI> <LI>Partner with other data science teams to develop best practices for adopting and expanding the use of machine learning and AI</LI></UL> <DIV><B>You’re the missing piece of the puzzle</B></DIV> <UL> <LI>Regarded as collaborative, creative, entrepreneurial and willing to experiment</LI> <LI>Sought out for your application of data mining, predictive modeling, statistics and other analytical techniques to solve diverse business problems in a data rich environment</LI> <LI>Noted for your understanding of data warehouse/Hadoop architecture, ETL processes and the software development lifecycle (Waterfall and Agile/Scrum)</LI> <LI>Respected for your ability to develop experimental and analytic plans for data modeling processes</LI> <LI>Known for building strong relationships across the organization and with vendors</LI> <LI>Confident in engaging with and making presentation to executive leaders</LI> <LI>Product development or business development experience</LI> <LI>5 or more years’ data analytics related experience in a matrix or consulting environment</LI> <LI>Master or Doctor of Philosophy degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree with a strong foundation in Modeling, Statistics, Analytics, Engineering or Math</LI></UL> <DIV><B>Great-to-haves</B></DIV> <DIV><BR></DIV> <DIV>Experience with:</DIV> <UL> <LI>Data visualization using Tableau, Qlikview, or Domo</LI> <LI>Hadoop data extraction using frameworks like Hive and from MPP platforms</LI> <LI>Real time streaming analytics such as Spark</LI> <LI>SQL, MySQL, Aginity, Oracle, R, Python, Java, SAS, SPSS</LI> <LI>Deep Learning such as RNN, LSTM, etc</LI></UL> <DIV><BR> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Who is TELUS?</B></DIV> <DIV><BR></DIV> <DIV>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</DIV> <DIV><BR></DIV> <DIV>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</DIV> <DIV><BR></DIV> <DIV>Do you share our passion?</DIV> <DIV><BR></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><BR></DIV> <DIV>At TELUS, <B>you </B>create future friendly® possibilities.</DIV> <DIV><BR></DIV> <DIV>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</DIV></DIV>
Title: Data Scientist - Strategic Analytics

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><P>EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax and transaction advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, Ernst & Young continually strives to be a great place to work.</P> <P> </P> <P>EY's Financial Accounting Advisory Services – Systems, Processes & Analytics (FAAS – SPA) group specializes in advising Finance leaders on relevant and emerging issues and trends within the Finance function. Central to the effectiveness of the Finance function is its ability to partner with internal and external stakeholders to drive critical business insights and support strategic decision making and growth. We understand the evolving role of the CFO and Finance function and work with our clients to automate and streamline Efficiency, Control and Compliance functions, while simultaneously improving the value Finance provides to the organization. We assist our clients with business and internal finance performance improvement initiatives by providing business advisory services that result in the achievement of measurable benefits in financial and operational effectiveness, controls and strategic decision making.</P> <P> </P> <P>As a FAAS – SPA Senior Consultant, you will actively establish, maintain and strengthen internal and external relationships. You will help to develop long-term client relationships and networks, as well as develop relationships with team members across all EY practices to service client needs. By drawing on your financial process knowledge and experience, you will provide innovative commercial insights for clients, adapt methods and practices to fit operational team and cultural needs and contribute to thought leadership. You will actively contribute to improving financial processes, operational and reporting efficiency, and in assisting the finance function drive business insight and effective decision support. FAAS – SPA focuses on three main areas including Advanced processes, FAASTech and Analytics and data intelligence. Your role as a FAAS – SPA Senior Consultant will focus on leading projects and business development activities under the FAASTech and Analytics and data intelligence pillars and supporting the activities of our Advanced process teams.</P> <P> </P> <P><U>Analytics and data intelligence</U></P> <P> </P> <P>IT infrastructure changes significantly and rapidly. New IT applications and infrastructure like big data technologies, predictive and prescriptive analytics and modern mathematical methods are opening up new possibilities for gathering and processing large amounts of data and opportunities to generate value from the client's financial data. This is why analytics is on everybody's agenda.</P> <P> </P> <P>To be ahead of the game, clients need to be prepared and take advantage of the opportunities analytics offers. EY's FAAS – SPA group is specifically focusing on different types of financial and data analytics to support the CFO agenda. FAAS analytics is the collection, combination and manipulation of financial data to help clients create insights that support the decision-making processes. This allows clients to improve accounting data integrity and quality, enabling them to produce more reliable reports and insights within the accounting, finance, governance and regulatory space.</P> <P> </P> <P><U>FAASTech</U></P> <P> </P> <P>FAASTech is the EY FAAS business model that unites FAAS' core accounting competencies with IT capabilities to deliver enhanced value to our clients. FAASTech projects typically fall into one of three categories:</P> <P> </P> <P>·  We provide the client with a specialized EY application or tool</P> <P>·  We tailor a commercial application (e.g., MS SharePoint or SAP) to the client's needs</P> <P>·  We assist the client by enabling their existing application or tools</P> <P> </P> <P><U>Advanced processes</U></P> <P><BR></P> <P>We provide efficient, sophisticated and reliable control methods, which enable our clients to reduce the cost of process monitoring, add value from available data and establish effective continuous monitoring to reach the next level of process assurance.</P> <P> </P> <P>In line with our commitment to quality, you'll consistently support CFO agenda discussions and assist in driving projects to completion, by ensuring work products and deliverables are issued timely and are of high quality. Your role in leading work streams and mentoring junior staff on engagements will depend on the size of engagement and will be under the responsibility of higher levels. They will look to you to anticipate and identify risks and escalate issues as appropriate, while ensuring you are building on your experience and subject matter knowledge.</P> <P> </P> <P>As an influential member of the team, you'll help to create a positive learning culture and will coach and counsel junior team members and help them to develop. </P> <P> </P> <P><BR> </P>                   <div>  <P><B>Client responsibilities</B></P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Participate in external client consulting engagements involving the advancement of the CFO agenda, looking at a company’s internal finance and accounting processes, building and analyzing complex data using a variety of big data technologies and analytics tools, assist in modeling, visualization and communication of key financial and operational metrics, and providing clients with smart solutions to enable reliable reporting, drive insights into the business, and support proactive decision-making</DIV></LI></UL> <P>·  Stay informed of analytical solutions and standards that affect business processes and apply analytical approaches under the supervision of higher level staff;</P> <P>·  Participate in business development initiatives, including service offering and proposal development; </P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Assist in managing the financial and commercial aspects of engagements by organizing staffing, tracking fees and communicating issues to project leaders; and </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Build strong internal relationships across EY’s service lines including Assurance, Advisory, Tax and Transaction Services.</DIV></LI></UL> <P> <B>Qualifications</B></P> <P>To qualify, candidates must possess: </P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Relevant knowledge of data analysis and strong analytical skills in related software, including data extraction and transformation, VBA, Alteryx, ACL, MS SQL Server, Teradata, SQL SSIS, MS Excel/Access </DIV></LI></UL> <P>·  Relevant knowledge of analytics tools including BI/data visualization, OBIEE, Tableau, QlikView, Spotfire, MicroStrategy - MS Power BI etc. </P> <P>·  Relevant knowledge of RPA software platforms including Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, UiPath, WorkFusion, Pegasystems etc; and other relevant AI and machine learning toolsets</P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Knowledge of accounting systems application such as SAP, Oracle / PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, MFG Pro, Extensity, etc.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Relevant knowledge of emerging blockchain technologies and business applications</DIV></LI></UL> <P>·  Knowledge and working experience on business processes including record to report, plan-to-perform, order-to-cash, and procure-to-pay</P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Performance measurement and performance management</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Project and change management</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to think critically and identify creative solutions outside of the box and thrive on new challenges</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Dedication to teamwork and leadership, with experience in managing and/or mentoring junior staff and providing direction to team members</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Excellent communication skills including verbal, written, and presentation</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>A high level of motivation and a self-starting attitude</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>A willingness to travel on short notice to meet client needs</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong academic record including a bachelor's degree in Computer Science and approximately 3 - 5 years of related work experience; or a graduate degree and approximately 3 years of related work experience</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Professional designation and/or qualification i.e. MBA, CA, CPA and/or relevant Developer Certifications are an asset</DIV></LI></UL> <P><B>EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply</B></P> <DIV><BR></DIV>  </div>            </div>  </div>  </div>     </div> 	</div>
Title: Senior Consultant, Financial Accounting Advisory Services – Systems, Processes & Analytics (FAASTech & Analytics and Data Intelligence)

Job_Description: Efficient receipt management is critical to the health of any business. Since 2013, Sensibill has been committed to building an AI-powered tool that makes capturing, organizing, and retrieving receipts as magical as possible. We work with banks to offer our receipt solution through their mobile banking apps. Banking customers use the service to keep track of important receipts for returns, exchanges, expenses, accounting, and taxes. Our mission? We want to give time back to freelancers and small business owners so that they can focus on the things they love. To find out more, visit www.getsensibill.com. <br/><br/> <strong>What does the job entail?</strong> <br/><br/> Lead our research engineers in making next-generation improvements to our AI based receipt processing engine. We're looking for someone who will be comfortable planning and developing R&D projects involving OCR, complex data processing algorithms, NLP and neural networks. You will get an opportunity to work with and learn from brilliant engineers and machine learning researchers and apply the scientific method to help achieve objectives. <br/><br/> A day in the life:  <ul>  <li>Be responsible for continuous improvements in accuracy and efficiency of our core receipt processing IP (engine).</li>    <li>Be a key contributor to the development of the engine and set the bar for efficient and maintainable code.</li>    <li>Organize and mentor a team of algorithm developers and machine learning researchers.</li>    <li>Guide your team in their career development and be responsible for their growth, performance, and evaluation</li>    </ul> A bit about you <br/><br/> We’re a fast-paced start-up, so we need versatile self-starters who are motivated by new technologies, will jump right in and can hit the ground running. We don’t expect to find someone that is a perfect match to the details below, but here are the typical bullet points that we’re hoping you bring to the table:  <ul>  <li>5+ years of experience writing code with a heavy focus on algorithm development or experimental development in a research setting.</li>    <li>5+ years of coding experience outside of academia.</li>    <li>2+ years of experience leading or coaching teams.</li>    <li>The ability to lead and mentor a team of developers and researchers to quickly build and test.</li>    </ul> In a perfect world, you’d also have:  <ul>  <li>Experience with Node.js in a production setting</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>NLP or Machine learning experience, particularly working with neural nets</li>    <li>A relevant post-secondary degree in Computer Science or Engineering.</li>    <li>A near-fanatical zeal for hitting performance targets.</li>    </ul> <strong>What’s in it for me?</strong> <br/><br/> We love #pie. Our culture is like that perfect piece of pie; humble and delivers exactly what you expect. Why #pie? That’s our acronym. We are a team of people that work to #getshitdone, all while ensuring Passion, Integrity, and Excellence. <br/><br/> Joining a startup in the early days is pretty much the greatest adventure you can embark on in your career. You have the opportunity to make meaningful contributions; to make an impact. We are lean, we are smart, and we live for balance – there are no mandatory 60-hour work weeks here. <br/><br/> This is not a top-down culture. We want everyone’s input during critical decisions. To that end, if you have ideas, we want to hear them. Together, we can build out your role, build our product, and our company. We want new core team members who want to invest in us the way we invest in them. We want your ideas, your energy, your skills, your dedication, and if you have any, we’ll take your #receipts too. <br/><br/> <strong>What can I expect when I submit my application?</strong> <br/><br/> A real person will review your application (no bribes or 8x10 glossies please) and either schedule a conversation with you or let you know that we’re passing on your candidacy within 5 business days. <br/><br/> <strong>What if I have more questions before I apply?</strong> <br/><br/> No worries at all! If you have additional questions prior to submitting your application, please feel free to reach out to Omar Khan, our recruiter at omar@getsensibill.com. <br/><br/> <strong>What does the interview process involve?</strong> <br/><br/> The first step is a conversation with Omar. He'll focus on the human side of things and answer any questions you may have. From there, we’ll provide an opportunity for those that exhibit a high potential to be successful in our environment to demonstrate their technical capabilities and then talk shop with some of the Technology team. Assuming you’re one of our finalists, we’ll be sure to give you a tour of the office and introduce you to some of your future teammates. <br/><br/> We’re not just interviewing you. We want to make sure that we’re the right fit for each other, so please feel encouraged to interview us at every step. <br/><br/> Sensibill is an equal opportunity employer. Should you require accommodation in any aspect of our selection process, please contact Omar Khan at omar@getsensibill.com
Title: Lead Algorithm Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Who We Are</strong> <br/><br/> Jibestream is the premier indoor mapping and location platform provider for enterprise organizations. We provide a geospatial platform that allows our customers to solve mission critical problems by integrating business data with indoor maps. <br/><br/> We are transforming the way people engage with indoor spaces. Every day, organizations rely on Jibestream to power their indoor maps to create an enriched experience of place. With a portfolio of high-profile venues deployed globally, including the Pentagon, World Trade Center, Mall of the Emirates, various Department of Defence hospitals and hundreds of other buildings in both the private and public sector, Jibestream is the go-to leader in the indoor mapping space. <br/><br/> We believe our product is the best in the market. Now all we need to continue to win is to expand our sales team. Finding amazing people is one of the hardest parts of building a successful company. Thats why we take our culture and our people seriously. <br/><br/> <strong>We are looking for great Account Executives at Jibestream.</strong> <br/><br/> With a strong pipeline and an exciting future, we are looking for new team members to join our growing sales team. Someone who can capitalize on data insights, work closely with Marketing and develop new business. <br/><br/> <strong>Our purpose.</strong> <br/><br/> At Jibestream, we are focused on bringing IoT, AI, BI, big data, blue dot and machine learning to the every-day persons experience of their surroundings. We make indoor spaces intelligent, providing end-users with an enhanced experience and clients with access to invaluable data generated by our algorithms. <br/><br/> Our platform combined with the data we generate is used in shopping centres, corporate campuses, government facilities, hospitals, public venues, and hospitality to predict pathways, inform choices, improve energy efficiency, monitor & visualize security incidents, and market services & amenities. <br/><br/> <strong>What do you bring?</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>Education and experience.</strong> You have a post-secondary degree and 5 years plus B2B full cycle sales experience. You have experience managing complex deals with multiple stakeholders and engaging with senior leaders and analysts. You know how to work with business partners.</li> <li><strong>A proven success record.</strong> You have consistently met or exceeded targets and you get an adrenaline rush every time you close the deal. Your achievements go beyond quotas, extending into highly satisfied clients who trust your expertise.</li> <li><strong>Motivation and drive</strong>. You get a thrill from pursuing the close which also means you are calm under pressure and can make sound decisions quickly. The confidence in our product and our company just makes it easier for you.</li> <li><strong>Sales methodology and innovation</strong>. You believe in following a process because it works and changing it up when it doesnt. You want to contribute to building tactics and refining our processes for repeatable success.</li> <li><strong>Communication</strong>. You have outstanding presentation skills. Your consulting approach in meetings gains the trust of those listening to you. Your written and verbal one-on-one communication skills - including the ability to listen and provide a true solution to a clients unique issues - are why you consistently exceed quota.</li> <li><strong>Passion.</strong> You are genuinely interested in new ideas and new technology. You want to be part of the IoT revolution.</li> </ul> <strong>Why should you join Jibestream?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>A Strong Business:</strong> We have world-class clients such as Mall of the Emirates, US Army Hospitals and the Pentagon. Last year we grew by 300% and its looking even better this year. <br/><br/> <strong>Culture & Team:</strong> We never stop recruiting the right people for our company because without an amazing team nothing is possible. People at Jibestream are smart, curious and know how to get things done like nobody else. <br/><br/> <strong>Learn & Grow:</strong> Our goal is to keep you as long possible and help you build a career with us. We do this by creating an environment where you will grow both personally and professionally. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats the downside?</strong> <br/><br/> We're pretty self-aware as a company and we know where we can do better. <br/><br/> <strong>The Challenges Ahead:</strong> We have a robust platform that has defined features and functionality and we're disciplined about pouring our R&D dollars into it. This requires rigour and planning from the entire team. <br/><br/> <strong>Process:</strong> The company is growing fast in all aspects, which is great. The hard part is that we dont have all the processes of a big company in place yet. We are counting on our people to help create that process and adjust it quickly as we grow. <br/><br/> <strong>Join Us</strong> <br/><br/> If youre interested in joining an awesome, growing team, apply now. We cant promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider your experience. <br/><br/> Follow us on Facebook and Twitter @Jibestream - you never know when the next opportunity will come up! <br/><br/> <em>At Jibestream, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all abilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</em>
Title: Sales Account Executive

Job_Description: <div><div>About Us <br/>  <br/> ScopeMedia is an artificial intelligence company with a focus on proprietary computer vision technology. After being founded in Vancouver in 2013, ScopeMedia went on to open offices in Beijing and Hangzhou, China. For developers and entrepreneurs alike, ScopeMedia’s image and video recognition technology is easily adaptable to any project. <br/><br/> With customer behaviour and sentiment constantly evolving, accessibility to image based information has never been more vital. <br/>  <br/> About the Job <br/>  <br/> We are currently looking for <strong>Research Scientists</strong> with skills and experience in computer vision to join our expanding team. You will have a chance to change the lives of millions of people, allowing them to do things they never dreamed they could do, by using your technical background to drive ScopeMedia’s innovation. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Research in image and video understanding using our multimedia data</li> <li>Design and carry out fundamental investigations that expand knowledge and may result in new products, new processes or new business areas</li> <li>Develop a deep understanding of data to understand usage patterns and apply the knowledge gained in developing algorithms that satisfy user needs</li> <li>Work closely with engineers to develop prototypes and transfer research to products</li> <li>Communicate research results to product and engineering teams</li> </ul>  Salary   <ul> <li>$75,000.00 – $100,000.00/Annually</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>   <ul> <li>5+ years of industrial or academic experience in Computer Vision, Multimedia, and Machine Learning methodology</li> <li>Ph.D. in Computer Vision, Multimedia, Machine Learning, AI or a related field</li> <li>Demonstrated expertise and desire to work hands-on in analyzing and modeling large-scale data sets</li> <li>Expertise in popular machine learning algorithms</li> <li>Strong algorithmic problem solving skills</li> <li>Software development skills (C/C++, Python, Java, etc.)</li> <li>Experience with popular Computer Vision toolbox (OpenCV, VLFeat, etc.)</li> <li>Mobile development skills (iOS & Android)</li> <li>Experience with Deep Learning and its toolbox (Caffe, TensorFlow, etc.)</li> <li>Excellent communication skills and ability to understand business requirements</li> <li>Team spirit as well as the ability to execute independently</li> <li>Local experience preferred</li> </ul>  Method of Application <br/>  <br/> ScopeMedia Headquarters is located in downtown Vancouver, British Columbia. To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in Canada. <br/> We thank all candidates who apply, however, only those being considered will be contacted. <br/><br/> Please send all cover letters and resumes to the email listed below. <br/><br/> careers@scopemedia.com</div> </div>
Title: Research Scientist - Computer Vision

Job_Description: <div> <div>Deep Genomics is a Toronto-based startup company that is changing the future of medicine using artificial intelligence. Founded in 2015, Deep Genomics brings together a multidisciplinary team of world-leading experts in machine learning, genomics, chemistry and biology. Together we are on a mission to develop an AI-powered platform for rapid discovery and development of the best genetic medicines, focusing on oligonucleotide drugs for the treatment of patients with rare genetic diseases.</div><br/>  <div>Ideal Candidate</div> <br/> <div>We are seeking a creative and experienced computational biologist with a strong background in bioinformatics and high-throughput sequencing assays to join our drug discovery team in Toronto. The successful candidate will design and analyze high-throughput assays to interrogate the molecular effects of antisense oligonucleotides in human cells. The ideal candidate has experience with high-throughput RNA-seq data analysis, can contribute to a growing bioinformatics and analytics pipeline, and knows the trade-offs of various library preparation and target-enrichment methods.</div></div><br/>  <div> <div> Key Responsibilities  <ul>    <ul> <li>Design and statistically analyze high-throughput RNA-seq experiments to uncover the direct and indirect effects of antisense oligonucleotides in model cell systems and organisms.</li> <li>Work with our experimental and machine learning teams to ensure consistent and high quality data is improving our AI platform.</li></ul>   </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> Requirements/Qualifications  <ul>    <ul> <li>PhD in bioinformatics or related computational biology discipline, or MS with at least 3 years of postgraduate experience.</li> <li>Ability to develop high-throughput pipelines and deploy on cloud infrastructure.</li> <li>Experience collaborating with experimental biologists and software engineers.</li> <li>Programming experience in Python and/or R.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to work independently and as a team member.</li></ul>   </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> What we offer  <ul>    <ul> <li>Exciting opportunity for a hard-working individual to gain a leading role in the future of AI-driven genetic medicine development.</li> <li>Inspiring, creative and fast-moving startup in downtown Toronto.</li> <li>Highly competitive compensation, including meaningful stock ownership.</li></ul>   </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div>Deep Genomics thanks all applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.</div><br/>  <div>Deep Genomics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</div></div> <br/>
Title: Computational Biologist – RNA-seq

Job_Description: Kal Tire is Canada’s largest independent tire dealer and one of North America’s largest commercial tire dealers with over 250 Kal Tire retail and commercial stores in Canada, warehouse facilities and 10 retread manufacturing plants. In addition Kal Tire’s Mining Tire Group is a global leader in mining tire service and supply, operating on more than 150 mine sites across 18 countries and five continents. The company employs more than 6,500 team members globally. <br/><br/> Our Vernon Office is located on the shores of the beautiful Kalamalka Lake in the Interior of southern British Columbia. Vernon is a city of over 40,000 people with a central location and only one hour’s flight to either Vancouver, BC or Calgary, AB. The area provides the opportunity to live and work in a vibrant community with its own College and with easy reach of wold class ski resorts, championship golf courses, mountain biking trails, popular recreational lakes, and the vineyards of the Okanagan Valley. Kal Tire is the ideal place to have a career while enjoying the lifestyle you have always wanted. <br/><br/> The <strong>Team Lead, Business Intelligence</strong> is a senior technical leadership role that is responsible for the direction and architecture for Business Intelligence and data platform technology solutions at Kal Tire. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director, Platform and Productivity Technology, the Team Lead, Business Intelligence, is responsible for leading a team of Business Intelligence Analysts, contractors, and vendors. Moreover, they represent the Business Intelligence team in forums such as project management reviews, planning sessions, and is the prime point of contact for BI vendors and other IS teams. <br/><br/> <strong>CORE RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/><br/> <u>Technology</u> <ul> <li>Designs solutions using Microsoft’s suite of Business Intelligence and data platform technologies such as SQL Server, SQL Server Integrations Services (SSIS), SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), and SQL Server Report Services (SSRS).</li><li>Designs and builds complex PowerBI dashboards that present data in a meaningful way and create insightful and actionable business decisions.</li><li>Publishes standards for documenting Business Intelligence related business and technical requirements.</li><li>Defines, builds, and maintains data models that supports a Business Intelligence self-service environment.</li><li>Implements and enforces controls to maintain data availability and quality.</li><li>Enforces security standards and performs audits to ensure data confidentiality is maintained.</li><li>Develops and ensures compliance for data management processes, policies, and standards.</li><li>Builds and executes annual roadmaps for projects and life cycle management of Business Intelligence and data platform systems.</li><li>Researches and leads experiments to look for new and innovative Business Intelligence and data platform solutions.</li> </ul> <u>Leadership</u> <ul> <li>Proactively presents Business Intelligence and data platform solutions to leadership at all levels of the organization.</li><li>Acts as champion and spokesperson for Business Intelligence at Kal Tire.</li><li>Manages the day-to-day work and priorities for the Business Intelligence eam and understand the importance of meeting committed deadlines.</li><li>Leads the Business Intelligence team by providing coaching, guidance, and the oversight of work.</li><li>Assist in the recruiting, hiring, and training of Business Intelligence team members.</li><li>Trains the Business Intelligence team and ensures compliance with IS processes, such as Incident, Change, Problem, and Release management.</li><li>Leads teams of business, technical, vendor, or contractor stakeholders on projects.</li><li>Assists in the recruiting, hiring, performance reviews, and training of team members.</li><li>Monitors and recommends advancement in team member’s career progressions.</li> </ul> <strong>KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS</strong> <ul> <li>Achievement of project goals and milestones.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Technical leadership and mentorship of team members, addressing both the departmental goals and the team member’s personal development goals.</li><li>Ensuring the Business Intelligence team is focused on IS priorities and delivering on commitments.</li><li>Peer teams in IS see the Business Intelligence team as “on board”, supportive, reliable, proactive, and committed.</li><li>Overall quality of Business Intelligence solutions by measuring KPI’s.</li><li>Quality of technical documentation.</li><li>Responsiveness to changing priorities and problems.</li><li>Quality of technical direction and leadership both within and outside of the Business Intelligence Team.</li> </ul> <strong>WORK EXPERIENCE</strong> <ul> <li>A minimum of 5 years’ IT experience, and a proven ability to build and lead teams of technology professionals.</li><li>Minimum 7 years of experience with the Microsoft Business Intelligence stack (e.g. MS SQL Server, SSAS, SSIS, SSRS and PowerBI).</li><li>Significant experience with Azure Data Platform – Azure Data Lake, Data Factory, Data Management Gateway, Azure Storage Options, Data Catalog, EventHubs, Azure PaaS SQL and Machine Learning.</li><li>Significant experience with business intelligence and analytics tools, platforms, and techniques (ex. DAX, R, PowerBI, Power Query, Data Lake Analytics)</li> </ul> <strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES</strong> <ul> <li>A solid understanding of the economics of cloud, including cloud licensing and implementation experience.</li><li>Solid understanding of project management and portfolio management frameworks and processes. Relative experience leading and participating in large, complex technology projects.</li><li>Experience working in a retail business of similar size and complexity.</li><li>Knowledge of accounting principles and processes.</li><li>Experience with the creation of solution roadmaps that demonstrate alignment with the business priorities.</li><li>Understanding of machine learning and AI technologies.</li> </ul> <strong>EDUCATION</strong> <ul> <li>Post-secondary graduate with a degree, diploma or certificate in computer science or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.</li> </ul> <strong>SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS</strong> <ul> <li>Occasional travel to company locations for work or training purposes.</li><li>Evening and occasional weekend work may be required.</li><li>Must have own transportation and a valid BC driver’s license.</li><li>May require on-call (24X7 availability) during major project events.</li> </ul> <strong>KAL TIRE AIMS</strong> <br/><br/> Must be consistently able to demonstrate the Kal Tire AIMS. <br/><br/> Kal Tire offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, along with a company-wide profit sharing plan that recognizes individual and team contributions.
Title: Team Lead, Business Intelligence

Job_Description: CBC Digital Products is the countrys biggest digital startup, taking on the challenges of innovating how media is made, sent and received. We are also part of Canadas oldest and truest broadcasting company. We are trying new things. We are growing. As an entity of our own. As a voice for our country. As a team. <br/><br/> If you want to enter the world of digital media and be part of the change this is your chance. CBC Digital Products is looking an Audio-Video Developer to join our AV Platform team and drive the integration of our Digital Audio/Video Systems that deliver on-demand and live audio and video content to millions of Canadians. It is a highly collaborative, high exposure role with a chance to attend A/V integration conferences in Canada and the US. <br/><br/> If you're passionate about Canada and you love technology, learning and bringing out the best in others, youll love working at CBC. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are and where are you now?</strong> <br/><br/> You are a Backend Developer working with large enterprise systems and developing applications to support distribution of live and on-demand audio and video content. You are looking for an opportunity to spearhead both new development and the integration of critical delivery systems for streamlining live Audio/Video workflows; middleware custom tools using various APIs; and more. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong>  <ul> <li><u>C</u>utting edge tech. You will provide technical expertise for online digital Audio/Video systems building, implementing and integrating multiple complex systems to ensure the successful delivery of A/V content.</li> <li><u>B</u>elonging. You will collaborate with our passionate and dedicated internal groups. You will work closely with Engineering, Media Presentation (Broadcasting), IT, Content Producers, Revenue, etc. to achieve integration. You want to make an impact bringing forward new tools and ideas that will meet the demand of a national audience and support the internal stakeholders need to digitally deliver as much content as we can efficiently.</li> <li><u>C</u>areer growth. You will deepen your skills as you innovate solutions to the unique challenges we face as we strive to deliver content to millions of Canadians across the country. You will gain hands-on experience with cutting edge technology and be given the opportunity to further develop through internal and external learning opportunities.</li> </ul> <strong>Why join us?</strong> <br/><br/> CBC/Radio-Canada reflects the Canadian identity and promotes democracy. We strive to represent the voices of the country and support social and economic innovation. Our values - collaboration, learning and continuous improvement- embody who we are as a people-focused, digital-forward employer. We offer a rare-in-tech work-life balance with flexible schedules, an excellent benefit package and a pension plan noted as one of the best in the country, we want to ensure you are happy in and out of the office. <br/><br/> Collaboration. We follow lean startup principles and use an Agile approach. Our dedicated people managers work closely with every individual to ensure we are leveraging their strengths, championing their ideas and supporting their pursuit of new skills and career progression. <br/><br/> Learning. From simply buying a book or recommending a course to one-on-ones, our leadership team is focused on creating an atmosphere where people feel fulfilled.Our team members are given opportunities to learn and work cross-functionally across multiple projects. <br/><br/> Continuous improvement. What can you innovate in 8 hours a week? Our Digital department at CBC recognizes just how smart, creative and inventive our team members are. From prototyping new UI/UX to setting up dev environments to experiment on and learning new programming languages to creating improved search functions for our media. Wherever your interests lie, your 20% time is yours to allocate in a productive and professionally gratifying way. <br/><br/> <strong>What you bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent.</li> <li>The direct experience. You have three years experience in software development (Java, Python, PHP). You have a proven track record of working with complex enterprise systems.</li> <li>The desire to learn. You have a keen interest in AI, Machine Learning, Product Intelligence. You can quickly pick up new tools and technologies including Video CMS such as the Platform or Brightcove; Google Advertising Platform (DFP) or Freewheel.</li> <li>The flexibility. You are available to participate in a rotating on-call shift one out of every four or five weeks, for which you will earn additional compensation.</li> <li>The interest in growing your A/V technical knowledge. You have a passion for the technologies and workflows relating to online A/V presentation:   <ul> <li>Akamai or other CDN media delivery.</li> <li>Video Streaming Delivery Protocols (RTMP, HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, UDP).</li> <li>Video Formats and Codecs (HLS, HDS, MP4, MPEG-DASH, CMAF, AV1, etc.).</li> <li>Video Encoders (FFMPEG, Digital Rapids, Vantage, Elemental).</li> </ul>  </li> <li>The extras. Nice to have experience including operating in Windows, Apple and Unix environments and a working knowledge of Apache, Tomcat, Docker/Containers, Cloud services.</li> </ul> <strong>To apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Think this job is meant for you but worried you dont have it all? At CBC we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. You can read about the various backgrounds the talented people that make up our team bring to us here. <br/><br/> Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest. <br/><br/> In becoming the leader in expressing Canadian culture and enriching democratic life, we need to be as diverse in every way as the country we serve, both within our workforce and on air. As an employer, we value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada's public broadcaster.
Title: Audio Video Developer

Job_Description: Job Position:<strong> Software Engineer – Artificial Intelligence</strong> <br/><br/> The AI software engineer will use a combination of software application frameworks from various programing languages in order to support, implement, test, debug, and maintain the software solution stack at Uni3T. The engineer will coordinate with the data science and artificial intelligence specialists in order to support mining complex data and providing systems-related advice for the organization. The AI software engineer possesses advanced analytical skills, in addition to exceptional oral and written communication abilities. Additionally, the engineer will provide support to the business analysts in order to recommend technological solutions to support the business’ goals, and validate some ideas through rapid prototyping. <br/><br/> As our AI software engineer at Uni3T, you will work collaboratively in a cross-functional team comprising of AI/data scientists, developers, UX Designers, product, business, and architecture team members. A successful candidate will combine an expertise in artificial intelligence, subject matter knowledge, and an interest in doing practical research regarding life science, biotechnologies, and pharmaceutics. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Solid experience in software development to develop platforms and applications that meet business needs and requirements. Strong understanding of web technologies, mobile application development, digital tools and components.</li>  <li>Working knowledge of DevOps concepts, such as CI (Continuous Integration), and CD (Continuous Delivery).</li>  <li>Agile mindset but adaptable to different tools and methodologies.</li>  <li>Exceptional verbal and written communicator, with a strong passion to get things done in a fast-paced deadlineoriented environment; Ability to effectively prioritize competing activities.</li>  <li>Apply best practices in technical design, software code, technical documentation, production deployment and software change management.</li>  <li>Design, develop, and deploy algorithms based on ML best practices in order to tackle the hard problems of Uni3T’s software platform where structured and unstructured data is involved.</li>  <li>Help the data science team perform and interpret ML studies and product experiments concerning new data sources or new uses for existing data sources.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years in technical background with a BS in Software Engineering, or Computer Science (or related disciplines) with demonstrable knowledge of machine learning algorithms.</li>  <li>Experience working with cloud computing (AWS, Microsoft Azure, etc.) and operating-system-level virtualization (containerization, such as Docker) and deployment (such as Kubernetes).</li>  <li>Full implementation experience with multiple web frameworks and application servers.</li>  <li>Advanced proficiency in several of the following program languages: Javascript, PHP, Python, C++.</li>  <li>Working knowledge of database design and interaction.</li>  <li>Knowledge of web services, REST, and JSON.</li>  <li>Experience and knowledge of full stack web development.</li>  <li>Experience working on one or more projects comprising one or more components such as big data/data mining, digital analytics, data warehousing/ETL, and/or machine learning.</li>  <li>Experience with the systems development life cycle process.</li>  <li>Willingness to take various responsibilities and wear different hats along the development spectrum.</li>  <li>Ability to cope under high demand, handle multiple priorities, projects and tasks, and meet tight deadlines.</li> </ul> <strong>Assets:</strong>  <ul> <li>Knowledge and experience of deep learning techniques in artificial intelligence, with libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe2, Keras, or Theano.</li>  <li>Experience in computer science or software engineering applied to biostatistics, bioinformatics (such as BioNLP), medical informatics, clinical trials, epidemiology, computational biology, biotechnology, etc. is a highly valuable asset.</li>  <li>A minimum of 2-3 years of experience in the private sector. Experience in the specific industry of life science, biotechnologies, and/or pharmaceutics is a big plus.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive base salary +sharing profits;</li>  <li>Comprehensive insurance coverage by Sunlife;</li>  <li>Permanent full time position;</li>  <li>Located between Griffintown and the Old Montreal, in the Cité du Multimédia neighborhood, now part of Montreal’s holistic hub for innovation, education, and entrepreneurship: the Quartier de l’Innovation.</li> </ul> <br/> <strong>What you need to know:</strong>  <ul> <li>Must be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role.</li> </ul>
Title: Software Engineer - Artificial Intelligence

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> Are you passionate about technology? Do you love building new things? Do you want to lead a team that is leading the industry in Data Science and Machine Learning? If you answered YES, then we have the right opportunity for you! <br/><br/> The IBM Data Science and Machine Learning is looking for a talented Software Development Manager to lead a growing team of highly motivated Software Developers that are building the next generation of IBM SPSS Modeler and Statistics. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate must have strong technical and management background and be very passionate about building and leading high impact teams. You enjoy working in a multicultural international organization and you have a passion for delivering high quality leading edge software applications. You have extensive experience with the Agile methodology and understand that you are responsible for setting the tone and tempo of your team - as such, you lead by example. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities include:</strong>  <ul> <li>Manage overall software development life-cycle</li><li>Create, prioritize, communicate, manage, and execute roadmaps, project plans, and commitments</li><li>Promote a culture of innovation, accountability, responsibility & sense of urgency</li> <li>Collaborate with your peers and technical leads to develop and implement innovative solutions</li> <li>Hire, coach, and mentor your team on an ongoing basis</li><li>Manage Developers in an Agile environment, encourage a collaborative approach, guide the work of the teams.</li> <li>Offer hands-on assistance with work through familiarity with the tools, technologies and processes used in software development and QA.</li> </ul>  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>At least 3 years as a Software Development Manager in an Agile environment, preferably in the Data Science related industry</li><li>Knowledge of Machine Learning and AI an asset</li><li>Strong relationship building skills.</li> <li>You are approachable and will be recognized as a leader by earning your recognition.</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills. You can clearly articulate your ideas</li><li>Passion for innovation.</li> <li>At least 3 years with Full stack development: Node.js, ReactJS, AngularJS, Shell script, Object-oriented programing languages (Java, C++, C#), GIT Source Control</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Docker, Kubernetes, Linux OS, Mac OS, CICD Pipeline tooling, e.g., Jenkins or Travis, Maven, Machine Learning /Data Science, Python, R, Scala</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Software Development Manager

Founded in 2015, Deep Genomics brings together a multidisciplinary team of world-leading experts in machine learning, genomics, chemistry and biology.
