Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</div></div> <br/>
Title: Junior Bioinformatician

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Montreal, QC, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada</strong></div><div>Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines. <br/><br/> As the Program Manager for the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Residency Program, you will be involved in the planning, launch and administration of the residency program. You will be responsible for curating the experience of AI Residents to help create an enriching research and learning environment that brings the spirit of AI at Google to life. You will also have the opportunity to work on all aspects of the program management process, from research to design to implementation and measuring success. <br/><br/> There is always more information out there, and the Research and Machine Intelligence team has a never-ending quest to find it and make it accessible. We're constantly refining our signature search engine to provide better results, and developing offerings like Google Instant, Google Voice Search and Google Image Search to make it faster and more engaging. We're providing users around the world with great search results every day, but at Google, great just isn't good enough. We're just getting started.</div><div><div> Responsibilities <div>  <ul> <li>Support the research teams in moving projects forward, helping the team innovate and achieve creative and technical objectives. Keep the team focused and productive.</li><li>Lead media and communications initiatives to educate the public on topics related to the responsible use of AI (e.g. privacy, robustness to attacks, fairness, etc.).</li><li>Collaborate with Google colleagues to identify potential cross-functional residency opportunities.</li><li>Maintain established relationships with stakeholders.</li></ul></div> <br/> <div> Qualifications <div>Minimum qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in Business or related field, or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>4 years of experience managing people and programs/projects.</li><li>Ability to speak and write in English and French fluently and idiomatically.</li><li>Ability to travel up to 15% of the time.</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience working with research and engineering organizations.</li><li>Experience with Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence.</li><li>Apps Script, Python, or other coding experience.</li><li>Ability to think, plan and deliver a range of projects that align goals across cross-functional teams.</li><li>Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to consult without authority.</li><li>Developed analytical and quantitative modeling skills, combined with impeccable business judgment.</li></ul></div> </div></div></div><div><div>At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.</div></div><div><div><strong>To all recruitment agencies:</strong> Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other company location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.</div></div></div>
Title: Program Manager, Artificial Intelligence Residency (English and French)

Job_Description: <strong>About the Role:</strong> <br/><br/> In this role, you will be implementing functionality similar to what you see in these videos: <br/><br/> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yUbK1yeYzAI <br/><br/> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M1ONXea0mXg <br/><br/> You will be learning and using the most advanced technologies in the fields of Natural Language Understanding, Speech, Search, and AI, all built in-house here at SoundHound over the past 10 years. <br/><br/> Weve worked hard to build a platform that enables individual developers to implement deep natural language user experiences very rapidly, often within days. These user experiences will be showcased within our Hound app, and made available to other developers via the Houndify platform, enabling them to power billions of devices and applications. <br/><br/> Your work will directly contribute to a revolution in the way people interact with the devices around them: by speaking naturally. <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong> <ul> <li>You are excited about being one of the first people to become proficient in a new programming paradigm.</li><li>Your dream job involves building/owning the systems that improve the lives of millions of users every day.</li><li>You view coding as an art form, and your love of coding is second only to your love of deprecating even more code.</li><li>You notice opportunities to improve the end user experience and are proactive about getting the details right.</li><li>You are a fast learner with strong software development skills, enabling you to meet aggressive deadlines while producing scalable and maintainable systems.</li>  </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Proficient in C/C++ and at least one scripting language</li><li>Excellent algorithms skills, and ability to write efficient code</li><li>Strong English language communication skills</li><li>Experience with data conditioning and relevance algorithms</li><li>Experience manipulating and managing large amounts of data</li><li>Comfortable working in Linux environment</li><li>BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to Haves:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience working with third-party APIs or datasets</li><li>Experience working in a client-server Agile development environment.</li><li>Familiarity with web crawling and related concepts</li><li>Familiarity with text search and related systems</li><li>Fluent in additional languages such as:</li>  <ul> <li>Spanish, French, German, Russian, Mandarin, Japanese, Korean, etc.</li></ul> </ul> <strong>How to Apply:</strong> <ul> <li>Please send us your resume and cover letter. Tell us why you would like a job at SoundHound in particular.</li> </ul> <strong>SoundHound is creating and productizing transformative technologies that improve life. Join us.</strong> <br/><br/> After amassing a global user community well over 300 million strong, a large portfolio of core technologies and award winning productswere just getting started. <br/><br/> At SoundHound, we value creativity, innovation, hard work, open communication and fast iteration, which allow us to act on valuable feedback from employees and users alike. SoundHound's culture is one of impromptu coffee breaks, less-impromptu fitness sessions, group lunches, and weekly happy hours. <br/><br/> We offer a competitive salary, SoundHound stock options, unique camaraderie, catered lunches, and the opportunity to call a company thats simultaneously changing the way we discover music AND interact with machines, home. Yep, it's that cool.
Title: Software Engineer - Natural Language Understanding

We are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential. <br/><br/> To ensure we continue to be recognized as Canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. This means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees. <br/><br/> If you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Bell is a Canadian business with a rich and deep history of providing communications services to Canadians across the nation. We are committed to providing exceptional service and products to our clients and to providing a challenging and rewarding working environment to our employees. This devotion has won us a rank among Canada’s top 100 employees in 2018 for the second year in a row: http://www.canadastop100.com/2018/bell-canada/. <br/><br/> If you love coaxing insight out of messy, wild data, this fast-growing, high demand career field is where you want to be. Check out: What It's Like to Have the Best Job in America right Now - Business Insider. <br/><br/> Bell’s Business Intelligence team is responsible for the management and optimization of BI systems used to analyze customer behavior, automate business insight processes, target marketing & contact strategy opportunities and provide insight to drive optimal business decisions. <br/> This is a terrific opportunity to help transform the organization, and achieve one of the most significant strategic mandates within Bell, leveraging machine learning and AI algorithms to drive business decisions. As part of this team, you will have opportunities to build your analytics skills, shape the next generation of BI and drive important business decisions working with new, cutting-edge technologies. We are looking for individuals who are highly logical, passionate, and can communicate effectively to all levels within the organization. <br/><br/> What our Team members have to say: <br/> “We work in a fast-paced environment, which allows us to learn about many unique parts of the business in short periods of time. I have the ability and freedom to continually leverage my ideas and research to help solve business problems.” <br/> “To me, the best thing about working for Bell is the amazing people. I am surrounded by a very supportive team and on a daily basis I collaborate with highly talented individuals throughout the company to solve complex business problems.” <br/><br/> Role: Senior Data Scientist, Modeling and Segmentation, Business Intelligence <br/><br/> <strong>Key responsibilities may include:</strong> <ul> <li>Working with clients in Customer Operations, Small Business, Finance, Marketing, Pricing and IT Specialists, etc. to make data driven business decisions</li><li>Leading the technical and infrastructure abilities of the team in how we build and deliver models to our clients</li><li>Translating business imperatives into data centered questions to be able to quantify and evaluate them</li><li>Build applied machine-learning solutions to improve Customer Experience and optimize Customer Operations processes.</li> <li>Work with and present to all management levels (entry to executive)</li><li>Maintain and expand your knowledge of ML through training opportunities and self-study</li> <li>Deliver solutions with measureable results</li> </ul> <strong>Required Competencies:</strong> <ul> <li>You have a graduate degree in a discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning or 4+ years of experience in Machine Learning or related area</li><li>You are highly analytical and logical individual and have the ability to leverage insights/opportunities from data to build strategies and make recommendations</li> <li>Experience analytical tools such as Python, R, SAS, or SPSS</li><li>You have the ability to work with a team towards common goals</li><li>You are able to manage multiple projects and priorities</li><li>You are a self starter who is comfortable working with and presenting to all management levels</li><li>You are highly driven to learn about the newest machine learning techniques and to apply them to solve business problems</li> <li>Bilingualism (English and French) is an asset in Ontario and a requirement in Quebec</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Competencies:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with classifier systems, predictive modeling algorithms, or ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Spark ML, Torch, Caffe, H2O, Kafka, Flume, etc.</li><li>Experience with SQL and database systems such as Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata</li><li>Experience with distributed data and computational resources such as Hadoop, HDFS in general, Docker, Dask</li><li>Basic working knowledge of project management steps</li><li>Experience in telecom marketing or product development</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> Bilingualism is an asset (English and French) <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong><u><strong><u><strong><u>Additional Information:</u></strong></u></strong></u></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Position Type:</strong> Management <br/> <strong>Job Location:</strong> Canada : Ontario : Don Mills <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong> 05/25/2018 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong><u><strong><u><strong><u>Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.</u></strong></u></strong></u></strong> <br/><br/> Bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> IBM Global Business Services (GBS) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM GBS empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries. <br/><br/> Bottom line? We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM. <br/><br/> In this exciting role, you will have the opportunity to discover new technologies and expand your skills. Do you want to be part of a highly talented team working with new and emerging technologies new business models that improve people's lives? <br/><br/> As our customer's needs grow and change, IBM is committed to developing a workforce that can grow and change accordingly. We are looking for enthusiastic, motivated, flexible team members who will embrace the opportunity, take ownership and want to be at the forefront of driving change in a working environment that enables smarter, collaborative, fact-based decisions, improves productivity and efficiency, and drives results while working in a dynamic team environment. <br/><br/> <strong>IBM Global Business Services is looking for an Application Architect, Automation (Cognitive) to join our innovative team.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong><u>Role description</strong></u>:</strong> <br/><br/> You will engage with clients and Automation Project Managers to translate Automation use cases into a Cognitive Automation solution that can optimize the service delivery. You will understand Cognitive Automation, specifically Functional and Non Functional requirements to provide technical solutions and to own deliverables from a technical perspective. You may need to work with RPA Architects to provide an end to end solution. You will require an expert level in Watson API, IBM assets (ex: iCurate, iAssist, Golden Bridge) to provide and recommend operational aspects and define technical solutions. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities</strong></u>:</strong>  <ul> <li>Design enterprise automation solutions and cognitive platforms for the clients enterprise;</li><li>Create end-to-end automation solutions utilizing all of IBMs capabilities in Cognitive, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Robotic Process Automation (RPA);</li><li>Support sales pursuits by providing technical leadership;</li><li>Translate winning proposals into referenceable client project delivery leading medium to large project teams with responsibility for overall successful delivery;</li><li>Build and grow client relationships through delivery excellence;</li><li>Build internal and external eminence in enterprise automation;</li><li>Contribute to thought leadership and point of view materials in enterprise automation;</li><li>Inspire and mentor technical team members.</li> </ul>  <strong><u>Candidate will have</u>:</strong>  <ul> <li>In-depth knowledge in business process mapping, rules-based engines and digital process automation;</li><li>In-depth domain expertise in at least one of the following industries: Banking, Insurance, Retail, Consumer Products, Telecommunication, Healthcare, Pharma, Energy, or Utilities;</li><li>Willingness to travel (domestic and international) for up to 4 days a week;</li><li>Demonstrated experience of working in global teams;</li><li>Fluency in English.</li> </ul>  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>15 years of experience in information technology and business consulting;</li><li>10 years of experience in application design, development and management;</li><li>5 years of experience in architecting enterprise solutions;</li><li>Demonstrated experience of providing technical leadership to large-scale application design and development projects;</li><li>3 years of experience developing proposals and responding to Requests for Proposals (RFP);</li><li>3 years of experience in architecting cloud-based solutions;</li><li>3 years of experience in creating and leveraging AI techniques, such as machine learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), knowledge induction, machine reasoning, etc;</li><li>3 years of experience in architecting Robotic Process Automation (RPA) implementations with in-depth expertise in any one of the leading RPA platforms;</li><li>3 years of experience in leading and managing high-performing consulting teams.</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>3 years of experience in architecting any ERP/package implementation;</li><li>2 years of experience in designing solutions using IBM Watson APIs;</li><li>2 years involvement in at least one aspect of a digital transformation (e.g., business modeling, digital marketing, operation automation, etc.);</li><li>In-depth knowledge of service management/ITIL;</li><li>In-depth domain expertise in at least one of the following process areas: Finance and Accounting (F&A), Sales Order Processing, Procurement, Inventory Management, Human Resource (HR), Sales & Marketing, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Supply Chain Management (SCM) or Engineering/Production.</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Application Architect, Automation (Cognitive)

Job_Description: As a Postdoctoral Researcher at Algolux, you will work alongside our academic partners at McGill University and Université Laval to develop and deploy novel applied research solutions in the areas of computational photography, computer vision, imaging and machine learning. <br/><br/> You will interact with both the leading academics in these areas, as well as the world’s largest smartphone vendors and automotive component manufacturers. It’s not uncommon for Postdoctoral work to end up in commercialized products, such as your next smartphone or car… and those of millions of others! <ul>  <li>Formulate and develop novel user-facing solutions for targeted applied research problems in the aforementioned research areas. This will include setting up lab measurements, field testing, conducting statistical and numerical analyses, and preparing academic manuscripts.</li> <li>Develop learning-based solutions for complex imaging systems.</li> <li>Develop and adapt computational photography and computer vision algorithms to challenging imaging problems.</li> <li>Support the development of deployable code alongside Algolux Software Engineers.</li> <li>Build compelling demos and illustrative results.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Ph.D. in computer science or engineering, in areas related to computational imaging, machine learning, computer vision, numerical methods or computer graphics.</li> <li>Track record of relevant publications in top-tier conferences and journals (SIGGRAPH, ICCV, CVPR, ICML, NIPS, etc.) and/or significant industry experience working as a member of a research team in the areas of interest listed above.</li> </ul> Desirable Requirements <ul>  <li>Experience with Deep Learning frameworks, model architecture design, training methodologies, and data management.</li> <li>Experience tuning digital camera systems (sensors and ISPs).</li> <li>Image/video quality KPI (Key Performance Indicators) expertise.</li> <li>Image processing library development.</li> <li>Python programming.</li> <li>C++ development and code optimization.</li> <li>Knowledge of cloud-based and GPU heterogeneous compute platforms.</li> <li>Agile development with Git, Bitbucket, pull requests, etc.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> What can we offer you? Algolux is a tight-knit, collaborative group of individuals from all over the world who are united by a common interest in applying AI to solve big problems in computer vision. On this diverse team, you will be introduced to new perspectives and will acquire knowledge and experience you wouldn’t necessarily gain elsewhere. We also encourage professional development by supporting participation in continuing education, technical conferences, and open source projects. We value individuals who like to push the science, but also have the right attitude and mentality to work on a software version cycle. A unique mix that is critical to scaling up our company. <br/><br/> At Algolux, we offer equity options for our employees so that as the company continues to succeed, so will you. We are currently partnering with major component manufacturers like Intel, Qualcomm, and ARM, as well as major automotive manufacturers, to drive the technology behind the introduction of driver-less vehicles. In fact, we were awarded the “Most Exciting Startup” at AutoSens 2017 - the world’s leading technical summit for ADAS and autonomous vehicle perception technology. <br/><br/> The Algolux office is an inspiring modern work-space situated in the heart of the trendy district of Pointe Sainte Charles, near downtown Montreal. Our open office environment encourages communication, teamwork, and a culture of mutual trust and respect. We work hard, but we don't take ourselves too seriously either and we always make room for fun along the way.
Title: Postdoctoral Researcher

Job_Description: About the role <br/><br/> As Analytics Solution Architect / Manager, you will actively participate in presales activities including public presentations, workshops and estimations. You will have a leading technical role in transitioning sales from qualifying to closing by working closely with the sales team and other technical consultants. You will work closely with program managers and bid teams to maximize the business development capacity and leverage Avanade capabilities. You will facilitate and execute requirements gathered during analysis and design phases and assist in driving business development initiatives with major stakeholders. Within the first year, you will manage multiple customer engagements and production implementations. <br/><br/> Day-to-day, you will: <br/><br/> * Participate in all aspects of sales activities, including demonstrations and proof of concepts <br/><br/> * Oversee the ongoing development and operations of a data and analytics architecture that enables fact-based decision making, ad hoc analysis and insight generation <br/><br/> * Collaborate with end users to identify needs and opportunities for improved data <br/><br/> * Develop and streamline processes regarding data flow and quality to improve data accuracy, viability and value <br/><br/> * Mentor the Analytics Team and other service lines for cross-optimization <br/><br/> * Participate in the hiring of new permanent staff and contractors <br/><br/> * Talk to senior stakeholders about all flavors of Analytics (data warehousing, ETL, integration, presentation/visualization, prediction, AI, Machine Learning). <br/><br/> * Can lead delivery / get hands on if needed. <br/><br/> * Travel as needed. <br/><br/> About you <br/><br/> You are an experienced leader with a proactive and participative management style. You instill and reinforce a strong customer service and business-oriented ethic. You have excellent communication skills and can confidently communicate to all levels of the business from operational to executive. You have extensive pre-sales experience in solution envisioning, building demonstrations, estimates, proposal development, client presentations and conducting workshops. You possess a good understanding of sales strategies, tactics and cycles and demonstrate good problem solving and analytical skills. <br/><br/> Your background and skills likely include: <ul>  <li>Strong IT Consulting experience especially in a pre-sales environment</li> <li>Understanding how Analytics and Cloud interact (i.e. knows Azure services or other cloud servicesGoogle or Amazon).</li><li>Enterprise Architecture as it relates to Analytics.</li><li>Estimates work, drives proposals and is a partner to the Sales team.</li> <li>Business Intelligence (BI) consulting/client-facing experience</li>  <li>Exposure to non-Microsoft BI tools a very strong plus.Relational and semi-relational structured data experience; implementing Hadoop or one of its commercial distributions</li>  <li>Strong OLAP SQL Server Analysis Services skills</li> <li>Strong Power BI analytics tools experience: PerformancePoint Services,PowerPivot, PowerQuery and PowerMaps</li>  <li>Microsoft platform including: SQL Server versions 2005 through 2014, Azure cloud, Power BI, R, Hive, Pig, Python, Spark, Hadoop, Mongo, Cassandra</li>  </ul> Your education likely includes a degree in computer science or the equivalent. <br/><br/> About Avanade <br/><br/> Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 27,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. We welcome all, and seek talented individuals who can bring their whole self to work, build inclusive teams and encourage diversity inside and outside the organization. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com.<br/><br/>Qualifications Avanade® Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, marital status or any other protected status. Avanade is also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.<br/><br/><strong>Requisition ID - 50382</strong> <br/><br/> Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud-enabling services, business solutions and design-led experiences, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 30,000 professionals in 24 countries. Visit us at www.avanade.com.
Title: Analytics Solution Architect

Job_Description: Our goal is to achieve Artificial General Intelligence by teaching machines to think, reason, and communicate. We’re an early leader in using deep learning to solve language-understanding problems and in training machines to model the decision-making capabilities of the human brain. Based in Montréal, a global hub for AI, our team brings together experts in various machine-learning domains: deep learning, reinforcement learning, NLP, machine reading, computational linguistics and more. As a member of the Machine Comprehension group, you will work on problems including machine reading, question answering, reasoning and memory mechanisms, language modeling, and information gathering. We build deep neural networks trained through techniques from supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning. This is a unique opportunity to change the way machines learn to understand and reason upon unstructured text. Your work has the potential to power products and services that may be used by millions of users. <br/><br/> Notre objectif est de doter les machines d’une intelligence artificielle générale en leur apprenant à penser, à raisonner et à communiquer. Nous sommes l’un des premiers chefs de file utilisant l’apprentissage profond afin de régler les problèmes de compréhension du langage et développant des algorithmes pour les machines basés sur les capacités décisionnelles du cerveau humain. Notre équipe, située à Montréal, une plaque tournante mondiale de l’intelligence artificielle, rassemble des experts dans des domaines variés en matière d’apprentissage artificiel : apprentissage profond, apprentissage par renforcement, traitement du langage naturel, lecture automatique, linguistique computationnelle, et plus encore. En tant que membre du groupe de compréhension des machines, vous travaillerez sur des problèmes, notamment en ce qui a trait à la lecture automatique, aux systèmes de questions-réponses, aux mécanismes de raisonnement et de la mémoire, à la modélisation linguistique et à la collecte d’informations. Nous construisons des réseaux de neurones profonds formés à partir de techniques supervisées et non supervisées et d’apprentissage par renforcement. Il s’agit d’une occasion unique de changer la façon dont les machines apprennent à comprendre et à raisonner à partir de texte non structuré. Votre travail a le potentiel d’améliorer des produits et des services qui pourraient être utilisés par des millions d’utilisateurs.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Develop cutting edge research in Machine Reading, Question Answering, and Natural Language Understanding</li><li>Conceive and execute ambitious research projects that will advance the capabilities of Machine Reading systems</li><li>Suggest and engage in team collaborations and work towards long-term research goals, while identifying intermediate milestones</li><li>Work with external collaborators and maintain relationships with relevant research labs</li><li>Report and present research findings within the Microsoft Research teams.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Réaliser une recherche de pointe sur la lecture automatique, les systèmes de questions-réponses et la compréhension du langage naturel</li><li>Concevoir et exécuter des projets de recherche ambitieux qui amélioreront les capacités des systèmes de lecture automatique</li><li>Participer à des collaborations en équipe et faire des suggestions lors de celles-ci, et travailler sur des objectifs de recherche à long terme tout en définissant les jalons intermédiaires</li><li>Travailler avec des collaborateurs externes et maintenir des relations avec des laboratoires de recherche compétents</li><li>Faire un compte rendu et présenter les conclusions de vos recherches au sein des équipes de Microsoft Research</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Masters or Ph.D. in machine learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, natural language processing, or related technical field</li><li>Experience or strong interest in natural language understanding, natural language generation, or related technical field</li><li>A track record of published papers demonstrating your experience in your research field</li><li>Proven experience working with software teams and systems to implement applications from your Research with strong implementation skills, esp. for RNNs</li><li>Hands on experience with Python -Hands on experience with at least one of the following tools: cntk, Theano, Tensorflow, or similar</li> </ul> Considering a Career with Microsoft Canada? <br/><br/> At Microsoft Canada, people are the source of our energy. The people at Microsoft Canada are creative, from all types of backgrounds, bringing passion and new ideas, meeting challenges, and realizing their potential. Our benefits and resources are designed to keep our most important asset - our employees - healthy, happy and equipped with the resources they need to be successful and realize their full potential. Microsoft Canada provides a flexible work environment, with career advancement potential and most importantly, the opportunity to make a difference. As a Microsoft employee you have the opportunity to participate in the following programs: Stock Awards & Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Registered Retirement Savings Plan, Employee Software Purchase Program, Fitness Membership & Subsidy, I Volunteer (5 Paid Volunteer Days), Employee Assistance Program Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity. Microsoft is committed to accommodating applicant’s with disabilities up to the point of undue hardship during the recruitment, assessment and selection process. Please notify Microsoft if you require accommodation in respect of the materials or procedures used at any time during this process. If you require accommodation Microsoft will work with you to determine how to meet your need. <ul> <li>Maîtrise ou doctorat en apprentissage artificiel, apprentissage profond, apprentissage par renforcement, traitement du langage naturel ou dans un domaine technique connexe</li><li>Posséder de l’expérience en matière de compréhension du langage naturel, de génération de langage naturel ou dans un domaine technique connexe ou avoir un vif intérêt pour ces sujets</li><li>Des références d’articles publiés démontrant votre expérience dans votre domaine de recherche</li><li>Expérience éprouvée en matière de collaboration avec des équipes de développement logiciel et avec des systèmes afin de mettre en uvre des applications de votre recherche, en plus de fortes compétences de mise en uvre, en particulier pour les réseaux neuronaux récurrents</li><li>Expérience pratique avec Python -Expérience pratique avec au moins un des outils suivants : CNTK, Theano, Tensorflow, ou l’équivalent</li> </ul> Vous envisagez une carrière au sein de Microsoft Canada? <br/><br/> Chez Microsoft Canada, nos employés représentent la force de notre entreprise. Notre personnel se compose de gens créatifs, passionnés et inventifs, de tous les horizons, qui relèvent constamment de nouveaux défis et réalisent leur potentiel. Nos avantages et nos ressources permettent à nos employés – notre atout le plus important – de mener une vie saine et heureuse, avec les ressources nécessaires à leur réussite et à l’atteinte de leur plein potentiel. Microsoft Canada offre un environnement de travail flexible, des possibilités d’avancement professionnel, et surtout, l’occasion d’apporter votre contribution. À titre d’employé de Microsoft, vous avez la possibilité de participer aux programmes suivants: Régimes d’attribution d’actions et d’actionnariat des salariés Régime enregistré d’épargne-retraite Programme d’achat de logiciels pour les employés Programme I Bénévolat (5 jours de travail bénévole payés) Programme d’assistance aux employés Et bien plus encore... Chez Microsoft, nous partageons une passion pour la technologie, nos clients et nos partenaires. Nous souhaitons être plus qu’une bonne entreprise, nous voulons être une grande entreprise. Notre force provient de notre engagement envers notre mission de permettre aux personnes et aux entreprises dans le monde entier de réaliser leur plein potentiel. Microsoft souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et favorise la diversité de la main-d’uvre Durant le recrutement, l’évaluation et la procédure de sélection, Microsoft s’engage à prendre des mesures d’adaptation à l’égard des candidats handicapés sans aller jusqu’à la contrainte excessive. Veuillez aviser Microsoft si vous devez demander des mesures d’adaptation concernant les procédures ou documents utilisés à tout moment durant ce processus. Si vous demandez des mesures d’adaptation, Microsoft travaillera de concert avec vous pour trouver un moyen de répondre à vos besoins.
Title: Researcher

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> IBM Global Business Services (GBS) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM GBS empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries. <br/><br/> Bottom line? We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM. <br/><br/> In this exciting role, you will have the opportunity to discover new technologies and expand your skills. Do you want to be part of a highly talented team working with new and emerging technologies new business models that improve people's lives? <br/><br/> As our customer's needs grow and change, IBM is committed to developing a workforce that can grow and change accordingly. We are looking for enthusiastic, motivated, flexible team members who will embrace the opportunity, take ownership and want to be at the forefront of driving change in a working environment that enables smarter, collaborative, fact-based decisions, improves productivity and efficiency, and drives results while working in a dynamic team environment. <br/><br/> <strong>IBM Global Business Services is looking for an Application Architect, Automation (RPA) to join our innovative team.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong><u>Role description</strong></u>:</strong> <br/><br/> You will engage with client and Automation Project Managers to translate Automation use cases into an RPA solutions that can optimize service delivery. RPA architects will understand the Robotic Process Automation, specifically Functional and Non Functional requirements, providing RPA solutions and own the same technically. RPA solution includes taking decisions about RPA products, mapping appropriate parts from Automation offerings, interlock with infrastructure/platform team to provide appropriate platform. You will have an expert level in IBM strategic remediation products like IPSoft, BluePrism, WinAuto etc. and know when to recommend what. You will also need to be at an applied level in IBM accelerators like Golden Bridge mfalpha etc. You will recommend operational aspects, such as how the various remediation tools and accelerators are offered (on premise vs shared), how the remediation tools will connect to customer network (S2S VPN, SSL over Internet or One Network) and how golden bridge will connect to client alerts (API, RestService, NetCool etc.) to create the entire RPA technical solution. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities</strong></u>:</strong>  <ul> <li>Design enterprise automation solutions and cognitive platforms for the clients enterprise;</li><li>Create end-to-end automation solutions utilizing all of IBMs capabilities in Cognitive, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Robotic Process Automation (RPA);</li><li>Support sales pursuits by providing technical leadership;</li><li>Translate winning proposals into referenceable client project delivery leading medium to large project teams with responsibility for overall successful delivery;</li><li>Build and grow client relationships through delivery excellence;</li><li>Build internal and external eminence in enterprise automation;</li><li>Contribute to thought leadership and point of view materials in enterprise automation;</li><li>Inspire and mentor technical team members.</li> </ul>  <strong><u>Candidate will have</u>:</strong>  <ul> <li>In-depth knowledge in business process mapping, rules-based engines and digital process automation;</li><li>In-depth domain expertise in at least one of the following industries: Banking, Insurance, Retail, Consumer Products, Telecommunication, Healthcare, Pharma, Energy, or Utilities;</li><li>Willingness to travel (domestic and international) for up to 4 days a week;</li><li>Demonstrated experience of working in global teams;</li><li>Fluency in English.</li> </ul>  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>15 years of experience in information technology and business consulting;</li><li>10 years of experience in application design, development and management;</li><li>5 years of experience in architecting enterprise solutions;</li><li>Demonstrated experience of providing technical leadership to large-scale application design and development projects;</li><li>3 years of experience developing proposals and responding to Requests for Proposals (RFP);</li><li>3 years of experience in architecting cloud-based solutions;</li><li>3 years of experience in creating and leveraging AI techniques, such as machine learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), knowledge induction, machine reasoning, etc;</li><li>3 years of experience in architecting Robotic Process Automation (RPA) implementations with in-depth expertise in any one of the leading RPA platforms;</li><li>3 years of experience in leading and managing high-performing consulting teams.</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>3 years of experience in architecting any ERP/package implementation;</li><li>2 years of experience in designing solutions using IBM Watson APIs;</li><li>2 years involvement in at least one aspect of a digital transformation (e.g., business modeling, digital marketing, operation automation, etc.);</li><li>In-depth knowledge of service management/ITIL;</li><li>In-depth domain expertise in at least one of the following process areas: Finance and Accounting (F&A), Sales Order Processing, Procurement, Inventory Management, Human Resource (HR), Sales & Marketing, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Supply Chain Management (SCM) or Engineering/Production.</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Application Architect, Automation (RPA)

Job_Description: The goal of Microsoft Research Montreal is to achieve Artificial General Intelligence by teaching machines to think, reason and communicate like humans. We’re an early leader in using deep and reinforcement learning to solve language-understanding problems and in training machines to model the decision-making capabilities of the human brain. Based in the global AI hub of Montréal, our team consists of experts in their respective fields. <br/><br/> The goal of the reinforcement learning group at Microsoft Research Montreal is to develop theoretically grounded methods and techniques to improve the scalability of RL, with the aim of applying it in real products, such as dialogue management and intelligent bots. As a member of the RL team, you will play an important role in making this ambitious goal a reality. Working closely together with other team members, and supported by a group of skilled engineers, you will take part on conceiving, implementing and testing new ideas that can revolutionize the way we interact with machines. <br/><br/> L’objectif de Microsoft Recherche Montreal est de doter les machines d’une intelligence artificielle générale en leur apprenant à penser, à raisonner et à communiquer comme les humains. Nous sommes l’un des chefs de file utilisant l’apprentissage profond et l’apprentissage par renforcement afin de régler les problèmes de compréhension du langage et développant des algorithmes pour les machines fondés sur les capacités décisionnelles du cerveau humain. Située à Montréal, la plaque tournante mondiale de l’intelligence artificielle, notre équipe se compose d’experts dans leurs domaines respectifs. <br/><br/> L’objectif du groupe d’apprentissage par renforcement est de développer des méthodes fondées sur des bases théoriques afin d’améliorer l’extensibilité de l’apprentissage par renforcement, dans le but de l’appliquer à de vrais produits, comme la gestion du dialogue et les robots intelligents. En tant que membre de l’équipe d’apprentissage par renforcement, vous jouerez un rôle de premier plan dans la concrétisation de cet objectif ambitieux. En travaillant en étroite collaboration avec d’autres membres de l’équipe et en étant soutenu par un groupe d’ingénieurs qualifiés, vous participerez à la conception, à la mise en œuvre et à l’essai d’idées nouvelles pouvant révolutionner la façon dont nous interagissons avec les machines.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Engage in team collaborations and work towards the research goals of the project</li><li>Develop and implement research ideas related to the project</li><li>Actively participate in project meetings and report and present research findings</li> </ul>   <ul> <li>Collaborer activement avec l’équipe sur les objectifs de recherche du projet</li><li>Développer et implémenter les idées de recherches du projet</li><li>Participer aux réunions de projet et présenter les découvertes de votre recherche</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors, masters or equivalent degree in machine learning, optimization, or a related technical field</li> <li>Hands-on experience with reinforcement learning and/or deep learning</li><li>Strong communication skills</li><li>(Desired) Papers in peer-reviewed conferences, demonstrating your experience</li><li>Hands on experience with Python</li> <li>(Desired) Hands on experience with one of the following tools: CNTK, Theano, Tensorflow, PyTorch, or a similar toolkit.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Maîtrise ou doctorat en apprentissage par renforcement, apprentissage profond ou dans un domaine technique connexe</li> <li>Expérience en apprentissage par renforcement ou en apprentissage profond</li><li>Fortes compétences de communication</li><li>Expérience pratique avec Python</li> <li>(Souhaité) Publications en conférences avec comité de lecture prouvant votre expérience</li> <li>(Souhaité) Expérience pratique avec CNTK, Theano, Tensorflow, ou un outil équivalent.</li> </ul> Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity. Microsoft is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities up to the point of undue hardship during the recruitment, assessment and selection process. Please notify Microsoft if you require accommodation in respect of the materials or procedures used at any time during this process. If you require accommodation Microsoft will work with you to determine how to meet your need. <br/><br/> Microsoft souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et favorise la diversité de la main-d’œuvre. Durant le recrutement, l’évaluation et la procédure de sélection, Microsoft s’engage à prendre des mesures d’adaptation à l’égard des candidats handicapés sans aller jusqu’à la contrainte excessive. Veuillez aviser Microsoft si vous devez demander des mesures d’adaptation concernant les procédures ou documents utilisés à tout moment durant ce processus. Si vous demandez des mesures d’adaptation, Microsoft travaillera de concert avec vous pour trouver un moyen de répondre à vos besoins.
Title: Research Intern

Job_Description: <DIV><DIV><DIV><DIV><strong><br/> <DIV>National Bank believes artificial intelligence (“AI”) is core to the future of financial services. As such, we are seeking to build a robust and efficient AI practice that works with 1) each and every business unit at the Bank 2) all data and analytics teams already in place across the organization and 3) external partners, associations, and academic institutions.</DIV> <br/> <strong><DIV>NBC’s intention is to:</strong> <br/> ▪ implement AI and machine learning experts within each business line <br/> ▪ engage broadly with the AI community to offer new solutions, practices and knowledge to address challenges in financial services <br/> ▪ work in conjunction with partners to develop solutions and roadmaps that meet NBC's needs</DIV>  <br/><strong><br/> To accomplish this NBC will be appointing: <br/> ▪ a "Deputy Vice-President – AI Relationships and Partnerships" <br/> ▪ an "AI Practice Lead" <br/> ▪ an "AI Leader" <br/> ▪ several "Artificial Intelligence Experts" who will be dedicated to a specific business unit (Financial Markets, Wealth Management, Personal and Commercial Banking, IT, Operations, Finance and Treasury, Risk Management and Human Resources) <br/><br/> Main challenges for the Artificial Intelligence Experts:</DIV> <br/> <strong><ul> <li>Understand all key business objectives of NBC and how AI can accelerate the underlying strategy.</li> <li>Work directly with business unit partners and take ownership of the overall AI aspect in projects, its execution and deliverables.</li> <li>Make an important contribution to the analysis, design, and implementation of business performance approaches by developing tailor-made solutions and ensuring a positive impact and sustainable results.</li> <li>Drive research on industry trends and the commercial applications of machine learning for your specific business unit and lead the tool/asset development strategy to support AI solutions.</li> <li>Work in collaboration with the extended team and other data scientists and analysts to define, design and develop tools and strategies based on AI technologies.</li> <li>Collaborate closely and cohesively with CDO/strategy counterparts to maintain the AI framework, tools, datasets and standards.</li> <li>Develop, implement, and train deep learning algorithms and architectures.</li> <li>Identify and prioritize opportunities to apply AI for your business unit.</li> <li>Manage the end-to-end process of developing, presenting, prioritizing, and leading the implementation of AI solutions.</li> <li>Develop prototypes and scalable algorithms using technical data to enable insights and facilitate the decision making process.</li> <li>Introduce advanced predictive modelling to unearth key metrics and define success.</li> <li>Interpret technical data requirements and manage the development of data intelligence capabilities.</li> <li>Build portions of NBC’s AI environment.</li> <li>Work with internal and external partners to support the NBC AI ecosystem.</li> <li>Assume responsibility for the delivery of AI solutions throughout your business unit.</li> <li>Ensure that NBC attains a position at the forefront of using AI for business growth by leveraging the latest techniques, capabilities and tools.</DIV></DIV></li> </ul>  <DIV>• Ph.D. or Master's degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Computer Science or other field relevant to AI   <ul> <li>Experience in artificial intelligence, machine learning, natural language processing or other related areas</li> <li>Experience in training and tuning machine learning models to be used in production environments for real-time processing</li> <li>Experience with a broad spectrum of machine learning algorithms including unsupervised, supervised, and reinforcement learning and a variant of neural network models</li> <li>Experience working with unstructured data (email, documents, chats)</li> <li>Sound applied statistics foundations; comfortable discussing topics such as probability distributions, bias/variance trade-off and hypothesis testing</li> <li>Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as k-NN, naive Bayes, SVM, decision forests, boosting, ensembling, neural networks, etc.</li> <li>Experience with common data science/machine learning toolkits</li> <li>Experience with big data tools such as Spark, Hadoop, an asset</li> <li>Strong perspective on current and emerging machine learning trends</li> <li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in a team</DIV></li> </ul>  <strong><br/> We strive to be an inclusive organization where all employees are valued. National Bank stands out for its many initiatives to promote inclusion, making it a Canada-wide leader in diversity. <br/> See how we do it: https://jobs.nbc.ca/diversity</DIV> <br/> <DIV>#LI-CF1</DIV>
Title: Artificial Intelligence Experts

Job_Description: Established in 1972, Thales Canada is a leading electronic solutions provider for the Transportation, Defence & Security, and Aerospace sectors. Thales Canada employs staff across main sites located in Montreal, Quebec City, Ottawa, Toronto and Vancouver. <br/><br/> Thales is known for its People1st philosophy and provides a competitive salary and benefits package. Join a dynamic and fast paced organization which is growing as a result of exciting new domestic and international projects.  <br/> The role of Thales Research and Technology (TRT) is to extend the influence of Thales within the scientific and technical communities, offering a platform for innovation and knowledge sharing, and attracting talented science graduates to build on our acquired expertise. <br/> Thales needs to obtain increasingly sophisticated technologies, particularly in detection, analysis and decision-making technology, in order to design and develop critical information systems. <br/><br/> With the exciting advancements within our Research and Technology hub, we are seeking a Lead Scientist-Artificial Intelligence who will manage three main activities within Thales; the AI R&T projects portfolio, the development of the AI Research and Technologies roadmap and the team of AI scientists mainly based in cortAIx our Center of Research and Technology in Artificial Intelligence eXpertise located in Montreal, with some resources in our Quebec City office as well. <br/><br/> Main Responsibilities <br/> · Manage the AI team of scientists in the Montreal cortAIx office; <br/> · Contribute to the development of the AI research and technology roadmap in collaboration with internal senior stakeholders, The TRT Director and Global Business Unit leaders; <br/> · Establish and maintain strong links with cortAIx Digital Factory North America. <br/><br/> Overall R&T responsibilities <br/> · Contribute to setting the scientific and technology vision in trusted and explainable AI; <br/> · Support the definition of the Country Technical & Innovation Strategic Plan (TISP) as it relates to AI; <br/> · Manage the portfolio of AI R&T projects through a well-established launch and review process; <br/> · Contribute to the delivery once a year of an AI R&T report identifying project progress, their financial status, the research context (consortium, partners), the objectives and the outcomes to the Group Technical Director; <br/> · Participate in accessing and increasing the sources of AI R&T funding; <br/> · Put in place AI partnerships with Universities and research institutions; <br/> · Create links with AI R&T networks that are pertinent to the Domains in North America; <br/> · On AI related topics encourage close cooperation and liaison between Domain and BL technical directors and the technical directors of all the TRT-Centers in the Group with AI capabilities; <br/> · When required and in relation to AI solutions in bids and projects provide the technical expertise for risk analysis and risk reduction approach; <br/> · Ensure consistency between AI R&T expertise and the needs; <br/> · Contribute to the promotion, development and support of AI experts carrier plan; <br/> · Support the training of highly educated people, encourage the recruitment and retention of scientists, engineers and supporting staff; <br/> · Ensure that IP generated through the projects is protected in accordance with the Group IP policy. <br/><br/> Essential Skills and Qualifications <br/> · Post Honours Doctorate (Ph.D) is a mandatory; <br/> · Experience in Trusted/Explainable and validated AI a preference; <br/> · Experience in Machine learning or Symbolic AI/cognitive agents a preference; <br/> · Experience in Hybrid approaches between data-driven and knowledge-driven; <br/> · Experience in Human-machine interaction/dialog; <br/> · Has authored a number of scientific publications and patents; <br/> · Leadership culture and qualities; <br/> · Team coaching skills and experience; <br/> · Previous experience in industry or with an industrial lab; <br/> · Strong motivation to transfer AI science and technology to applied AI in industrial solutions; <br/> · Experience in Agile methodology to deliver proof of concepts and projects; <br/> · Solid English communication skills (French would a plus in the Montreal ecosystem); <br/> · Has fostered internal and external collaborations. <br/><br/> Thales is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applicants from the four designated groups (women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and aboriginals) to apply for employment. At Thales, we provide accessibility to people with disabilities. Should you require accommodations, please consult with your recruitment office and they will work with you to make any adjustments that best suit your individual needs. Should you wish to view a copy of our policy click here. <br/><br/>
Title: Lead Scientist-Artificial Intelligence

Job_Description: Would you like the opportunity to provide senior leadership to a dynamic research and engineering organization at the time of its rapid growth? <br/><br/> Founded in 2011 and acquired by Microsoft in 2017, Microsoft Research Montréal (formerly Maluuba)’s start-up culture, combined with Microsoft’s commitment to research, is tackling the biggest challenges in language understanding and artificial intelligence. Our goal is to achieve General Artificial Intelligence by teaching machines to think, reason, and communicate. We’re an early leader in using deep learning to solve language-understanding problems and in training machines to model the decision-making capabilities of the human brain. Based in Montréal, a global hub for AI, our team brings together experts in various machine-learning domains: deep learning, reinforcement learning, NLP, machine reading, computational linguistics and more. <br/><br/> We are seeking a candidate to be a key member of the Microsoft Research Montréal leadership team to provide business and operational leadership to ensure effective programs and processes are in place to meet MSR Montréal’s business objectives. The role is an interesting and unique hybrid of several traditional roles - management consulting, strategic planning, financial planning, analytics, and project management, operations strategy, execution, government relations,. This is a great opportunity to help scale and influence a fast growing and important technology for Microsoft. <br/><br/> <strong>Role Description</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong>Business Manager</strong> drives and facilitates the business operations, processes, strategies, communications and general administration of the organization. Provides insight and advice to management around financial and operational issues, participates in overall operational strategy decisions, and assists in implementing best practices, policies and procedures within the organization. Must have the ability to think strategically and work with leadership to effectively develop and implement best practices, processes and procedures that facilitate consistent efficient management of the business planning, reporting, procurement and control processes. Also, track and report on high level group and team objectives and on-going progress that aid MSR Montréal leadership in identifying and removing obstacles. <br/><br/> Aimeriez-vous occuper une place de choix au sein de la haute direction d’une entreprise dynamique de recherche et d’ingénierie en pleine expansion? <br/><br/> Microsoft Research Montréal (anciennement Maluuba) a été fondée en 2011, puis achetée par Microsoft en 2017. Notre culture d’entreprise en démarrage et l’engagement de Microsoft envers la recherche nous permettent de nous attaquer aux plus grands défis de la compréhension du langage et de l’intelligence artificielle. Notre objectif est de doter les machines d’une intelligence artificielle générale en leur apprenant à penser, à raisonner et à communiquer. Nous sommes parmi les premiers chefs de file à utiliser l’apprentissage profond dans le but de régler des problèmes de compréhension du langage et à développer des algorithmes pour les machines basés sur les capacités décisionnelles du cerveau humain. Notre équipe est située à Montréal, une plaque tournante mondiale de l’intelligence artificielle, et elle rassemble des experts dans des domaines variés en matière d’apprentissage artificiel : apprentissage profond, apprentissage par renforcement, traitement du langage naturel, lecture automatique, linguistique computationnelle et plus encore. <br/><br/> Nous sommes à la recherche d’un candidat qui occupera un rôle clé au sein de l’équipe de direction des activités et des affaires de Microsoft Research Montréal afin d’assurer la mise en place de programmes et de processus destinés à l’atteinte des objectifs commerciaux de l’entreprise. Le poste comporte un mélange intéressant et unique de plusieurs tâches traditionnelles, soit le conseil en gestion, la planification stratégique, la planification financière, l’analyse, la gestion de projets, la stratégie et l’exécution des opérations et les relations avec les organismes gouvernementaux. Il s’agit d’une excellente occasion d’apporter sa contribution afin de faire progresser une technologie essentielle de Microsoft en plein essor. <br/><br/> <strong>Description du poste</strong> <br/><br/> Le <strong>gestionnaire d’entreprise</strong> stimule et facilite les activités, les processus, les stratégies, les communications et l’administration générale de l’entreprise. Il fournit des idées et des conseils à la direction concernant les questions financières et opérationnelles; participe à l’ensemble des décisions stratégiques; contribue à la mise en œuvre des pratiques exemplaires, des politiques et des procédures au sein de l’entreprise. Il doit être capable de penser de façon stratégique et de travailler étroitement avec l’équipe de direction pour concevoir et mettre en œuvre des pratiques exemplaires, des processus et des procédures qui facilitent une gestion cohérente et efficace des étapes de planification, de production de rapports, d’approvisionnement et de contrôle au sein de l’entreprise. Il fait le suivi et rend compte des progrès concernant l’atteinte des objectifs fondamentaux de groupes et d’équipes, afin d’aider la direction de Microsoft Research Montréal à détecter les obstacles et à les surmonter.<br/><br/>Responsibilities<br/><br/>Key member of the MSR Montréal senior leadership team, with responsibility for the business aspects of MSR Montréal, including: <ul> <li>Budget owner, work with the finance team and Microsoft Research Montréal managers to drive effective yearly, quarterly and monthly budgeting processes, and to ensure tracking, analyzing and follow-up on all budget-related activities take place; also includes developing and rolling out new systems and processes related to budget management when necessary</li><li>Establishing and maintaining hiring, onboarding and offboarding practices, including partnering with other labs and Microsoft groups to implement best practices. Managing headcount for the lab and overseeing workflow and workload of supporting staff</li><li>Provide purchasing oversight and troubleshooting support for Microsoft Research Montréal procurement of goods and services</li><li>Working with various Microsoft groups, including:</li>  <ul> <li>Microsoft Legal on contracts, IP and other legal matters for Microsoft Research Montréal</li> <li>Microsoft Tax related to tax opportunities and compliance matters</li><li>Microsoft Real Estate, Montréal site manager and Finance on all office space management and planning</li><li>Microsoft Redmond admin/operation team, including finding and implement best practices from other teams into the Microsoft Research Montréal team</li> </ul>  <li>Ensure Microsoft Research Montréal is compliant with Microsoft standards and policies in the finance, HR and business operations</li><li>Handling special projects as requested by the Corporate Vice President and Managing Director of Microsoft Research</li><li>Business Manager’s direct reports include office manager, administrative assistant and contingent staff</li> </ul> Membre clé de l’équipe de haute direction de Microsoft Research Montréal et responsable des aspects commerciaux de l’entreprise, dont voici les tâches principales : <ul> <li>Gère le budget; travaille avec l’équipe des finances et la direction de Microsoft Research Montréal afin d’accélérer les processus d’établissement de budgets annuels, trimestriels et mensuels; assure l’analyse et le suivi de toutes les activités liées au budget; développe et procède au lancement de nouveaux systèmes et processus de gestion de budget, au besoin.</li><li>Instaure et maintient les pratiques d’embauche, d’accueil et de départ des employés, en collaborant avec d’autres laboratoires et groupes Microsoft pour la mise en œuvre de pratiques exemplaires. Gère les effectifs du laboratoire et supervise le flux et la charge de travail du personnel de soutien.</li><li>Supervise les achats et offre du soutien et du dépannage pour l’approvisionnement de biens et de services de Microsoft Research Montréal.</li><li>Travaille avec divers groupes Microsoft, notamment :</li>  <ul> <li>le service juridique de Microsoft au sujet des contrats, de la propriété intellectuelle et d’autres affaires juridiques pour Microsoft Research Montréal;</li> <li>le service fiscal de Microsoft au sujet des avantages fiscaux et des questions de conformité;</li><li>le service immobilier de Microsoft, de même que le gestionnaire de site à Montréal et le service des finances en matière de planification et de gestion des espaces de bureau;</li><li>l’équipe d’administration et d’exploitation de Microsoft Redmond, notamment pour la recherche et la mise en œuvre de pratiques exemplaires au sein de l’équipe de Microsoft Research Montréal, en s’inspirant des autres équipes.</li> </ul>  <li>S’assure que Microsoft Research Montréal est conforme aux normes et aux politiques de Microsoft en matière de finances, de ressources humaines et d’opérations commerciales.</li><li>Gère les projets spéciaux à la demande de la vice-présidente et directrice générale de Microsoft Research.</li><li>Les subordonnés directs du gestionnaire d’entreprise comprennent le directeur des services administratifs, l’assistant administratif et les collaborateurs.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Ability to think strategically at a cross-group level and develop processes that facilitate consistent and effective management of the business process, reporting and control systems</li><li>Strong cross-group skills, experience leading virtual teams, technical aptitude to engage with researchers and ability to develop internal and external relationships are critical for this role</li><li>Demonstrated experience managing government relations in a research, education or similar environment</li><li>Proven ability to drive and complete projects independently and to work on several diverse projects at the same time</li><li>High level of motivation, self-starter, drive for results, strong team-work spirit</li><li>10+ years’ experience in financial analysis, project management, business planning or similar experience</li> <li>Demonstrated people management experience</li><li>Business or accounting degree preferred</li><li>Bilingual French/English preferred</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Capacité de penser de façon stratégique en tenant compte de plusieurs groupes et de développer des processus facilitant la gestion cohérente et efficace des processus d’affaires et des systèmes de contrôle et de production de rapports</li><li>Sont essentielles pour ce rôle une grande capacité à travailler avec plusieurs groupes, une expérience en gestion d’équipes virtuelles, les aptitudes techniques nécessaires à la collaboration avec des chercheurs et une capacité à créer des liens internes et externes</li><li>Expérience démontrée en gestion des relations avec des organismes gouvernementaux dans un contexte de recherches, dans un environnement pédagogique ou dans un milieu du même type</li><li>Une capacité éprouvée à lancer et à réaliser des projets de façon indépendante ainsi qu’à travailler simultanément sur un grand nombre de projets</li><li>Bon esprit d’équipe, grande motivation, détermination et volonté d’obtenir des résultats</li><li>Au moins dix années d’expérience en analyse financière, en gestion de projets, en planification d’entreprise ou dans un domaine semblable</li> <li>Expérience démontrée en gestion du personnel</li><li>Diplôme en affaires ou en comptabilité préférable</li><li>Préférence pour les candidats bilingues (français, anglais)</li>  </ul> Considering a Career with Microsoft Canada? <br/><br/> At Microsoft Canada, people are the source of our energy. The people at Microsoft Canada are creative, from all types of backgrounds, bringing passion and new ideas, meeting challenges, and realizing their potential. Our benefits and resources are designed to keep our most important asset - our employees - healthy, happy and equipped with the resources they need to be successful and realize their full potential. Microsoft Canada provides a flexible work environment, with career advancement potential and most importantly, the opportunity to make a difference. As a Microsoft employee you have the opportunity to participate in the following programs: Stock Awards & Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Registered Retirement Savings Plan, Employee Software Purchase Program, Fitness Membership & Subsidy, I Volunteer (5 Paid Volunteer Days), Employee Assistance Program Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity. Microsoft is committed to accommodating applicant’s with disabilities up to the point of undue hardship during the recruitment, assessment and selection process. Please notify Microsoft if you require accommodation in respect of the materials or procedures used at any time during this process. If you require accommodation Microsoft will work with you to determine how to meet your need. <br/><br/> Vous envisagez une carrière au sein de Microsoft Canada? <br/><br/> Chez Microsoft Canada, nos employés représentent la force de notre entreprise. Notre personnel se compose de gens créatifs, passionnés et inventifs, de tous les horizons, qui relèvent constamment de nouveaux défis et réalisent leur potentiel. Nos avantages et nos ressources permettent à nos employés – notre atout le plus important – de mener une vie saine et heureuse, avec les ressources nécessaires à leur réussite et à l’atteinte de leur plein potentiel. Microsoft Canada offre un environnement de travail flexible, des possibilités d’avancement professionnel, et surtout, l’occasion d’apporter votre contribution. À titre d’employé de Microsoft, vous avez la possibilité de participer aux programmes suivants: Régimes d’attribution d’actions et d’actionnariat des salariés Régime enregistré d’épargne-retraite Programme d’achat de logiciels pour les employés Programme I Bénévolat (5 jours de travail bénévole payés) Programme d’assistance aux employés Et bien plus encore... Chez Microsoft, nous partageons une passion pour la technologie, nos clients et nos partenaires. Nous souhaitons être plus qu’une bonne entreprise, nous voulons être une grande entreprise. Notre force provient de notre engagement envers notre mission de permettre aux personnes et aux entreprises dans le monde entier de réaliser leur plein potentiel. Microsoft souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et favorise la diversité de la main-d’uvre Durant le recrutement, l’évaluation et la procédure de sélection, Microsoft s’engage à prendre des mesures d’adaptation à l’égard des candidats handicapés sans aller jusqu’à la contrainte excessive. Veuillez aviser Microsoft si vous devez demander des mesures d’adaptation concernant les procédures ou documents utilisés à tout moment durant ce processus. Si vous demandez des mesures d’adaptation, Microsoft travaillera de concert avec vous pour trouver un moyen de répondre à vos besoins.
Title: Business Manager

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><DIV>EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax and transaction advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>We are seeking passionate, entrepreneurial individuals to join us on an exciting journey of evolving our next generation Data Science and Big Data platform and building an expanding set of Managed Data Science Services across multiple industries. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>The role will be responsible for proactively identifying AI and Machine Learning opportunities within Client portfolios, building, and validating, deploying and monitoring advanced descriptive, predictive and prescriptive machine learning models, including Risk Management, Customer Experience and Journey analytics, Digital Analytics, Customer Segmentation, Customer Acquisition, Churn Management, Next Best Action and many others.</DIV>                   <div>  <DIV><B><U>Responsibilities:</U></B></DIV> <DIV><STRONG><U></U></STRONG> </DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Effectively partner with Clients to understand and anticipate their needs and guide them towards building AI and Machine Learning solutions delivering both short-term wins and identifying long-term opportunities for managed data science services</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Build, validate, deploy, monitor and provide DevOps support for a set of AI/Machine Learning models and services for both internal POCs and Client production initiatives, including Risk Management, Customer Experience and Journey analytics, Digital Analytics, Customer Segmentation, Customer Acquisition, Churn Management, Next Best Action and many others.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Leverage commercial and open source AI, Machine Learning, Big Data ecosystem tools, BI, Visualization and Discovery tool to deliver advanced models and other Data Science solutions. Specific tools will include (but not limited to), full SAS stack, R, Python, Scala, Java, Spark SQL/ML/MLLib/GraphX, Data Science Notebooks and Workbenches, Azure Machine Learning, Tableau, Datameer, and other tools</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proactively monitor and tune AI / Machine Learning model performance, manage champion/challenger models to ensure optimal performance and resource utilization.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ensure all AI/Machine Learning models are properly packaged and documented for deployment. Participate in client training and knowledge transfer as required.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ensure all solutions comply with the highest levels of security, privacy and data governance requirements as outlined by EY and Client legal and information security guidelines, law enforcement, and privacy legislation, including data anonymization, encryption, and security in transit and at rest and others as applicable</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Effectively leverage continuous integration, continuous development and continuous deployment agile and DevOps tools and processes to deliver and support advanced Data Science and Big Data solutions and services, including Git, Jira, Jenkins and others as required</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Acts as a Subject Matter Expert and a Thought Leader, continuously following industry trends, the latest competitive developments, and delivering papers and presentations at major industry conferences and events.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B><U>Qualification/Requirements</U></B></DIV> <DIV><STRONG><U></U></STRONG> </DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>A degree in AI, Machine Learning, Statistics, Economics/Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Data Scientist certification, including Hadoop, Spark or equivalent production experience </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proficiency and an in-depth understanding of the Predictive Modeling Lifecycle and best practices for feature engineering, model development and tuning (hyper-parameter, ensemble modeling techniques, deep learning), model validation, model deployment packaging, model management and performance monitoring </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>7+ years of extensive experience building Predictive Machine Learning and AI models for Customer Experience, Customer Journey analytics, Customer Segmentation, Churn modeling, Lookalike Modeling or equivalent use cases</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>5+ years of experience with Text Mining, NLP and Sentiment Analysist</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>5+ years of production experience with SAS platform, including, Base, Stat, ETS and other core packages, client tools – Enterprise Guide (EG), Enterprise Miner (EM), Visual Analytics (VA), Visual Statistics (VS), SAS Studio</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience running SAS 9.4 on Hadoop – SAS/Access or in-database SAS HPA</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with SAS Risk and Finance modeling modules and workbenches would be an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with SAS Decision Manager would be an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with SAS Text Mining and Sentiment Analysis (SA) would be an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with Open source AI / Machine Learning / Data Science tools – R, Python, Spark.
