Including experience working with Notebooks (Zeppelin, Jupyter) and Data Science Workbenches (Azure, DSX)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with Spark-based machine learning, including Spark SQL, ML, MlLib, GraphX</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with Deep Learning on CPUs and GPUs, including ANN, CNN, RNN frameworks like TensorFlow/Keras, MXNet or equivalent would be an asset. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with Azure Machine Learning would be an asset</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV>  </div>            </div>  </div>  </div>     </div> 	</div>
Title: Manager – Data Scientist

Job_Description: <strong>Role: Solutions Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Company: integrate.ai,</strong> https://www.integrate.ai <br/><br/> <strong>Location: Downtown Toronto</strong> <br/><br/> At integrate.ai, our mission is to build a future in which AI enriches people’s lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. To do this we are building an AI powered platform for B2C enterprises that integrates with business processes to make customer interactions more natural and valuable. We are proudly based in downtown Toronto, Canada at the center of an exciting AI ecosystem. <br/><br/> <strong>Role</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a <strong>Solutions Analyst</strong> who is excited to work on a client facing team and excels at delivering and communicating concise business insights. Responsibilities for this role will range from data ingest to collaborating with both internal and external stakeholders to build the platform in a way that best suits our clients' needs. This is an exciting role that requires both strong interpersonal skills and deep technical knowledge. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Responsibilities</strong></strong> <ul>  <li>Consistently delivering quality work as a member of integrate.ai’s client engagement team, while keeping client love and trust at the forefront of all your work</li> <li>Principally delivering data ingest for our client data, including cataloguing the data and mapping it to our schema</li> <li>Collaborating with integrate.ai’s business team to create polished data visualizations and pull high level business insights from our client data</li> <li>Working closely with our machine learning team in the early stages of model development to identify valuable patterns and information in the data</li> <li>Collaborating with integrate.ai's Solutions Engineers to translate complex business logic into integrate.ai's proprietary schema</li> <li>Supporting Solutions Engineers to do systems integration work with our clients</li> <li>Sending feedback to our platform engineering and product teams to develop requirements for our product roadmap - specifically our ingest, structuring, and integrations abilities</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>An appreciation for the beauty of data. You love a challenge, and you’re excited about bringing a narrative to complex business problems using what you learn from a dataset</li> <li><strong>Experience directly working with clients and understand the importance of prioritizing client needs</strong></li> <li>A Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Data Science/Statistics is an asset</li> <li><strong>Strong technical abilities, creative problem solving skills and high adaptability</strong></li> <li>Extraordinary interpersonal, organization and communications skills</li> <li>Experience working directly with business users to build reports and answer business questions with data</li> <li><strong>Experience working with big data structures and ETL tools to uncover meaningful business insights</strong></li> <li>A good understanding of statistical modelling and you’re passionate about deriving insights from large datasets</li> <li><strong>Previous exposure to big data technologies (Hadoop/Spark, Hive SQL, etc.)</strong></li> <li><strong>Programming experience with Python, R, or SAS</strong></li> <li>Adaptability and interest in working with a dynamic, early stage company</li> </ul> The diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ai’s team members help us make better decisions and drive great results. We foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. We're committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. We hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and growth. We are naturally curious with strong attention to detail. We love working as a team where trust is paramount while focusing on making an impact every day. If this sounds like the right fit, please apply and come work with us!
Title: Solutions Analyst

Job_Description: We are looking for an experienced Software Architect to join our team and make an immediate impact. <br/><br/> You will need to make intuitive high level decisions for software development. You will see the big picture and create architectural approaches for software design and implementation to guide the development team. <br/><br/> A great software architect with a strong technical background and excellent management/organizational skills with an interest in the emerging field of blockchain business applications. <br/><br/> The goal is to provide a framework for the development of our specific software products and oversee the team/process. <br/><br/> Must be capable of dealing with aggressive schedules. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Collaborate with other professionals to determine functional and non-functional requirements for new software or applications</li> <li>Use tools and methodologies to create representations for functions and user interface of desired product</li> <li>Develop high-level product specifications with attention to system integration and feasibility</li> <li>Define all aspects of development from appropriate technology and workflow to coding standards</li> <li>Communicate successfully all concepts and guidelines to development team</li> <li>Oversee progress of development team to ensure consistency with initial design</li> <li>Provide technical guidance and coaching to developers and engineers</li> <li>Ensure software meets all requirements of quality, security, modifiability, extensibility etc.</li> <li>Approve final product before launch</li> <li>Developing a plan to integrate acquired companies tech stack into our core platform</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Proven experience as software architect and project lead</li> <li>Experience in software development and coding in various languages (HTML, Java (node.js), PHP) etc.)</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of software and application design and architecture</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of implementing agile development methodologies</li> <li>Familiarity with UI/UX design</li> <li>Understanding of software quality assurance principles</li> <li>A technical mindset with great attention to detail</li> <li>High quality organizational and leadership skills</li> <li>Outstanding communication and presentation abilities</li> <li>Github account with a track record of quality work</li> <li>Familiarity with AI / machine learning</li> <li>Familiarity / enthusiast with blockchain cryptocurrency technology such as Ethereum and Solidity</li> <li>Familiarity with the digital ad tech landscape</li> </ul> <strong>Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of related experience</li> <li>Proven track record</li> <li>BSc/BA in computer science, engineering or relevant field</li> </ul> <strong>Job Location</strong>  <ul> <li>Collingwood, Ontario</li> </ul>
Title: Software Architect Project Lead - Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Company Description</strong> <br/><br/> null <br/> Job Description<br/><br/>Ubisoft Montreal is looking for you, Data Scientists. <br/><br/> At Ubisoft Montreal, a preeminent developer of video games located in Montreals dynamic Mile-End neighbourhood since 1997, we offer a work environment unique in the industry for allowing you to build and cultivate games that are part of critically acclaimed, iconic AAA franchises of international repute. <br/><br/> When you join Ubi Montreal, you enter a community of passionate, extraordinary developers connected by their need to innovate, to be creative and to work with the latest technology. Youll discover a world where employees enjoy constant career advancement, a supportive learning environment, and competitive compensation packages. <br/><br/> <u><strong>On being a data scientist at Ubi Montreal</strong></u> <br/><br/> The Data Scientist must develop and execute statistical and mathematical solutions to resolve corporate and / or project challenges. The incumbent provides solutions that make processes and systems smarter by designing predictive models and must create relevant analytical methods to evaluate results in a scientific manner. <br/><br/> <u><strong>The daily life of a data scientist at Ubi Montreal</strong></u> <ul> <li>Identify issues and determine approaches and quantitative methods to develop solutions;</li> <li>Conduct research to identify new ways to model and predict player behaviors and design tests that answer targeted questions;</li> <li>Develop tools to solve complex problems (for example, optimizing game performance, monetization and product adoption);</li> <li>Demonstrate analytical rigor and use statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data and develop workable analyzes that apply advanced statistical techniques, such as predictive models, player / user profiles, segmentation analysis, design and survey analysis and data mining;</li> <li>Design and manage proof of concept for forecast / prescription and AI projects;</li> <li>Document and define projects including data collection and processing, advanced approaches, final algorithm, detailed results and analytical criteria;</li> <li>Develop material that serves to explain project findings and solve complex problems in an ingenious and effective way;</li> <li>Collaborate with colleagues and managers internally and externally to share relevant complex information;</li> <li>Work on short and medium term tasks that often require independence of judgment beyond the procedures in place;</li> <li>Contribute to the identification of approaches and the development of new or improved technical tools;</li> <li>Coach less experienced colleagues;</li><li>Perform other related duties</li> </ul>  Qualifications<br/><br/><u><strong>What it takes to make it</strong></u> <ul> <li>Master&apos;s degree and / or doctorate in mathematics, statistics, machine learning or equivalent experience;</li> <li>Minimum of 3 years of complex experience and in-depth expertise related to the position;</li> <li>Ability to use and develop proven machine learning algorithms and related methods;</li> <li>Ability to use advanced data science techniques ;</li> <li>Ability to use statistics to understand the behavior of systems and individuals;</li> <li>Ability to configure, use and develop data management systems;</li> <li>Knowledge of big data technologies (Hadoop, Casandra, MongoDB, ElasticSearch);</li> <li>Software Engineering Skills;</li><li>Knowledge of distributed computing to ensure model learning;</li> <li>Being passionate about using the science of data in problem solving;</li> <li>Ability to assess problems quickly, both qualitatively and quantitatively;</li> <li>Team spirit and excellent organizational, relational and communication skills;</li><li>Bilingualism (French-English)</li> </ul>  Additional Information<br/><br/><strong>We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.</strong>
Title: Data Scientist (user research lab)

Job_Description: Job Description<div><strong>Junior Data Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>AdeptMind Inc.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Compensation- CA $35k-$45k Annually</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Position: Full-Time</strong> <br/><br/> Adeptmind is a fast-growing Machine learning company applying natural language and search technologies on e-commerce space. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do:</strong> <ul>  <li>Create, collect, edit, organize and clean data</li>  </ul> <strong>You should be able to check off most things from this list:</strong> <ul>  <li>BSc/BA or equivalent</li> <li>able to multitask and handle a fast pace environment</li> <li>Familiar with Excel or Google Spreadsheet</li> <li>Native fluency in English</li> <li>Interest in AI/ML</li>  </ul> If you are interested, you can get introduced to some of the latest AI technologies, maybe play with some of them. <br/><br/> <strong>Perks:</strong> <ul>  <li>Competitive salary commensurate with experience/qualification: CA $35k-45k</li> <li>Smart and knowledgeable colleagues</li> <li>And of course, catered meals managed by food expert</li>  </ul> <strong>About the Company:</strong> <br/><br/> Adeptmind is an AI company innovating in e-commerce search using active learning and deep learning. Its co-founders recently came out of a quite successful sale of their previous company. This time around, they raised a little too much VC capital and are looking to grow a kick-ass Silicon Valley style team right here in downtown Toronto. <br/><br/> Of course, life in a young startup can get hectic. We actively hold technical seminars, send our people to conferences and initiate manageable research projects. We believe a company cannot grow until the people can. <br/><br/> Let us know if you feel like working here!</div>Company Description<div>About the Company: <br/><br/> Adeptmind is an AI company innovating in e-commerce search using active learning and deep learning. We're the first company boasting 100% accuracy in our results! <br/><br/> Our co-founders recently came out of a quite successful sale of their previous company. This time around, they raised a little too much VC capital and are looking to grow a kick-ass Silicon Valley style team right here in downtown Toronto. <br/><br/> Our current engineering efforts focus on vertical expansion: building more tools and services. Current projects ranges from creating internal service to providing command line utilities as well large scale crawling and data processing. If you are a hacker minded developer like us, you will find it at home. <br/><br/> Of course, life in a young startup can get hectic. Above all, our people matter to us. We truly focus on being a platform on which we the people become the best we can be. We actively hold technical seminars, send our people to conferences and conduct academic research. Of course, a company cannot grow until the people can. <br/><br/> If you feel like being a startup superstar, we'd love to hear from you!</div>
Title: Junior Data Analyst

Job_Description: Our paid marketing team spends their days creating digital advertising programs that will drive growth for the business in traffic, user acquisition and revenue. At the core of all their decisions is data.and they love it. <br/><br/> With a focus on paid search youll strategize, optimize (and all the other izes!) to drive quality traffic to our site and kick some ROI goals. Youll build testing frameworks and like the rest of the team, be digging in to the data to develop insights and change tactics when needed. Youll increase Marketing spend efficiency by working closely with the Analytics team to introduce AI and Machine Learning algorithms into Marketing Campaigns. Well make sure you have all the support you need so you can learn, grow and amaze us with the results you achieve. <br/><br/> <strong>What Youll Do</strong> <ul> <li>Lead strategy and execution across paid search programs on Google, Bing and other search platforms</li><li>Lead management of paid social programs on Facebook, Pinterest and other platforms that could capture potential buyers</li><li> Lead the monitoring of bids, budget caps, impression share, competition metrics, and other important account metrics, to proactively identify and action opportunities for optimization</li> <li>Develop strategic pay per click campaigns based on research and insights by implementing campaign structures that are ripe for automation and testing</li><li>Organize keywords into focused ad groups and identify appropriate keyword match types and bidding strategies</li><li>Analyze existing paid search strategies and structure and provide actionable insights and recommendations for improvement</li><li>Keep pace with search engine and PPC industry trends and tactics and identify new opportunities for growth</li><li>Monitor paid search performance and communicate to the team on new project developments and results</li><li>Assist in the management of display and other contextual advertising platforms</li><li>Communicate frequently and work collaboratively with the broader Marketing team and cross-functionally with our Analytics, Technology, Merchandising and Seller Services teams</li><li>Assist the Paid Media Specialist to further refine our paid marketing best practices and procedures</li><li>Develop interim and post-campaign results reports and dashboards, highlighting campaign performance in a compelling format that is accessible to different audiences</li><li>Communicate with our vendors (Adobe, Google, Bing) to provide/receive regular updates on performance and platform functionality</li><li>Manage direct reports for success</li> </ul> <strong>What Youll Achieve</strong> <ul> <li>As part of the paid marketing team, we believe youll have the tools to create and manage an award-winning paid search program, improving and optimizing campaigns to increase performance and drive growth for the business</li><li>Provide insights and assistance with display campaigns, social ads and other performance platforms, increasing top-line revenue and search market share while exceeding defined ROI expectations</li><li>Lead a team of junior marketers, sharing your expertise in the industry and nurturing their ongoing development</li> </ul> <strong>What Youll Need</strong> <ul> <li>5 years online marketing experience, including 3 years focus in biddable and direct response strategy & execution</li><li>2 years experience in a Digital Marketing leadership role managing direct reports</li><li>Passion for search and digital marketing</li><li>A recognized degree or diploma in marketing, communications, e-commerce or similar</li><li>Experience developing, managing and reporting on successful online marketing campaigns, ideally in PPC or display</li><li>Knowledge of and/or experience working with online search and analytics platform(s), e.g. Google Analytics, AdWords, DoubleClick, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Media Optimizer, Adobe Audience, Criteo, etc.</li><li>Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, Javascript with use of Google Tag Manager</li><li>Knowledge of programmatic Ad buying is an asset</li><li>High attention to detail and natural tendency of triple-checking all changes</li><li>Keenness for analyzing vast amounts of online/offline datathose Excel skills are a must</li><li>The ability to learn quickly and adapt to new challenges, channels and goals</li><li>Effective written and oral communication skills</li><li>A desire to work independently being highly self-motivated and accountable</li> </ul> <strong>What You Must Have</strong> <ul> <li>An audacious spirit that embraces uncertainty and challenges with enthusiasm</li><li>High levels of integrity and a commitment to do what you say you are going to do</li><li>Strong entrepreneurial spirit that has grit, determination and challenges the status quo</li><li>High degree of empathy and the ability to see others perspective</li><li>Strong sense of curiosity and the desire to learn and get better everyday</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>What is BuildDirects mission?</strong> <br/><br/> BuildDirect is a technology company, building an open platform for the home improvement industry. Our platform enables home-owners and contractors to find the perfect home improvement product from a large online selection. Our mission is to transform the home improvement industry, empower home owners to create their dream home, enable suppliers and manufacturers to supply what home owners really want and the way they want it, and reimagining the home improvement industry. <br/><br/> <strong>BuildDirect by the numbers</strong> <br/><br/> Founded in 1999 in beautiful Vancouver. Today over 250 employees with more than 100 in the Technology groups in Vancouver, Waterloo and Bangalore. Every month 2.5 million home owners visit BuildDirect and we ship eight million pounds of products over a distance of about six million miles. Learn more at https://www.builddirect.com/Welcome.
Title: Digital Marketing Manager

As part of our team, you will help customers unlock the value of their data through on premise and remote support deliveries.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul> <li> <strong> Deep</strong>  <strong>technical</strong> <strong>or</strong> <strong>architectural</strong> <strong>knowledge</strong> <strong>of</strong> <strong>at</strong> <strong>least</strong> <strong>2</strong> <strong>of</strong> <strong>the</strong> <strong>following</strong> <strong>areas:</strong></li></ul>  <ul>   <ul> <li> <strong> <strong>Database</strong></strong>  <strong>administration</strong> (preferably with SQL, including Azure SQL) – performance tuning and optimization, trouble-shooting, high availability / disaster recovery, security</li></ul></ul>  <ul>   <ul> <li> <strong> Job_Description: <div><div>One of Alberta’s Top Employers for a seventh consecutive year, NAIT offers a wealth of personal and family health and well-being benefits, training and development opportunities to support the professional growth of our staff, access to recreational and leisure facilities, a welcoming and inclusive environment unrivaled in engagement and dynamism, and co-workers who are collaborative, respectful and supportive. <br/><br/> Focused on boosting productivity in Alberta’s $573-million digital media industry, which includes companies that develop software, apps, movies, animation and games, the CIM will enable NAIT to house the experts, equipment and environments to help partner companies develop and commercialize new digital products. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Associate Dean Research, and working in close collaboration with the Centre Director, Business Development, the Senior Technical Theme Lead will be a key member of the CIM’s leadership team, providing technical expertise as well as project management cycles. <br/><br/> Current work will include platform development efforts in the evolution of serious games, training platforms, digital learning objects, and the evaluation of the effectiveness of these applied research projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Development and management of project deliverables, milestones, and budgets</li>  <li>Closely collaborating with the Centre Director, Business Development to support Centre growth, new initiatives, and new funding opportunities including grant and proposal writing</li>  <li>Being the lead technical expert in their discipline, providing technical direction to the development team</li>  <li>Coaching and managing Technical Project Developers, as well as student project efforts where applicable</li>  <li>Coordinating with NAIT staff and faculty, students, and industry partners to produce outcomes identified for each project</li>  <li>Some financial reporting and other administrative duties as required</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> · Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or similar technical focus in design, animation, or other related field <br/><br/> · Proficiency with C++ or C# as a software developer or game developer. <br/><br/> · Demonstrated leadership abilities <br/><br/> · Agile or SCRUM project management experience <br/><br/> · Minimum 5 years’ experience working within Unity3D Pro, potential additional experience using Unreal, Frostbite, or Cryengine <br/><br/> · Minimum 5 years’ of directly related, industry, or applied research experience, with at least one major platform project or product release (game, simulator, or similar interactive project) <br/><br/> · Proficiency with at least one system of a game engine (physics, AI, animation, networks, other) <br/><br/> · Experience with system design, instructional design, serious games, outcomes based online learning, 3D modeling, digital object stores, media rendering, sharing, workflows and distribution, machine learning, artificial intelligence, systems testing, hybrid on-premise and cloud based solutions, and the application of these skills in industrial applications will be considered strong assets <br/><br/> <em><strong>Remuneration:</strong> $82,756.44 - $109,642.00 + a comprehensive benefit package</em> <br/><br/> <em>Thank you for your application however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <em>It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from World Education Services or the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS) - http://work.alberta.ca/immigration/international-qualifications-assessment-service.html</em></div> </div><div></div>
Title: Senior Technical Theme Lead

Job_Description: <strong>About Us</strong> <br/><br/> Our ambitious goal of helping innovators build a better world with data started in 2009. Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, surpassing $1B in revenue at the end of 2017. <br/><br/> The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pures technology literally in the drivers seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power mission-critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation create a thriving company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love. For more information on our business, check out the corporate fact sheet here. <br/><br/> <strong>Marketing Team at Pure</strong> <br/><br/> As part of the Americas Marketing team, the role of the Senior Marketing Manager, Canada is responsible to lead the development, strategy and execution of end user and partner marketing programs to increase awareness and generate demand of Pure Storages products and solutions. This individual will leverage the marketing strategies and programs created by the Corporate Marketing and Americas Marketing Teams and tailor them for the local Canadian market. Programs will incorporate tactics such as webinars, email, online marketing, advertising, direct mail, in-person events, telemarketing and public relations. Requires ability to partner cross-functionally with Sales, Corporate and Product Marketing, AR/PR, as well as our strategic alliance partners and reseller channel ecosystem. <br/><br/> <strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong>  <ul> <li>Owns and develops Canadas marketing strategy, in collaboration and alignment with Sales Leadership. Strategize and execute marketing plans. Project-manage strategic marketing activities.</li> <li>Lead product launches and quarterly campaigns, including driving the brand direction in Canada.</li> <li>Adapt product messaging based on different target audiences, from actual users to decision makers, buyers, and channel partners.</li> <li>Collaborate with Pures sales and marketing teams to devise high-impact awareness and lead generation programs in all Canadian regions, territories, and customer segments of focus.</li> <li>Understands customer needs and messaging of relevant use cases for Pures products and solutions.</li> <li>Assist partners in developing demand marketing plans for identified Focus Partners.</li> <li>Drive adoption and utilization of Channel Marketing Program tools, incentives and programs.</li> <li>Regularly meet with partners and partner management to understand impact on current business and market trends and to ensure that programs meet their needs.</li> <li>Leverages customer insights to improve overall marketing results, targeting, segmenting and personalizing communications to attract, attain, retain, convert and upsell customers.</li> <li>Build, implement and optimize proven marketing processes including repeatable frameworks and models for effective communication with sales and channel partners.</li> <li>Analyze program/campaign/segment performance in order to optimize future campaigns to achieve and/or improve ROI</li> <li>Development of communications process to provide Field Sales and Channel with visibility to all demand-gen efforts.</li> <li>Manage local vendors for logistics, content, collateral & promotional items</li> <li>Responsible Canadas marketing program budget, with an eye to further efficiencies & effectiveness of spend.</li> </ul> <strong>What You Bring To The Team</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong ability to define business objectives and translate them into strategic marketing tactics with the ability to implement them across a broad range of audiences.</li> <li>Exceptional project management skills, with the ability to multi-task, prioritize, and adhere to deadlines while maintaining attention to detail and quality. Agility, patience and the ability to drive projects to completion</li> <li>Excellent comprehension of customer acquisition and awareness-building.</li> <li>Highly creative with the ability to originate and innovate ideas.</li> <li>Strong interpersonal communication skills.</li> <li>Excellent writing and editing skills, with an emphasis on clarity and simplicity.</li> <li>Ability to work with a diverse team spread across the US, Canada, and Latin America. Flexibility to collaborate regularly with regional time zones.</li> <li>Proven ability to work well with all levels of management and peers. Understanding of inter-relationships of the business units and working knowledge of all sales and marketing functions.</li> <li>Must be willing and able to work in an open office, team environment.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>8+ years experience in Enterprise/B2B high tech market, with experience in the storage space a plus</li> <li>Bachelors Degree in Marketing, Communications or Business, or relevant combination of degree and experience. Masters degree is a plus.</li> <li>Budget management skills</li> <li>Travel required</li> </ul> <strong>No Storage? No Problem.</strong> <br/><br/> We look for talent and culture first, specific technologies second, so once you decide Pure is the right place for you, we will match you with the right project to start with. Plus, we like people to have the ability to do different things and be constantly learning, so we encourage our engineers to move around to different teams and project across the company. <br/><br/> <strong>Pure creates opportunities for your development and career growth.</strong> <br/><br/> At Pure, we believe that each Puritan is a leader contributing to the success of our business, regardless of role. We offer an assortment of learning options available to all Puritans, including workshops on leadership, management, career development and more! Were here to change the world and we hope you join us! <br/><br/> <strong>Popular Perks</strong> <br/><br/> Our rewards philosophy is tailored to provide Puritans globally competitive compensation and benefit programs that enable innovation and growth. We offer a wide variety of benefits and perks including comprehensive medical insurance, meal service, opportunities to attend events, join sports leagues, employee assistance program, work-life services, travel assistance, and employee resource groups all of which are thoughtfully designed to maintain mind and body wellness. Through our Pure Good Foundation, we also offer numerous volunteer opportunities for employees to give back across the globe. <br/><br/> <strong>Pure is Committed to Equality</strong> <br/><br/> Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitingops@purestorage.com. <br/><br/> #LI-POST
Title: Senior Marketing Manager, Canada

Job_Description: <div>Software Engineering Manager/Software Engineering Director <br/><br/> Description <br/><br/> Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. <br/><br/> Analog Device's technology can be found at the cutting edge of new technologies that are transforming the world in automotive, communications, aerospace, industrial, healthcare and power management. <br/><br/> This is an opportunity to drive key software initiatives across multiple business units and disciplines while integrating them with hardware roadmaps to unlock new business models and revenue streams. This role requires an energetic and motivated individual with strong communication, organization, and technical skills who works well in a diverse environment across a geographically distributed organization. <br/><br/> Key Responsibilities  <ul>  	<li>Directs the strategic development and deployment of software engineering capabilities in support of business outcomes.</li> <li>Provide inputs and insights into the strategic technology and product portfolio roadmap from a software perspective.</li> <li>Lead the effort to establish a software development capability and culture to deliver innovative products that enables new platforms, business models and revenue streams.</li> <li>Setup, incubate, seed and lead software teams in pursuit of strategic initiatives within business units.</li> <li>Recruit, train, coach/mentor, manage and influence across business units.</li> <li>Develops, coordinates, guides and maintains product plans in support of the overall corporate objectives across select business units.</li> <li>Define a vision for meeting current and future software development needs, while ensuring alignment and integration of software/hardware development with the overall vision, mission, and values of the corporation.</li> <li>Establish, gain alignment and execute on short and long-range initiatives in support of growing software capabilities and new business models across multiple business units.<br/><br/>Required Skills/Experience</li>  </ul>    <ul>  	<li>Innovative, curious, analytical problem-solver with an interest in technology and a bias to action.</li> <li>Flexible and self-directed with a track record of delivery of leading-edge software products</li> <li>History of building high performing software teams that deliver business results.</li> <li>Experience in working across organizational boundaries to deliver new commercially successful products and drive improvement in engineering processes.</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills, tailored for audiences from individual contributors to executive management to influence and guide cross organizational development processes.</li> <li>Knowledgeable about platform concepts and the breadth of business models enabled through software.</li> <li>Ability to combine customer insights, business needs and technology to deliver a superior product.</li> <li>Expertise in customer focused design, system architecture and software product development.</li> <li>Experience in delivering software powered products from edge to cloud.</li> <li>Familiarity with a wide range of technologies, including signal processing, algorithmic development, machine learning, AI, security as well as hardware and silicon product development processes is a plus.</li> <li>10+ years of experience developing and leading teams that develop commercially successful software products.</li> <li>BSc or higher degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electronic Engineering or equivalent qualifications.</li> </ul> <em>For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.</em> <br/><br/> Analog Devices, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability <br/><br/> EEO is the Law: Notice of Applicant Rights Under the Law <br/><br/> <strong>Education Level</strong>: Bachelor's Degree <br/> <strong>Travel Required</strong>: Yes, 10% of the Time</div> <br/>

We're looking for someone to go into the trenches with us. Job_Description: <div><strong>About Us</strong></div><div>Deep Genomics is a Toronto-based startup company that is changing the future of medicine using artificial intelligence. Founded in 2015, Deep Genomics brings together a multidisciplinary team of world-leading experts in machine learning, genomics, chemistry and biology. Together we are on a mission to develop an AI-powered platform for rapid discovery and development of the best genetic medicines, focusing on oligonucleotide drugs for the treatment of patients with rare genetic diseases.</div> <br/> <div><strong>Ideal Candidate</strong></div><div>We are seeking a creative and experienced computational biologist with a strong background in bioinformatics and high-throughput sequencing assays to join our drug discovery team in Toronto. The successful candidate will design and analyze high-throughput assays to interrogate the molecular effects of antisense oligonucleotides in human cells. The ideal candidate has experience with high-throughput RNA-seq data analysis, can contribute to a growing bioinformatics and analytics pipeline, and knows the trade-offs of various library preparation and target-enrichment methods.</div>Key Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Design and statistically analyze high-throughput RNA-seq experiments to uncover the direct and indirect effects of antisense oligonucleotides in model cell systems and organisms.</li><li>Work with our experimental and machine learning teams to ensure consistent and high quality data is improving our AI platform.</li> </ul>  Requirements/Qualifications  <ul> <li>PhD in bioinformatics or related computational biology discipline, or MS with at least 3 years of postgraduate experience.</li><li>Ability to develop high-throughput pipelines and deploy on cloud infrastructure.</li><li>Experience collaborating with experimental biologists and software engineers.</li><li>Programming experience in Python and/or R.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Ability to work independently and as a team member.</li> </ul>  What we offer  <ul> <li>Exciting opportunity for a hard-working individual to gain a leading role in the future of AI-driven genetic medicine development.</li><li>Inspiring, creative and fast-moving startup in downtown Toronto.</li><li>Highly competitive compensation, including meaningful stock ownership.</li> </ul>  <div>Deep Genomics thanks all applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.</div><br/> <div>Deep Genomics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</div><br/>
Title: Computational Biologist RNA-seq

Job_Description: Location: Toronto, Ontario- Canada <br/><br/> Job ID: 18WD28186 <br/><br/> <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The Digital Creation Products Group within Autodesk are looking for a strong, well-rounded designer with skills and experience in the visualization domain, software interaction design and user research as a contributor to development of software and its supporting environment. <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be well trained in design, illustrate an ability to apply strategic thinking and business goals to design work, possess an understanding of both workflow and user tasks, and will be known for having a good eye, usability focus, and aesthetic values. They will also have experience in liaising with customers in order to understand requirements, test designs and prototypes to create user-centred designs that meet business needs and customer goals. You will report to the Experience Design Manager who looks after the Experience Design Team in Conceptual and Automotive Design. This is a great opportunity to help shape the future of software tools for product designers the world over, from our Toronto office.. <br/><br/> Autodesk’s flagship office located at MaRS Discovery District in Toronto is a 60,000 sqft state-of-art R&D facility, office and community space. Anchored in one of the largest urban innovation hubs in the world, the new office serves as a conduit to one of the fastest growing technology clusters in North America. We are establishing a distinctive platform for demonstrating Autodesk’s thought-leadership in the cutting edge technologies ranging from AI, Machine Learning and IoT to industries and macro topics involving manufacturing, construction, learning, social innovation and city building. We convene with customers, partners, startups, academic and governmental organizations to push the boundaries of technologies and shape the future of making things . <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Customer-Centric: <ul> <li>Effectively communicate with customers and peers. Able to break down complex concepts into easy, understandable terms and effectively communicate appropriate to the audience</li><li>Lead focus groups, research and test customer use cases to develop a product concept</li><li>Utilise software analytics and customer feedback to create compelling conceptual designs for user interaction</li><li>Working collaboratively with development teams to design innovative product visions and workflow prototypes that meet and exceed our customer’s expectations</li><li>Work with product management and design teams to analyze customer requirements and propose suitable application solutions</li><li>Internally act as a customer advocate while balancing ROI and available project resources to obtain an optimal solution</li><li>Organize and facilitate meetings with external customers and internal stakeholders to investigate and identify customer needs, preferences and priorities</li> </ul> Workflow and Design: <ul> <li>Drive research, workflow, design and analytics as core components of the product development process</li><li>Develop product vision proposals that may be used to design complete systems, environments and features</li><li>Present design proposals to varying audiences</li><li>Develop detailed specifications for supporting development activities</li><li>Ensure consistency of the application workflows</li><li>Maintain familiarity with other Autodesk products to ensure compatibility with features shared across our product family</li><li>Maintain familiarity with competitive products</li><li>Evaluate the technical feasibility of alternate design approaches, considering the cost of implementation and the anticipated value to customers</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>BSc/BA in Human Computer Interaction, Information Design, Industrial Design, Graphic Design, Application Design or equivalent</li><li>Excellent skills within Design Thinking and design-as-strategy</li><li>Excellent skills in problem definition and analysis; ability to identify and describe the “right” problem from a set of data of varying types</li><li>Communication skills: Verbal and written fluency in the English language; strong verbal and visual communication skills with an ability to work in a highly collaborative environment</li><li>Ability to solve complex problems and drive projects from concept to conclusion; work independently, manage multiple tasks, and set priorities with direction and/or feedback from management and teammates</li><li>Technical background and/or a demonstrable understanding of modern software development processes and concerns as they relate to design</li><li>Previous experience designing for complex creative applications, 3D tools, animation and/or visualization tools</li><li>Expertise with design support tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Freehand, Visio, Sketch, Invision and similar</li><li>3 years of professional experience relating to user experience design and human factors</li><li>Understanding of the Industrial Design Processes</li><li>Understanding of Software Development Processes</li><li>Ability to set and communicate clear expectations and deliver on them in a dynamic environment across multiple time zones and a diverse workforce</li><li>Highly adaptive with an ability to organize, coordinate, and execute on details</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>
Title: Sr. User Experience Designer

Job_Description: We’re on a mission to <br/> build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the <br/> passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us <br/> there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right <br/> for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence <br/> in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how <br/> you do it. <br/><br/> To learn more about <br/> CIBC, please visit CIBC.com <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Be Doing</strong> <br/><br/> You’ll be joining a <br/> collaborative team that is transforming the face of banking in North America. <br/> Innovation and collaboration aren’t just buzzwords, they’re the job <br/> description. You’ll be preparing for the future of banking by shaping it. We <br/> have opportunities to build your career in digital, tech and data – we call <br/> these roles transformational. Together, we can create an experience <br/> that’s faster, easier and built around our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>How You’ll Succeed</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Digital</strong>   <ul> <li>As part of the Client</li> </ul>  Connectivity group, you will play a key role in defining and leading digital <br/> design strategy as well as managing collaboration with partner groups. In <br/> addition, you will be hands-on in creating innovative and compelling digital <br/> experiences and drive innovation and strategy backed by a strong knowledge of <br/> research, data, and best practices. Key Digital roles include: UX Designer, UI <br/> Developer, Process Engineering Specialist, Digital Analytics roles.</li><li><strong>Technology</strong> - Various technology <br/> teams are all contributing in helping CIBC achieve its goal of being #1 in customer experience. Transformational talent with experience in <br/> mobile development, payments, enterprise architecture, Cloud, Agile, and information <br/> security will leverage new technologies, enhance collaboration & decision <br/> making and improve client experience and efficiencies through different <br/> exciting projects and initiatives. Key <br/> transformational technology roles including but not limited to: Mobile <br/> Developer, Front/Back-end Developer, Agile Coach, Business System Consultant <br/> for Payments/Mobile Development, Scrum Master, Information Security Consultant, <br/> Cloud Engineer, Enterprise Architect, etc.</li><li><strong>Data</strong> - CIBC's <br/> Enterprise Advanced Analytics team is a central hub of data science expertise <br/> within CIBC, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in machine <br/> learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology <br/> platforms. You will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling <br/> to solve challenging business problems and bringing innovative solutions. <br/> You’ll interact with groups across the organization from client facing to <br/> operational, risk and capital markets. You’ll work with real world structured <br/> and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from <br/> experiment to deployment. We collaborate with the most exciting new companies <br/> in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage in collaborations with <br/> leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our <br/> talent. Key data related roles in CDO: <br/> Data Scientist, Senior Data Scientist, Data Engineer and Big Data Hadoop <br/> Developer.</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li><strong>You can demonstrate experience in</strong> one of the areas including <br/> digital, data, mobile development, Agile, information security, Cloud, Block <br/> chain and Enterprise Architecture.</li><li><strong>You embrace and champion <br/> change.</strong> You'll continuously <br/> evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.</li><li><strong>You're driven by collective success.</strong> <br/> You know that collaboration can <br/> transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an <br/> inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.</li><li><strong>You look beyond the moment</strong>. You make decisions and take actions that will make a <br/> difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define <br/> what's possible.</li><li><strong>You <br/> love to learn.</strong> You're passionate about growing <br/> your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.</li><li><strong>Values matter to you</strong>. You bring your real self to work and you live <br/> our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>What CIBC Offers</strong> <br/><br/> At CIBC, our people are our greatest <br/> asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s <br/> unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do <br/> it well. As part of our team, you will: <br/><br/> <strong> <ul>   <li>Thrive</strong>:</strong> <br/>  Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the <br/>  flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at <br/>  home</li> <li><strong>Connect</strong>: <br/>  Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters <br/>  innovation, collaboration and creativity</li>   <li><strong>Develop</strong>: <br/>  Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding <br/>  experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development <br/>  planning</li> <li><strong>Prosper</strong>: <br/>  Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, <br/>  banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase <br/>  plan</li> </ul> <strong>What You Need to Know</strong> <ul> <li>CIBC is committed to <br/> creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like <br/> they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide <br/> an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the <br/> application or interview process, please contact <br/> Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally <br/> eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where <br/> applicable, must have a valid work or study permit</li> </ul>
Title: Transformational Talent - Digital, Tech & Data

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Vancouver </p><div><p><p>External Posting Description</p><p><p> </p><p>Deloitte is seeking a Senior Associate to be a part of our Advanced Analytics team.</p><p><br>Your role as a Senior Associate at Deloitte</p><p><br>• Deliver detailed analytic solutions incorporating large data sets, data science and data architecture components; and managing project timelines, deliverables and client relationships.<br>• Collaborating extensively with team members across design, data visualization, data science and consulting disciplines<br>• Ideate and convey concepts and solutions to various target groups in both technology and business sectors</p><p> </p><p>A career in Advanced Analytics at Deloitte will offer you the opportunity to:</p><p><br>• Work in a fast growing and challenging environment with business-minded people with creative-solving problem skills, who are eminent in their respective technical field and/or industry<br>• Develop advanced analytical solutions within our analytics team, across service lines at Deloitte, and with clients in multiple industries including financial services, consumer products, manufacturing, energy & resources, insurance, public sector, and healthcare<br>• Continue your professional development to reinforce and expand your chosen career path<br>• Work with high profile clients on a variety of Canadian and international engagements</p><p><br> <br>Responsibilities</p><p><br>As a Senior Associate, you will:</p><p><br>• Develop and deliver different components of projects as part of a high performing team, day-to-day execution of the analytical solution and overall project, and communication with internal stakeholders and external clients.<br>• Deliver advisory services to high growth organizations with a diverse team consisting of data scientists, data architects, software developers, information designers, and business/industry subject matter experts<br>• Develop methodology for analytical solutions for clients business problems<br>• Perform “hands on” statistical modelling, computations, and data ETL to deliver best-of-breed analytical solutions for clients’ business problems<br>• Work with large amounts of data on a granular level, from structured and unstructured data sources<br>• Participate in various structured and ad-hoc analysis projects with cross-functional teams within Deloitte<br>• Conduct planning, data collection, data analysis, and support proposal bids</p><p> </p></p></p><p><p>External Posting Qualifications</p><p><p> </p><p> </p><p>• Strong track record exemplifying ability to quickly understand business problems, developing solutions and insights, and communicating them by leveraging data and analytics<br>• Enthusiastic about solving complex problems with a variety of analytical tools<br>• Professional services, consulting, or advisory experience is an asset<br>• Data analysis experience using (one or more): R, SPSS Modeller, SPSS Statistics package, SAS, Angoss Knowledge Studio, RapidMiner, or similar tools is required<br>• Database and programming languages experience and data manipulation and integration skills using (one or more) SQL, Oracle, Hadoop or similar tools is required<br>• Strong experience with statistical analytical techniques, data mining, and predictive models is required<br>• Strong experience working with large amounts of data with significant ambiguity, developing creative approaches to analytical problems, and interpreting data and results from a business/industry perspective<br>• Experience with social media analytics and/or text mining and/or optimization is an asset<br>• Strong oral and written communication skills is required<br>• 2 years relevant work experience with applying analytics or working with data in any industry<br>• Minimum of BA/BSc degree in a quantitative degree including Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Epidemiology, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field is required. Advanced degree (MA/MSc, equivalent or higher) is preferred<br>• Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence (AI) experience would be considered an asset.</p><p> </p><p><br> </p></p></p></div><p><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong></p><p>Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.</p><p>At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:</p><ul><li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li></ul><p>Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em></p><p>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.</p><p>We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted</p><p>34361</p><p> </p></div>
Title: Senior Associate, Advanced Analytics

Job_Description: <strong>FUNCTION:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director of Analytics, Research and Pricing, Alberta Blue Cross is seeking a Manager of Analytics supporting the development and implementation of the Organizations Analytics platform. This position will be part of a newly launched team whose purpose will be to advance the impact that data and analytics will have on the business as well as support and foster a data driven culture. In return this individual will experience a dynamic, highly engaged and fast-paced organization that is committed to your success. <br/><br/> The Manager of Analytics will be responsible for building an analytics culture within the organization as well as lead a team of data scientists and business intelligence professionals in areas of data research, predictive modeling, marketing, pricing, risk selection, and other operational areas of group and individual health, dental, life and disability insurance products and services through a centralized operating model. In this role, you will collaborate with business partners to understand business problems, gather business requirements and project manage tasks and timelines as well as create excellent working relationships with both business and IT leaders. <br/><br/> <strong>DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Lead and participate in problem solving initiatives, collaborating within a cross functional team of specialists, to design innovative solutions for clients and business leaders</li> <li>Apply data science expertise including descriptive, predictive, machine learning, deep learning and AI techniques to generate new insights and solve business problems.</li> <li>Collaborate with IT partners and other Data Science teams within Alberta Blue Cross to build out the data environment and analytics work platforms</li> <li>Develop standard operational performance metrics, reporting and data analytics to support dashboard level management metrics</li> <li>Build and maintain strong working relationships with the Operations and IT partners to ensure delivery of initiatives.</li>   <li>Proactively engage other leaders on business solution development for knowledge sharing, input and best practices.</li>   <li>Demonstrate creative problem solving and ability to translate data patterns into business insights, cause/effect relationships and variables to amplify predictive power of underlying models</li> <li>Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.</li> </ul> <strong>SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors Degree plus 8 years of experience in data analytics, or Masters Degree plus 6 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD plus 4 years of experience in data analytics</li> <li>Experience implementing analytics programs and solutions at an enterprise level</li> <li>Excellent collaboration skills and the ability to work in a team environment, across multiple sites and multiple business units.</li>   <li>Communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills - be able to effectively communicate complex results to a business audience not familiar with complex data and analytics</li>   <li>Deep knowledge and experience of the algorithms and techniques of modern data science especially as they pertain to business and experimentation</li> <li>Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and priorities</li> <li>5+ years of quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reports</li> <li>Proven leadership ability and comfortable developing and leading a team of business intelligence and data science professionals.</li>   <li>Comfortable using one or more statistical programming languages (i.e., Python/R/SAS) to work with data sets. Familiarity with any of the following tools is a plus: Microstrategy/Microsoft BI/Tableau</li> </ul> Alberta Blue Cross offers a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work in a challenging team-oriented environment. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, apply online at www.ab.bluecross.ca .
Title: Manager- Analytics

Job_Description: <strong>Company:</strong> DemandHub (www.demandhub.co) <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> We are a well funded tech startup founded by successful tech entrepreneurs who built and sold their last startup to one of the worlds largest tech companies in a multimillion dollar acquisition. <br/><br/> We are building technology to power todays relationship between businesses and their customers. DemandHub helps businesses by powering daily communication, generating reviews and feedback, and gaining insight into the overall customer experience. <br/><br/> Our frontend stack is React with our back-end in NodeJS and MySQL. We are looking for highly self-driven people who are creative problem solvers that learn quickly and can thrive in an environment with little guidance. We follow modern software development practices, including TDD, CI, and rigorous code reviews. We are very analytics driven and continuously run A/B tests to inform our product design. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong> <ul> <li>Plan, design, and implement core components of our back-end REST API to support our front-end developers.</li><li>Plan, design, and implement DemandHubs customer-facing web-based applications.</li><li>Plan, design, and implement distributed job scripts that support our core applications.</li><li>Plan, design, and implement tools to monitor the health of our software system, including logging and software alerts for our ops team.</li><li>Work closely with team members in other functions, including sales, support, and marketing.</li><li>Support the ops team for automating our testing and production build process.</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum B.Sc. in a technical field (Computer Science, Software Engineering, etc.).</li><li>1-3 years experience working as a full-stack developer.</li><li>Minimum 1 year experience with back-end Node.js development (using the Express framework and NPM).</li><li>Minimum of 2 years experience with MySQL or PostgreSQL.</li><li>Minimum 1 year experience building and using REST APIs.</li><li>Experience with ES6 promises and deferred asynchronous operations.</li><li>Advanced knowledge of HTML5, CSS, and AJAX, and jQuery.</li><li>Experience with Javascript frameworks such as ReactJS or Angular.</li><li>Experience building template-driven user interfaces.</li><li>Recent experience developing single page applications (SPA).</li><li>Experience with modern version control and ticketing systems such as GIT and JIRA.</li><li>Experience with caching frameworks such as Redis or Memcached.</li><li>Strong algorithms, data structures and coding background.</li><li>Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance.</li><li>Experience with web infrastructure and distributed systems.</li><li>Evidence of exposure to architectural patterns of a large, high-scale web application (e.g., well-designed APIs, high volume data pipelines, efficient algorithms).</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus Skills</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with CSS preprocessing frameworks such as Sass or Less.</li><li>Experience with task runners such as Gulp or Grunt.</li><li>Familiarity with AWS tools such as Elastic Beanstalk, EC2, RDS, SQS, S3, and CloudFront.</li><li>Experience with PHP or other back-end programming languages.</li><li>Experience with machine-learning, natural language processing, or other AI disciplines.</li><li>Experience working in an agile environment.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul> <li>Great startup company culture with an amazing and motivated team</li><li>Awesome opportunities for growth</li><li>Health benefits (medical & dental)</li><li>Hands-on opportunity to help shape the future of the company</li><li>Casual dress code</li> </ul> We are looking for people who are passionate about technology, team players, hard-working, and have a positive attitude geared towards getting things done. <br/><br/> This is a full-time opportunity in Mississauga, ON (near Hurontario & Matheson). <br/><br/> We look forward to receiving your application!
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Backend Software Engineer</strong><br/><br/>We are looking for Full Stack Software Engineers who can help us to architect, design and implement a software system to build Bot Application that power conversational marketing experiences. A complex system Based on bleeding edge technologies (`Scala`, `Akka`, `Spray`, `Cats`, `Reactive Programming`, `Kubernetes`, `Docker`...), a modern architectural style (`Micro Services`, `CQRS`, `Event Sourcing`, `Eventual Consistency`), and a clean codebase (`Clean Code`, `Domain Driven Design`…) -- emphasis on the “Engineer” over the “Full Stack” part , you’ll work in kanban style with multidisciplinary teams (Business people , Marketing people, Front-developers, AI engineers) to deliver software at the best ratio user value vs cost .<br/><br/><strong>Profile</strong> <br/> <ul>    <li>Proficient with computer science fundamentals in object-oriented development, data structures, and algorithms</li>  <li>Proficient with GIT</li>  <li>Experienced in Functional Programing (Scala, Haskell)</li>  <li>Familiarity with Functional Reactive Programming (Event Sourcing, Streaming, CQRS, Domain Driven Design ...)</li>  </ul>  <br/> <strong>A plus</strong> <br/> <ul>    <li>DevOps engineering (Docker, Kubernetes, Microservices, Continuous Integration,Ansible..)</li>  <li>AI engineering (Mathematical, Statistics, Probability, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Large Scale Data Mining)</li>  </ul>  <br/> <strong>About Automat</strong><br/><br/>Automat is helping companies use AI to talk to their customers, to understand them and serve them better. We're the first Conversational Marketing platform powered by artificial intelligence and we believe in a world where every company can have a personalized one-on-one conversation with every customer, fan, and follower.  <ul>    <li>https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/announcing-automats-series-a-funding-andy-mauro</li>  <li>https://www.marketingweek.com/2017/04/24/loreal-artificial-intelligence/#.WP4nl5Nz8O4.twitter</li>  <li>http://betakit.com/10-montreal-tech-companies-to-watch-in-2017/</li>  <li>http://finance.yahoo.com/news/cb-insights-reveals-ai-100-150000872.html</li>  <li>http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/canada-artificial-intelligence-companies-montreal-talent-1.3890556</li>  <li>http://adage.com/article/digital/covergirl-chatbot/307052/</li>  <li>https://medium.com/slack-developer-blog/investing-in-the-future-of-work-d4ffb87f985#.es1xu0yjm</li>  <li>http://fortune.com/2016/07/19/slack-app-investment-fund-2/</li>  </ul> Learn more at www.automat.ai, or message us at m.me/automatinc

Title: Junior Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>About Us</strong></div><div>Deep Genomics is a Toronto-based startup company that is changing the future of medicine using artificial intelligence. Founded in 2015, Deep Genomics brings together a multidisciplinary team of world-leading experts in machine learning, genomics, chemistry and biology. Together we are on a mission to develop an AI-powered platform for rapid discovery and development of the best genetic medicines, focusing on oligonucleotide drugs for the treatment of patients with rare genetic diseases.</div><br/> <div><strong>Ideal Candidate</strong></div><div>We are recruiting a creative and experienced research scientist with a strong background in molecular biology and next-generation genomic applications to join our experimental biology team at JLABS in Toronto. The successful candidate will lead the development of high-throughput assays that interrogate the molecular effects of antisense oligonucleotides in human cells, advancing our AI-powered drug discovery platform. The ideal candidate has experience with massive parallel reporter assays, including recombination-based cloning, library construction, barcoding strategies, and NGS sequencing.</div>Key responsibilities:  <ul> <li>Design and execute massively parallel reporter assays (MPRAs) to uncover regulatory sequences driving RNA processing in mammalian cell systems.</li><li>Combine the latest multiplexing techniques in creative ways to generate huge amounts of data on RNA processing, localization, and interactions.</li><li>Work closely with our computational team to guide the analysis and Job_Description: AcuityAds is a Demand Side Provider (DSP) that processes over 80 Billion bid requests per day and serves hundreds of millions of ads. These impressive statistics are made possible through Acuity’s state of the art ad technology platform. Acuity’s DNA is interlinked with many of the most popular and successful open source software projects. Our real time bidding and ad serving layers are built in Java, Akka and Spring. Millions of events are funneled over Kafka topics destined for storage and analysis in our Hadoop Big Data cluster. Data flows into a real time analytical reporting for end users. Our AI/Machine learning ingests events and completes feedback loops into the real time systems. End users enjoy interacting with our systems through best in class rich client applications built on HTML5, Angular, ReactJS and Bootstrap technologies using REST endpoints.This is a great opportunity to join a growing company as a Team Lead. You will help build digital designs and high performing web pages that play a key part in defining the user experience for Acuity.Essential Job Functions: Assist in the delegation of work, determining the method of work, giving clear and concise direction, and follow up to ensure proper execution.Respond and handle team and technical issues by using good judgment and logic in solving problems and making decisions within the job scopeAdhere to established engineering and architectural patternsWork as part of a team to deliver solutions in an Agile fashionAbility to break down complex product requirements, providing development estimates as neededDeliver high quality code that has been thoroughly testedOther duties as assigned by Management.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:front end: 1 yearJava: 5 yearsback end: 1 yearLocation:Toronto, ON
