Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: ABOUT MYLO  Mylo is a leading Canadian FinTech company that is completely re-imagining personal finance. Our purpose is to empower everyone to achieve their financial goals in a simple and stress-free way by removing the burden of actively managing their finances.  Problem: People are not achieving their financial goals because managing personal finances is complicated, confusing, time consuming and for many, inaccessible.  Solution: First, the Mylo platform automatically rounds up every purchase you make and invests the spare change. Then, once plugged in, Mylo Insights uses data, algorithms and AI to provide users appropriate and optimized financial management insights, recommendations and solutions through a 3rd party API enabled in-app integration.  Mylo is backed by leading investors including Ferst Capital Partners. Learn more here .  We are seeking great people to help us shape the next wave of innovation in the financial services industry. If you enjoy working with talented folks, solving big problems and delighting users - come join us in helping millions of Canadians achieve their financial goals.  Job Description  We're looking for a machine learning developer, responsible for owning and delivering a project end to end – everything from literature review and data pre-processing to implementing machine learning algorithms.  Responsibilities  Our machine learning engineers have a wide range of skills and so your exact duties depend on how your skills align with others. You will certainly:  Reviewing scientific literature to identify state-of-the-art algorithms in project-specific areas. Prototyping solutions and collaborating with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions.  Implementing prototypes into solutions ready for iproduction. Extracting, transforming and loading massive datasets using distributed computing framework technologies (Hadoop, Spark etc.).  Collaborate with the team in key architectural decisions  Participate in daily scrums and weekly sprint planning meetings  Share learnings and coach others  Qualifications  3+ years of machine learning algorithms coding experience  Computer Science degree Demonstrated interest or experience in Traditional Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Time-Series Analysis ... Familiarity with the Unix command line and bash scripting. Proficiency with Machine Learning packages such as Scikit-learn, Matlab, Numpy Proficiency with Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow, Theano, Keras and PyTorch. Exposure to distributed computing frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases. Have an active public profile where you share passion projects.  Experience with AWS or a strong desire to learn Excellent problem solving, leadership, mentoring, and communication skills  Interest in FinTech and startups  Commitment to continuous learning  Bonus points for: Being a Mylo user and early FinTech adopter  Experience with Transactionnal Data  Experience with Docker and microservices  Experience in coaching and mentoring other team members Knowledge of security infrastructure  What We Offer  At Mylo, it’s our people and their passion that sets us apart. We value transparency, taking initiative & ownership, sharing our wins and learning from our failures.  You’ll love: Our open-concept offices at FCP FinTech Studio (dogs are welcome!)  Competitive market salary plus stock participation  Awesome and comprehensive health benefits package  Generous vacation policy as well as flexible work hours and location  Support with continuing your skills development, developing your industry knowledge and achieving your career and personal development goals  Team activities and get-togethers like our annual oyster shucking Christmas party  A casual environment where you will work with smart and passionate people  We believe in being an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and differences of perspectives at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Title: Mylo - Machine Learning Engineer

Job_Description: Flex A.I. Inc. is a 1-month-old startup (located in Coal Harbour, Downtown) developing an idea that combines fitness and artificial intelligence (patent pending). The company consists of 3 co-founders (one technical, one semi-technical/designer, one business/fitness) + 2 employees and has secured $850K in funding within 2 weeks of the company's inception.We're looking for back-end developers, preferably with expertise in building scalable architectures (preferred experience developing micro service frameworks). An interest/experience in machine learning is preferential but not required.We're also looking for machine learning engineers/researchers.Our team consists of very talented/smart/friendly/ambitious people: pay and equity will be based on degree of experience/quality of talent, anywhere from 50-100k for pay and 1-3% for equity.Keep in mind our wages will only temporarily be at this level until the company skyrockets in growth in the next year, at which point we will likely provide higher wages. The short term lower wages is compensated by the very high equity offering, which we expect to be much more valuable and also gets everyone more invested in building a great company.We're excited to hear from you and hope you're excited in joining a rapid-growth startup that has huge potential!Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $50,000.00 to $100,000.00 /year
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Role: Product Manager  Company: integrate.ai, https://www.integrate.ai  Location: Downtown Toronto Role At integrate.ai, we are looking for a Product Manager who aspires to improve customer experiences through innovative products. You will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming the next product innovation to working directly with customers and engineers to implement features and convey your vision through bold product roadmaps. You will be expected to push the boundaries of what’s possible while sharing in our healthy obsession for quality and attention to detail. You will work with our Machine Learning Engineers and Data Modelling experts to gather insights and identify opportunities to build a world class AI platform. integrate.ai Our mission is to build a future in which AI enriches people’s lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. To do this we are building an AI powered platform for B2C enterprises that integrates with business processes to make customer interactions more natural and valuable. Founded by Steve Irvine, former Facebook executive, we are proud to be based in Toronto, Canada at the center of an exciting AI ecosystem. Responsibilities Leading the ideation, technical development, and launch of innovative products for our enterprise B2B platform. Weaving together an empathetic understanding of customers with your knowledge of technology and competition, to create product strategies and features. Prioritizing what we should build and when by collaborating with stakeholders on product vision and strategy. Managing the release and sprint backlog through planning, backlog grooming, development, and review. Seeing features through documentation, prioritization of bugs and enhancements, and usage analysis. Writing specifications that stakeholders can review and provide feedback, and finding ways to keep readers engaged. Defining and analysing metrics that inform the success of products to our enterprise B2C customers. Understanding our company's strategic and competitive position to deliver products that make an impact to our clients. Requirements You have shipped features that correspond to the 'a-ha' moments: uncovering the types of interactions that are the greatest predictors of long, healthy customer/company relationships Thought through entire customer journeys and how to maximize mutual lifetime value, but you are probably happily lopsided in one of these areas: customer acquisition, upsell, or retention Built recommender systems that have increased customer satisfaction and/or the dashboards you've spec'ed and designed help users take specific actions Strong experience and background in an Agile environment Technical fluency: you may not be a developer but you have an understanding of the technical architecture of complex web and mobile applications and can work with engineers to make intelligent technical trade-offs. Experience designing simple and intuitive user interfaces – ability to create examples through wireframes and mockups You are a Strategic Product Manager, however, you don't mind working on the tactical, day-to-day, hands on execution activities You have approximately 4-8 years of progressive Product Management or Senior Product Management working experience. Created and managed both short-term and medium-term product roadmaps Found and developed unique data assets that improve experiences for our clients and their customers Experience developing social products, technologies and platforms is strongly desired. An entrepreneurial spirit: you’re a self-starter, can identify opportunities, understand potential impact and effectively prioritize across multiple competing priorities. NICE TO HAVE: Actual machine learning expertise is great, but at minimum you have participated in a data science bootcamp The diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ai’s team members help us make better decisions and drive great results. We foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. We're committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. We hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and growth. We are naturally curious and have strong attention to detail. We love working in a team where trust is key and try our best to make an impact every day. If this sounds like the right fit, please apply and come work with us.
Title: Product Manager (AI PLATFORM)

Job_Description: Backend Developer, Digital Products (English Services) - TOR06201  Job Family Media Production Primary Location Toronto Position Language Requirement English Only Language Skill Levels (Reading / Writing / Speaking) - - - Status of Employment Permanent Work schedule(s) Full-time  Description  What it’s like working at CBC/Radio-Canada  At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance.  Do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? Whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to Canadians.  Your team: CBC Digital Products is the country’s biggest digital startup, taking on the challenges of innovating how media is made, sent and received. We are also part of Canada’s oldest and truest broadcasting company. We are trying new things. We are growing. As an entity of our own. As a voice for our country. As a team.  Digital is a part of our present and all of our future. CBC’s strategy is focused on becoming a digital-first organization that provides a digital platform for storytellers. Our mission is to engage our audience with stories they care about.  The opportunity:  If you want to enter the world of digital media and be part of the change and growth of one of Canada’s long-established and respected broadcasters, this is your chance. CBC Digital Products is looking a Senior Systems Integration Developer to join our AV Platform team and drive the integration of our Digital Audio/Video Systems that deliver on-demand and live audio and video content to millions of Canadians. It is a highly collaborative, high exposure role with a chance to attend highly specific A/V integration conferences in Canada and the US.  CBC’s Audio/Video Content Management System comprises of a suite of tools used to manage the vast library of on-demand and live streaming content. Our new Integration Developer will implement and enhance the systems, workflows and presentation of A/V streaming on all platforms. As part of a core team supporting the bigger organization, this is an opportunity to work with live broadcasting machinery and content and interact with all of the teams in the department and teams across the organization.  If you're passionate about Canada and you love technology, learning and bringing out the best in others, you’ll love working at CBC.  Who you are and where are you now?  You are a Backend Developer with a focus on integrating systems and implementing workflows for large amounts of audio or video streaming content. You are looking for new challenges and an opportunity to spearhead both new development and the modernization of connecting the workflows and systems.You want to join an organization that is shifting towards digital-on-demand for the web. You want to make an impact bringing forward new tools and ideas that will meet the demand of a national audience and support the internal stakeholders’ need to digitally deliver as much content as we can efficiently.  What’s in it for you?  Cutting edge tech. CBC has more than 25 digital sites, all of which are mandated to reach Canadians online everywhere and every way, with a high emphasis on mobile devices. To achieve that goal, with no down-time, takes a robust infrastructure, powerful technologies, reliable solutions and rewarding work. Java, JEE, PHP and Python are just part of our rich technology landscape.  Belonging. CBC/Radio-Canada is a Canadian institution. By joining our dynamic Digital Products team, you will be exposed to the best of all worlds. Corporate. Public. Startup. You will be part of a team that embraces diversity and at its core, truly cares about the country and the world.  Career growth. CBC is fully invested in our people. Whatever it is you want to pursue whether it’s a new programming language or a technical solution, whether it’s expanding your Agile knowledge or building an audience-facing platform. We will provide you with the time, resources and championing that you need to keep your career here rewarding.  How you will contribute to the team, you will:  Provide technical expertise for online digital Audio/Video systems. You will integrate multiple complex systems to ensure the successful delivery of A/V content. Collaborate with internal groups. You will work closely with Engineering, Media Presentation, IT, Content Producers, Revenue, etc. to achieve integration. Build and implement key deliverables. You will develop delivery systems for streamlining live Audio/Video workflows; middleware custom tools using various APIs; and more. Manage the production systems. You will oversee the complete development and support lifecycle of specific systems. You will provide quality product support to end-users. Qualifications  What you bring:  Post-secondary degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent. The direct experience. You have three years experience in software development (Java, Python, PHP), with a focus on integrating systems. You have a proven track record of administering an Audio Video delivery system. You have experience operating in Windows, Apple and Unix environments and have a working knowledge of Apache, Tomcat, Docker/Containers, Cloud services. The hands-on A/V technical knowledge. You have a passion for the technologies and workflows relating to online A/V presentation, with hands-on experience using: Akamai or other CDN media delivery. Video Streaming Delivery Protocols (RTMP, HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, UDP). Video Formats and Codecs (HLS, HDS, MP4, MPEG-DASH, CMAF, AV1, etc.). Video Encoders (FFMPEG, Digital Rapids, Vantage, Elemental). The desire to learn. You have a keen interest in AI, Machine Learning, Product Intelligence. You can quickly pick up new tools and technologies including Video CMS such as the Platform or Brightcove; Google Advertising Platform (DFP) or Freewheel. The communication skills. You know how to listen and relay empathy and understanding for diverse perspectives. The Agile approach. You believe in the Agile methodology deeply, but you are flexible and open to the real-world twists and turns. The flexibility. You are available to participate in a rotating on-call shift one out of every four or five weeks, for which you will earn additional compensation.  Why join us?  CBC/Radio-Canada reflects the Canadian identity and promotes democracy. We are rooted in the communities we serve and committed to sharing stories as Canadians live them, each and every day. We strive to speak in the voices of the country and support social and economic innovation. We live these external values. They are the foundation of our employee culture. A diverse culture of collaboration, learning and continuous improvement.  Collaboration. We follow lean startup principles and use an Agile approach. Our dedicated people managers work closely with every individual to ensure we are leveraging their strengths, championing their ideas and supporting their pursuit of new skills and career progression. Our team members are given opportunities to collaborate cross-functionally across multiple projects.  Learning. From simply buying a book or recommending a course to one-on-ones, our leadership team is focused on creating an atmosphere where people feel fulfilled.  Continuous improvement. What can you innovate in 8 hours a week? Our Digital department at CBC recognizes just how smart, creative and inventive our team members are. Everyone is given the opportunity to choose personal projects on which to spend 20% of their time. From prototyping new UI/UX for our content to setting up dev environments to experiment on. From reviewing Apple Developer videos and learning new programming languages to creating improved search functions for our media. From updating old code to building unit testing tools. Your 20% time is yours to allocate in a productive and professionally gratifying way.  To apply:  Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all? At CBC we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here.  Please click on the link to apply: http://bit.ly/2Cir71z  Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.  CBC/Radio-Canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. That’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect Canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. That’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada’s public broadcaster. For more information, visit the Talent and Diversity section of our website. If you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.  If this sounds interesting, please apply online! We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Job Posting Date Apr 14, 2018, 7:00:00 AM Unposting Date May 26, 2018, 6:59:00 AM
Title: Backend Developer, Digital Products (English Services)

Job_Description: What to expect... Are you passionate about data visualization? Do you get excited about telling a great story in a way that helps people see and understand data? Maybe you'll become the next member of our Data & Analytics team! We are a fast growing team in need of a talented and forward thinking individual to design, create, deploy, and evolve our visualization platforms. Our growing scope on Data Analytics, AI, and Digital Innovation requires an experienced Data Visualization Expert to accelerate the development of our various visual analytics in support of our business stakeholders (Finance, Marketing, HR, IT, Audit, Tax, Advisory & Consulting). Some of your key responsibilities and accountabilities will include...  Working directly with engineers on the back-end, business analysts and end users on the front-end throughout the entire engagement life cycle. Coaching and growing new and interested designers across the firm. Turning complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectives. Developing a user experience that is simple, yet flexible. Incorporating data governance and access controls in Tableau. Visual storytelling through Tableau and D3 web applications. Who you are...  A Designer. You have a solid understanding of the design process and best practices around dashboards and visual perception. Experienced. 5+ years of experience, including a rich portfolio of design use cases demonstrating user experiences. Experience in developing and designing dashboards and reports in Tableau, and D3.js web applications. Other BI platforms such as PowerBI and QlikSense are a plus. Some basic SQL knowledge is preferable as well. End-to-End Developer. Ability to create complex calculations (including LOD expressions), action filters, user filters and implement advanced dashboard best practices in Tableau. Understand data modeling based on user specs. Experience with embedding Tableau applications is a plus. Optimizer. Experience tuning the performance of Tableau Server dashboards to optimize user experience. A Team Player. A willingness to listen, challenge, communicate, and respect team member's ideas and opinions openly. Taking a 360 degree view of data, connecting technical data solutions to product, business, and organizational focuses of the team. Agile. Able to work in a fast paced environment, similar to a startup. Comfortable with uncertainty and effective in delivering iterative solutions. Familiar with using agile methodology. Curious. A desire to learn, share and collaborate. Always looking for better, more efficient ways to get things done. Creative Data Rockstar. A passion for data visualization, design and software development. A creative individual who isn't afraid of introducing disruptive thinking in the design and implementation of visual solutions. You can work with...  Data Scientists and Data Analysts for building effective data production pipelines and processes for analytics and machine learning solutions. Business Analysts and Product Owners for mapping business requirements to technical solutions provided by our enterprise data warehouse / data lake. Systems, IT, and DevOps Engineers for database implementation, performance monitoring and optimization. If this sounds like you and you have a passion for tech innovation, a startup mindset, and a desire to work with a growing team of Scientists, Analysts, and Business Innovation specialists, let's start the conversation
Title: Data Visualization Expert

Job_Description: Principal Application Developer-18000LSI  Preferred Qualifications  The Oracle Cloud Applications team is looking for a Principal Application Developer to help transform the way that customers use, interact, configure and personalize Oracle Cloud Apps by leveraging the latest and greatest technologies, from powerful client-side technology to machine learning and AI capabilities.  Due to the scope of responsibilities and domain knowledge required, this role calls for a highly technical, passionate and result oriented candidate who will work with developers, product managers, and architects, using cutting edge technologies to develop component-based UI and tools and ensure successful uptake by Oracle Cloud Apps.  In this role you will need to: Work in a SCRUM team to design and successfully deliver new components and required supporting tools to Cloud Apps teams. Work closely with Cloud teams during the uptake of these components to ensure successful release of Cloud Apps using the next generation of UI. Work with Product Management, Architecture and Oracle PaaS teams to make sure the deliverables are aligned with Cloud Apps functional and technical requirements  The ideal candidate will have the following: 7+ year experience in product development Strong experience in Java design and development Strong experience in JavaScript/Typescript/HTML and related Client-side technologies (e.g. jQuery, RequireJS) Strong knowledge of REST and related Server-side technologies (e.g. SWAGGER, OpenAPI, NodeJS) Experience with Cloud Applications and technologies. Experience in scalability, performance, security, concurrency for cloud-based Apps is a plus. Very strong communication and analytical skills Ability to take ownership and work on multiple tracks in a fast-paced distributed environment Experience with SCRUM and Agile development methodology  Detailed Description and Job Requirements  Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.  As a member of the software engineering division, you will take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures. You will be responsible for defining and developing software for tasks associated with the developing, designing and debugging of software applications or operating systems.  Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience.
Title: Principal Application Developer

Job_Description: Finger Food Studios is seeking a passionate and driven Technical Artist to join our team. Finger Food Studios uses the latest technologies in AR/VR/MR, AI, Machine Learning, Internet of Things, Blockchain and Robotics. We work across platforms to provide, innovative industry first solutions global companies.  As a Technical Artist you will be adept at problem-solving, able to complete work in a timely manner, and possess diverse technical knowledge. Finger Food Studios works in the AR/VR/MR space which requires outside-of-the-box thinking, rapid iteration, and the ability to automate. We are seeking creative thinkers, hard workers, and fast learners. The ability to collaborate in teams to develop, support and iterate is essential to success.  Responsibilities: Optimization, performance & visual quality improvement solutions. Develop pipelines and efficiency tools for the team. Contribute to team rendering and shading techniques and processes. Able to both work autonomously and as part of a team – you’ll need to do both here, so we need people who can get a brief and go solo as well as communicate and collaborate. Interfacing with clients as required, from our office or on-site. Ability to collaborate with developers, designers, and management both locally and remotely.  Qualifications: Excellent problem solving skills Excellent communication skills  Solid understanding of industry tools: 2D content applications 3D content applications Popular game engines  Excellent technical troubleshooting ability Intermediate scripting or programming skills for pipeline tool creation or game development  Nice-to-Haves: Familiarity with building robust UI systems. Modelling, texturing, rigging and animation expertise. Familiarity with Unity & C#. Microsoft Hololens, HTC Vive or other AR/VR platform experience.  To Apply All candidates must be willing and able to work onsite. Please ensure that you are eligible to work in Canada prior to sending your application. Please submit your resume to technicalartist@fingerfoodstudios.com including your first & last name as the subject. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, regret to inform only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
Title: Technical Artist

Job_Description: DIGITAL DEVELOPER  Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?  Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,000 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.  Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people. POSITION SUMMARY: Working as part of the Development Team to design, develop, deploy and maintain a full range of products and services to support the digital transformation of the company and the realization of the IS Digital Strategy. Provide key inputs to help create and maintain a cohesive, dynamic and successful digital development team. RESPONSIBILITIES: Design, including front end graphical user interface, and develop applications under the digital initiatives of the company such as websites, mobile applications and other digital technologies Maintain software applications as required Develop interfaces between different systems Create and maintain documentations relevant to internally developed applications Liaise with UX Design Team to ensure all designs are supported by the correct technical architecture Engage in project assessment and scoping to ensure that all technical possibilities are explored Review and influence ongoing designs, standards and methods for websites, mobile application and other digital technology development projects Provide complete technical specifications and documentation. Identify key integration points between different systems and integrate newly developed applications to existing systems Conduct code reviews to ensure code complies with development standards and best practice Manage the deployment of codes/apps to test, staging and live environments Contribute to ensuring projects are delivered on time, to standard, within budget and that expected business benefits are delivered. Often this involves engaging with and influencing cross functional teams. Undertake any other duties of a similar level and responsibility as may be required from time to time Develop over time a degree of multi-skilling and knowledge sharing with other developers in order to be able to provide cover or support as required Provide normal and after hours support. Maintain awareness of best practice and trends in other digital technologies/platforms such as but not limited to AR, AI, ML, Blockchain, Big Data. Challenge traditional views about software/application design and development   KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:  Experience/Qualifications: Minimum 5 years’ experience in designing and developing web and native mobile applications. Minimum 5 years’ experience in a CPG or manufacturing industry Proven experience in designing, building and delivering working solutions that work across a range of devices including smartphones, tablets, laptops and desktops that meet users needs Sound, logical approach to the analysis of complex problems and design of business solutions Proven conceptual thinker and experience in design thinking Experience in selecting technology components that will provide fit for purpose digital solutions. Ability to evaluate the impact of decisions on stakeholders and include this in the decision making process. Ability to make fully evaluated and firm recommendation and proposals to Project Teams. Attention to detail whilst also demonstrating the ability to see the wider picture. Experience in integrating multi systems Organized and detail oriented in ensuring solutions meet stated requirements. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a deadline driven environment Ability to follow specific processes and governance Positive and accountable Works well in a team setting Experience in UX design is a plus Experience in Agile methodology or DevOps is a plus   Technical Skills Requirements: HTML5, CSS, Javascript, .Net, Visual Studio\ Java, and Swift/Objective C Xamarin (Forms, Android, iOS)/C# Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft Azure REST/oDATA Android and iOS app deployment Knowledge of relational database systems Knowledge in web application frameworks, MVC and web services Knowledge in APIs and microservices architecture Familiarity with Blockchain, Machine Learning, Augmented Reality, Big Data or IOT is a plus   Education: University degree in the field of computer science, information systems CSSLP or MCSD App Builder certification is a plus    We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.  Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at accommodations@mapleleaf.com. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.
Title: Digital Developer

Job_Description: Airlab, a company created by the founders of Ubisoft, is looking for a Developer for its artificial intelligence team. This position will be working within a small and entrepreneurial team, you will participate to the development of innovative application. Open mindedness, a strong interest in mathematics, and a desire to keep on learning are key qualities for this position.  You will work on future technologies, among them artificial intelligence, language recognition, Big Data processing, applied to specific fields as user acquisition for mobile apps, automated QA and customer care automation.  Responsibilities: Design and develop optimized and performing programs using all server resources ( parallelism, client-server technologies, GPU). Participate in the conception of mathematic models in artificial intelligence. Develop prototypes to validate models. Implement databases. Develop web interfaces to present results. Debugging and maintenance. Technology watch.  Requested Qualifications: Minimum A Level in programming, mathematics or equivalent. 1 to 2 years of experience on an artificial intelligence project. Very good level in C++ programming and python. Very good Linux skills. Skills in web technology is a plus (PHP & javascript). Experience in one or several of those technologies : deep learning, language processing and recognition, classification, neuronal networks. Very sharp analytic skills. Autonomy.  Airlab, société créée par les fondateurs du Groupe Ubisoft, est à la recherche d’un(e) programmeur(e) pour son équipe d’intelligence artificielle. Au sein d’une petite équipe dynamique, vous serez amené à concevoir et développer des applications dans des domaines comme l’achat de publicité en ligne, le test automatisé ou encore le support consommateur automatisé dans lesquels l’innovation a un rôle prépondérant.  Vous allez être amené à travailler sur les technologies du futur dont entre-autre l’intelligence artificielle, le traitement du langage, et la manipulation de mega données. L’ouverture d’esprit et l’intérêt très marqué pour les mathématiques sont des qualités essentielles pour ce poste.  Responsabilités: Concevoir et développer des programmes optimisés et très performants utilisant toutes les ressources des serveurs (parallélisme, technologies client-serveurs, GPU). Participer à la conception de modèles mathématiques en intelligence artificielle. Développer des prototypes pour valider des modèles. Mettre en place des bases de données. Développer des interfaces web pour présenter les résultats. Débuggage et maintenance. Veille technologique.  Qualifications requises:  Minimum Baccalauréat en informatique, mathématique ou équivalent. 1 à 2 ans d’expérience sur un projet d’intelligence artificielle. Très bon niveau en programmation C++ et python. Bonne maitrise du langage SQL. Maitrise de Linux. Des connaissances en technologie web sont un atout (PHP & javascript). Expériences dans une ou plusieurs de ces technologies: apprentissage profond, traitement & compréhension du langage, classification, réseaux de neurones. Esprit d’analyse très développé. Bilingue français et anglais. Grande autonomie.  About Airlab   The Airlab team is composed of worldwide specialists in Artificial Intelligence and cutting-edge technologies with many years of experience in developing Machine Learning and Deep Learning applications. Airlab management also includes experts in mobile apps development. Airlab is currently deploying AI techniques in areas such as Advertising, User Acquisition, Automated QA and Automated Customer Care, in order to provide Mobile apps developpers with powerful tools to boost their business.
Title: Developer (Artificial Intelligence)

Job_Description: BlackBerry is looking for server-side Software Developers to join our Enterprise software team where we are innovating and advancing technology to help provide comprehensive visibility and control, and delivering unified endpoint management across the entire “Enterprise of Things” – This is the NEW IoT !  As part of the Enterprise Identity Management team you would help provide leading edge identity and access management functionality that leverages state of the art technology to go beyond authentication and authorization to assess and manage ever growing threat/risk vectors, and delivers rock-solid security. We are looking for enthusiastic developers who love new technologies and want to learn and thrive in cloud based PaaS and SaaS solutions.  These platform roles demand broad generalized ability – effectively managed through a full stack approach to developing software. There would also be exposure to DevOps functions for delivery to various cloud platforms, including BlackBerry’s own highly secure private cloud infrastructure.  New graduates with an interest in the development of high-quality software using agile software development methodologies, and TDD are preferred.  Our group is committed to innovation, and as a member of our platform team; you will participate in ideation sessions to generate new patentable inventions, then help architect, design, deliver and support these fantastic concepts as they come to life.  Equally, as our service offerings grow and mature, we will be turning our attention to managing big data in interesting and novel ways through the use of Machine Learning, Analytics, and AI, so candidates with an interest or background in these areas would have a great opportunity to learn and grow these skills.  Skills and Qualifications: As a new member of the team, you would be a self-starter. The ideal candidate would have the following skillsets:  Have a degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline Have an interest in platform software development using an agile methodologies Thrive in a high-paced environment Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to effectively communicate solutions to the team  Additional Assets: In addition, we are looking for motivated self-starters who are passionate about software development, can learn new technologies with minimal guidance, and have a strong interest in cloud platform software development and deployment.  Bonus if you have any of these: Develop software with Node.js, J2EE/Java Experience with large scale web and cloud service development Experience with large scale Cassandra deployments and non-relational database design methodologies Knowledge and experience in identity technology, cryptography, authentication. #LI-TT1   Job Family Group Name: Product Development    Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40
Title: Identity Platform & Security Software Developer (New Grad)

Job_Description: PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. Recently named one of Deloitte’s fastest growing technology companies and Canada’s best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. PointClickCare is a dynamic environment to advance your career while performing meaningful work with great people. PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. This position will require you to draw heavily from your strengths across multiple disciplines. Your creativity, knowledge, and inspiring thought leadership will play a pivotal role in shaping our team, our products, and our future. What your day-to-day will look like: Work with counterparts to architect, design, and lead the building of high-quality analytical delivery solutions Play a key role embracing agile processes and driving deployment cycles that deliver high valued/high quality commercial software to our customers Advance the technology vision through collaboration and strong leadership Mentor the Director, Managers, Team Leads, Developers, and SET personnel to ensure vision translates into real solutions Drive feasibility exercises for strategic initiatives through research, critical criteria analysis, and strong prototyping methods Participate as a principal lead in design reviews, code reviews, and test automation reviews to ensure proper adherence to design principles Initiate advanced research exercises that will lay the foundation of next-generation data architecture and data engineering capabilities Advance the building and documentation of a comprehensive library of design patterns across multiple technology stacks Act as a point of escalation on strategic initiatives by applying strong oversight to all aspects of the project Lead, lead, and lead more  What qualifications we’re looking for: Extremely strong leadership and mentorship skills Incredible talent related to complex data systems design Endless appetite for creative (yet pragmatic) solutions Excellent organization, critical-thinking and personal leadership skills Self-starter with the ability to deliver with minimal supervision Team player/Team Mentor 10+ years as a lead developer/architect in complex data management solutions 10+ years working with large scale data repositories (>10 Terabytes at a minimum) 5+ years experience shipping enterprise grade commercial software Proven ability to deliver a major project initiative Ability to articulate with specificity, most of the following key technology and process components of a data management system (primarily cloud based) ETL/ELT BI/Analytical Data Quality Master Data Audit Metadata Statistical/Machine Learning/AI API Data Access Gateway Production Monitoring Familiarity with Service Oriented Architectures Strong experience with Advanced KPI and Predictive model solutions Bonus points for having: Java/Python development skills Test Driven Design experience API driven integration techniques Hadoop (Cloudera) Technology Stack solutions  Education: Degree or Masters in Computer Science or any related degree in Information Technology centric studies Working at PointClickCare goes beyond the resume, because the work we perform makes a true difference in people’s lives. We build innovative healthcare technology for seniors and their caregivers that improve their quality of life and well-being on a daily basis. We believe work is so much more meaningful when you’re doing it with a higher purpose. For more information on PointClickCare, please visit us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn. Job_Description: About ImagiaImagia focuses on AI-driven personalized care solutions across healthcare & bioscience industries. Our research scientists, engineers, clinicians, designers and colleagues work with hospitals, healthcare professionals and AI scientists to integrate impactful solutions in routine clinical workflows and help patients access treatment as quickly and accurately as possible.We offer a stimulating and focused yet fun work environment, modern facilities in the heart of Montréal, competitive compensation and benefits package, but most importantly, the opportunity to join a group of highly qualified professionals with a genuine passion for health, science and progress. Job_Description: AcuityAds is a Demand Side Provider (DSP) that processes over 80 Billion bid requests per day and serves hundreds of millions of ads. These impressive statistics are made possible through Acuity’s state of the art ad technology platform. Acuity’s DNA is interlinked with many of the most popular and successful open source software projects. Our real time bidding and ad serving layers are built in Java, Akka and Spring. Millions of events are funneled over Kafka topics destined for storage and analysis in our Hadoop Big Data cluster. Data flows into a real time analytical reporting for end users. Our AI/Machine learning ingests events and completes feedback loops into the real time systems. End users enjoy interacting with our systems through best in class rich client applications built on HTML5, Angular, ReactJS and Bootstrap technologies using REST endpoints.This is a great opportunity to join a growing company as a Team Lead. You will help build digital designs and high performing web pages that play a key part in defining the user experience for Acuity.Essential Job Functions: Assist in the delegation of work, determining the method of work, giving clear and concise direction, and follow up to ensure proper execution.Respond and handle team and technical issues by using good judgment and logic in solving problems and making decisions within the job scopeAdhere to established engineering and architectural patternsWork as part of a team to deliver solutions in an Agile fashionAbility to break down complex product requirements, providing development estimates as neededDeliver high quality code that has been thoroughly testedOther duties as assigned by Management.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:front end: 1 yearJava: 5 yearsback end: 1 yearLocation:Toronto, ON
Title: Sr Java Developer

Job_Description: Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better.  At Loblaw Digital , we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started.  We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.  The Senior Director of Data Science will be leading a team of Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and BI Developers, responsible for designing and implementing groundbreaking solutions utilizing large-scale data sets. This individual is also responsible for developing the long-term AI strategy, evangelizing the results of the Data Science team’s research, coordination & collaboration with various internal teams, and working closely with engineering to integrate solutions into our production systems.  What You'll Do: - Lead a team of 12 Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and BI Developers, providing vision, direction, and day-to-day management - Define data science and AI/ML strategy across the eCommerce and retail business - Work with functional businesses (Trading, Marketing, Operations, Supply Chain etc.) on solving problems such as customer segmentation, customer engagement, inventory forecasting, and more - Lead the development and implementation of scalable, data-driven solutions using Hadoop (HDFS, Map/Reduce, Hive, Hbase, Sqoop, Spark, etc.) - Lead the BI efforts to centralize data warehousing, and empower business users to self-serve data for insights and analytics using Tableau and Microstrategy - Recruit top talent to continue to invest in Loblaw’s Data Science capabilities  What You'll Need: - Masters degree/PhD in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Engineering/Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, Applied Math, or equivalent work experience - 10+ years of relevant experience in data science or similar field - Creative problem solver, resourceful in getting things done, and productive working independently or collaboratively - Experience in working with Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Hbase and related big data technologies - Experience working with large structured and unstructured data sets from multiple sources - Experience with recommendation systems & personalization - Strong passion for empirical research and data driven decisions  Deep knowledge in data mining and machine learning - Strong knowledge of and experience with statistics - Data visualization experience to present findings at the appropriate level of detail for both business and technology teams. - Excellent written and spoken communication skills  #LI-NK2   How You’ll Succeed: At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.  We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.  If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.  Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. Apply today.   Employment Type: Full time   Type of Role: Regular   Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.
Title: Senior Director, Data Science

Job_Description: Our Mission is to impact people’s lives by uncovering the truth and empowering others to make a difference. We do this by equipping examiners and investigators with the best digital forensics tools available, so they can accomplish their mission: Fighting crime. Protecting company assets. Guarding national security.  We are proud to be ranked #9 on the 28th annual PROFIT 500, the definitive ranking of Canada’s Fastest-Growing Companies.  Who are we? We build software that automates the recovery of digital forensic evidence, helping thousands of forensics professionals around the world find, analyze, and report on the digital evidence from computers, smartphones, and tablets.  Our flagship software, Magnet AXIOM, has revolutionized the work of digital forensics investigators in law enforcement and government agencies, and has been essential in use cases involving child exploitation, murder, terrorism, and more.  How we work: We are a dynamic team who are passionate about the work we do. We are inspired because our work makes a difference and there is a shared sense of purpose in our culture.  Our development team works in an agile environment and we operate on a fast-paced model of continuous improvement. We work in cross functional teams to regularly experiment, iterate, and deliver on new product goals, pushing the boundaries in everything we do, to bring world class digital forensics tools to law enforcement, government agencies and corporations.  What we are looking for: The AI Developer will be a key contributor on a development team dedicated to finding customer driven data science based ways of revolutionizing how forensics is done worldwide. If you can demonstrate a proven track record of productization of models you’ve developed, including the necessary data curation, then we want to talk to you!  The exponential growth of data seen across the spectrum of daily life is making the work of people entrusted with our safely extremely difficult. The successful candidate will be leading the charge of taking the latest AI techniques and applying them in an area which has currently not been very well explored, while solving critically important problems which impact people’s lives in a very positive way.  Responsibilities: Be the subject matter expert guiding machine learning and deep learning model development on both the research and product teams. Responsible for developing new models to solve challenges in forensics, and will assist others in similar tasks Responsible for developing frameworks needed to develop models, these include anything from data curation, model training, to analysis and result review Assisting various teams with productization of machine learning models Responsible for developing and maintaining robust data sets necessary for creation of forensically accurate models Qualifications: Minimum 2 years’ recent experience as an AI Developer, Data Scientist or similar role Proven track record of taking machine learning or deep learning models from concept to production Working knowledge in the following areas: Machine learning and deep learning libraries such as keras, tensorflow, sklearn, caffe, opencv General programing in Python, C#, C++ or C Classification of one or more data types such as images, video, text, or natural language processing Experienced with curating and creating data used for model development
Title: AI Developer – Waterloo, Ontario

Job_Description: Type of position This is a full time position. Locations Sherbrooke, QC, Canada Québec, Qc, Canada About Menya Solutions Our mission is to develop software systems that automate thought processes in order to support users and machines in their decision making processes, allowing them to save money, time and lives. We develop software for autonomous robots, military battle management, and simulation-based training. Our partners and clients include Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC), Thales Canada, Fujitsu Canada, Canadian Space Agency, Lockheed Martin Canada, CAE and MDA Corporation. Job Description We are currently recruiting talented software developers to maintain and expand our existing technology for autonomous decision making (automated planning, plan recognition, machine learning, execution and execution monitoring) to drive the next generation of automated agents driven by artificial intelligence. We are looking for programmers interested in one or more of the following: Development of artificial intelligence algorithms. Ideally, you are familiar with basics concepts in artificial intelligence programming theories and algorithms, such as machine learning, automated planning and probabilistic reasoning. Game AI development and similar applications. Development for robots and of robot automation algorithms. Ideally, you have hand-on experience with robot programing (using frameworks such as ROS and OMPL). Development using Unity3D. Requirements B.Sc., B.E. in computer science, or software engineering, or equivalent. 3 years experience in software development. Strong software development skills (C++, Java, C#, Python). Bonus Fluent in both French and English. Team lead experience. Ability to work concurrently on multiple tasks.
Title: AI Developer

Job_Description: Job Description  The incumbent will work hand in hand with data scientist to deliver Artificial Intelligence (AI) / Machine Learning solutions to make processes and systems smarter through the building of data pipelines that meet predictive model data requirements. She/he will also be accountable for ensuring availability and integrity of needed data sets.  Responsibilities:  The main and routine tasks of this position are to: Lead the design, implementation and maintenance of data transportation process required by the data scientist; Perform a set of data transformation to feed a predictive model; Lead data architecture efforts in support of reliable data pipelinesof both structured and unstructured data; Design scalable data model required to build the predictive model; Develop transition between data pipeline and data model; Integrate trained predictive model into various applications, systems or workflows; Integrate various technology together to build solutions; Monitor and track data quality (reliability, consistency, integrity) and data flow dynamics; Monitor performance and be accountable to make necessary infrastructure adjustments; Train models through distributed computing; Work on a wide range of projects involving the implementation of new and existing systems, solutions and processes; Carry out all other related tasks. Qualifications  Training: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or any related field.  Experience: A minimum of 5 years industry experience working with data, coding, scripting and design. A minimum of 5 years experience developing and administering large data systems. A minimum of 3 years experience in data modeling and administration of NoSQL and SQL databases.  Skills:  Ability to design processes following data flow design and architecture; Ability to extract, transform and load data from and to systems; Ability to configure, use and develop on systems that manage data; Ability to develop large structured software using software engineers methods; Employ a variety of languages and tools (e.g. scripting languages Python, SQL, Bash) to integrate systems together; Creative thinker with excellent problem solving abilities; Team player with solid interpersonal skills; Business value oriented; Understanding of machine learning; Desire to independently research work-around solutions to complex problems; Agile methodology knowledge.  Knowledge:  Experience with Flume, NiFi, Kafka or other data pipeline tools; Experience using REST API; Experience with Design pattern OOP; Experience with C++, Csharp, Java, .Net; Experience with Linux and Windows; Solid knowledge of CS fundamentals in algorithms and data structures; Experience with Data Driven Principles and architecture, Data Flow Analysis, Data Flow Diagram; Experience with Information Refinement, Data Cleaning, Data Transport, Data Integrity; Bilingualism (French-English) is an asset. Additional Information  We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.
Title: Data Developer

Job_Description: Job Description: Social media generates a massive volume of data about online interactions in a daily basis. Such interactions provide useful information about users’ behaviours and psychological states. SafeToNet has an AI-based engine that constantly analyzes the patterns behind human written languages and produces psychological insights about user’s emotional and mental health. Our emerging technologies are used to promote the safety and welfare of children.We are seeking an intermediate to senior full-stack developer to help us create the next generation of SafeToNet technology.The ideal candidate should have a passion for quality, attention to detail, and continuous learning. Join an interdisciplinary team of PhD-level researchers and software developers at SafeToNet!Roles and responsibilities: Work with a multidisciplinary team.Develop high-quality code for both back-end and front-end; i.e. build ad-hoc applications for internal use, such as data labelling and data management.Develop API-driven applications such as REST API services.Develop shell scripts to handle complex task execution and automate procedures such as machine learning scripts.Provide light maintenance of a PHP-based web application. This application presents information to parents about text and image content drawn from the APIs of popular social media platforms.Provide maintenance of integrations with third-party services and APIs.Implement user experiences or improve existing UX designs.Mentor and manage junior or intern developers.Follow best practice of agile continuous delivery, test-driven development (TDD), and development process.Be relentless on product quality, consistency, and performance i.e. optimizing front-end or back-end whenever necessary.Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent.Technical Requirements: 3+ years of experience with full-stack development in terms of the front-end side, back-end side, web services, and database systems.Familiarity with a variety of web frameworks and libraries.High proficiency in Java. The familiarity with the Spring framework and JPA is required (ActiveMQ is an asset).High proficiency in JavaScript (ES6 is an asset), HTML 5, and CSS 3 (SASS is an asset).Proficiency in the Yii PHP framework.Strong SQL skills using MySQL and PostgreSQL.Proficiency in test unit libraries such as JUnit, Mockito, Karma, and Mocha.Proficiency in source control tools such as GIT (Bitbucket and/or Github is an asset).Experience with AWS.About SafeToNet: SafeToNet recently launched the world’s first real-time sext filtering software that safeguards children across all social networks and messaging apps. It can identify and filter inappropriate images and text and has built an intelligent keyboard that works on both iOS and Android. SafeToNet has aspirations to safeguard children from around the world and is working with a high number of mobile network operators who will sell or give the software away for free to their clients. SafeToNet is one of just 5 companies in the world to be part of the Go-Ignite accelerator programme which is a consortium of Orange, Singtel, Deutsche Telecom and Telefonica. They give access to over 1.2bn customers. The board and executive team is highly experienced and the company is well funded, with substantial support from London’s investor community (see https://techcrunch.com/2018/02/26/safetonet-demos-anti-sexting-child-safety-tool/).SafeToNet is expanding, with a new office in Waterloo for our Canadian subsidiary, SafeToNet Canada (previously VISR Inc.). Together with the University of Ottawa’s Natural Language Processing Lab, SafeToNet Canada is focused on developing the machine learning and natural language processing capabilities necessary for identifying complex child-safety and wellness issues in user generated digital communication data. Our Waterloo office is tasked with working together with our research partners to perform R&D; and to productionize the resulting tech.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:full stack development or equivalent: 3 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Waterloo, ON
Title: Full-stack developer

Job_Description: Job Description  Change the world at IBM. There aren’t many companies who can say they have been an integral part of the global business landscape for more than a century. While the world has changed considerably over the past 100 years, IBM, our people and our offerings have continuously led the way with business and technology innovation.  Today, we are more than a hardware, software and services provider, yet we remain true to our heritage as a team of collaborative forward-thinkers, focused on making business and society work better. We are part of the fabric of everyday life and stand for world-changing progress.  Join a company where you can make an impact and literally change the world. With so many different opportunities available – the sky is the limit!   This position resides in Toronto, Ontario and is a 4 or 8 (co-op) month work term commencing September 2018 . It is mandatory that all applicants are enrolled in full-time studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term.  What IBM Offers You? Work directly on product and services that affect our clients, while having access to cutting edge software technology Work on projects which are challenging, innovative and rewarding A business casual dress code and flexible work hours, to ensure work-life balance Access to the Future Blue Community - IBM’s large student community that provides networking opportunities, sporting and social events.  It is a mandatory requirement for students to apply online at www.ibm.com/jobs  Closing Date: Open Until Filled  By 2020, there will be 30 Billion connected devices and IoT will generate 40% of all data. Beyond connectivity, IoT value will be driven by a revolution in Artificial intelligence—delivered through advanced analytics and cognitive capabilities.  IBM Watson IoT team is a global leader in helping clients re-invent their businesses with IoT by enhancing efficiencies in manufacturing, operation, asset optimization, financial services, and supply chain management. Visit our website to get an overview of the IBM Watson IoT Platform and solutions, https://www.ibm.com/internet-of-things/  IBM Watson IoT platform is an industry leading cloud solution that allows you to: Connect and manage IoT devices, networks and gateways Integrating IoT data with structured and unstructured data from other sources Gaining insights from information using real-time, predictive and cognitive analytics Secure IoT data with Blockchain Develop custom machine learning algorithms using both IBM Watson and open source Deep Learning, CNN, and Computer Vision software Deploy embedded computing and edge analytics to IoT systems  We are looking for developers that can work in one or multiple roles as below:  IoT Platform / Full Stack Developer Experience with cloud platform development environments including AwS, Bluemix and Azure Understanding of API specs and knowledge of how to create and integrate with REST services using NodeJS, ExpressJS, Sails.js, Java, etc. Experience with SQL and noSQL databases. Big data (Hadoop, Spark) platform is a plus Comp Eng, Comp Sci students with proven API and web development skills  AI / Machine Learning Developer Hands-on experience with fast prototyping using public libraries and APIs for Machine Learning or Deep Learning Experience with Python, C#, C++, Scala, LUA, JavaScript, Matlab, or Java Frameworks such as caffe, chainer, tensorflow, synaptic, eblearn, torch, shark, etc… Comp Eng, Comp Sci students with proven Math and programming skills  Embedded Systems Developer Understanding of IoT hardware, sensors, gateway, network, etc Capable of interfacing with sensors, gateways, and transceivers using embedded stack protocols and edge computing Programming skills with C, c++, python, JS, Java, etc Comp eng, Electrical eng, Mechanical eng, Systems Eng, Nanotech eng, Mechatronic eng  Are you eager to harness the IoT potential by collecting and securing data to gain real time actionable insight and implement AI solutions?  Are you that person who sees opportunity everywhere for digital technology to improve experiences? Can you collaborate and push the envelope to design, develop and implement leading applications for our clients? We want your skills and experience. Bring us your work portfolio and let’s talk!  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  Minimum of two co-op work terms in a development role Co-op or internship program enrollment is mandatory  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  None  EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
Title: IoT & AI Developer - Coop (Toronto, ON)

Job_Description: Position: Rapid Prototype Developer Location: Toronto Job Type: Permanent  Are you a future-focused Software Developer with a knack for different languages and tools? Are you a Software Engineer who wants to poke around in IoT, microservices, serverless technology, Azure, AWS, AI, containers, etc.  We are working with a cloud-based virtual automation product development company and they are looking to hire a Rapid Prototype Developer and Researcher for their future-thinking group to work ahead of the main engineering team on such things as serverless computing, microservices, DevOps, and more.  Most of your time will be spent developing cutting-edge prototypes that could potentially serve as the blueprint for the next generation of products and features.  Responsibilities:  Research how the product can add value to cloud technology, serverless computing, IoT frameworks, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning technologies, etc. Tinker with rapid design, prototypes, and integration of Microservices-based applications, their PaaS frameworks and their deployment blueprints Develop prototypes to understand cloud computing technologies Perform requirements analysis and feature definition Participate in system architecture design Prepare design, code unit test, and integration tests for prototypes Monitor trends and analyze feasibility of these trends with their product(s) Most importantly – experiment, build, code, test and have fun!  Requirements:  Proven ability to learn new languages quickly Experience working with container and microservices  Experience with the following would definitely make you a front-runner:   Building Container technology (Docker, Kubernetes, Photon/VIC, Red Hat OpenShift, etc.) Working with Microservices design methodology DevOps tools and practices including blue/green, canary and rolling update deployments (Jenkins, Maven, Github, Xebia, Chef, Puppet, Terraform, Ansible) IP networking, SDN (NSX), Container networking (CNI) PaaS (CloudFoundry, AWS, Azure) Virtualization (VMware, OpenStack, Microsoft Hyper-V) Public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google) Building modern web applications (PrimeFaces, Bootstrap, jQuery, Atmosphere, Angular) Hibernate (O/R mapping) Spring (dependency injection, AOP) Languages Java, JavaScript, C# and Go RESTful web services Relational, NOSQL, key-value databases, etc.  Please send your resume as a Word document to Melissa Campbell at the following address: melissa.campbell@quantum-qtr.com.  If you recommend a friend or colleague, you may be eligible for a referral bonus.  We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for interview will be contacted.  Quantum is an equal opportunity employer.
Title: Rapid Prototype Developer

Job_Description: Brokerage is looking for a hands-on software developer to join the firmwide developer tools and systems group, MSDE. MSDE is responsible for shaping the software development lifecycle (SDLC) within Brokerage by implementing the tools, systems, and processes used by all developers across the globe for software development and deployment.  We are looking for a candidate with expertise in the Apache Spark and Data Analytics space. The candidate's role will be to setup and develop the Spark component of the project following best practices. The candidate will be expected to share knowledge with peers and actively participate in both the architectural and software design of the project.  The candidate will be working with an international team of experts to quantify measure and analyze the firmwide adoption of the Agile & Continuous Delivery methodologies. As such we are looking to build a solution to ingest data from disparate systems and build a distributed analytics engine to analyze and interpret the heterogeneous workflows used by each team in the Firm in an effort to promote the adoption of the Agile methodology.  Responsibilities  The main functions of this position are to   Analyze the various data sources and perform data exploration; Develop and maintain real-time and batch data ingestion pipelines; Share acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels; Identify and troubleshoot process errors and recommend solutions; Establish responsible deadlines and personal work plans and manages time effectively.  Qualifications  Skills required   3 to 5 years of relevant experience Experience with Apache Spark Experience with Git Knowledge of Agile methodology Problem solving and critical thinking Creative and innovative Responsible and accountable for his/her actions Persevering, autonomous, takes initiative Good team player, able to accept constructive criticism and give feedback, facilitates effective team interactions  Skills desired   Knowledge and experience of Scala an asset Knowledge and experience of Java an asset Knowledge of machine learning, AI also an asset
