Job_Description: We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com What You’ll Be Doing You’ll be joining a collaborative team that is transforming the face of banking in North America. Innovation and collaboration aren’t just buzzwords, they’re the job description. You’ll be preparing for the future of banking by shaping it. We have opportunities to build your career in digital, tech and data – we call these roles transformational. Together, we can create an experience that’s faster, easier and built around our clients.  How You’ll Succeed  Digital - As part of the Client Connectivity group, you will play a key role in defining and leading digital design strategy as well as managing collaboration with partner groups. In addition, you will be hands-on in creating innovative and compelling digital experiences and drive innovation and strategy backed by a strong knowledge of research, data, and best practices. Key Digital roles include: UX Designer, UI Developer, Process Engineering Specialist, Digital Analytics roles. Technology - Various technology teams are all contributing in helping CIBC achieve its goal of being #1 in customer experience. Transformational talent with experience in mobile development, payments, enterprise architecture, Cloud, Agile, and information security will leverage new technologies, enhance collaboration & decision making and improve client experience and efficiencies through different exciting projects and initiatives. Key transformational technology roles including but not limited to: Mobile Developer, Front/Back-end Developer, Agile Coach, Business System Consultant for Payments/Mobile Development, Scrum Master, Information Security Consultant, Cloud Engineer, Enterprise Architect, etc. Data - CIBC's Enterprise Advanced Analytics team is a central hub of data science expertise within CIBC, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms. You will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve challenging business problems and bringing innovative solutions. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from client facing to operational, risk and capital markets. You’ll work with real world structured and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. We collaborate with the most exciting new companies in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage in collaborations with leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent. Key data related roles in CDO: Data Scientist, Senior Data Scientist, Data Engineer and Big Data Hadoop Developer.  Who You Are  You can demonstrate experience in one of the areas including digital, data, mobile development, Agile, information security, Cloud, Block chain and Enterprise Architecture. You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what's possible. You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve. Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.  What CIBC Offers At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will: Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan What You Need to Know  CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job_Description: Our public sector client is seeking an AI/ML Researcher and Developer to join their team for a contract opportunity Downtown Toronto. The successful candidate will be passionate about the application of Data Science to solve problems.  Roles and Responsibilities  Work on some pre-defined problems and apply AI (Artificial Intelligence) and ML (Machine Learning) tools.  Explore new generation of analytics using AWS, IBM Watson, SQL server, bots.  Develop workable solutions.  Qualifications and Experience  Strong background with data science and manipulating large data sets.  Solid grounding in data modeling, machine learning algorithms and software development techniques and languages used to implement analytics solutions.  Resourceful, able to drive towards results in a start-up style environment.  Some proficiency with Python, R, Java, and other important ML and analytics languages (e.g. Scala).  Basic understanding of building solutions on AWS, IBM Watson, SQL and SQL server, bots.
Title: Artificial Intelligence Developer

Job_Description: Senior Vision Developer (2 open positions)  Senstar Corporation has been safeguarding people, places and property with the world’s largest portfolio of perimeter intrusion detection sensors for over 35 years. Now combined with world-class video management systems and analytics (formerly Aimetis), Senstar offers a comprehensive suite of proven technologies that work together to reduce complexity, improve performance and unify support.  About the Position  Senstar is looking for talented individuals to push the boundaries of video analytics and build the next generation of smart surveillance software. As part of a highly-skilled team of researchers and software engineers, you will use cutting edge advancements in deep learning to build solutions for real-world surveillance problems like multi-camera tracking, person re-identification, facial recognition, and license plate recognition. At Senstar, you will develop systems that will be rapidly deployed in production at customer sites around the world.  You need strong understanding of at least two of the following:  Convolution neural networks (CNN) - particularly training deep neural networks for detection and classification.  Multi-target tracking and detection-based tracking.  Facial Recognition.  Person Re-Identification.  License Plate Detection and Recognition.  You will: Research and develop computer vision algorithms for cutting-edge surveillance applications.  Create efficient, production-ready systems complete with automated tests and performance metrics.  Work with the product team and customers to discover new ways that AI can revolutionize video analytics.  Be fluent in English and have strong written, oral, and presentation skills.  Qualifications  MS / PhD specializing in Computer Vision/Machine Learning or Bachelors with equivalent experience  3+ years of experience in C++  3+ years of experience designing and implementing computer vision algorithms  Experience with libraries such as OpenCV, IPP, Tensorflow, Caffe  Experience deploying machine learning / computer vision algorithms for real world problems  Some experience in Matlab/Octave and Python  Willing to travel occasionally  Location  Waterloo, Ontario, Canada
Title: Sr. Vision Developer

Job_Description: Job Description  You’ll take part in the development of a new division of the Amaris R&D; Lab located in Montreal. The Lab is part of the IT department and focuses on internal long-term R&D; needs for the Group. It is composed of strongly motivated individuals who work together around Artificial Intelligence related research and its applications to the wider scope of our operations. The Lab aims at creating synergies between long-term research activities and short-term development needs by anticipating future needs and creating new possibilities, positioning Amaris as a leader in breakthrough technologies.  As part of the Lab's data infrastructure team, you will: Have a key role in the construction of our big data back-end.  Implement web crawlers to collect data across the web.  Implement and install data streams coming from various sources (internal databases, web crawlers).  Use NLP, Image Processing and Machine Learning algorithms to clean and standardize our data.  Help data scientists and end-users to find and access relevant data through well-defined APIs and web services.  Closely interact with the IT and BI team.  Deal with security and anonymization aspects.  Lead initiatives to support the local AI ecosystem.  Ideal Candidate  Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field preferred.  Strong back-end programming skills (Java, C# is preferred).  Deep knowledge of web development with associated technologies.  Experience in Big Data environment with  NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Cassandra)  Clusters (Hadoop, HDFS, Spark)  Search engines (Hive, Elastic Search, Lucene Solr).  Familiar with the implementation and documentation of RESTful services.  Experienced with development in a best practices’ environment ( Agile, DevOps ).  Shows interest and passion for AI related topics, from classification and clustering problems to neural networks applications.  You are willing to work in an Agile R&D; environment with a focus on tangible results.  You are an organised and rigorous person, with a natural leadership.  Proactive and bold, you have the ability to drive a project and set up objectives in order to improve the organisation and the results of a department.  Dynamic, you want to blossom by contributing to a company in full expansion.  You have a positive mind and are able to quickly find the solution to any problem.  Bilingual French/English
Title: Amaris R&D Lab - Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: For two decades, NVIDIA has pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With our invention of the GPU - the engine of modern visual computing - the field has expanded to encompass video games, movie production, product design, medical diagnosis and scientific research. Today, visual computing is becoming increasingly central to how people interact with technology, and there has never been a more exciting time to join this critical team.  Research in artificial intelligence is booming worldwide. NVIDIA is in the best position to take deep learning to previously unimagined levels with our GPU technology, which addresses the massive computational needs of deep learning and are widely used in the field.  Our Content & Technology group is now looking for a Senior Deep Learning Animation Engineer to help us apply AI techniques to character animation systems. Your extensive experience with animation in the gaming or visual effects industry, combined with our Toronto-based team of experienced AI professionals will help bring movie and gaming characters to life like never before.  What you’ll be doing: Play a leading role in building tools and technology libraries to help power AI driven animation systems for applications both inside and outside NVIDIA Be involved in advanced research combining physical simulation with autonomous animation systems to achieve state of the art results that appear indistinguishable from real motion Work with other senior developers within NVIDIA's Content and Technology group to integrate these tools with existing animation systems inside games and VFX systems Research the best ways to apply Deep Learning techniques to improve traditional motion capture pipelines Lead and mentor others involved in this work, helping to build their knowledge of traditional animation techniques as they apply their experience in AI to this type of real-time application  What we need to see: Bachelors or MS in Computer Science or related field with 8+ years of experience, including at least 2 years of animation experience Expertise in computer graphics, simulation or game development Experience with C++, DirectX, OpenGL Expertise with content creation pipeline tools such as Maya, Max, or Houdini, as well as their APIs Strong software engineering skills  Ways to stand out from the crowd: Previous experience with machine learning Experience with motion capture hardware and software tools Strong ability to communicate well and teach others. Demonstrate your interest in applying cutting edge technologies to revolutionize the way artists and animators create games and films for generations to come  NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!  NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.     #deeplearning
Title: Senior Deep Learning Animation Engineer

Job_Description: We are looking for highly skilled individuals who are passionate about developing products that matter. And always curious, strive to overcome challenges, and come up with innovative and creative solutions for problems. And mostly, always thinking of the WHYs.  Responsibilities will include but not limited to: Working closely within the AI team and rest of engineering organization to build out our core AI platform.  Integrate with our partners and vendors.  Data warehouse and mining.  Qualification: 1+ year(s) AI product development required.  Proficiency in and experience with Java, Python, and C/C++.  Strong in object-oriented design and efficient data structures.  Knowledge in machine learning, algorithm design, complexity analysis, problem solving, and diagnosis.  Plus: Familiar with AWS.  Experience with networking and distributed systems, high performance computing, and multithreading programming.  Degree in computer science, operations research, statistics, engineering, or mathematics.  Job Type: Full-time  Compensation: competitive and depending on experience.  Please apply for this position by sending your resume to kris@trilliumhr.com
Title: AI Developer

Job_Description: AcuityAds is a Demand Side Provider (DSP) that processes over 80 Billion bid requests per day and serves hundreds of millions of ads. These impressive statistics are made possible through Acuity’s state of the art ad technology platform. Acuity’s DNA is interlinked with many of the most popular and successful open source software projects. Our real time bidding and ad serving layers are built in Java, Akka and Spring. Millions of events are funneled over Kafka topics destined for storage and analysis in our Hadoop Big Data cluster. Data flows into a real time analytical reporting for end users. Our AI/Machine learning ingests events and completes feedback loops into the real time systems. End users enjoy interacting with our systems through best in class rich client applications built on HTML5, Angular, ReactJS and Bootstrap technologies using REST endpoints.This is a great opportunity to join a growing company as a Team Lead. You will help build digital designs and high performing web pages that play a key part in defining the user experience for Acuity.Essential Job Functions: Assist in the delegation of work, determining the method of work, giving clear and concise direction, and follow up to ensure proper execution.Respond and handle team and technical issues by using good judgment and logic in solving problems and making decisions within the job scopeAdhere to established engineering and architectural patternsWork as part of a team to deliver solutions in an Agile fashionAbility to break down complex product requirements, providing development estimates as neededDeliver high quality code that has been thoroughly testedOther duties as assigned by Management.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:front end: 1 yearJava: 5 yearsback end: 1 yearLocation:Toronto, ON
Title: Sr Java Developer

Job_Description: Job Title: Application Developer (Full Stack – Mobile)  What are the hours of work; please specify break times as well: 37.5 a week  Will overtime be required (Y/N): N  Likelihood of extension: Y  Brief Project Description: Enterprise mobile apps/ application development to transform the way employees work today  Team/Culture: Agile teams, fast paced, highly collaborative Each team is about 7-10 solution team members  Daily Responsibilities:  Design, develop, test, deploy, support and evolve software (native / hybrid applications, API’s) Manage individual priorities, deadlines and deliverables. Collaborate with QA & solution team on continuous integration and delivery as well as automated and manual testing to ensure good quality solutions are delivered to provide value to our customers (company employees) participate in an agile delivery process, and as part of that help size stories and own, research and recommend new solutions Using various techniques and tools, deliver strategic technical solutions to match business requirements and product life cycle deliverables. Focus on component reusability, data sharing and security while complying with Enterprise standards and processes. Experiment with new tools and technologies ensuring our solutions stay relevant in a rapidly changing technology landscape while sharing gained knowledge across teams.  Must Have Skills:  5 years of mobile programming in native (iOS or Android) and hybrid apps 5 years of full-stack development DevOps CI/CD pipeline configuration including publishing applications to Google Play store, Apple app store or an enterprise app store RESTful APIs, Microservices, webservices, expert in SOA design and technical implementations A thorough understanding of Object Orientated Programming, MVC (and iOS application architecture for iOS mobile developer) Proven experience in PCF, Bluemix, TomCat, Liberty, Framework, Rest API, Java Hibernate, JPA, DevOps (Eclipse, Jenkins, Maven, UCD, Docker, MS visual studio), Junit Experience with test automation Junit, XCTest and XCUI, Selenium Hands on experience with relational databases (MS SQL Server) and exposure to no-SQL data stores: MongoDB, ElasticSearch as well as caching stores (Redis) Methodology: Agile, Iterative, TDD Demonstrated ability to make design/enhancement recommendations/decisions for multiple applications/technologies, mentor on standards and coding practices and debug very complex or urgent problems. Ability to resolves integration issues to guarantee solution conformance to requirements and engineering limitations. Language: Java, C#, Objective-C, Swift, React, AngularJS, Angular2, ReactJS, Veu.js, Redux, Backbone.js, JQuery, Bootstrap, SQL  Nice to Have Skills: Both iOS and Android native app development experiences Algorithm design and optimization  In addition, candidates with the following nice to have skills would be excellent: AI/Machine Learning/Cognitive Computing MDM/MAM/EMM (Mobile Device/Application Management or Enterprise Mobile Management) Platform experience Chatbot ElasticSearch  Soft Skills:  Excellent communication and collaboration skills Self-starter Interview Process: Please note interview type(s): Hire off resume? Yes  Will there be training provided (Y/N)  No

Job_Description: Our Company Founded in 2010, Index is one of the fastest-growing Web marketing company in the World. Our vision is to be globally recognized as the best Web Marketing solutions provider. You can read more about our services and products here: http://www.indexwebmarketing.com/en As part of this vision, Index is growing its team and adding a Full-Stack Developer to its Montreal division. You will primarily work on developing technology products (marketing solutions and artificial intelligence) as well as helping our production team on various client projects.   The profiles of our members have one thing in common: exceeding the expectations by offering leading-edge performance solutions. The values that sustain Index’s growth are results-oriented, innovation, transparency, proactivity and respect. You will be given the tools you've always dreamed of using – many already developed in-house. Your abilities will prove their worth while working on projects involving highly competitive industries. You will have an international, and quantifiable, impact while working on major accounts. You will work closely with one of the most innovative teams in the World. We guarantee you will be working with leaders in their respective fields (online advertising, SEO, analytics, technology). Whether you have a diploma or not, we want to work with you if you’re passionate, talented, and innovative! Summary Product management: You will mainly work on products, such as our flagship product SiteVolt Brain – a web marketing A.I. solution Project leadership: Work with project managers, front-end developers, designers for various teams Server management: Collaborate on the infrastructure of the organization Contribute to the company’s research and development activities Assure quality control Contribute to creativity sessions Participate in team building activities  Qualifications and Skills Front-end dev: Javascript technologies such as React/React Native, jQuery Back-end: PHP, Node.js, Python and various frameworks (Laravel, Express, Flask) Databases: MySQL, MongoDB, etc. Tech products: GitHub, APIs, AWS, WordPress, etc. Motivated and friendly team-player who will bring energy and a positive attitude to the position Excellent communication skills and respect for deadlines Ability to work both independently and in a team, and to multitask several projects at once under tight deadlines  Assets Degree in computer science or similar Data science understanding (machine learning, A.I., statistics) Experience in the field of startups, SaaS, or scaling various technology products Contributed to many open-source projects Mobile development Graphic design Knowledge of SEO, online advertising, social media and web marketing strategies Bilingual French and English, as well as writing skills in French and English Experience in the agency or digital marketing worlds Passion for the web & new technologies A great fit with our company vision and values Entrepreneurial and leadership qualities International experience  Benefits and Perks Competitive salary High-growth, high-impact on some of Canada’s largest companies Regular team building activities Annual bonus Company stock options possibility Startup vibe (casual dress code, espresso machine, foosball) International opportunities
Title: Full-Stack Developer, Intermediate/Senior, Montreal

Job_Description: What is the opportunity? We’re looking for an experienced full-stack Innovation Tech Lead who will be working on Innovative products that will be the future of technology, such as Natural Language Processing voice channels (e.g. Google Home), machine learning / AI and natural language interfaces, and integrating RBC's internal landscape with external vendors . As a Tech Lead, you’ll be working with a first-class team and brilliant minds in tackling extremely challenging problems while delivering a high level of application and product knowledge, technical expertise and problem solving unique to one or more area(s), acting as a trusted resource for less-experienced department personnel .  What will you do? Set the technical direction for all development, maintenance and architecture initiatives, ensuring adherence to overall IT architectural direction. Provide expert consulting on technical and managerial direction for strategic projects with a focus on cross-divisional strategies. Function as an in-house consultant / expert for the resolution of complex technical issues Research emerging trends / best practices and determine the implications of proposed solutions on business unit strategy. Perform code review of the code delivered in-house, ensuring adherence to RBC IT policies and guidelines. In collaboration with other stakeholders, determine the best mix of development, interfacing applications and third party vendor solutions to meet business requirements and project objectives. Develop criteria to evaluate third party vendors and software and develop due diligence exercises, conducing due diligence for very complex projects and overseeing the diligence process for less complex projects. Collaborate with the Architecture group to contribute to the creation of technical strategy for Innovation projects within RBC IT; identify technical and business opportunities to take advantage of cross-project knowledge, best practices and reusability to expedite projects.  What do you need to succeed? Must-have 5+ years of experience with different programming languages (e.g. Java / Spring Framework / Node.js / Angular.js / React.js / HTML / JavaScript / Python / T-SQL) and 2+ years of lead experience Experience with Cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Pivotal) Experience with DevOps capabilities (e.g. Jenkins, Maven, Chef, Puppet, UrbanCode) Experience with microservices architecture platforms (e.g. Node.js, Spring Boot) Experience providing guidance and support to developers within a team Experience with SQL, NoSQL and Big Data platforms (e.g. Cassandra, Mongo DB) Nice-to-have Experience with the Agile Methodology Experience in or understanding of Innovation products (e.g. Chat-bots, Machine Learning / AI, NLP / NLU) Experience with native mobile development (e.g. iOS [preferred], Android) Experience with data streaming technologies (e.g. Kafka)  What’s in it for you? Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential. Working in a unique atmosphere dedicated to Innovation. Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale. Work on Next Gen Technology to lead the way in Innovation.  SFDG  Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs  About RBC Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.  Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers .  Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.  JOB SUMMARY City: Toronto Address: 88 Queens Quay West Work Hours/Week: 37.5 Work Environment: Office Employment Type: Permanent Career Level: Experienced Hire/Professional Pay Type: Salaried Required Travel(%): 0-25 Exempt/Non-Exempt: N/A People Manager: Yes Application Deadline: 2018-06-15 Req ID: 164565 Posting Notes: SF: JB
Title: Experienced Full-Stack Innovation Tech Lead

Job_Description: Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better.  At Loblaw Digital , we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started.  We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.  The Senior Director of Data Science will be leading a team of Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and BI Developers, responsible for designing and implementing groundbreaking solutions utilizing large-scale data sets. This individual is also responsible for developing the long-term AI strategy, evangelizing the results of the Data Science team’s research, coordination & collaboration with various internal teams, and working closely with engineering to integrate solutions into our production systems.  What You'll Do: - Lead a team of 12 Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and BI Developers, providing vision, direction, and day-to-day management - Define data science and AI/ML strategy across the eCommerce and retail business - Work with functional businesses (Trading, Marketing, Operations, Supply Chain etc.) on solving problems such as customer segmentation, customer engagement, inventory forecasting, and more - Lead the development and implementation of scalable, data-driven solutions using Hadoop (HDFS, Map/Reduce, Hive, Hbase, Sqoop, Spark, etc.) - Lead the BI efforts to centralize data warehousing, and empower business users to self-serve data for insights and analytics using Tableau and Microstrategy - Recruit top talent to continue to invest in Loblaw’s Data Science capabilities  What You'll Need: - Masters degree/PhD in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Engineering/Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, Applied Math, or equivalent work experience - 10+ years of relevant experience in data science or similar field - Creative problem solver, resourceful in getting things done, and productive working independently or collaboratively - Experience in working with Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Hbase and related big data technologies - Experience working with large structured and unstructured data sets from multiple sources - Experience with recommendation systems & personalization - Strong passion for empirical research and data driven decisions  Deep knowledge in data mining and machine learning - Strong knowledge of and experience with statistics - Data visualization experience to present findings at the appropriate level of detail for both business and technology teams. - Excellent written and spoken communication skills  #LI-NK2   How You’ll Succeed: At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.  We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.  If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.  Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. Apply today.   Employment Type: Full time   Type of Role: Regular   Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.
Title: Senior Director, Data Science

DemandHub helps businesses by powering daily communication, generating reviews and feedback, and gaining insight into the overall customer experience.Our frontend stack is React with our back-end in NodeJS and MySQL. We are looking for highly self-driven people who are creative problem solvers that learn quickly and can thrive in an environment with little guidance. We follow modern software development practices, including TDD, CI, and rigorous code reviews. and implement tools to monitor the health of our software system, including logging and software alerts for our ops team.Work closely with team members in other functions, including sales, support, and marketing.Support the ops team for automating our testing and production build process.Required SkillsMinimum B.Sc. in a technical field (Computer Science, Software Engineering, etc.).1-3 years PostgreSQL.Minimum 1 year experience building and using REST APIs.Experience with ES6 promises and deferred asynchronous operations.Advanced knowledge of HTML5, CSS, and AJAX, and jQuery.Experience APIs, high volume data pipelines, efficient algorithms).Bonus SkillsExperience with CSS preprocessing frameworks such as Sass or Less.Experience with task runners such as Gulp or Grunt.Familiarity with AWS tools such as Elastic Beanstalk, EC2, RDS, SQS, S3, and CloudFront.Experience with PHP or other back-end programming languages.Experience with machine-learning, natural language processing, What You'll Do: - Lead a team of 12 Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and BI Developers, providing vision, direction, and day-to-day management - Define data science and AI/ML strategy across the eCommerce and retail business - Work with functional businesses (Trading, Marketing, Operations, Supply Chain etc.) on solving problems such as customer segmentation, customer engagement, inventory forecasting, and more - Lead the development and implementation of scalable, data-driven solutions using Hadoop (HDFS, Map/Reduce, Hive, Hbase, Sqoop, Spark, etc.) - Lead the BI efforts to centralize data warehousing, and empower business users to self-serve data for insights and analytics using Tableau and Microstrategy - Recruit top talent to continue to invest in Loblaw’s Data Science capabilities  What You'll Need: - Masters degree/PhD in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Engineering/Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, Applied Math, or equivalent work experience - 10+ years of relevant experience in data science or similar field - Creative problem solver, resourceful in getting things done, and productive working independently or collaboratively - Experience in working with Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Hbase and related big data technologies - Experience working with large structured and unstructured data sets from multiple sources - Experience with recommendation systems & personalization - Strong passion for empirical research and data driven decisions  Deep knowledge in data mining and machine learning - Strong knowledge of and experience with statistics - Data visualization experience to present findings at the appropriate level of detail for both business and technology teams. - Excellent written and spoken communication skills  #LI-NK2   How You’ll Succeed: At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.  We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.  If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.  Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. Apply today.   Employment Type: Full time   Type of Role: Regular   Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

Recently named one of Deloitte’s fastest growing technology companies and Canada’s best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. Job_Description: Associate, Corporate Development - Montreal, Quebec  Artificial intelligence and machine learning are poised to fundamentally transform nearly every industry. Organizations need to understand what AI means for their business and access the expertise required to develop and implement AI solutions. Element AI is one of the world’s leading applied AI research company. We give large organizations unparalleled access to cutting-edge research, delivered through strategic engagements, custom applications built on our platform, and turn-key products.  The Corporate Development function sits in the Industry Solutions arm of Element AI. The mandate of the Corporate Development function is to identify, evaluate and drive organic and inorganic growth initiatives for the company, with an initial focus on partnerships, joint ventures and acquisitions.  Roles and Responsibilities  As a Corporate Development Associate, you will work with the team to evaluate growth opportunities – from idea to business case to deal execution and post-deal integration – taking a holistic, cross-functional approach. You will bring to the team strong financial acumen and an analytical mindset, entrepreneurial spirit and consultative approach to problem solving. As a part of your role, you will work with and learn from a range of experts, from leading scientists to researchers to software developers and designers. This is a unique opportunity to learn about the business and technical sides of the most important technology in a generation. We are looking for outstanding candidates in both Montreal and Toronto.  On a daily basis, you will:  Support Investment/Partnership deal structuring and execution process from market analysis, target identification, deal negotiation, due diligence and integration Create detailed financial / valuation models to support decision-making, including comparable valuation, DCF, and merger modeling Analyze market and internal data to identify trends/opportunities, develop strategic options based on the insights synthesized from the data analyzed, and create compelling presentations identifying key business implications and recommendations to senior leadership and functional teams Work with our business and institutional partners to support the local AI ecosystem Research industry trends and commercial applications of machine learning and operations research  You want to join us because you have:  Undergraduate degree; post-graduate degree is a plus 3-5 years of work experience in management consulting, venture capital, private equity, corporate development or investment banking Demonstrated interest/experience in technology Proven record of entrepreneurship in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities preferred  We want you to join us because you are:  A self-starter with an ability to excel in a dynamic, ever-changing environment; An agile thinker who quickly understands new domains and identifies opportunities to apply and extend their knowledge; Comfortable navigating and creating clarity in ambiguous environments;; Able to engage and communicate effectively with managers and the front-line; Able to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams that include researchers, engineers, and designers  What we offer for your valuable work:  Highly dynamic, innovative, passionate, entrepreneurial team; Open and inclusive company culture; Worldwide competitive salary; Participation in the company success through the Employee Stock Option Plan; Participation in company employee benefits program; Flexible hours (outside of core hours); Autonomous, self-managed Agile teams.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Title: Associate, Corporate Development

Job_Description: Back-End Developer Wanted  We’re a team of strategists, designers, and technologists, driven by a shared passion for creating thoughtful digital platforms, products, and services that span web, mobile, and connected spaces. Based in Vancouver and New York City, we’re focused on changing how organizations connect with users in an increasingly digital world. If you’re up for that challenge, you should join us.  The Role  As an Intermediate Back-End Developer, you’ll contribute a broad range of technical expertise, contributing to the planning and implementation of functionality and logic across web and mobile platforms and products. As part of a project team, you’ll help to define the most effective approach to prioritizing and implementing features and requirements against a roadmap, taking into account performance, stability, and scalability. Your experience in navigating the diverse ecosystem of tools, frameworks, and 3rd party platforms will ensure the team is exploring a range of approaches to deliver the right solutions for our clients and their users.  Responsibilities  Support and collaborate in planning, development, testing, and delivery/deployment of solid, structured, and standards-compliant code Understand scope, project goals, and requirements, and provide input towards practical solutions, innovations, and time estimation Participate in ideation sessions, workshops, and roadmapping, contributing a perspective on improved production and development approaches, tools, and techniques Collaborate in strategic planning of desktop and mobile websites, web apps, and native mobile apps, assessing opportunities for driving innovation from a development perspective Participate in the sourcing and documentation of requirements through stakeholder engagement, research, evaluation Support the planning and documentation of technical architecture, operations, and maintenance for the code we deliver Test, refactor, and optimize code to achieve the best performance, and strive for flawless and bug free deliverables by making quality assurance a top priority Follow industry best practices, and coding standards developed by the agency and contribute to internal and external knowledge sharing Understand our clients’ business, their needs, and the technical opportunities and challenges that exist within their categories Required Skills & Experience  3-5 years experience in back-end and server-side web and mobile development with a focus on custom applications, Linux/Unix and open source, including Laravel, PHP (LAMP), and Ruby Thorough understanding and working experience with CS fundamentals including automation, algorithmic processes, data modeling, and design patterns Experience with database design, solution architecture, and development with MySQL, MongoDB and cloud hosting with AWS and Heroku Experience integrating with web services APIs via JSON and REST Experience planning, prototyping, developing, and testing for web, mobile/tablet, SaaS products, connected devices, and other interactive experiences Experience with setup, implementation, and integration with payment gateways (Stripe) and merchant account providers Experience in behavioral development, test-driven development, continuous integration and delivery, and agile including scoping and roadmappping, and self-management Familiarity with secure web application practices (authentication, authorization, encryption), SSL, web application firewall, web service proxy, and multi protocol gateways Familiarity with both open source and enterprise CMS and ecommerce platforms and integration including WordPress, Adobe Experience Manager, Squarespace, Shopify, and Magento Familiarity with native mobile development and mobile app frameworks a nice to have An interest and general understanding of machine learning and AI a nice to have Digital agency or startup team experience preferred Degree in Web Development or Computer Science preferred but not required Candidates should be a resident of Vancouver or willing to relocate and able to travel Benefits  In addition to an exceptional company culture, we offer the following benefits to all employees:  A welcome kit, a brand new MacBook, and all the tools you need on day one Personal learning budget for classes, events, and conferences, and access to General Assembly, Treehouse, Udemy, and One Month to help you expand your skills Winter holiday break in addition to 3 weeks vacation time to start Office snacks, coffee, tea, beer, and monthly birthday lunches Holiday parties, happy hours, and team building activities Health and dental coverage Offices in two of the best cities in the world – Vancouver and New York City An incredible global client list including some of the most recognized brands Focused yet casual work environment in downtown Vancouver and close to public transit How to Apply  If this sounds like a fit, please apply through our online application form. Only candidates with an online portfolio or work samples may be shortlisted and contacted. Please clearly state your personal contribution to each project submitted. If you have a Github profile, blog, or other online projects, please send those URLs along too. Extra attention will be given to creative candidates who are active online.  No recruiters, agencies, or phone calls please.  Visit us at www.enginedigital.com
Title: Back-End Developer (Intermediate)

Job_Description: Job DescriptionMinimum 5 years’ experience on C# development, .NET, HMTL52 – 3 years’ experience on Azure’s Machine Learning platformDesign and integrate Azure ML tools into our existing applicationsExisting applications are designed to manage the warehouse’s tasks and production scheduleThe individual will be working with the R&D; team on our Smart Warehouse project. The Smart Warehouse project is comprised of a number different technologies including barcoding, wireless, indoor positioning, and AI. Title: AI Developer

Job_Description: What you’ll do: As the AI Program Manager, you will define and support the execution of a robust TELUS-wide artificial intelligence (AI) program. Through this program, you will collaborate with stakeholders across TELUS to build up scalable AI and machine learning capabilities and deploy cutting-edge machine learning use cases across TELUS to support priority business, team member, and customer outcomes. You will help shape a growing team of data scientists, data engineers, developers, and strategists at TELUS who are focused on building a scalable model for developing, deploying, and using machine learning responsibly across our organization.  This role is an exceptional opportunity to stretch yourself, continue to build new skills, and accelerate your career.  This is a full-time, renewable 1-year contract position.  What you’ll be responsible for: Supporting team members from across TELUS to deliver on the vision for the AI Program Defining success targets and evaluating the performance of investment streams across the program Providing regular program updates at senior leadership forums and managing capital discussions to move TELUS towards its AI goals Partnering with stakeholders from across TELUS (digital, marketing, business technology, security, privacy, governance, etc.) and vendors to define the program roadmap, prioritize initiatives, develop governance processes, and facilitate the delivery of valuable use cases for our customers and business  What YOU Bring: Over 5 years of experience managing and scaling strategic programs in an enterprise environment ideally within the communications, media, or tech industries, or equivalent Proven track record of defining and delivering measurable outcomes for customers, team members, and the business in a highly complex stakeholder environment Demonstrable knowledge of and passion for AI and machine learning (experience with AI and machine learning is a plus) Demonstrated experience communicating broad strategic initiatives to key stakeholders and diverse internal teams Advanced analytical, verbal, and written communication skills Ability to tackle multiple projects and challenges with enthusiasm Ability to develop and articulate succinct business rationale supporting recommendations Compelling storytelling and presentation skills - ability to understand diverse audiences and tune messages, generate storyboards, develop materials, and communicate effectively stakeholders Ability to navigate difficult situations Passion to explore uncharted territory that would complement TELUS’ broader digital strategy  About TELUS Digital  We’re a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most.  TELUS Digital’s mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app.  Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts.  We’re looking for team members who: Share our passion for all things digital Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers Are curious, experiment and never stop learning Foster diversity & inclusion  What you can expect from us: An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas Flexible work hours in a central downtown location A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing  We aspire to build the best products. We’re always a work in progress and looking for people to join our mission and help us digitize telco. Learn about our team at http://labs.telus.com .  Accessibility  At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.  Bonus points  Check out labs.telus.com/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.
Title: AI Program Manager

Job_Description: DescriptionAs a Python QA Analyst, you are a highly skilled individual with technical expertise that spans across multiple technologies. You will be a key part of a team that develops machine learning solutions for digital cameras in self-driving cars. We work with the leading companies in the automotive industry. Your work at Algolux has great chances to end up in the next generation of autonomous vehicles.Key Responsibilities:Design, develop, and execute detail-oriented automation test scripts and test cases based on product specifications.Actively participate in test planning discussions to assure automation coverage is continuously improving.Collaborate with other testers and developers to improve testing processes.Analyze root cause of automation test case failures.Improve exploratory/manual testing in areas where automation is not yet available.Advocate code-level testing and establish good practices within the team.RequirementsExpertise in writing test cases and developing test automation code for python applications at all levels (functional, unit, stress, performance).Exceptional Python coding skills and Object-Oriented Design.Deep knowledge of automation frameworks, in particular those relevant to Python development tools (pytest framework)Extensive knowledge of Linux, including system installation, networking configuration, complex shell scripting, etc.Experience with DevOps tools like Jenkins, Vagrant, Docker and others.Experience with configuration management tools like Ansible, Salt, Puppet and others.DesirableExperience with parallel distributed processing systems.Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc).Experience in imaging software (Gimp, Photoshop, OpenCV, etc).Experience configuring cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).BenefitsWhat can we offer you? Algolux is a tight-knit, collaborative group of individuals from all over the world who are united by a common interest in applying AI to solve big problems in computer vision. On this diverse team, you will be introduced to new perspectives and will acquire knowledge and experience you wouldn’t necessarily gain elsewhere. We also encourage professional development by supporting participation in continuing education, technical conferences, and open source projects. We value individuals who like to push the science, but also have the right attitude and mentality to work on a software version cycle. A unique mix that is critical to scaling up our company.At Algolux, we offer equity options for our employees so that as the company continues to succeed, so will you. We are currently partnering with major component manufacturers like Intel, Qualcomm, and ARM, as well as major automotive manufacturers, to drive the technology behind the introduction of driver-less vehicles. In fact, we were awarded the “Most Exciting Startup” at AutoSens 2017 - the world’s leading technical summit for ADAS and autonomous vehicle perception technology.The Algolux office is an inspiring modern work-space situated in the heart of the trendy district of Pointe Sainte Charles, near downtown Montreal. Our open office environment encourages communication, teamwork, and a culture of mutual trust and respect. Job_Description: Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada All Available Locations: Toronto  External Posting Description  Deloitte’s Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning practice (AI and ML) practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.  Your role at Deloitte as a GIS Lead Manager Provide subject matter expertise to enable the development of geospatial methodologies to support client deliverables Acquire, process, and analyze large quantities of data (spatial and aspatial) at a granular level Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing methodologies. Develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these best practices within a geospatial context Perform “hands on” spatial data ETL, GIS analysis, modelling, and visualization to deliver best-of-breed analytical solutions for clients’ business problem Participate in various structured and ad-hoc projects with cross-functional teams within Deloitte Leverage a diverse team consisting of data scientists, data architects, software developers, information designers, and other business/industry subject matter experts to deliver meaningful client deliverables Actively participate in client pitches and proposals, leveraging your experience delivering geospatial solutions to enhance Deloitte’s offerings.  External Posting Qualifications 10+ years relevant work experience as a GIS Manager, Geospatial Consultant or GIS Specialist Broad knowledge of how GIS is used across various industries (Retail, Government, Oil & Gas, Utilities, Finance) Experience designing and implementing large-scale spatial analysis solutions Spatial data manipulation and analysis experience using (one or more of): ArcGIS, QGIS, PostGIS, Python (GeoPandas), SQL Server (working with spatial data), R, Mapshaper or similar tools as required Strong track record with an exemplary ability to quickly understand business problems, develop solutions and insights, and communicate both internally and externally to stakeholders Professional services, consulting, or advisory experience is an asset Strong oral and written communication skills Enthusiastic about solving complex problems with a variety of analytical tools Strong experience working with large amounts of data with significant ambiguity, developing creative approaches to analytical problems, and interpreting data and results from a business/industry perspective Preference given to candidates with experience in (geospatial) statistical modelling techniques, data mining, and predictive models Minimum of BA/BSc degree in a quantitative degree including Geography, GIS, Geomatics, Spatial Analysis, Statistics, Demography, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field is required. Advanced degree (MA/MSc, equivalent or higher) is preferred Why Deloitte? Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster. You can work your way: We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful. You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work. Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at Deloitte. The One Firm. For You. Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. Job_Description: Do you want to take part in the AI revolution?  Thales is a global leader in digital technologies with expertise in aerospace, space, transportation, defense and security. We help our customers to think smarter and act faster; from the bottom of the oceans to the depth of space and cyberspace.  As an early adopter of open, creative and collaborative innovation model, Thales has built the Centre of Research and Technology in Artificial Intelligence eXpertise (cortAIx). Led by Thales, cortAIx, in collaboration with the MILA (Artificial Intelligence Institute of Quebec), the IVADO (Institute of Data Valorization) and the Vector Institute of Toronto, is located in Montreal’s famous Little Italy, in the heart of Montreal’s innovation community.  With the exciting implementation of our Artificial Intelligence organization cortAIx, we are seeking a Full Stack Developer for a full time role in Montreal. The Full Stack Developer will be a part of a humble and driven team, participating in the elaboration, architecture, design, development, testing, deployment, operation, maintenance, and enhancement of tools, libraries, frameworks, platform and full stack software solutions.  Main Responsibilities Designing, implementing and operating friendly and scalable APIs and microservices; Collaborating with the Machine Learning research group to productize the models and research findings as well as maintain AI models deployed in production; Working on both the backend and front-end aspects of complex solutions; Participating in the evaluation and selection of the appropriate technology platform, frameworks and deployment architecture for each given problem to solve; Embracing and promoting Continuous Delivery, Test Driven Development, AI and UX First approach, iterative development (YAGNI) and other SaaS best practices and principles; Fostering a strong DevOps culture; Participating in the continuous improvement of development and delivery best practices as well as mentor junior team members.  Essential Skills and Qualifications At least 10 years of experience on large scale projects, preferably continuously delivered SaaS projects; Experience and mastery of a few programming languages among: Python, Java, JavaScript, C#, Scala, F#, Go, C/C++, etc. An open mind and a desire to learn and use the best language/technology to solve a given problem; Experience developing and delivering on a public cloud provider like Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services; or have built an in-house cloud with all that this involves in terms of tools, monitoring, diagnostic, etc.; Experience or knowledge of Web GUI frameworks like Angular, React, ExtJS, Backbone, etc. as well as HTML and CSS; Experience with Continuous Delivery of cloud native, microservice-based large scale solutions in a DevOps culture; Experience with and belief in TDD and the testing tools for the different portions of the technology stack; work experience on AI projects with Tensor Flow and CAFFE an asset. Experience with Continuous Delivery and its toolchain (e.g. Git workflow, CI systems like Jenkins, CircleCI, SnapCI, Team Foundation, jFrog Artifactory, etc); Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or other container-based deployment along with the automation tools.  Thales is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applicants from the four designated groups (women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and aboriginals) to apply for employment. At Thales, we provide accessibility to people with disabilities. Should you require accommodations, please consult with your recruitment office and they will work with you to make any adjustments that best suit your individual needs.  Thales thanks all those that apply but only those selected for interview will be contacted. At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 68,000 employees in 50 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now! .

Job_Description: Job Description Are you passionate about technology? Do you love building new things? Do you want to lead a team that is leading the industry in Data Science and Machine Learning? If you answered YES, then we have the right opportunity for you!  The IBM Data Science and Machine Learning is looking for a talented Software Development Manager to lead a growing team of highly motivated Software Developers that are building the next generation of IBM SPSS Modeler and Statistics.  The ideal candidate must have strong technical and management background and be very passionate about building and leading high impact teams. You enjoy working in a multicultural international organization and you have a passion for delivering high quality leading edge software applications. You have extensive experience with the Agile methodology and understand that you are responsible for setting the tone and tempo of your team - as such, you lead by example.  Responsibilities include: Manage overall software development life-cycle Create, prioritize, communicate, manage, and execute roadmaps, project plans, and commitments Promote a culture of innovation, accountability, responsibility & sense of urgency Collaborate with your peers and technical leads to develop and implement innovative solutions Hire, coach, and mentor your team on an ongoing basis Manage Developers in an Agile environment, encourage a collaborative approach, guide the work of the teams. Offer hands-on assistance with work through familiarity with the tools, technologies and processes used in software development and QA.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  At least 3 years as a Software Development Manager in an Agile environment, preferably in the Data Science related industry Knowledge of Machine Learning and AI an asset Strong relationship building skills. You are approachable and will be recognized as a leader by earning your recognition. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. You can clearly articulate your ideas Passion for innovation. At least 3 years with Full stack development: Node.js, ReactJS, AngularJS, Shell script, Object-oriented programing languages (Java, C++, C#), GIT Source Control  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  Docker, Kubernetes, Linux OS, Mac OS, CICD Pipeline tooling, e.g., Jenkins or Travis, Maven, Machine Learning /Data Science, Python, R, Scala  EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Job_Description: Data Science Developer - Student Location: Calgary, AB, CA Company: ExxonMobil   Job description  As a member of the Architecture & Technology team, you will work closely with Technology Architects to develop prototype solutions using machine learning and deep learning to address challenging business problems. This may involve technologies, such as Python, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, cognitive API frameworks and others. This includes interfacing with business and technical contacts, seeking new and innovative approaches, developing prototypes and explaining ideas to a broad audience.  Examples of specific job responsibilities:  Development of Prototype Solutions Leveraging Machine Learning Learning about a spefic business opportunity or problem Seeking innovative solution approaches involving data science/machine learning/artificial intelligence Acquisition and preparation of data needed for development of models Development of predictive models Documentation and presentation of key ideas   Evaluation of New Technologies and Frameworks Participate in evaluation of new products and solutions Advise on technologies used by these products   Development of prototype solutions Using Pre-built Components Utilize technologies, such as Amazon Alexa, Cognitive APIs from Microsoft/Google/Amazon and Microsoft Bot Framework to build prototypes and demonstration solutions   Technology Awareness Learn about latest advances in deep learning and data science Reproduce algorithms described in published research in the area of deep learning using company’s computing plafroms and data Learn about latest AI offerings from vendors, such as Microsoft, Amazon, Google and others Learn about existing tools/technologies that are offered by ExxonMobil IT    Qualifications  Academic: 3rd or 4th year Computer/Electrical/Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics students interested in a career in data science Enrolled in Masters-level degree program in the area of Machine Learning, Data Science or Computer Science preferred To be considered for employment, your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application   Other: Ability to build data preparation scripts using Python and other higher-level tools Ability to write machine learning models in Python utilizing libraries, such as Scikit-Learn and Tensorflow Interest in learning about latest advances in machine learning and deep learning Strong interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communication skills Ability to work effectively in a team environment to accomplish organizational goals Demonstrate sound analytical and problem-solving skills Highly motivated individual able to work with minimum supervision Capability to rapidly learn and apply new IT technologies and then to teach and train others Flexibility in dealing with changing priorities and short deadlines  Start date: September 2018 (start date negotiable) Work term: 12 months preferred, 8 months considered Location: Calgary, Alberta    Your benefits  This position will provide you with an opportunity to leverage your skills in support of a large integrated energy company. For example: Work in a high caliber, collaborative learning environment Receive on-the-job experience, coaching and training Gain technical and business background in the operations of the oil & gas resource industry through participation in various networking programs Work with a geographically dispersed team Work directly with the client business unit to deliver IT solutions to meet critical business needs    Who we are  At ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada ULC (EMBSCC) we are an integral part of a worldwide network of business support centres that provide financial, technical, information service, transactional, and customer service support for ExxonMobil’s global operations. Other considerations For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required. We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.  Eligibility to work in Canada Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Proof of eligibility must be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence or work permit. Document must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Work permit must be valid for the duration of the term. Proof of eligibility is required if an offer is made. Failure to provide the appropriate documentation within a reasonable timeframe (generally 6 weeks prior to your start date) may result in the offer being rescinded or a delay in your start date. Application deadline: June 3, 2018     The ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. In certain situations, ExxonMobil may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions within the Company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including Imperial Oil and affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates. Title: Data Science Developer - Student

Job_Description: AcuityAds is a Demand Side Provider (DSP) that processes over 80 Billion bid requests per day and serves hundreds of millions of ads. These impressive statistics are made possible through Acuity’s state of the art ad technology platform. Acuity’s DNA is interlinked with many of the most popular and successful open source software projects. Our real time bidding and ad serving layers are built in Java, Akka and Spring. Millions of events are funneled over Kafka topics destined for storage and analysis in our Hadoop Big Data cluster. Data flows into a real time analytical reporting for end users. Our AI/Machine learning ingests events and completes feedback loops into the real time systems. End users enjoy interacting with our systems through best in class rich client applications built on HTML5, Angular, ReactJS and Bootstrap technologies using REST endpoints.This is a great opportunity to join a growing company as a Team Lead. You will help build digital designs and high performing web pages that play a key part in defining the user experience for Acuity.Essential Job Functions: Assist in the delegation of work, determining the method of work, giving clear and concise direction, and follow up to ensure proper execution.Respond and handle team and technical issues by using good judgment and logic in solving problems and making decisions within the job scopeAdhere to established engineering and architectural patternsWork as part of a team to deliver solutions in an Agile fashionAbility to break down complex product requirements, providing development estimates as neededDeliver high quality code that has been thoroughly testedOther duties as assigned by Management.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:front end: 1 yearJava: 5 yearsback end: 1 yearLocation:Toronto, ON

Job_Description: Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better.  At Loblaw Digital , we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started.  We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.  The Senior Director of Data Science will be leading a team of Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and BI Developers, responsible for designing and implementing groundbreaking solutions utilizing large-scale data sets. This individual is also responsible for developing the long-term AI strategy, evangelizing the results of the Data Science team’s research, coordination & collaboration with various internal teams, and working closely with engineering to integrate solutions into our production systems.  What You'll Do: - Lead a team of 12 Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and BI Developers, providing vision, direction, and day-to-day management - Define data science and AI/ML strategy across the eCommerce and retail business - Work with functional businesses (Trading, Marketing, Operations, Supply Chain etc.) on solving problems such as customer segmentation, customer engagement, inventory forecasting, and more - Lead the development and implementation of scalable, data-driven solutions using Hadoop (HDFS, Map/Reduce, Hive, Hbase, Sqoop, Spark, etc.) - Lead the BI efforts to centralize data warehousing, and empower business users to self-serve data for insights and analytics using Tableau and Microstrategy - Recruit top talent to continue to invest in Loblaw’s Data Science capabilities  What You'll Need: - Masters degree/PhD in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Engineering/Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, Applied Math, or equivalent work experience - 10+ years of relevant experience in data science or similar field - Creative problem solver, resourceful in getting things done, and productive working independently or collaboratively - Experience in working with Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Hbase and related big data technologies - Experience working with large structured and unstructured data sets from multiple sources - Experience with recommendation systems & personalization - Strong passion for empirical research and data driven decisions  Deep knowledge in data mining and machine learning - Strong knowledge of and experience with statistics - Data visualization experience to present findings at the appropriate level of detail for both business and technology teams. - Excellent written and spoken communication skills  #LI-NK2   How You’ll Succeed: At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.  We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.  If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.  Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. Apply today. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization.
